Please note that the shipping costs listed below are estimates only, based on current shipping prices. Changes and fluctuations are not only possible but highly likely! 
US Shipping
Based on experience shipping in the USA, we've worked to establish a new shipping rate for Kickstarters, and this is the debut of that hard work:
For book-only pledges, we charge a flat $8 shipping charge (media mail + packaging and handling costs) for USA addresses. This includes tracking delivered to your email.
For pledges that include more than books (items such as dice, cards or tokens), we have to increase the cost to $15 (priority mail + packaging and handling costs).
We always do our best to keep shipping affordable by doing our own fulfillment so we can ensure it's done right.
EU Shipping
For orders in the EU, our friends at Angry Hamster Publishing are handling our Kickstarter fulfillment.
For book-only pledges, we charge a flat €10 shipping charge (the shipping costs + packaging and handling costs) for EU addresses. We're still exploring tracking options and will share those details when we have them. 
For pledges that include more than books (items such as dice, cards or tokens), we have to increase the cost to €25 (a larger package + packaging and handling costs). These packages are tracked.
Because these packages will be shipping from inside the EU, VAT and Customs fees will not apply!
UK Shipping
For book-only pledges, we use Royal Mail, which is relatively inexpensive. Unfortunately, we can't currently offer a firm price as rate increases are imminent in the UK.
For pledges that include more than books (items such as dice, cards or tokens), unfortunately, we can't give a firm price as rate increases are imminent in the UK. We will use the Parcelforce service.
Our fulfillment team will updated numbers soon, and we'll post those ASAP.
The Rest of the World
We recommend you look into the options below for print-on-demand. If you still want an offset book, you're welcome to back at the appropriate level, but you will be charged full shipping, and we will be unable to offer refunds of your pledge if shipping ends up more than you expected. It can get very expensive - effectively doubling the cost of your pledge - so please be aware before you pledge. 
If you need an estimate, don't hesitate to reach out to shipping@gallantknightgames.com
If You're Concerned About Shipping Costs...
We are exploring having the Blue Planet: Recontact books in print on demand on DriveThruRPG. We fully intend to offer POD options if we can do so appropriately. Any extra offset print run will be sold via our webstore, and you can always get books there, but the high shipping concerns still exist.
All of our digital rewards - and our print on demand rewards - are being handled by our fulfillment partners at DriveThruRPG.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Biohazard/Gallant Knight Games partnership represents decades of experience in RPG production, and its members have collectively brought dozens of acclaimed game titles to life. They are skilled creators, capable production managers and experienced industry professionals. Though this is only Biohazard's second Kickstarter, Gallant Knight Games and its principal Alan Bahr have brought over 20 Kickstarter campaigns to completion under the GKG banner, as well as helped to deliver other projects (including troubled or disrupted ones) and understands how to execute on funded projects. There is always the possibility of unforeseen events delaying production, but Blue Planet is as sure an RPG investment as Kickstarter has to offer.

Q: Can Biohazard/Gallant Knight Games handle this project?
Gallant Knight Games has run over 20 projects (even more as a consultant) and worked with Biohazard before, so we're bringing a wealth of experience to the table. We're aiming for an ambitious project, something big and exciting here, so while there will inevitably be hiccups, we're equipped to manage them.

Q: What if the text or art isn't finished?
A: 85% of the text is done and the rest is outlined. Artists have been contracted, and we've already invested considerable money into the project and will see it to the end.

Q: What about delays in art?
A: We've already begun the process of commissioning the core art assets for the game, and we're really pleased with the work so far. If there are issues or delay on the art, we also have back-up artists who are ready work.

Q: Increase in shipping costs?
A: Shipping costs constantly rise, and while we've projected them to the best of our abilities, there's not a lot we can do if they change. However, due to the limitations on the size of our product, we're confident this won't be a critical issue. We're working to ensure we can provide worldwide shipping to everyone as economically as possible. 

We have teamed up with Angry Hamster Games to handle our EU and varied world-wide fulfillment. In the UK, Red Dice Games will be handling the Blue Planet: Recontact fulfillment.

Q: What if something happens to the principals?
A: If something were to happen to Jeff or another writer on the project, we've identified our backups, and our team is spread all over the world. It'd take a really big asteroid, zombie apocalypse or alien invasion to wipe us all out. The files and plans have been communicated to the whole team, and a new project lead has already been identified.

*IMPORTANT NOTE*
We hold rewards for a year from fulfillment start date, after which we can no longer promise that we'll be able to fulfill your rewards. We're a small company with limited space, and while we've never had an issue, it's better to be clear about our practices so you're aware. Once we start shipping, if your reward gets returned, or your fulfillment info wasn't provided, we'll give you a full calendar year to sort out the issues and will still ship your rewards. After a year, we may no longer have the rewards, or we might require you to pay updated shipping charges, as they are always going up.

updates.update_content: Welcome to the first of our monthly Blue Planet updates. Our intention with these updates is to share progress, design anecdotes and writing and art previews as we move through production. Happy to also answer any questions you might have along the way, so don’t hesitate to ask in the comments below.

With art direction for 70+ interior illustrations pending, and 1600+ backers with cool thoughts about the parts of Poseidon they want to see brought to life, I thought it would be fun to solicit ideas for possible illustrations. Not all ideas will be used and it's not practical to credit inspiration as there will likely be a lot of overlap in ideas, but if you think this would be a fun way be involved, please . In fact, feel free to submit as many suggestions as you would like.

28 day campaign ✔︎
4 hours to fund ✔︎
417% funding goal ✔︎

I want to offer a very short update to mark passing $100k and to thank you all for your unexpected and incredibly generous support. To see how much the old crew still loves Blue Planet and to see how many new folks are excited to dive into Recontact has been a profoundly gratifying experience. You are carrying Blue Planet: Recontact far beyond any expectations, and we are deeply grateful.

With 22 stretch goals already funded and the end of the campaign in sight, we want to offer a final wave of cool additions to the project that will round out a couple of the goals already in the works as well as add the much-requested virtual tabletop game play assets.

Just a super-short update to offer a super-fun invitation...
What: Blue Planet-Recontact live Q&A

If you had asked me how I hoped the Blue Planet: Recontact Kickstarter would go before we launched, I would have cautiously said 650 backers and $60k - and crossed my fingers that I didn't jinx it. I knew we had some strong support among the longtime fans and that there was growing interest among Newcomers to Poseidon, but almost 1000 backers and $80k, with half the campaign left to run? No way,  no how - not in a million years. But, here we are, having just broken that mark and chasing down our 20th stretch goal of a fully-illustrated field guide!

updates.update_userinfo: A Little Help From My Friends
updates.update_content:
Thank you all!
We are deeply grateful for the immediate success of the Blue Planet Kickstarter campaign, and it's all because of your support and generosity. We are already well into the 2nd wave of stretch goals are are looking forward to reaching as many of those as we can. Personally, getting to double the size of Wormhole would be a very much unexpected and exciting triumph.

Thank you all for what has been a unexpectedly strong and gratifying start to the Blue Planet: Recontact campaign. It's your enthusiasm and support that is making this happen, and we couldn't be more grateful. We never expected to get this far, and so never thought we would get to share these, but we are excited to offer even more stretch goals additions to the project. Check them out and if they inspire you as much as they do us, tell all your gamer friends about Poseidon so they can help us make them happen!

My Father's Work is a worker-placement euro board game in which 2-4 players are competing mad scientists entrusted with a page from their father's journal, along with a large estate in which to perform their devious experiments. Players earn points by completing Experiments, aiding the Town in its endeavors, upgrading their macabre Estates, and hopefully completing their Father's Work in this app-driven branching-narrative game.

Enter a world of high fantasy where both gods and mortals war against the binding threads of fate. 
Venture Maidens is a 5th Edition roleplaying setting born from the actual-play podcast of the same name, which five femmes bring to life every week for thousands of listeners. Our world is riddled with machinations of the powerful and plagued by ancient forces ready to devour the unwary, where only adventurers who possess an unshakeable will can hope to forge their own path. Are you prepared to take up the challenge and fight for your destiny?
Venture Maidens Campaign Guide Cover Art by Kii Weatherton
Venture Maidens Campaign Guide interior design & formatting by BNE Design
Inside this promo, you will find previews of the material from the Venture Maidens campaign book for both players and DMs. Discover one of the twelve new subclasses inspired by the Venture Maidens’ world: a warlock granted powers of creation by a progenitor titan. You will also get a sneak peek at our unique new Heroic Destiny system, giving DMs the tools to craft meaningful story arcs tailored to your players’ characters. Click here to download the promo now!
Download the Venture Maidens Campaign Guide promo now!
At the heart of Venture Maidens is a homebrew 5th Edition campaign brought to life as a bi-weekly live stream and podcast. Five years ago, a group of lifelong friends came together to fumble their way through tech troubles to produce a show that now boasts millions of downloads and thousands of listeners across the globe. However, somewhere along the way, Venture Maidens became so much bigger than just one show. The venturers are a passionate gaming community who champion friendship and creativity in all things. The stories we tell both on and off the table are fun, fearless, and unapologetically human. Learn more about the show on their website here.
Learn more about the Venture Maidens!

Celeste Conowitch is a game designer based out of the Pacific Northwest. She is the producer, DM, and editor of the actual-play podcast Venture Maidens. When not plotting behind the screen, you can catch her championing femme lead shows as co-founder of the Penwitch Studio podcast network. She works as a full-time designer at 2CGaming and has freelanced with companies like Wizards of the Coast, Kobold Press, and MCDM Productions. To keep up with Celeste, follow her on Twitter @cconowitch.

Willy Abeel's a gonzo game designer who tends to toy with weird worlds and mechanical miscellanea. They developed Jumping On Mounted Combat for MCDM’s Arcadia magazine and introduced clown people to D&D on The Book of House for some unexplained reason. You can usually find the Willyboo, @TheWillyboo, funposting online and having a good time over on Twitter.
Katie Budabin plays Fera Velen on the Venture Maidens podcast. Ever since that first YA fantasy novel, she began looking for creative outlets and found herself in the Dungeons & Dragons community. When she’s not playing a tiefling sorceress, she can be found making D&D-inspired pins and jewelry on her Etsy store. For more info you can find her on Twitter @lazy_mermaiden.

Naseem Etemad is an actor and stylist as well as a lifelong gamer, playing in the Venture Maidens podcast as the big-hearted human monk, Sawyeh Noor, since the podcast’s launch. She also operates the Venture Maidens social channels as the show’s social media manager. Find her on socials @nas_ghoul if you are interested in keeping up with her streaming schedule and other professional work.
Mike Evans is a reluctant wrangler of the darkest demon known to the living: Adobe. He designs and animates tirelessly in a futile attempt to save this plane from the undead hordes of poor typography. When not shouting at his computer, Mike creates artifacts to imprison the world’s evils over at TheImperialForge.com.
Kat Kruger is a best-selling freelance game designer at her owner-operated company, Steampunk Unicorn Studio. Her previous projects include: HeroQuest, Betrayal at Baldur’s Gate, and various D&D adventures. In the TTRPG sphere she has most notably contributed to the inaugural Uncaged Anthology and Eyes Unclouded. She is also the Dungeon Master on the family-friendly, actual-play podcast d20 Dames. When she’s not writing or editing games, she’s raising a geeky toddler with her partner and their dachshund in Seattle. To keep up with Kat, follow her on Twitter @KatKruger.
After studying game design and software programming, JB Little discovered an aptitude and love of writing and literature that secured his bachelor’s degree in English. After four years in the hobby of tabletop gaming, he released his first product on the DMs Guild for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition and, in the fall of 2018, transitioned into the role of full-time content creation for tabletop RPGs. He’s since released 28 bestselling titles and worked with numerous companies such as Absolute Tabletop, Action Fiction, Amarune’s Almanac Team, Kobold Press, Grim Press, Jeff C. Stevens, and Vorpal Press. You can follow him on Twitter @DropTheDie.
Brittany Quintero is a tattoo artist and gamer who brings Arrnodel Ithil the moon elf warlock to life each week on the Venture Maidens podcast. Visual art is one and the same as the art of magic to Brittany, so she usually plays a magic-user. By day, Brittany weaves her own magic into her work as a tattoo artist, illustrating stories and meanings by her clients’ request. Like a warlock, she earned her powers through a lifetime of practice and an apprenticeship from an all-knowing mentor. To keep up with Brittany, find her on Instagram @vizualwarlock.
Sage Stafford is both a player and showrunner for the Venture Maidens. When they’re not playing their favorite barbarian cleric combo Kara Brynehilde, they love running modules on the Venture Maidens Twitch channel. When they’re not playing Dungeons and Dragons, you can find them talking Magic: the Gathering on their “Sage of Fables” YouTube channel. Follow Sage @StaffOfSage to see what they’re up to every week.
Ryan Servis serves the dual role of Lead Designer and Writing Director at 2CGaming, ensuring the writing quality and game design are always improving and achieving a diverse array of high-quality projects. You can herald his coming or issue a challenge at www.2cgaming.com or twitter @2cgaming.

2CGaming has run professional and personal games and produced tabletop gaming supplements for 5th Edition D&D and the Pathfinder RPG since 2014. We’ve a long list of completed projects, many of which are detailed below and are available at store.2cgaming.com! Not only do we have a history of delivering on our promises, we have received critical acclaim for our books, which stand out for their content and production quality.

Hope everyone is doing great! We're very excited to share some quick updates on the Venture Maidens Campaign Guide!

Art & Writing
And we're off! The writing team is already putting pen to paper or fingers to keyboards, and the art for the project is scoped and starting to get underway. Celeste is getting the administrative and management infrastructure in place to organize all the moving parts and things are moving smoothly, and as anticipated. We can't wait to show you some art & writing progress as soon as we have something! Going to be great.

Thank you so much for all the support on the Venture Maidens Campaign Guide! We are so, so thrilled for the amazing support and are extremely excited to leap into development! There are a few housekeeping items we'd like to run by all you lovely people, so we'll keep this update short and to the point!

Next Steps

Assemble your party—we’re in for a world of adventure!
You’ve done it! As our Kickstarter draws ever closer to a close, you all have come through to hit that 100k mark! This means that all you wonderful backers who purchased the Hell’s Bells Adventure Zine (or a collector’s box) will get three additional adventure zines! We are thrilled to give you all the tools to play a level 1 through 20 adventure highlighting the best our setting has to offer. And if you haven’t grabbed the Hell’s Bells Adventure Zine yet, now is the time to upgrade your pledge, because four adventures for the price of one is a deal you don’t want to miss!

updates.update_userinfo: Last Week - New Promo - Blossom Court
updates.update_content:
What’s this? A sweet-smelling new promo has dropped!
Hey, venturers! Since you all have been so amazing through this Kickstarter, we’ve decided to share another promo with you! Click here to download the Blossom Court promo (or grab it from the Kickstarter page!), which gives you a peek at the Sovereign Fey Court lore we’re writing for the book. Not only does this promo reveal some juicy world secrets, it also gives you a first look at the monster templates we’re including so you can upgrade any existing creature with the powers of the plant-themed Blossom Court. Check it out, and give us a shout on social media to let us know your thoughts! Can’t wait to message you again when we hit that next stretch goal.

It’s time to get fancy, because we’ve unlocked our fourth stretch goal!
It’s raining gold! Since we hit the 70k mark, our book is receiving a masterwork printing upgrade. That means we’re adding gold foil to the cover, adding a midnight-purple bookmark, using higher-quality paper, and grabbing the highest quality stitching we can get. Our book is now the best it can possibly be both inside and out, all thanks to your generous support! Now we can turn our sights to additional tools to help you explore the world of Venture Maidens.

Good news, everyone—we’ve added more Collector’s Boxes!
Hello, champions. We’ve got some exciting news! We’re doing an additional run of Collector’s Boxes! Since our first set of Collector’s Boxes sold out so quickly, we’ve put our resources together to conjure another 50 boxes available at the $250 level. This second round of boxes will take us a little longer to produce, so if you order one now (or upgrade your pledge) you will receive the box in September 2022 as opposed to June 2022. This extra time frame is necessary to accommodate the production of all the extra goodies that go inside the box. So, if you missed that first run, now is your chance! Make sure to hurry though, because they are already flying off the (virtual) shelves. We are so thrilled that we can make this happen for you wonderful people, because you deserve all the best for making our dreams come true.
What’s that we hear? It’s the sound of our fourth stretch goal unlocking!

Our 48-hour promotion has ended, but the add-on fun is just beginning!
You have floored us with your support during the last two days, but the campaign is still heating up! Our 48-hour promotion to get a free enamel pin or adventure zine is officially over, but never fear–you can still grab these items as add-ons through the end of the campaign. At any time, you can choose to upgrade your pledge to include any (or all) of the excellent add-on items posted on the page. That means you can grab that gorgeous enamel pin of fate, the “Hell’s Bells” adventure zine, or a stunning set of handmade polyhedral dice with the Venture Maidens logo up through the end of the campaign, and afterwards through the pledge manager!
Prepare for trouble—we’ve unlocked our third stretch goal!

A return to the city! After the success of Fantasy City Sites and Scenes (Kickstarter campaign, DrivethruRPG page) and Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II (Kickstarter campaign, DrivethruRPG page), I'm back with a third volume in the series and another sixteen city locations for your campaign. 
Fantasy City Sites and Scenes III is a 48-page (plus cover, inside covers, and back cover) 8.5" x 11" book for gamemasters who are in need of inspiration. This systemless work builds on those two earlier books in the line, but gamemasters may ignore the earlier titles if they wish and use only the locations detailed within this book.
 City Sites. The sixteen locations described in the book (each a two-page spread) presents new buildings that may be dropped into your campaign . . . and along with it, the characters and events detailed alongside the building. You won't find a dry collection of statistics and facts in this book. Each entry was written to spark the gamemaster's imagination and provide GMs with just enough to take the idea and make it their own!
 City Scenes. Pages 36 through 48 (plus the inside back cover of the printed book!) are packed with new encounters. These encounters do not duplicate any found in the first two Fantasy City Sites and Scenes books, meaning that this section greatly expands the gamemaster's number of choices when it comes time to randomly select a city encounter.
Digital mockup. Text shown on the pages is not complete.
Do you already own my other fantasy RPG supplements that were created thanks to the support of Kickstarter backers? Then you're looking for either the $1 (PDF) or $18 (print, U.S. only) reward levels. 
Are you outside of the United States and want print-on-demand codes? Please see below. 
Fantasy City Sites and Scenes III is available in three different editions:
PDF - For only a buck! If this campaign is successful, you will be able to download the systemless 48-page book in PDF from Dropbox. 
Print Code - The $10 and $30 rewards include both the Dropbox link to download the book in PDF and a coupon code to purchase the printed edition from DrivethruRPG as a full-color softcover book. You will be responsible for the printing and shipping costs. (See the FAQ for more information.) ESTIMATED DRIVETHRURPG PRINT PRICE: $8 per softcover book. Please note that you pay all printing and shipping costs at DrivethruRPG as a separate expense.
Saddle-Stitched Book. United States only. The $18 and $58 rewards is for a saddle-stitched edition that will be printed at Mixam, the same printer I worked with for the first two volumes in this series. If you already own the two earlier titles as saddle-stitched works, the $18 reward is what you want. 
The print-on-demand offering is primarily for those who live outside of the United States and want a copy of the book in print.
NOTE: The print-on-demand book will be created using DrivethruRPG's print-on-demand systems and will be offered using the best quality paper they offer. Your Kickstarter pledge for the print code does not cover the actual printing and shipping costs; those will be your responsibility.  (See the FAQ for more information.)
All DrivethruRPG price estimates are estimates only and effective as of project launch. I do not have any control over the DrivethruRPG systems and any price changes and shipping costs are under their control. All I can provide are estimates. Final prices may vary.
So that we don't accidentally cause project delays, there will be no stretch goals for this campaign. I'd much rather deliver on schedule than risk running late with delivery of the rewards.
I know that the lack of stretch goals will cause some of you to turn away, but I ask that you keep this in mind: The 52-page PDF reward is only a buck, making this a great deal for any gamemaster who enjoys running city encounters and adventures.
As you can see in the reward levels, I have estimated delivery as December 2021. Why so long? Unlike the first two books in the series, I have not yet written this third volume. I'll start the work just as soon as possible if we meet the funding goal, and I'll do all I can to finish well before December, but I want to give myself plenty of time in case things go wrong.
As with all of my projects, I'll post regular updates so everyone knows where I'm at with the creative process of the book.

Risks and challenges
Unlike the previous two books in this series. Fantasy City Sites and Scenes III is not yet written. I've blocked out the entire book, including all artwork, but next up is the task of writing all of the necessary locations and encounter hooks. If there's enough demand to make this book happen, then I'll start the writing process just as soon as the campaign reaches the goal.

As always, I'll post updates to keep everyone informed of my writing progress as well as to share the review file when writing is complete. After a review stage, I'll then print the finished book and shift to the fulfillment stage as quickly as I can.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you!!! Important Survey Deadline and Info On Existing Rewards.
updates.update_content:
Thank you, everyone, for being here! This third volume in the series is going to be every bit as fun as the first two, and I owe the project's success to your trust and support of my work.
Survey Deadline: May 14, 2021
If you are receiving print rewards, your survey is ready. Please complete the survey no later than May 14, 2021 so that we can keep the project moving forward.

We're about to hit the 48-hour mark and as we close in on the end of the campaign, I'd like to point out the May 14 survey deadline. Why such an early survey deadline if the new book won't be ready for a few more months? One, we need to complete surveys so that we know everything is in good shape on the accounting side and two, more importantly, we need addresses so that reward levels that include existing print rewards can be mailed out in early June.

Thank you, gang! I'm always worried that when I launch a new project that there won't be enough interest to push the work to the funding level. No matter how many times I create something, I am constantly certain that this time I'll fail. So thank you, seriously, for being a part of this creative effort. Your support means a lot to my sanity and motivates me to keep trying to succeed.
I've spent time this morning working on the book and will continue writing until all of the pages are ready for your review. When will that be? It's too early to say at the moment.

Thank you! When I launched this, I had no idea how much interest there would be in a new addition to the Fantasy City Sites and Scenes series. We're already over 75% of the way to the goal so it looks like I'll have to start writing the new content tomorrow morning.
I'm about to close the computer down and have a lazy evening. Before I go, I'd like to leave all of you with this link to something completely I've been working on: musical soundscapes that will (eventually) include fantasy RPG encounter hooks for each track. This is a future project and one I work on in the early morning hours when I cannot sleep. With headphones on, of course.

campaign.story:
On a dark Halloween night...
The six young and gifted students completed their ritual around the jack-o-lantern, causing the shadows to leap, swirl and coalesce.  The darkness grew shape, and focus, and form before regarding them with glowing eyes filled with promise and pain, a hint of chaos and a dash of admiration.  

It spoke to them, "From the time you were born your eyes were open to the light within the darkness, your ears heard the whispers within the silence.  In slumber you saw the dreams behind what most would call nightmares. It called out to us, and we called back. Now we are here together. You have done well, coming this far on your own, but the time has come for you to journey further down this path. Be warned, this is not an easy path, nor a safe one, and it is journey which never ends.  But if you truly wish to walk it, we will show you the way, as other shapes and shadows did for us, when we sat where you are now. So, are you ready?"

The six, a newly formed coven, spoke as one. "Yes, my master. We are ready."

The darkness smiled, "Then let us begin."

Welcome to Terror of Octobernomicon.
Terror of Octobernomicon
This project is a celebration of new authors, writing about new monsters, in brand new scenarios shepherded along by a pair of established industry mentors.  The new authors are young, eager, and talented fresh faces, making their mark on the internet, though the Miskatonic Repository, seeking out mentors for their craft, or challenging them on the field of battle.  They have shown their worth.  They have earned their place, and their time has come.

For mentors we have:
 Matt "Trollboy" Wiseman - Ennie award winning author and webmaster of Shoggoth.net
 Oscar Rios - Ennie award winning author, publisher, and president of Golden Goblin Press.
We can't begin to express how excited we are to be part of these new author's journey, and to present these exciting new scenarios and authors to both our fans and the wider Call of Cthulhu Role Playing community.

What is Octobernomicon?
The new monsters come from the pages of Shoggoth.net's most beloved traditions - Octobernomicon.  Year after year this amazing online community features 31 original monsters for the Call of Cthulhu Role Playing Game, one for each day of October. These creatures are submitted by talented amateurs and established professionals alike, posted daily, free to download and incorporate into Keeper's home campaigns. Octobernomicon has always been a place for new authors to cut their teeth, fertile ground for eager young creators wishing to add their voices to the dark chorus of Call of Cthulhu. 

The Collection
Terrors of Octobernomicon will be a collection of six original scenarios, written by six new and newish authors, each featuring an original monster from Octobernomicon. Four of the scenarios are classic 1920's-30's era adventures, one is for the Cthulhu Invictus™ setting (The Roman Empire), and another is for the Down Darker Trails® setting (The Old West).  Each has been edited by the teams mentors, with professional maps, illustrations, and handouts by our design teams (Mike Wilson - Editing, Greg Shipp - Cartography, Brad Hicks - Cover & Interior illustrations, Alberto Guerra - Interior Illustrations, Mark Shireman - Layout & Design), a mix of Golden Goblin Press and Shoggoth.net personnel. 

 Classic Era (1920’s-30's) 
 Suspended Pending Resolution, by Francesca McMahon 
Things just don't seem to add up...
Investigators are hired by an insurance company handling the salvage of a wrecked freighter, beached along the coast of Cornwall, near St. Ives, in Great Britain. It seems salvage crews have turned up a number of alarming discrepancies, and certain questions about the tragic events of five years ago have never been fully explained. Work has been halted after a number of unexplained events begin plaguing the worksite. Soon investigators stumble upon the smoldering embers of a deeper, and far deadlier, mystery.

 Accounts of Violence, by Marek Golonka 
A lovely morning in Vienna ruined by madness and mystery.
When relaxing in a Vienna Café, investigators are victims of an unprovoked attack by a local journalist. They are shocked to discover he knows some of their names and a bit about them. Looking into a possible connection between the unhinged man and themselves leads investigators to a most unusual mystery. Soon other attacks follow, as random acts of violence spreads through the City of Dreams. Will investigators be able to put a stop to it all before it’s too late?

 Scarabs of Sekhmet, by Helen Yau 
Welcome to the trip of a lifetime, because it might just be your last.
After winning tickets on the maiden voyage of Reine du Nil, their picturesque riverboat cruise down the Nile takes a terrifying turn. Deck side cocktails are quickly sidelined as rumors of grave robbers, mystical curses, and ancient folklore ensnare everyone in a web of death, horror, and madness. For everyone onboard the fine line between life and death soon thins and becomes blurred. Can investigators solve the mystery in time to not only save themselves, but everyone else onboard as well?

 Currency of Grief, by Daniel Purcell  
Dark things lurk in the spaces between love, grief, and madness.
A wealthy family hires the investigators to find the widow of their dead son, who vanished after quickly draining the substantial inheritance he left to provide for her. Their suspicion falls squarely on a “so-called spirit medium”, a charlatan they claimed was preying upon her deep grief. They soon learn she is not his only victim, but also discover a darker truth; that grief has a value all its own, one coveted by creatures beyond human understanding.

Sun and Shadow, by Walter Attridge
Investigators find themselves in North Queensland, Australia, delivering an exotic cargo to the owner of a major sugar plantation. The cargo of Cane Toads (the world’s largest toad, native to South and Central America) could revolutionize pest control on his crops and increase his profit margins considerably. But his Aboriginal workers are deeply opposed to the plan, claiming that the interlopers would anger their gods. Things quickly spiral out of control when workers walk off the job and people begin to vanish. Can the investigators solve the mystery before it’s too late?

 Cthulhu Invictus (Ancient Rome)
 The Expedition, by Morgan Llewellyn 
Zosimos, are you sure you packed quite enough maps??
The investigators are hired to guards an expedition into the Arabian wilderness. Their employer seeks a newly discovered oasis rumored to contain a grove of wild Torchwood trees. As these trees are the source of both Frankincense and Myrrh, rare commodities worth more than their weight in gold, he is sure that untold riches are there for the taking. However, unbeknownst to anyone, this oasis has a dark and secret history, and the grove is far from undefended.

 Down Darker Trails (The Old West)
 A Lowdown Dirty Owlhoot, by William Adcock 
What manner of low down dirty owlhoot would go and hang a woman?
 The Colorado Territory is a good place for all sorts of bad people to vanish into. The investigators are hired by the good people of Milkweed City to hunt down a mysterious creature rumored to be responsible to for a string of deaths. Said to fly about at night and kill at will, the local papers call it “The Devil Buzzard.” When investigators find a hanged woman, lefts for dead, with a story to tell, well, things get plumb loco.


About Our Authors
Golden Goblin Press and Shoggoth.net have pooled their contact lists, scoured the internet, and peaked behind every keeper screen in every convention across the universe, in a search for the best, brightest, and most creative new authors we could fine.  Here is what we've found.
Meet our Team!

Daniel Purcell, The Lurker In Shadow - A British writer from London, Daniel studied, and settled with a family in Lincolnshire. Long-time director and storyteller and the internet’s best kept secret. Entered an Iron GM contest and drew with a living legend, the rest as they say will be history. Having contributed to Shoggoth.net and been a lifelong companion to the void, the writer is truly sorry for what your players will be put through, truly sorry. One of these things is not like the other…An enigma wrapped in mystery wrapped in an awesome beard. A literal Viking who has come here to pen harrowing stories and chew bubble gum (I am all out of gum.)  A literary dark horse, who delights in crafting worlds where the darkness is ever present and the only real victory is holding onto a diming candle another minute longer.
Daniel Purcell, The Lurker In Shadow [Interview Posted Below]
PLAY


Morgan Llewellyn, Scribe of Carcosa –This South Jordan, Utah, writer is the author of “The Blood of the Woods” published in the Tales of Cthulhu Invictus: Britannia collection from Golden Goblin Press. An English Literature student at Utah Valley University with an Associates of Applied Science degree in Cyber Security. He started playing Tabletop Role-Playing Games at a young age after learning a homebrew system from his father and first learned of the Cthulhu Mythos after seeing the board game Arkham Horror being played when he was ten years old. He became more involved in the TTRPG community after joining the Into the Darkness podcast.
Morgan Llewellyn, Scribe of Carcosa [interview posted below]
PLAY

Helen Yau, She Who Is Legion - A lover of RPGs in general, and Call of Cthulhu in particular, her first scenario; A Tableau of Red, in available through the Miskatonic Repository. She has also contributed to Stygian Fox’s 2018 Ennies Nominee ‘Hudson and Brand; Inquiry agents of the obscure’. Along with RPGs, Helen is a board game geek, and has repurposed her dining room into a dedicated games room. When not writing, or playing games, she enjoys knitting (badly), inventing cheesecake recipes (terribly) and reading everything she can get her hands on.
Helen Yau, She Who Is Legion [Interview Posted Below]
PLAY


Marek Golonka, The Mist from the East  – This author first learned of Lovecraft when he asked a friend about the source of strange tentacled aberrations in D&D but has since worked in horror much more than fantasy. He coordinates Zgrozy, a series of Call of Cthulhu supplements published in both Polish and English, striving to refresh cosmic horror tropes while also writing for other games as well. Marek lives in Katowice, in the Upper Silesia region of southern Poland, and has taught game design at various Polish universities. He works from a desk surrounded by posters from Zgrozy, Mary Poppins and the Takarazuka revue.
Marek Golonka, The Mist from the East [Interview Posted Below]
PLAY

Francesca McMahon, The Dark Avatar  – This romance, fantasy, and horror writer hails from Oxford, England.  From a young age, she has had a love for writing, and in pursing this passion, Francesca has found success within various forms of fiction, incliding everything from screenwriting to table top RPGs.  Francesca has worked on the wargame 7TV Pulp and was shortlisted for the Dame Janet Suzman Playwriting Award, and is currently working with Golden Goblin press on various projects. She is a copy-editor and beta-reader for authors such as Antoine Bandele, and has begun writing her Adventure trilogy series called “Into the Wild”. When not writing, Francesca spends her time making YouTube videos and running a podcast."
Francesca McMahon, The Dark Avatar [Interview Posted Below]
PLAY


William Adcock, The Dread Apprentice – This author lives in Rochester, NY with his wife and cat, and has worked for Golden Goblin Press since 2017. He has contributed to the 7th Edition Guide to Cthulhu Invictus and has a scenario in the Fronti Nulla Fides. William has also self-published, through the Miskatonic Repository, the scenarios “The Parsonsville Horror,” “The Titan Incident,” and “We Are All Savages”. He reads widely in the fields of history, archaeology, cryptozoology and the occult for his inspiration. Outside of Call of Cthulhu, William enjoys painting miniatures and watching classic monster movies.
William Adcock, The Dread Apprentice [Interview Posted Below]
PLAY

Walter Attridge, The Seventh Scion: This very inexperienced writer is a refugee from a galaxy far far away, come to plumb the Cyclopean depths of that blasphemous knowledge… The Cthulhu Mythos! An avid fan of fantasy, Sci-fi, and horror, Walter was introduced to the mythos by Oscar Rios, President of Golden Goblin Press, when he a struggling writer learning his craft. This earned him a spot at many a playtest, including Ripples from Carcosa, The Ravenar Saga, and The Legacy of Arrius Lurco. Walter was amazed to learn how Lovecraft in his short career formed a foundational mythology that underpinned some of the most successful commercial franchises in existence. Though having no published adventures Walter’s written and run many successful campaigns for various Sci-Fi and fantasy RPGs. In every case the Cosmic Horror of the Mythos has creeped in and revealed itself.  He considers this opportunity to be a twofold honor… First to be mentored by two veteran writers with impressive resumes, and second to be in the company of such accomplished and talented writers.
Walter Attridge, The Seventh Scion

Shoggoth.net
For over 20 years, Shoggoth.net has existed to promote the Cthulhu Mythos in all of it's forms. Our goal has always been advancing and increasing popularity of our favorite genre.  In doing so, we proudly publish submissions from our readers and do what we can to spread the word about their talents. Who is Shoggoth.net? Why, dear reader, Shoggoth.net is you.  You've always been a loyal fellow cultist.  This is because all the content you'll enjoy on Shoggoth.net; be it games, creatures, fiction, filks, reviews, news items, crowdfunding announcements, or simple announcements, is written by our loyal readers.  As the mythos continues to grow, and the publishers slither forth from the fetid pool of shub niggurath, it pleases us without limit to see the taint of madness spread and take root in the minds of new people every day.  Ia Ia!

Stretch Goals
Stretch Goal One UNLOCKED / A 7th Scenario (+2,500 / $17,500) – Unlocking this stretch goal will add a 7th scenario to Terror of Octobernomicon. It will be by another new author and feature another original monster from the pages of Octobernomicon. We’ll also film and publish a 7th get to know you video with them and add it to the Kickstarter page, along with the author’s bio and photo.

Stretch Goal Two / Dark Discoveries PDF (+2500 / $20,000) – This is the fiction companion to Terror of Octobernomicon. It features six short stories that include the same six original creatures appearing in the Terror of Octobernomicon scenarios. The book is already written, with editing poised to begin upon unlocking this stretch goal. Everyone getting digital rewards gets a PSF copy of this collection as part of their basic rewards. More on this (author list, story titles, and mocked up cover) after the project fully funds.
Mock-Up Cover / Final will be in color!
Mother of Serpents by Glynn Owen Barrass – Detective Inspector Edward Spenser of Scotland Yard is summoned to the Yorkshire Moors to investigate a series of mysterious deaths. The mystery only deepens once he arrives as the deaths continue. He soon realizes a grander plot is unfolding, one he may have been a part of all along.

Our Beloved Daughter by Andi Newton – Reeling from the loss of their daughter Cammie, Tessa and Amanda struggle to find a way to live with the pain and somehow move on. As Amanda spirals into a deeper depression things become even more complicated when Cammie suddenly returns to her. They soon learn the line between miracle and nightmare is quite thin.

The Captain of Clubs by Edward Morris – A sketch artist becomes inspired after a night of violence while attending a protest. Drawing more and more images inspired by his experience, he struggles to maintain his own rising temper and grip on reality. When art takes on a life of its own can madness not be far behind?

The Burning Man by Josh Reynolds – When Enrico Zanetti desperately requests the help of Anton Sforza, he had nowhere else to turn. Rumored to be a Benandanti, a “good walker” or practitioner of benevolent folk magic, was said to have experience with situations like this. Can they solve the mystery of the strange creature relentlessly hunting Enrico across Venice in time?

The Devil Flies in the Strix by Stephen Mark Rainey– When the Stiles family moved west to settle in Colorado, in 1896, they worked hard to make a new home. However, a local legend claims the land they built on is haunted. To their horror, the family soon learns it's more than legend, when a winged creature with glowing red eyes begins appearing on their property by night.

The Angels of Pestilence by Peter Rawlik – During the horrors of the Great War, a pair of American doctors struggle to find the cause of terrifying visions and strange deaths of sick soldiers. Something monstrous lurks in the dark places between life and death, but for Dr. Herbert West, that place is one he knows all too well.

updates.update_content:
Hey there,
The team has been working hard this week, and reached a couple of major milestones.  The authors and mentors have been hard at work for weeks, and we've finally reached the point where the art team and our formal editor have are now at work too.  It's going to be a very exciting summer at the Goblin Lair bringing this project into focus.

Hey there everyone, 
This will be a quick one.
We are hard at work on this book.  Currently all scenarios are written, 6 of the 7 have come back from their first round of re-writes.  Of those six, two have been sent back for a 3rd round of rewrites, one other is in review, and one is about to be sent to 3rd round rewrites.  By the end of the week we expect to have 4 scenarios in their 3rd round of re-writes, and two others under review.

Congratulations everyone!

Terror from Octobernomicon is over.  We were able to fund this, and add a 7th scenario to the collection. Unfortunately we fell short of adding Dark Discoveries, our fiction companion, to the collection.   We got close, and it looked like we'd make it for most of the day, but not every story ends with a happy ending.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 48th Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays

The estimated delivery date for this project is May 2022, for single wave pledges, and for Expedited Shipment pledges, September 2021 and May 2022 for wave 1 and 2 respectively, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment, no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.
All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in to the Pledge Manager and confirm your pledge in that system within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and in the past have led to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

All backers that have selected “No Reward” on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for this campaign, must make sure to confirm their order by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed.

If you do not accept these terms please do not pledge on this project, but instead wait for the retail release.

To make sure you have the best gaming experience, all CMON products are warrantied against manufacturing defects for 2 years from the of date purchase from CMON (proof of purchase required). If you open your game and see that something is missing or broken, our customer service team will work hard to get you replacement parts and make things right. Simply contact them at https://support.cmon.com/hc/en-us.
Note: Warranty does not cover accidental damage, theft, loss, or any other event that is not a manufacturing defect.

campaign.story:
Wake up and smell the puzzles!
Conundrumug is more than a vessel for the hot beverage of your choice.
Conundrumug is for those who will not settle for gently sipping a liquid through a wide circular opening while manually cantilevered by a stylish-yet-functional ergonomic handle.
Conundrumug is a puzzle. On a mug. From the creator of Journal 29 and The Cypher Files.

Conundrumug is a portable, porcelain-like, escape room in a cup.
It is the perfect gift for the escape room fan in your life, and the best way to check if you are already awake at work.

HOW TO USE CONUNDRUMUG
1. Prepare beverage.
2. Pour beverage into the mug.
3. Solve the puzzles & reward yourself with a satisfying sip!
The Conundrumug comes in 2 editions, each with a unique puzzle.
The Butterfly is our flagship mug, an elegant and mysterious object.
The J29 is a special edition inspired by the Journal 29 books and the adventures found within.

Both editions of the Conundrumug are what you could definitely call large cups, intended to hold enough of what fuels you through a day of hard work - or a healthy amount of reading on a rainy day.
The Conundrumug has enough of a table presence not to be ignored, while still having the subtle touches of minimalist design that distinguishes the Journal 29 style.
The austere, line-drawing aesthetic invites curious looks and stimulates the mind even when not trying to solve the puzzles they form. Do not be surprised at co-workers trying to surreptitiously solve your Conundrumug while feigning disinterest...
The Conundrumug is a 15 oz (445 ml) ceramic mug, is fully machine washable, and its printing is made to last.
Each edition contains 9 puzzles with solutions that combine to solve the overall puzzle.
Please, do not attempt to solve the puzzles while the mug contains potable substances.
It is compatible with every known variety of coffee, every cultivar of tea, and tested with a range of quality single malt and blended whisky. Enjoy responsibly.
Proven to function in both home and work environments - especially if those are the same place, it is the mug of choice for the discerning puzzle & escape room fan.
WARNING: The Conundrumug is *not* cat-proof. May cause funny looks during Zoom calls. Could become a target for swiping by jealous co-workers.
Note:
The J29 edition of Conundrumug is going to be made in limited quantities, primarily to fulfill the needs of this campaign.
It will be available directly through us via the post-campaign pledge manager (see Shipping section), where backers will be able to add more copies to their pledge.
Journal 29 is an interactive book game first published in 2017. It was a groundbreaking publication that created its own category of puzzle in printed form.
With 63 puzzles in 148 pages, you may have to do certain things you may not want to do to a book, in order to solve them. Unconventional thought is rewarded, and the fate of an expedition to solve an alien mystery is decided.
The first book was followed by Journal 29 Revelation, which added 57(+?) puzzles and continued the story of the expedition with another series of intriguing riddles to figure out and obstacles to overcome.
Here is what people have to say about Journal 29:
Goodreads - BGG - Escape the Review -  EscapeTalk - Watch it Paint it
You will be able to obtain copies of Journal 29 and Journal 29 Revelation by adding them on to your pledge in the post-campaign pledge management platform.
For more information on the books, please visit: Journal29.com

Shipping
Conundrumug will be packed in a cardboard box with transparent windows. It is going to be shipped in such a way as to preserve the structural integrity of the mug itself, rather than the packaging, with the intention of keeping overall weight (and by extension the shipping costs) to a minimum.
Backers wishing to give the Conundrumug as a gift will be able to choose additional external protective packaging for a small fee in the post-campaign pledge manager.
We will be using Backerkit as our post-campaign fulfillment suite and pre-order management platform, through which shipping costs may be paid and additional copies may be obtained.
Certain countries do not appear on the list of available shipping destinations. This is due to past experiences and potential cost overruns due to weight fluctuations. Click the pledge level and please contact us via KS message if your country does not appear on the list. Regrettably, shipping to CIS and Brazil will not be possible. 
Additional Items (e.g. more copies of Conundrumug, Journal 29 books, protective gift packaging) added on to your order in the pledge manager may incur additional shipping costs. You will be able to see all such costs before finalizing your order.
Since we will only be charging cards for shipping & add-on costs before fulfillment begins, there will be plenty of time to modify your order. There will be backer updates and a final 48-hour notice before carts are locked and orders are charged.
Please note that Backers are responsible for any import fees, value-added taxes or other charges incurred in receiving Conundrumug to their location.
Note that we can not be responsible for any re-shipping fees in case your package is returned as unclaimed, or if the address you provided is not valid. Should a package not arrive within a certain time frame, we will spend a period of time investigating its fate before any action is taken.

Covid-19 Impact
Fulfillment providers worldwide are reporting that significant disruptions in deliveries persist in parts of the world. In practical terms this means that shipments to individual countries may be subject to delays.
We have taken what we now (April 2021) know into account when determining our production, logistics and fulfillment plans. However, it may happen that we may deviate from the schedule, and as noted in the Risks section, other backers may receive their rewards a lot earlier than you.
When we have new information, we will reach out to backers, either via a backer update or individually, as the situation develops. In any case, please be prepared for delays, both in freight (before your reward is shipped), and after individual fulfillment has commenced.

campaign.story:
Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game is a worker placement game that puts 1-5 players inside a plant cell, where they will compete over limited resources in order to undergo photosynthesis, produce carbohydrates, and build the cell wall to score points. With everyone vying for the same actions, players must time their use of proteins, hormones, and cell component cards in order to diversify their strategies and outplay the competition!
Cellulose is the sequel and counterpart to our 2017 release Cytosis (BGG). The two games have complementary themes and some familiar game systems, but Cellulose is a new standalone game that gives players greater control over available resources, strategic paths, and even the game length.
For each backer in the first 72 hours of the campaign, we're planting a tree! Our games use a lot of paper/cardboard/wood, and it takes a lot of energy to ship them around. We wanted to offset some of our production and have a backer bonus that wouldn't feel too bad to miss, so we're partnering with TreeSisters. They strategically plants trees to reforest areas where they're most needed to offset carbon, stabilize soil, and encourage biodiversity. They're very thoughtful about the best ways to do this, and we'd encourage you to check out their work. We plan to have an option to add more trees in the pledge manager.

In Cellulose, players compete over limited resources as they take advantage of powerful point-scoring combinations. They will race to build the cell wall, use hormones to signal plant growth for a steady source of water and CO2, and compete to contribute the most water to the cell’s central vacuole. Once the cell wall is completely built, the game ends!
Each round of Cellulose is one day played over three phases: Sunrise, Daytime, and Evening.
Sunrise Phase
In the Sunrise Phase, players collect resources and take bonus actions according to their markers on the plant board. Throughout the game, players will have the chance to use hormone signaling to advance along these tracks, earning additional benefits.
Daytime Phase
During the Daytime Phase, players take turns claiming the limited action spaces on the cell board in order to collect much-needed water and CO2, undergo photosynthesis in order to produce carbohydrates, and place carbohydrates into the cell wall, in cellulose form, to score points.
Players may also acquire and play cell component cards, which grant them powerful bonuses.  Protein storage vacuoles immediately recover action markers, granting extra actions in the round. Enzymes allow chaining together bonus actions each time a new one is played. Specialization cards like hormone receptors create endgame scoring opportunities and special powers. 
Evening Phase
In the Evening, players recover their action markers, refresh the board, and build the next space on the cell wall.  Whoever has contributed the most water to the central vacuole will earn points and is given an additional action marker, which they can use in the following round.
Check out the draft rulebook for more gameplay information, or you can try Cellulose now on Tabletop Simulator — join our Discord Server to find a game!

Genius Games creates games with compelling strategic gameplay and accurate science. We began designing Cellulose with careful research and modeling the major functions and tensions of plant cells: the scarcity trade-off of absorbing CO2 and losing water, the ability of plants to create their own food, and the growth cycles of a maturing plant. 
Cellulose will include a "Science Behind Cellulose" booklet that describes key aspects of plant cell behavior and its relationship to Cellulose. You don't have to know any biology to play, but if you enjoy the game, we think you might enjoy the science as much as we have!


Cellulose includes an Automa Deck for solo play featuring a unique emerging strategy system, where the automated opponent will develop a responsive strategy over the game that determines how it plays. Some details in Update 6, with art to come!
We designed Cellulose to model some of the functions and tensions of plant cells in the context of the larger organism.  Scenarios tailor the story of your gameplay to different plant species with unique circumstances and adaptations.  Each Scenario will set realistic  conditions that push players to play in ways that parallel plant responses — while also creating exciting variations on how to play Cellulose.
Cellulose will initially include the Cactus scenario, showcasing how the Cactaceae family responds to sparse water availability: acquiring water is extra difficult, but using it well is very rewarding.
We hope to make more Scenarios available throughout the campaign.  If you have a great plant story to tell, get in touch! We’re working on a couple ideas, but would love to work with your areas of study and expertise.


Shipping costs for each reward level and country are shown within each pledge level and will be charged with your pledge as soon as the campaign ends. The listed shipping charges are all subsidized to make it cheaper for you to get a copy of the game.  
All games pledged for during the campaign will be shipping from US, EU, UK, Canada, and Australia through several fulfillment centers, ensuring that we have "Friendly Shipping" (no additional import taxes for backers) to all countries in these regions. Sales Tax and VAT are included. 
PLEASE NOTE: Please note that any pledges not confirmed within 6 months from the time the campaign begins actual fulfillment may need to be sent outside of our normal fulfillment process, and so will incur increased costs, customs fees, and/or may receive the closest available product (if a limited print run is no longer available). No guarantees can be made concerning pledges not confirmed more than 6 months after the shipping begins.
To better serve backers in Asia, Middle East, Brazil, Africa and beyond, and help keep international shipping costs down, we are excited to be partnering with a number of local game stores throughout your regions with the help of VFI. We've been compiling a Directory of International Retailers who will be offering the game directly, with all Kickstarter options and stretch goals available here, during the normal fulfillment period. If you do not see your country listed among the shipping options, click here to contact VFI about about finding a participating store that's best for your region. You can also let your local game store know you're interested in preordering and have them contact VFI.
More science games are available through our website or at your local or online retailer.

campaign.story:
The acclaimed setting of Symbaroum has enticed and fascinated fans of tabletop roleplaying games since the launch of the game in 2016. Now this dark and mysterious world welcomes an even wider audience, with the production of a Player’s Guide, Gamemaster’s Guide and Bestiary adapted for 5E, published under the Open Gaming License. Note that you will need the core 5E rulebooks to fully enjoy Ruins of Symbaroum.
Welcome to the world of Symbaroum

The rich and nuanced Symbaroum setting revolves around the Ambrians – a civilization that two decades ago were forced to flee their ancestral soil after a devastating war. Their new and promised land borders on the vast forest of Davokar, covering the remnants of the Empire of Symbaroum which fell into ruin hundreds of years ago. Brimming with natural resources and mythical treasures, the forest calls out to the Ambrians to be explored and plundered, but the road into its depths lays far from open. Not only are the shadows beneath the foliage fraught with danger, monsters and infectious Corruption; there are also the elves of the Iron Pact who have vowed to die to keep anyone from disturbing the ruins of old, warning that the ancient evil of Symbaroum stirs in its sleep. 
About ten years ago, Queen Korinthia of the Ambrians finally vanquished Chieftan Haloban and his Jezites.
Now you can join in the adventure! Seek out the barbarian clans to trade or to plunder their treasuries; establish a base of power among princes, guilds, or rebellious refugees in the capital city of Yndaros; survive encounters with trolls, dark-minded beasts, and undead warlords. But always remember the warnings spoken by the wardens of the forest: tread carefully and do not disturb the ruins of old, for the horrors of Davokar are about to awaken!
If you want a more in-depth introduction to the setting, download On the Nature of Davokar - a report from a lecture at the wine cellar Tuvinels in Yndaros.

220+ pages, full color, hardback, sewn and glued spine, size 8.5 x 11 inches / 216 x 279 millimeters
Aside from the base core rules referenced in the 5E OGL, the Ruins of Symbaroum Player’s Guide contains everything you need to create characters and set out to explore the world of Symbaroum. We provide this information in five major sections: an introduction to the setting, new rules for gameplay, new character origins, new character classes and feats, and a set of resources (equipment, spells, etcetera) for making characters and for use during play.

New Rules 
To emphasize the dark fantasy nature of the setting, new rules for traveling and rests, social challenges, and magic are introduced. Regarding magic, wielders of mystical powers cannot avoid being affected by the ever-present threat of Corruption — the gathering of darkness to each character’s Shadow which, if left untended, can manifest as terrible physical transformations and even the eventual loss of the character entirely, as Corruption consumes them mentally and physically.

New Origins
Aside from familiar folks such as humans, elves, and dwarves, the Symbaroum game world lets you create PCs and NPCs who are changelings, ogres, goblins, trolls and even a particular form of undead. Also, the more recognizable folks differ quite radically from what you would expect – for instance, in Symbaroum the elves (rather than orcs, trolls, or similar) could be described as the default enemy of adventurers and explorers.
In Ruins of Symbaroum, character Backgrounds are generally tied to Origins. The following Origins and Backgrounds are included in the Player's Guide: 
Origins: Human (clanfolk), Dwarf, Elf and Troll
New Classes
The Ruins of Symbaroum Player’s Guide presents the classes Captain, Hunter, Mystic, Scoundrel and Warrior – each with between four and seven different approaches (called Subclasses in the 5E OGL rules), and all of them with customized features up to the 20th level. The captain class is something special, as its members have the capability to command and train others, to improve the fighting ability of a group as a whole. 
Approaches: Ironsworn, Rune Smith, Weapon Master and Sorcerer
The graphic design of Ruins of Symbaroum borrows elements from the award-winning design of the original Symbaroum game.
Both these spreads are drafts (works-in-progress) from the Ruins of Symbaroum Player's Guide.

200+ pages, full color, hardback, sewn and glued spine, size 8.5 x 11 inches / 216 x 279 millimeters; NOTE: the cover art is a placeholder and will be replaced.
The Ruins of Symbaroum Gamemaster’s Guide provides tools and guidelines for running the game, developing the setting and creating your own adventures. The content may be summarized as follows:

Invoking Symbaroum
 Gamemaster’s Rules – on Ability Checks, Combat and Challenge Ratings, Time Within the Game, and Shadow and Corruption.
 The Setting – describes three settlements central to the setting: Thistle Hold, the town of explorers and treasure hunters; Yndaros, the capital city of the kingdom of Ambria; and Karvosti, the cliff of the barbarian High Chieftain deep inside the forest of Davokar.
Running Ruins of Symbaroum
 Building Game Worlds – guidelines on how to understand and develop the specific game world of Symbaroum.
 Adventures and Landscapes – instructions on creating adventures and adventure landscapes where the PCs dictate the course and outcome of the story.
 Chronicles – tips on how to design an adventure chronicle (also called campaign or adventure path) set in the world of Symbaroum.
 Magical Items and Artifacts – a huge number of mystical artifacts that all come with ready-made adventure hooks, as well as guidelines on how to create mystical artifacts of your own.
Optional Rules

200+ pages, full color, hardback, sewn and glued spine, size 8.5 x 11 inches / 216 x 279 millimeters; NOTE: the cover art is a placeholder and will be replaced.
The Ruins of Symbaroum Bestiary is in most respects a reflection of the award-winning Symbaroum Monster Codex, but with stats and rules adapted for 5E – the difference being that it also includes the monsters and adversaries featured in the Symbaroum Core Rulebook.

Hordes of the Eternal Night
Twenty-seven original creatures that haunt, roam and wreak havoc on the world of Symbaroum.
Each creature come with full color art, lore, an adventure Set-up and between one and four variants with different stat blocks
Beasts & Monsters
Approximately sixty creatures presented with shorter descriptions and stat blocks
Sorted into categories, such as Abominations, Predators, Spiders, Undead and Winged Creatures

Adversaries
Approximately seventy types of cultural beings presented with shorter descriptions and stat blocks
Sorted into categories, such as Champions of Prios, Elves, Outcasts, People of Davokar, Townsfolk and Trolls
The abominations of Davokar come in different shape and sizes...

To celebrate that the world of Symbaroum is finally coming to 5E, we're delighted to offer an unique Collector’s Edition of the three main books, invluded in the pledge level Conqueror of Symbaroum. These deluxe tomes are bound in faux leather with gold foil-stamped adornments. The Collector's Edition is exclusive to this Kickstarter and will never be printed again. 

We love friendly local gaming stores and want to forge an even closer relationship with you. We offer a retailer pledge, including five copies each of the three main books, at a discounted retailer price.
By taking part in this Kickstarter as a retailer, you make sure you get the books on time for the official release, and you get them at a lower cost than through most normal distribution channels. As an added bonus, your pledges will contribute to unlocking stretch goals.
For more information about how we work with retailers, and to get early information about our upcoming releases, sign up to our monthly retailer newsletter!
Please note that retailer pledges are only available to actual retailers. You will be asked to present your company organization number when confirming your pledge.

The stretch goals below are of three different types - Prints, PDFs and Expansions. Note that you must have selected the pledge level WARDEN OF DAVOKAR or higher to get the printed stretch goals.

updates.update_content: Dear backers, we hope that this update finds you well and in good spirits. Here at the Free League HQ things are hectic as always. The Symbaroum team has just sent Alberetor - The Haunted Waste (part five in The Throne of Thorns for the original game line) to print, and are preparing to distribute PDFs to pre-purchasers. At the same time, the RoS 5e team has reviewed a first draft of the entire Gamemaster's Guide and can conclude that the text is not far from being finished. Also, the Player's Guide has been laid out from start to finish - sure, there are still some gaps to fill, some tweaking and polishing to be done, but... Well, it would surprise us if we couldn't get the Alpha to you BEFORE Q4 2021. :-)

A certain emptiness consumes us, dear backers... This was three such amazing weeks that we will miss the daily interaction with you and seeing the continuous progress we made together. But that is how it is with Kickstarters, and luckily we can fill the void with fun work and dreams of the future. We will try to keep you updated on our progress, and you can always visit our forum where Jacob drops a note from time to time - currently about the task of converting the creatures of the Symbaroum Monster Codex to fit the Ruins of Symbaroum Bestiary. :-)

... or rather, it could have been the end, were it not for you, our amazing backers! Because of you, this is instead a beginning, hopefully the beginning of something that comes close to being as great as this Kickstarter experience has been.
It is late here in Sweden, so we hope you will forgive us for waiting until tomorrow with a more lengthy summary of the campaign. Right now we are all smiles and fuzzy feelings, which  was probably pretty evident in the Youtube countdown which ended a few minutes ago.  You can see the rerun anytime you like by clicking the image below.

updates.update_userinfo: WE HAVE EMPTIED THE DIG SITE!
updates.update_content: Or, more accurately, YOU have emptied it, dear backers! We hope that you are as happy about the thirty-two finds as we are, for the value they have added to your pledges, and for what they will add to your upcoming sessions at the gaming table. :-)

First, dear backers, amazing work while we napped! You blew past the folder in a hurry (yay!) and here we find ourselves closing in on the expanded ruins map. Will we also see the second art print in the bag before the end!? Either way, looking at the SGs uncovered, we hardly know what to say anymore...

Yes, dear backers, by this time tomorrow we will be crossing the finish line; we will have emptied this ruin of finds; we will have reach the bittersweet end - sweet, because of the awesome outcome; bitter, because... well, because this great journey has to stop. Since yesterday at about this time, we have been travelling with great speed, so chances are that we will reach the finish line running.

It was a while since we said it "out loud", but with 34 hours to go it is high time to repeat how incredibly grateful we are for the support and assistance you have given this project, dear backers. Thanks to you, Ruins of Symbaroum 5E will not only transform from idea to reality; it is already an immediate success that launches with readymade supplements, such as the GM's Screen, the two adventure books and the VTT-modules. We cannot thank you enough, but let us at least share another stunning art piece from the Bestiary with you!

That, dear backers, was the sound of us exploding, from joy that the base setting bundles will come to be fitted into super nice, Kickstarter exclusive slipcases! Honestly, that we (meaning you) managed to salvage this find little more than an hour after the reminder email started circulating… we did not see that one coming. Hence, all the more reason to rejoice, and to explode. :-)
Were it not so late we would surely grab our shovels and get back to work, since we will hardly be able to claim the adventure map of Kurun and Sarli just by standing around with these blissful smiles upon our faces.

Because you're worth it, dear backers! :-)
Call us overly confident, but since we now are quite sure that we will reach all the way to kr4.000.000 before the end, why take any chances with the slipcases? In other words, stretch goal #28 and #29 have swapped places, meaning that the slipcases are next on the list. We want you to have them! And, yes, we are quite keen on them ourselves...  :-)
