At $23,000: Cleared! Even more player handouts! We will add four more at this pledge level.
At $25,000: Cleared! Over the course of this campaign you’ll read a variety of design notes from the team that created this adventure. At this stretch goal level we will print the design notes and include them for print backers!
At $28,000: Cleared! Let's make that cover stand out even more. At this level we will print the title in a brilliant foil.
At $32,000: Cleared! Even more player handouts! We will add four more at this pledge level. At this point we’re up to +16 on the original count, or approximately 40 or so.
At $34,000: Cleared! Pre-printed character sheets for the pregens! In a tournament format the included pregens are ready-made for the adventure. At this stretch goal we will create pre-printed character sheets, ready for distribution at the table and immediate use. PDF pledges will receive the digital files, and print pledges will receive the preprinted versions. Get out your pencil and start marking off the hit points!
At $36,000: Cleared! I Got Wasted By The Devil Lich! This amazing graphic was used for a T-shirt at the original 2004 Gen Con tournament. At this pledge level, we’ll include a poster of this vintage graphic for every print backer. Maybe some stickers too. PDF backers will receive the high-res file for home printing.
At $39,000: Cleared! Even more player handouts! We will add four more at this pledge level. At this point we’re up to +20 on the original count, or approximately 44 or so.
At $42,000: Cleared! I Got Wasted By The Devil Lich, Again! At this pledge level we’ll create a new poster design, using the new cover art, and include it for all print backers. PDF backers will receive the high-res file for home printing.
At $45,000: Cleared! We will print the books with custom endsheet art.
At $60,000: Cleared! Six more pregenerated characters! Give your players additional options after the Devil Lich scores her first TPK. (already achieved)
At $70,000: Cleared! For all print backers, "I got wasted by the Devil Lich" stickers (in sets for 6 for a special TPK set)
At $80,000: Cleared! Even more pregenerated characters! Another six so your players can keep going after the second TPK.
At $90,000: Cleared! A player handout folio. For print backers, this will be a separate set of handouts, bound in a different volume than the main book, ready for distribution to the players
At $100,000: Cleared! The Lost Level of the Crypt of the Devil Lich, for both DCC and 5E. A completely new level to the complex, designed in the original tournament style of multiple designers all coordinated by a master dungeon architect.
Along the way: we will add an option to print all the player handouts in full color. We will ask backers to spread the word about this project, to help us all achieve the stretch goals. If enough backers achieve a set of social media goals, we’ll print 100% of the handouts in full color. More details to come on this!
At $120,000: Cleared! The devil lich as patron! We will create DCC rules for the devil lich as a patron, including three new spells.
At $125,000: Cleared! Slipcase with new art on it, automatically added to all hardcover pledges (regardless of rules set or cover art choice, all printed hardcovers will have this slipcase added). This will be a Kickstarter exclusive, not available in retail stores, and will feature brand new art.
Let's get the deluxe slipcase!
Rules Format in 5E and DCC
We are producing two books. The core adventure is the same, but one book has 5th edition stats, while the other uses DCC stats. Each book is available in both print and PDF format, as well as a limited-run virgin art cover.
The grid below shows all book-related pledge levels. (There are additional pledge levels in PDF and VTT format, as noted below.)
VTT Support Options
We are offering VTT support as separate pledge levels and as add-on options in the Kickstarter pledges. VTT support options are as follows:
 Fantasy Grounds VTT, in 5E rules set ($20)
 Fantasy Grounds VTT, in DCC rules set ($20)
Platform-neutral VTT art set (maps & tokens) ($10)
How do I add on VTT support? Click "Manage Your Pledge" and select from the add-ons that are available.
Shipping Cost
Shipping costs are not included in the pledge levels. Shipping costs will be assessed closer to actual time of shipping. Based on estimated page count for the book, here are estimated shipping costs. Please note that shipping costs have been extremely volatile for the last year, and there are several active events affecting shipping costs (for example, Brexit). Final shipping costs will be based on actual shipping cost at time of shipment (as assessed through a post-Kickstarter pledge manager).
For international shipping destinations, these estimates include prepaid VAT and tracked shipment via FedEx. We have found this service to be extremely fast, reliable, and efficient, although it is more expensive than traditional USPS bulk shipping.
USA shipping estimate: $8-$10
Canada shipping estimate: $25-$30 (via FedEx, including prepaid VAT and customs clearance)
EU/UK shipping estimate: $30-$35 (via FedEx, including prepaid VAT and customs clearance)
AUS/NZ shipping estimate: $35-$40 (via FedEx, including prepaid VAT and customs clearance)

The process for writing this dungeon involved a master designer who assembled the overall plot, then contributing writers who each designed a few rooms. The master designer on both the original edition and the updated edition is Chris Doyle.
The contributing writers, who each designed one or more encounters, include Chris Doyle, Lisa Doyle, Mike Ferguson, Joseph Goodman, Andrew Hind, Jason Little, Adrian M. Pommier, Jeffrey Quinn, F. Wesley Schneider, and Andrew N. Smith.
Chris Doyle began his freelance writing career in the tabletop role playing game industry in the early 1990’s through volunteer efforts with the Role-Playing Game Association (RPGA). He has since freelanced for several companies including TSR, West End Games, Wizards of the Coast, Atlas Games, and Goodman Games. Although he has designed and contributed source material for various game systems, his true passion is adventure design for Dungeons and Dragons. He has penned adventures for the 2nd edition, 3rd edition, 3.5 edition, 4th edition and 5th edition of Dungeons and Dragons. For Goodman Games, he is a contributor to the Fifth Edition Fantasy product line and is the lead writer on four of the six Original Adventures Reincarnated product line, 5th edition conversions and homages to classic adventures from the 70’s and 80’s. In late 2020, Chris joined Goodman Games full time as the Director of 5E Development and Design. Chris is a certified Lake Manager, and has nearly 30 years experience as an aquatic biologist. He is a proud resident of New Jersey on the East Coast.
Bob Brinkman has been playing RPGs since dinosaurs roamed the earth and game books were small and beige. Best known for his work for Goodman Games, Bob has been a part of the creative teams for DCC Lankhmar, DCC Dying Earth, and MCC. On the 5E side of things, he authored Castle in the Sky and The Forgotten Hive, and was fortunate to write additional material of the OAR release of Castle Amber.
Bob has worked with a number of publishers, including Shield of Faith (The Umerican Road Atlas), Stiff Whiskers Press (Weird Frontiers), Fail Squad Games (Those Dam Goblins), and additionally, is one of the “Keepers of Mysteries” at the Sanctum Secorum (www.sanctum.media) podcast.
Outside of gaming, Bob has been a stable hand, swordsman, stuntman, and even a professional fire-breather. He lives in southwest Florida with his wife, Judge Jen, and their four cats.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
The Devil Lich is a remorseless taskmaster, and she works us hard! Here's the latest recap of progress on this Kickstarter.
The Lost Level
One of the most exciting stretch goals was unlocking The Lost Level of the Devil Lich. The 5E manuscript for the Lost Level is now written and in editing. The DCC conversion is coming soon. Each designer did a different room, and Chris has assembled the detailed map sketches below in the rough order that they'll appear in the final map. The final map will be rendered in our usual style, with connecting passages and such - this is just to give you an idea of the room layout. As with the original dungeon, each room is full of unique challenges and will be a real challenge for PCs.

The 5E manuscript is now completely written, playtested, and edited, and some art has been commissioned. We have a preview below of some of that art. 
The DCC manuscript is in process, with some final playtest feedback being incorporated.

And again, thanks to the superbackers who stepped in and answered other folks questions before we did. I know we lost a few backers along the way due to the artwork situation, but extra thanks to those who stuck with us, despite the bumps. We think you are getting an outstanding product!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Indie Boards & Cards has learned how to streamline the game publishing process and has successfully delivered games to thousands of its supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Aeon's End: Legacy of Gravehold will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards & Cards will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS

We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case-by-case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense of replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS

If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY

Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Since the dawn of fantasy roleplaying games, opening locks has been a staple of roguish characters. This mini-supplement for the worlds most popular roleplaying game is filled with information about locks and how to open them.
It includes:
A real-world history of locks and keys
Ideas for a fantasy history
Variant Locks – Including real world items like false keyholes, and fantasy items like talking locks
A random key generator
2 new traps
4 new magic items
1 new spell
3 new monsters
A Mini-Kickstarter for a Mini-Supplement
We love how Kickstarter campaigns encourage experimentation. With this campaign we're trying something new: a low funding goal for a short product.
The text of the Lock and Key is written and we already have some art complete. We could release a version of the book as-is. So why run a Kickstarter Campaign? Because we want to release the best book possible. We want to use the funds to improve the book with more art, including a color cover, and to fund conversions to Pathfinder 2nd Editionand Savage Worlds Adventure Edition.
We also want to test the market for a possible line of books, each themed around a piece of mundane gear. If we reach enough stretch goals, the next book will be themed around rope, and Kickstarter backers will help us choose the third book.
Which brings us to...
Stretch Goals!

campaign.story:
Return to the world of Root with The Marauder Expansion. Raze the Woodland to the ground as the fearsome Lord of the Hundreds, or recover precious relics from this destructive conflict as the Keepers in Iron. Explore dozens of faction combinations, including many new head-to-head matchups with the hirelings and advanced setup cards. New and experienced players have never had so many ways to enjoy Root!
The Keepers in Iron are an order of itinerant warriors who have come to the Woodland to recover ancient relics. To find them, they must manage their Woodland contacts carefully, as only the local animals know how to find the relics they seek. Paragons of discipline, their warriors sport pristine armor of a quality rarely seen here, making them a terror in battle. However, to keep their forces well-supplied and mobile, they must maintain a network of caravans and waystations.
Claiming to be the true voice of the Woodland, the Lord of the Hundreds spreads distrust and division among its inhabitants, inciting torch-wielding mobs to destroy the enemies of their righteous dominion. His swarming army can overwhelm all but the toughest defense. By looting items from the undeserving and adding them to his towering hoard, his power grows as he develops an increasingly fearsome monomania.
Root's hirelings lend their services to factions willing to pay the price. Court the Marquise's infamous Forest Patrol or sway the rampaging Last Dynasty from the Eyrie to join your cause. Whether you are playing with two players or six, the hirelings are sure to offer you exciting new ways to play Root. 
Discover new corners of the world of Root.  Fight for control of the cosmopolitan Free City of Root or attempt to secure influence over the Black Market. Build buildings among the Elder Treetops or secure the Legendary Forge. Each landmark offers players new strategic challenges and tactical possibilities. Best of all, they work with each of Root's four maps!
With your support in 2019, the Underworld Kickstarter brought Root to more players than ever before. In the years since the game’s release, Root continues to enjoy a vibrant and welcoming community of old and new players alike.
At Leder Games, we are deeply grateful for this community. Because of you all, we can keep food on our tables and the lights on at the office. You also give us space to take risks and develop new games. And, perhaps best of all, your support means that we can continue exploring the world of Root!
Root: The Marauder Expansion is the next chapter in the series. The expansion offers two new factions: the Lord of the Hundreds and the Keepers in Iron. Both factions are designed to work seamlessly with all previous factions and provide players with unique gameplay challenges and the dramatic, narrative-first asymmetry that has become a hallmark of Root’s design.
The expansion also introduces the hireling system. This is a gameplay option that can be used at any player count and faction mix. Hirelings are perfect for folks wanting the experience of Root as a two-player contest or who want to inject their multiplayer games with even more combos and color from the game’s wider world.
Root is a fully asymmetric strategy board game designed by Cole Wehrle, lavishly illustrated by Kyle Ferrin, and brought to life by the team at Leder Games. Stalk the woods as one of the Vagabonds, seize the initiative with the Eyrie birds of prey, rule over your subjects as the Marquise de Cat, or command the Woodland Alliance to create a new order. In Root, the players drive the narrative, and the differences among the roles create unparalleled interaction and replayability.    
To understand how Root integrates with all of our products in this campaign, as well as our current existing expansions, please refer to our New to Root Chart.
Root is currently in-stock and available on our webstore for most regions. (For North American backers, we have a pre-order open for late Spring delivery.) If you want to obtain a copy as fast as possible, check with your Friendly Local Game Store or consider ordering from our site. For other expansions and products, you can order directly from our webstore or visit your neighborhood game seller. We will not offer an “All-In” pledge, or include previous releases as add-ons for this campaign. 
At Leder Games, we are committed to sharing our design process openly. As with campaigns in the past, we'll be releasing preview kits both as print-and-play files and mods for Tabletop Simulator. The first kit will be released on Thursday the 25th, and the second will arrive on the week following. 
Click here to download the preview kit!

If you are looking for players, you can find a huge community over on Leder Games' official Discord channel, the Woodland Warriors. 
Shipping will be charged post-campaign in Backerkit.

Customs and Duty-Free Shipping
Leder Games will pre-pay the duties and taxes for the backers who receive their games in the US, EU, Canada, and Australia. All other countries or regions may be subject to additional customs fees upon delivery.

For our UK friends: At this time the UK has not provided a mechanism that will allow this type of pre-payment for crowdfunded projects fulfilling after June 2021. We are working with our VAT agency to find a solution, but at this time there is not one available. It is likely that by the time we’re making plans for fulfillment there will not be additional VAT, but we cannot promise this with the ongoing legislation changes. We are keeping a close eye on developments, and will provide updates as we are able during the campaign and leading up to fulfillment. We assure you we wish Brexit had less effect, but alas here we are.
Countries we cannot ship to: Afghanistan, Congo, Ivory Coast, Eritrea, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar, North Korea, Somalia, Sudan,  and Syria.

Leder Games now has 11 excellent employees who are all good at their jobs. Our project management, production, and logistical capacities have grown considerably over the past few years. We have completed many Kickstarters in the past and are on the verge of fulfilling our most recent project, Oath.

At every stage of the design, development, production, and fulfillment process we have many established partners. If we raise enough funds on Kickstarter, we will make sure that you get your games. 

That said, the global pandemic has put stress on supply chains everywhere. This has caused some delays in Oath's shipping and increased our costs. It is possible that this project experiences some delays, but we have built lots of padding into our schedule. In any case, we are committed to being as transparent as possible and have a wide range of contingency plans for every circumstance.

Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully cooperative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore. 
Here's a look at everything included in a base pledge:

28mm scale Factory Sample Photo (not final color).
Miniatures painted for example purposes only. Miniatures in the game will come unpainted.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss.
Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path.  Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.
Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.
The game is played over 2 ACTS: the Dungeon and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.
After clearing the dungeon of all its minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.
These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!
Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss!
In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect Legendary Loot, and Supreme Spells. 
Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect. 
Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact.
The story is yours to tell in...
When you pledge for a Deluxe copy of Tiny Epic Dungeons, you will receive the base game PLUS the Deluxe, Potions & Perils, components shown below.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!
Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins.  When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!
Additionally,  the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players!

In Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories players dive deeper into the lore of Aughmoore. 
The Stories expansion introduces a new Story Mode that has Heroes completing Side Quests and adventuring deeper into the dungeon, descending Multiple Floors and eventually fighting multiple Dungeons Bosses at once!
In addition, Stories offers a slew of new Heroes, Loot, Dungeon Rooms, Dungeon Bosses, Minions, and Goblins! 
The Stories expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Dungeons. It will share the same length and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!

Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Dungeons to game tables around the world!

campaign.story:
The Wizard's Grimoire
A few years ago now, I designed a game called The Wizard's Grimoire. In it, you play an ambitious minor wizard who's come into possession of a grimoire beyond your arts. Can you study and unlock it? What wizardries does it contain? Into what troubles and adventures will your ambitions lead you?
Since then, I've written several more games set in the same world -- The Barbarian's Bloody Quest, The Last Adventure, The Thief & the Necromancer -- and also additional grimoires for the original game. Each offers new characters to play or new wizardries to unlock and master.
I'd like to bring these games to a wider audience. In all, I've already written enough material to publish 7 issues of a zine, so that's what I'm going to do!
Gameplay: the Grimoire
At the heart of the game is the grimoire: a text of many sections and its own set of rules. Each section represents a wizardous advancement you can achieve, a new spell you can learn or act of wizardry you can undertake, but each also has its own rules for unlocking and studying them. Don't read ahead! You can only read the sections you've unlocked and studied.
Most wizards' grimoires also include "safeguards," sections you unlock by improper study. These include magical curses, setbacks, and disasters. Trigger a safeguard and the spellbook may rewrite itself, summon a destructive creature from another world, or even send you reeling 10 minutes back into the past. Keep trying to study it without disarming the safeguard, and it'll keep sending you back!
Your first grimoire is a challenging 1st-level text called "The Signature of Aibesta of the Two Courts." Aibesta of the Two Courts was a powerful wizard of an age some four centuries past. Her grimoire includes the techniques to summon an Impeccable Servant, a powerful familiar and bodyguard, an act of wizardry that Aibesta undertook but never accomplished.
Work your way through the entire grimoire, and not only will you learn powerful new spells, you'll establish your workroom, the foundation of your future seclusium; you'll learn techniques to better subdue and study future grimoires; and you'll accomplish what Aibesta herself couldn't: the summoning of an Impeccable Servant!
Gameplay: You and Your Volunteers
To play The Wizard's Grimoire, you need two volunteers (or three works fine) to play against you. Only you, the wizard player, need to know the rules. You're responsible for knowing your own rules and making your own calls. You're also responsible for telling your volunteers any points of continuity that you want them to know.
In this way, the game upends the normal player-GM relationship. Instead of a GM saying, "hey, I have this game I'd like to run, who's in?" you say, "hey, I'm trying to get my wizard through this spellbook, do you have a minute?"
Each session that you play is an episode in your wizard's study and adventures. They can be as short or as long as you like, you can play as often or rarely as you like, and you can have different volunteers, or the same ones, every time you play.
Gameplay: System & Dice
The Wizard's Grimoire uses a dice pool version of the good old PbtA moves.
You have ratings for your moves based on your qualities -- for instance, your rating to exert yourself subtly to take surreptitious action is equal to your Ambitious + your Cunning, while your rating to exert yourself violently against an enemy is equal to your Bold + your Cunning. Roll that many dice, count the 4s, 5s and 6s as hits, and if you roll no hits, it's a miss. Usually, you get to spend your hits on things you want to happen or questions you want to ask, but you know how it is with moves, they each work a little differently.
Since you both call for your own rolls and interpret their results for yourself, the moves answer to different design concerns than they do in a conventional PbtA game. I think they're pretty interesting, and if you're a PbtA-head like me, I think you will too.
Future Issues (Spoilers!)
 The Dictum of Polume the Farer: An easy and useful 1st-level grimoire, including such spells as creating a scampering lantern and summoning a jarful of plasmic hornets. You can study it alongside Aibesta's Signature for very good results.
 The Barbarian's Bloody Quest: Can you find and slay the wizard who butchered and subjugated your family? Includes "The Book of Doomed Wizards." 
 The Three Scrolls of Jorvelte Wild-Crowned: A 2nd-level grimoire, including the wizardous techniques to enchant magical items, including a useful and dangerous staff of glimmering menace.
 The Last Adventure: In your youth, you were a warrior and a hero. Now you're dead, but no one brought you the sup of oblivion. Take up the memory of your old sword, the memory of your old helmet, and make your last adventure here in the land of death. Includes "In the Land of Death" and "Answering the Calling Voice." 
 The Red Tome of Salabrusto the Wise: A 2nd-level grimoire, including an almanac of alien worlds and planes, and wizardous techniques both to travel to them and summon entities from them.
 The Thief & the Necromancer: You're friends, a gifted necromancer and a thief and street performer. You've both escaped bad situations and you've thrown in together to take on the world. Includes "Goerne, a Ghostly Tutor." 
Attention: Patrons
If you support lumpley games on Patreon, you'll already get the digital version of The Wizard's Grimoire as a patron reward. Don't sign up for it here!
If you'd like a copy in print, though, this is the best way to get one.
Reduced Price Level & Community Copies
Times are tight!
If you want to support the project but the full price is a stretch, or if you're curious about the game but can't justify paying full price sight unseen, we've been there! Please feel free to join in at the reduced price level.
When we publish, we'll also make a number of free, community-supported copies available, no questions asked. If you can't join in now, please reshare the project and pick up a community copy when they come out.
Thanks!

updates.update_content: "...Along the road to this other world, his small book was stolen from him by the wizardess Doura of the House of Pulo. At that moment his psyche was searching for the path ahead, apart from his body, and she thought that he was dead. She thrust a sharp skewer through his body and throat several times to test her theory. It being, she considered, proven, she kept his side-bag and his sun-bonnet, but left his shoes, which were by this time stained with travel."

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Manufacturing

Beasts of Balance is already in the market and has enjoyed both extremely positive customer reviews and very low hardware defect rates ( <0.5%). We're constantly working to optimize the hardware and software to make the game even more stable and easy to use. Adding new components such as the new Beasts does increase complexity, but we'll be working hard with our manufacturing partners and QA team to ensure that quality is as high as its always been.

Digital Development

We will continue to build out digital features using Unity, which is an extremely well supported cross platform game engine that helps ensure we can deploy app updates compatible with a broad range of iOS and Android devices at a regular cadence. However, as with all software development, there is always the risk of unforeseen challenges and gnarly issues that can slow down development or make certain features that much harder to ship in a given timeframe. We will, however, always be as transparent as possible with our player community in the unlikely event that we need to delay or drop digital features.

updates.update_content:
Hello Beastly Balancers!
We hope you're all getting ready for summer and playing lots of games wherever in the world you call home. We know we are (when we're not working on all things Beasts of Balance and Raid).
The survey results are in and we are ecstatic that nearly 27% of backers responded. Thank you to everyone who took the time to complete it!

Hey Beastly Balancers!
Thanks to all of you, there will be five awesome new Beasts joining the world of Balance next year and for those of us with an ever expanding collection of Beasts and Artefacts, we will have a brand new Beastly Big Box to store all of them in one place.
While the Kickstarter campaign just wrapped up and we successfully funded, the real work is just getting started.

updates.update_userinfo: Woot! Thanks for all your support!!
updates.update_content:
Hello Beastly Balancers!
In case the title of this update didn't make it obvious, we have a BIG announcement today and if you've been following the campaign at all, you probably already guessed that we are officially launching the Beastly Big Box.
As long time BoB players ourselves, we are acutely aware of the storage challenges that come along with owning Beasts of Balance and many (or all) of the wonderful expansions. Recently, we've been displaying the BoB core game box on a shelf with all the expansions setup which sits alongside other shelves containing some of our favorite games, books, music and photos.

Hey Beastly Balancers!
We are more than halfway through the campaign and are coming into the home stretch. For everyone that has shared their feedback on the campaign, things you love, things you think we could be doing better, etc, thank you!! We really appreciate it.
For those that want to hear from us more, we're going to do a better job sharing updates and monitoring comments over the next week or so.

updates.update_userinfo: BoB Base Game + KSE Bundles Price Improvements
updates.update_content:
Hello Beastly Balancers,
We heard some of you were interested in seeing what is included in the Kickstarter Exclusive Edition of the base game for the campaign. Ya know what? That makes sense! It's a totally reasonable expectation.
Apologies that we didn't include these details at the start of the campaign. We got a bit too cutesy for our own good as we had this elaborate plan to unveil items a bit at a time over the duration of the campaign. To a certain extent, that will still happen, but to make it easier to understand the value of the KSE package and what you're backing in the campaign, we have updated all Reward Tiers in the story section of the campaign to reflect extras that are included at each level.

Hey Beastly Balancers!!!
We did it! You did it! We hit our funding goal in 6 hours and we couldn't have done it without you. :)
Thank you sooooo much for all the love you show for BoB everyday! We feel it. And if you're new to the wonderful world of Balance and the Beasts that inhabit it, welcome! We can't wait for you to experience the game all of us love so much.

Risks and challenges
THINGS CAN CHANGE 
All images used in this Kickstarter are subject to change and may represent unfinished or non-final art or design. All card counts are subject to change. All card and component names are subject to change. All packaging is subject to change. Rules are subject to change. 

As the game has not been manufactured yet, all images and descriptions are what we are aiming to create. It is possible during the production process that some items might change in appearance, functionality, size, or quantity. We will attempt to keep such changes to a minimum. 

FULFILLMENT 
Bezier Games, Inc. has been publishing boardgames for more than 10 years. Several factors can cause delays that are beyond our control, including manufacturing issues and shipping delays. The COVID-19 pandemic could be a factor in possible delays; in all cases, we've tried to incorporate a reasonable level of padding into shipping estimates. 

The estimated fulfillment is December 2021, but keep in mind that this is just an estimate, this year more than ever before. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. 

RESTRICTED DELIVERY 
Due to increased frequency in Kickstarters failing to deliver to certain locations, Bezier Games, Inc. has decreased the amount of locations Kickstarter rewards may ship to. This is because of several reasons - the majority being issues of reward packages getting lost, stolen, being unable to clear customs. In addition to this, some countries have been removed due to heavily increased accounts of piracy. 

Bezier Games, Inc. will only be shipping to the following locations: United States of America, Puerto Rico, Canada, United Kingdom, Europe (European Union, Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Georgia, Iceland, Kosovo, Liechtenstein, Macao, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Norway, San Marino, Serbia, Switzerland, Turkey, Ukraine, Vatican City), Australia, New Zealand, China, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea, Taiwan, Philippines, and Military (APO)

SHIPPING
Shipping is charged after the KS campaign concludes, based on the actual costs Bezier Games incurs to ship from distribution centers to your delivery address. All shipping & handling costs will be paid by backers through our BackerKit Pledge Manager. Links to this pledge manager will be sent roughly two weeks after the campaign ends. The BackerKit pledge manager is a 3rd party used to finalize orders and shipping outside of Kickstarter, Kickstarter has no responsibility in this regard. Shipping costs vary based on where you will have your reward delivered; we always do our very best to ensure backers the best price possible. 

At the start of this campaign, we expect the box included with the Collector level and Royal level to be about 300 x 300 x 160mm (similar to the Suburbia Collector’s Edition “regular” box) and weigh about 11 pounds. The Colossal level includes the same box, PLUS an additional box which we expect to be about 300 x 300 x 148mm, shipped together in a single carton weighing about 26 pounds. The shipping estimates below reflect these calculations.
 
Regional applicable taxes will be calculated in the Pledge Manager as well. Our shipping is US, CA, EU, UK, AU friendly meaning rewards will ship from within these regions. Any VAT for EU and UK will be collected in the pledge manager.

REFUNDS 
Bezier Games, Inc. will do whatever they can to minimize the risks but, should a backer become uphappy, we are willing to refund pledges if issues should arise while the Pledge Manager is open. Refunds of 100% of collected funds are available within the first 14 days of a campaign's end. Past that, Kickstarter still needs to collect their portion of the pledge which we do not cover. This results in a 90% refund given if it is requested after the 14 day period. Once the Pledge Manager closes, refund requests will be reviewed on a case by case basis. 

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed. Bezier Games, Inc. is not responsible for changes in the rate of foreign exchange. 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS 
By pledging to this project, you agree to conduct all public interactions via Kickstarter's communications channels with this project and our team and other backers in a positive manner. Harassment, name-calling, or attempts to inject inappropriate content into the public communications channels will not be tolerated. Bezier Games, Inc. reserves the right to cancel any pledge. 

If we ship to the address that you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is returned to us as undeliverable you may be required to pay the full cost to ship your reward again to a revised address. 

If we ship your reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package tracking status shows as delivered to that address, but you are unable to receive it, or you have moved and are no longer the occupant of that address and cannot otherwise retrieve the package, or if the package is lost or stolen after delivery, and you wish to have the order fulfilled again, you may be required to pay the full cost to ship the order to a revised address in addition to the amount of the original reward including any add-ons and other upgrades on your order. 

If we ship the reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is held in customs or by any other government agency, our ability to help may be limited. You may be required to contact your customs agency or government and arrange for the package to be cleared and released at your expense. We are not responsible for any fees levied against your pledge by customs or any government agency. We are not responsible for any refunds or re-shipments for packages held by customs or a government agency. 

Other than as noted elsewhere in these terms & conditions, if any part of your order cannot be fulfilled for any reason Bezier Games, Inc. will provide you with a pro-rated refund for that portion of your order. 

If you do not log in to our Pledge Manager and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. Bezier Games, Inc. reserves the right to deny or fulfill orders beyond these 8 weeks under our discretion. If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our Pledge Manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. 

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the retail release. 

If you have questions or concerns about these terms & conditions please email orders@beziergames.com for further information. Thank you!

We could use your input!
We are considering adding pull tabs to the box top to help when removing the lid; these half moon cutouts are typically on the box sides to the right and left of the cover.  We have heard some folks don't care for the way the tabs look aesthetically when the game is stored upright on its side when shelved.  Another option would be to put the tabs on the top side and the bottom side so they don't show when shelved, but you would have to turn the box to pull the lid off easily.

campaign.story:
Pinnacle Entertainment Group loves Pathfinder and Paizo's legendary Adventure Paths. We know you do, too, because we've seen literally hundreds of fan-made conversions of their amazing adventures over the years. So we decided to make it official and Paizo was gracious enough to let us play in their sandbox.
That means we're making Pathfinder for Savage Worlds AND an official version of the Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path!
Those who love the Savage Worlds game system can now play some of the best-selling, most-played, fan-favorite epic fantasy adventure tales in the entire history of the roleplaying game industry!
See below for details on two incredible packages—Pathfinder for Savage Worlds AND the Rise of the Runelords boxed sets!
Fast! Furious! Fun! FANTASY!
If you're new to Savage Worlds, it's a flexible system that can transition from NARRATIVE "theatre of the mind" to detailed tactical combat with CRUNCH as you like!
It powers everything from our own best-selling, award-winning Weird Western, Deadlands™ to our our many other settings such as Rippers™, The Last Parsec™, Eric Powell's The Goon™, or the Savage World of Flash Gordon™. You might also know we made the smash-hit Rifts® for Savage Worlds with  Palladium Books. Supers, horror, Western, scifi, and now high-fantasy—it's all one Fast! Furious! Fun! system.
You can check out the Test Drive here.
Dozens of Savage Worlds to explore!
Now we're taking our explorers into the land of Golarion, starting with the Pathfinder for Savage Worlds core rulebook. This 256-page, hardback book gives you all-new Class Edges, new powers and power options, gear specific to the world of Golarion, magic items, and more. And you don't need the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition for this one—the entire core Savage Worlds rules system, streamlined and tweaked for Savage Pathfinder, is included!
We've also created a hardback Pathfinder for Savage Worlds Bestiary, Game Master's Screen, and converted the classic and atmospheric adventure Hollow's Last Hope.
These accessories help the GM bring the world of Golarion alive for her players.
We're also super excited to bring you the Savage Worlds version of Paizo's first "Adventure Path," Rise of the Runelords. This epic, six-book saga takes Pathfinders on an incredible journey filled with deadly cultists, terrifying ogres, rampaging stone giants, and a final confrontation with...well, we don't want to ruin the surprise, but there's a big hint in the title! ;)
If you're interested in the original version, here's a link to the Pathfinder Rise of the Runelords product page. Paizo makes a wide range of pawns, additional books, maps, and even more for this and all their Adventure Paths.
We love Paizo's ethos, world-building, dedication to story, and incredibly detailed Adventure Paths, and can't wait to take this journey into the Savage World of Golarion with you.
 You can back this campaign at a Digital level or a Print level. Backers of digital reward tiers receive PDF files for the products contained in the respective tier. Print backers receive the physical products as well as PDFs of the products they backed.

Two huge boxes of Fast! Furious! Fun! Fantasy!
The core book contains the complete Savage Worlds rules, revised and tailored for Pathfinder. No other rulebook is needed!
Here are a few other highlights you can look forward to...
 Class Edges give players the feel of Pathfinder's iconic levels and classes in the classic Savage Worlds character creation and advancement system
 New powers and power options to reflect the feel of iconic Pathfinder spells
A trove of magic items, potions, scrolls, and other treasures 
Pathfinder for Savage Worlds features artwork from Paizo's amazing artists and graphic design from fan-favorite artist and Game Master Karl Keesler! (art and layout in this image not final)
The Ultimate Core Boxed Set gives you everything you need to start playing Pathfinder for Savage Worlds. (Art not final.)
The Ultimate Core Boxed Set includes: Savage Pathfinder Core Book with ribbon dividers, the Bestiary, GM Screen & iconic adventure Hollow's Last Hope, Dice Set, Bennies, Golarion Poster Map, Action Deck, Power Cards, Status Cards, Archetype Sets 1 and 2, Set of 5 Power Dials, Power Templates,  Cardboard Tokens Sheet, Ally & Adversary Cards, and the Quick Chase Deck!
Power Cards detail each power in the book, for easy reference. (Art not final.)
High-quality plastic poker-style chips featuring classic Pathfinder images. (Art not final.)
Archetype Cards feature Novice AND Seasoned Iconic characters ready to play, out-of-the-box. (Art not final.)
Status Cards remind players of the effects of the various game statuses they may suffer. (Art not final.)
If you back this campaign at the Runelord! level, you'll receive the Pathfinder for Savage Worlds Ultimate Boxed Set, as above, and the Rise of the Runelords Boxed Set.
The Rise of the Runelords Boxed Set contains everything the GM needs to run this epic 6-part Adventure Path. (Art not final.)
The Rise of the Runelords boxed set includes:* Burnt Offerings, The Skinsaw Murders, The Hook Mountain Massacre, Fortress of the Stone Giants, Sins of the Saviors, Spires of Xin-Shalast, Guide to the Hinterlands (unlocked as a stretch goal), a Campaign Map, 24 Adversary Cards, and player handouts. 
* Rise of the Runelords books are softback books, 80 to 96 page each.
What's Pathfinder?
Originally published in 2009, Pathfinder is a hugely successful d20-based fantasy roleplaying game from Paizo Inc. Players take the role of fantasy heroes seeking adventure, fame, and fortune in the world of Golarion. 
What's Savage Worlds?
Savage Worlds is a versatile roleplaying game system, first published in 2003 by Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Savage Worlds can be used with any genre or setting from four-color supers, to gritty sci-fi, to gothic horror, to high fantasy.
What's an Adventure Path?
Adventure Paths are in-depth stories for the Pathfinder RPG that tell an epic tale over a series of connected adventures. Players will see their characters grow in power from lowly beginnings until they become mighty heroes. 
So why convert these Adventure Paths to Savage Worlds? 
Simply put, because we love them. Pathfinder fits right into the types of worlds we love to play in, like the Weird Wild West of Deadlands, college horror and hijinks in East Texas University, the monstrous Victorian pulp world of Rippers, the far-flung future of The Last Parsec, the comic-strip heroism of Flash Gordon, or any of the other settings we’re known for.
So why not give Savage Worlds fans official rules to stop the insidious Skinsaw cult in Rise of the Runelords, defeat Baba Yaga in Reign of Winter, or explore the scorching deserts of Osiron in Mummy’s Mask? 
That was our proposition, and we feel honored our Paizo friends have trusted us to re-present their original work for our system. It’s truly an honor and a privilege, and one of the greatest projects we’ve ever worked on.
What are some of the Big Rule Changes from regular Savage Worlds?
First, Savage Pathfinder has Class Edges that give you one or more special abilities that balance out to the traditional Edge cost. Each one is unique and reinforces the class-based tropes of Pathfinder. And of course these serve as Requirements for higher Rank Edges that reflect Pathfinder's high-level abilities.
Savage Pathfinder also uses our dynamic, flexible power system. Certain Arcane Backgrounds have features that reflect the nuances of Pathfinder magic. For example, sorcerers and wizards have Armor Limitations that inflict penalties on their arcane skills if they wear inhibiting armor, and the rules for resting and recovering Power Points have been tweaked to best reflect the world of Golarion.
We've also added new powers and advanced Power Modifiers modeled (but adjusted) from the "Exalted Powers" created for Rifts® for Savage Worlds. These allow your bard, cleric, druid, sorcerer, or wizard to fully realize their power at higher Ranks!

campaign.story:
Every fantasy world is filled to the brim with interesting objects and intriguing features, but it takes a practiced eye to highlight those that can be used to your advantage. Enter Twill Medwyn, foremost expert in the all-important field of cryptoarchaeology, and her first-ever guide to Twist Points! With Twill's guide in hand, your adventurers will learn to explore their environments to find new ways to succeed in the harrowing challenges they face every day! 
The haunted artifacts of Mansion D'Arthane are ideal for cryptoarchaeological research!
Every Twist Point provides two fantastic options that your players can use to immerse themselves in the game world. Whether they shatter a Haunted Mirror to enhance their spiritual weapons or wind themselves up Hanging Silks to gain an acrobatic flair to their attacks, your adventurers will find hundreds of thematic options to create memorable combat scenes!
Twill's Twist Points is a 56-page zine filled with 25 fantastic locations and rules to bring them to life! Each location has six twist points, unique objects and features that players can use to enhance their abilities and grant them new options in combat. From strange spell components and mystical effects to dangerous nooks and dire environmental hazards, each twist point grants two possibilities to empower your players during a climactic scene!
Prototype image of the Infernal Machine scene and two sample Twist Points!

Along with two dozen unique locations, all backers will also receive rules for discovering and utilizing twist points with Twill Medwyn's very own Guidelines for Apprentice Cryptoarchaeologists! Finally, there will also be guidelines for creating new spectacular scenes and filling them with your very own twist points! 
This zine is intended to be used with the 5th Edition of Dungeons & Dragons under the Open Gaming License, but will include advice for adapting these rules to Pathfinder, Fantasy AGE, OSR, and many other roleplaying games.
Dungeons & Dragons works best when players are able to experience the three major pillars of play: combat, roleplaying, and exploration. Twist points are designed to give players clear options for exploring an encounter, without adding too much time and complexity to the scene. 
Each twist point is based around one or two skills. If your character is proficient in that skill, you can instantly see how to use a twist point to your advantage! 
These waterlogged masts are only strong enough for one last hurrah! Which will it be?
Powerful twist points require a more focused approach. By spending a bonus action and succeeding on a skill check, players gain access to dramatic Legendary effects! Most twist points can only be used for one moment of high-action play, driving players to choose between two fantastic boons. Throughout their battle, players must work together and strategize about the best way to apply these effects to a scene! 
Legendary twist points grant even more incredible opportunities to empower your scene!
Game masters can use Twill's Twist Points in a couple ways to add some explorative heft to their game.  Sometimes, one of our prewritten scenes is the perfect place to set a climactic battle scene in your own game. But game masters can easily take a set of Twist Points and use them in their own world. Twill's Twist Points is filled with a wide variety of scenes for almost any occasion!

Let's get Twill's Twist Points into your game with as little fuss as possible! 
Pledge levels are quick, simple, and convenient.
$7: Digital Cryptoarchaeologist
One digital copy of the zine, along with all stretch goals! You'll get Dropbox download links for both full-color and print-friendly formats.
$15: Physical Cryptoarchaeologist (US Shipping Only)
One physical copy of the zine, along with all stretch goals, sent to your very own home! The physical zine is a 5.5"x 8.5" booklet, printed and shipped from Los Angeles. You'll also get a digital copy of the zine!
$50: Master Cryptoarchaeologist (Create Your Own Scene!)
You'll send us a short description of a fantastic location from your own campaign. Julian and Rich will then work with you to create a brand new set of twist points for your game and include it in the zine! Oh yeah, and physical and digital copies of the zine! Plus, we'll ship this zine to you anywhere in the world. 

DESIGN & LAYOUT: Julian Leiberan-Titus (@dragmorian) is a game designer, graphic designer, and avid storyteller. He's the co-creator of Storm Hollow: a Storyboard Game, a storytelling adventure game for all ages, and Riftwalker, a board game set in the Storm Hollow universe. 
DESIGN & FULFILLMENT: Richard Malena-Webber (@rmalena) is a game designer, professional Dungeon Master, long-time teacher, and complete geek. He is the author of Empyrean Investigations and the headmaster of the Academy of Adventures. You can find his many other D&D projects on the Dungeon Masters Guild!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The largest risk in any Kickstarter is project completion. However, Twill's Twist Points is already more than half finished and we're both excited about finishing up our scenes. While we have added a "Write Your Own Scene" pledge level, this will come with strict deadlines to ensure that things are done on time and as planned. We currently see no reason why Scene Twists would be delayed due to either creative or design problems.

Both Rich and Julian have plenty of practice with the Kickstarter process, which means we know that shipping can always be a problem. Unfortunately, we are limiting our shipping exclusively to the US, since we would struggle to guarantee any kind of timeline to international customers.

This grimoire of new magic items for 5th Edition campaigns brings wild surprises to your gaming table, from unknown potions, to fabled weapons and armor, to everyday magic that could become a campaign staple. 
With over 800 items to start, many by leading tabletop designers and Kobold Press veterans, there's something here for your game, whether it is a new game underway or a long-term campaign that needs a jolt of new inspiration—for both the heroes and the villains! 
The regular edition of the hardcover features a durable Smyth-sewn binding, full-color printing, and hundreds of original magic items, plus tables for determining major and minor treasure placements that include SRD entries (so you can roll on the Vault of Magic tables and get an item from the Vault or from the 5E core items). 
The Vault of Magic limited edition features a leatherette cover with two-color foil stamping, special endpapers, and a ribbon bookmark. Only a few hundred of these will be produced; they will not be reprinted.
Previews and Design Diaries
What's in this tome? Check out design chats with Luke Gygax and Lauren Urban, the design chat with Deborah Ann Woll and Celeste Conowitch, designer Jeff Lee's Designer Diary, Celeste Conowitch's Designer Diary, the Fabled Items rundown, the Notes from the Editor. 
There are also Guest Designer Item Reveals for a dozen items or so in detail, available to anyone who pledges $1 or more. These include items by Deborah Ann Woll, Luke Gygax, Adam Bradford, Todd & Meagan Kenreck, Celeste Conowitch, and more.
Virtual Tabletop Support
When you pledge for one of the virtual tabletop reward levels, you get your choice of Roll20, Fantasy Grounds, or Shard format. These VTT rewards include the items from Vault of Magic, with art and stats already set up, as treasures you can add to your own campaign.
No matter how you play, there's a format of Vault of Magic that suits your needs. Just find the combination you prefer in the matrix below to determine which pledge level you want. 
A tome so chock full of amazing magic needs cool people contributing to it. Kobold Press has invited a whole slew of guest designers to write up their own unique items so we can share them with all of you. 
Deborah Ann Woll is a graduate of USC's BFA Acting program. She began her career on the highly acclaimed HBO series True Blood as the fiery baby vamp, Jessica, and starred as Karen Page on Marvel's Daredevil for Netflix. She is also the DM for Relics and Rarities, a D&D series set in a mysterious curio shop filled with wondrous items and real-world puzzles and props.
Adam Bradford is the founder of D&D Beyond and a catalyst in the TTRPG space. He started gaming at five with The Legend of Zelda, but his first love has been tabletop roleplaying for three decades. Adam lives in Huntsville, Alabama with his wife, two sons, and two rescued dogs. You can find Adam on Twitter.
Celeste Conowitch produces the actual-play D&D podcast Venture Maidens, and when not busy with that, you can find her writing for RPG companies such as Wizards of the Coast, Kobold Press, and 2C Gaming. She also moonlights as a space game master in her weekly Burn Bryte live stream on the Roll20 Twitch channel. To keep up with Celeste, check out her website.
Luke Gygax is the son of Dungeons & Dragons co-creator Gary Gygax and literally grew up at the gaming table. He has authored several role-playing game accessories over his lifetime. Luke organizes Gary Con, a memorial game convention held in honor of his father every year. He is also a lieutenant colonel in the Army with over 30 years of service. Luke is currently the Executive Officer for the 224th Sustainment Brigade whose motto is "The Dragonslayers."
Daniel Kwan is a former archaeologist turned Gold ENnie Award winning podcaster, game designer, and cultural consultant. You might know him from the ENnie Award winning Asians Represent! podcast. He is one of the co-founders of Level Up Gaming, a Toronto-based organization that provides adults with autism and other disabilities opportunities to develop their social skills through group gaming experiences.
Meagan Kenreck plays Sofieus, an Artificer Artillerist in the D&D 5e live-play show "Silver and Steel." She finds joy in getting creative with spell components and is a big fan of the spell Grease, which inspired the new magic item in Vault of Magic.
Todd Kenreck has been reporting on the tabletop and video-game industry for over 14 years and is an avid Dungeon Master and player. Visit Todd Kenreck on YouTube.
Professor Dungeonmaster is the host of the Dungeon Craft YouTube channel, where he rambles about people and things that do not exist. He also teaches wizardry at the secondary-school level and has taught advanced sorcery at the college level.
Victoria Rogers is the award-winning dungeon master of the all-women and non-binary actual-play podcast, The Broadswords. She was the producer for several “Podcasts of . . .” events for Wizards of the Coast as well as a consulting producer for D&D Live 2019: The Descent. A social-media witch by trade, she makes her home in Ontario, Canada, making wine and spending time in her garden.
Lauren “Oboe” Urban is the Community Manager for Codename Entertainment as well as a professional classical oboist. When she's not playing a Bard in real life, she's a prolific DM and player on a variety of livestreams and podcasts including the DM for the Dungeon Drunks podcast and playing Orkira on D4. You can find links to her published D&D content and performances on her website and Twitter.
Shanna Germain is an award-winning writer, game designer, and mocha imbiber, as well as the co-owner of Monte Cook Games. Most recently, she has worked on games like Numenera, No Thank You, Evil!; Predation, Invisible Sun, and We are All Mad Here. You can follow her down the rabbit hole at www.montecookgames.com or https://twitter.com/ShannaGermain
Vee Mus’e is well known for her work with terrain and miniatures for TTRPG (check out the terrain she made for Kobold Press' Zobeck!), as well as for her skills as a professional DM and player on a variety of live streams. She ran The Last Heir, a campaign inspired by Kobold Press’ Tales of the Old Margreve, for two seasons. You can find her on all social media platforms as The Crafting Muse.
Patrick Rothfuss is the international bestselling author of The Name of the Wind, though fewer folks know he got his storytelling start in 1984 when he found the AD&D DMG at the local library. Thought this was *way* before D&D was cool, Pat was still enough of a social pariah that nobody wanted to play with him, so he just read the books, imagined worlds, and dreamed of a time when he could find a group to play with him. He’s since rolled dice with Critical Role, Acquisitions Incorporated, the McElroys and many other fabulous, kind-hearted geeks. He streams at twitch.tv/patrickrothfuss/ and blogs at PatrickRothfuss.com.
Mike Shea is the writer for the website Sly Flourish and the author of Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master, the Lazy DM's Workbook, and other books including co-authoring Fantastic Lairs. Mike has freelanced for Wizards of the Coast and Kobold Press, and he has been writing for and about RPGs since 2008. Mike also happens to be the son of Robert J. Shea, author of the 70s cult SF novel Illuminatus!. Mike lives with his wife Michelle in Northern Virginia, USA.
Nerdarchist Ted has been an avid role playing fan for most of his life, playing tabletop RPGs for almost 30 years and RPG video games before that. He is a member of Nerdarchy, and you can find their thousands of videos discussing all things RPG on Youtube. Ted is a 7-palm Eagle Scout and is raising his kids in Scouting as well. As an all-around Nerd, loves novels, board games, and RPGs, and he invites you to check out Nerdarchy, where you can Stay Nerdy together.
Rudy Basso is a freelance audio engineer, designer, and GM who loves all things gaming. He is currently most excited about Dames & Dragons, the D&D AP podcast he produces that features a detailed original setting, lots of stupid jokes, a mystery or two, and some fumbling attempts at heroism.
Wolfgang Baur is the founder and publisher at Kobold Press, and has been an RPG writer since the days when print magazines roamed the earth. His recent design work includes Courts of the Shadow Fey, Southlands, and Tyranny of Dragons for 5th Edition. He can be found on Twitter @monkeyking
Janet Forbes is the founder and director of World Anvil, the ultimate worldbuilding platform and campaign manager, and has been writing fantasy and playing RPGs since she was 10. As a worldbuilding expert, she spoke at GenCon, GaryCon, TraCon, and as a streamer and gamer has performed and hosted for Wizards of the Coast, Modiphius, and Wyrd Games. Her most recent project is the Dark Crystal RPG .
DM Noir is a voice actor, streamer, musician, and improvisor. He has studied at Chicago's iO, Westside Theater, and Second City. He is the Nerdy host of Critical Misses' Morning Ritual, creator and GM for Kobold Press’ Into the Southlands, Magpies’ Second City Saviors, and The Lonely Throne, a 5th Edition game on Thursdays. You can find Noir on most platforms @TheNoirEnigma
Bee Zelda is a non-binary Canadian content creator. They are a member of the Broadswords podcast, and they are a regular TTRPG streamer and professional GM on Roll20 and many other channels. You can find Bee on Twitter @Bee_Zelda.
This project uses Kickstarter's Add-Ons feature. Add-ons make it easy to add items to your pledge during the Kickstarter campaign when you want to mix and match items from multiple reward tiers in an unusual way (or at least, in a way the Kobolds did not anticipate!). If you want a copy of the Limited Edition, you must select that as the base reward; it is not available as an add-on.
For example, if you want the Limited Edition hardcover + PDF, and you also want a copy of the regular edition and both a Shard license and a Roll20 license, you will have the option to add those as add-ons to your Limited Edition package after you select your pledge level.
The add-ons for this project are limited to the physical book produced as part of this project. Per Kickstarter policy, we will not be offering add-on items from prior Kobold Press Kickstarters.
The books, PDF, and VTTs will all release in late October per the current schedule. Given how far along we are with design, development, editing, and art, this is a reasonable schedule.
At the same time, we're going to take a serious risk with international shipping for this project. Despite the difficulties we encountered getting Tome of Beasts 2 to backers in a timely way and the increasing costs of international shipping, we're offering the printed books as part of the Kickstarter globally. Shipping costs will be calculated separately from the Kickstarter itself and charged in a pledge manager. 
This project will use bulk shipments to Canada, the EU, the UK, and Australia to attempt to reduce shipping costs. Given the confusion around VAT in the EU and UK shipments right now, this is a serious risk. Overseas backers may be required to pay VAT or Customs fees, but the cost of postage itself is usually lower using bulk shipping. This form of shipping means overseas packages will arrive a month or two later than US shipments.
As is always the case with a Kobold Press project, if we exceed our initial funding goal, we will expand the contents of Vault of Magic through fun and value-added stretch goals. The greater your level of support, the better the book becomes. How many will we hit? The funnest part is finding out! Below, you can see the many, many goals reached with your support!
Fabled Items: We're introducing some new styles of items in Vault of Magic. More information is available on this in the "What is a Fabled Item?" update.
Guest Designer Items: We'll reveal items by our guest designers to our backers as stretch goals, and some guest designers will discuss them on the Kobold Chat Twitch show. You will find 21 guest designers in all, with their item previews posted under Updates.
Our final run of stretch goals is spelled out below. It's been a huge run, our single most successful project ever--even bigger than the Tome of Beasts!
We found one more goal: every great book needs a great bookmark!

We're incredibly proud of the creative team that has been working on Vault of Magic for 5th Edition the last year and more. Here are a few of the primary contributors:
Jeff Lee, Designer. Jeff has been a gamer for 39 years and a freelance game designer for the last seven years. He has produced material for Gun Metal Games, Legendary  Games, Louis Porter Jr. Design, and Rogue Genius Games, among many others. Jeff is the author of Demon Cults & Secret Societies and 12 Peculiar Towers from Kobold Press.
Phillip Larwood, Designer. Phillip has been writing for Kobold Press on and off for more than a decade and has a deep, abiding love for all things magical and mysterious. He excelled at aberrations,  fiends, and horrors in his contributions to Tome of Beasts and Tome of Beasts 2, and he further expanded our knowledge of alkemancy and magical servitors in Deep Magic for 5th Edition. Many of the fantastic items in this book are a result of his great penmanship and warped imagination, and his hand-typed manuscripts always smell faintly of cinnamon and myrrh.
Meagan Maricle, Lead Editor. Meagan was the lead editor on Kobold Press's upcoming City of Cats, Margreve Player’s Guide, Underworld Player’s Guide, Empire of the Ghouls, Tome of Beasts 2, and the ENnie award-winning Creature Codex. When not saving kobolds from their own word traps, she schemes the demise of her players’ characters while petting her diabolical, furry companion (“I’ll get you next time, PCs!”). She has been playing (Advanced) Dungeons and Dragons since the early 90s when her parents turned her into an emerald wyrmling.
Marc Radle, Art Director. Marc has been the Art Director and lead graphic designer at Kobold Press  since 2012. He's done the art direction, layout, and graphic design on  hundreds of Kobold Press releases. Marc also occasionally squeezes in time to write—he penned the Shadows of the Dusk Queen adventure and was the lead designer on the New Paths Compendium, both from Kobold Press. He's been playing D&D since the late 70s, along with plenty of other great RPGs—Pathfinder,  Marvel Superheroes, Champions, Elfquest, FASA’s Star Trek, Star  Frontiers . . . the list goes on and on.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Kobold Press has shipped over 37 crowdfunded titles since 2006, both small and large, with 17 of them on Kickstarter (this is #19). The Kobolds have won Gold and Silver ENnie Awards for this work, most recently an ENnie for the Creature Codex for 5th Edition in 2019 as Best Monster/Adversary book. The creative team is experienced, and we keep leveling up!

For Vault of Magic, the item design is already done and with the editor. Likewise, we already have the cover and a portion of the interior art commissioned because of our confidence in this book. 

The main challenges are layout and proofing of the books, and managing the uncertain landscape for printing and shipping.

Other risks include the new ones: the health of the core team of kobolds (editor, art director, and publisher), as well as business-related risks from COVID-related printer delays plus the recent tampering with the US Post Office. We'll keep you informed on any delays if they arise. 

And if some dangerous magic is unleashed by our rash experiments in the wizard's chambers? Well, surely one or two kobolds will survive to tell the tale!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Item Sneak Peek - Early Kobold Magic
updates.update_content: When we set out to create Vault of Magic, we knew we wanted to delve into some of the older tunnels of the warrens, but we weren’t prepared for the kinds of treasure we would find in those dusty, cobweb-filled rooms! For today’s sneak peek, we want to share some of those ancient, wondrous treasures that made their way into the Vault of Magic (after some dusting, of course!).

The PledgeManager for Vault of Magic is now live! PledgeManager is how we collect pre-order and Kickstarter shipping details, and all backers should have received emails with PledgeManager surveys.
This PledgeManager will close on SUNDAY, JUNE 28TH, which means we will no longer be taking preorders or pledge adjustments after this date. If you include any add-ons and/or if your order includes any shipping costs, your card will be charged on June 28th.

Periodically, our designers will share a bit of insight about their process building items to go into the Vault. Today, we share a designer diary by Kobold designer Christopher Lockey, the devious kobold responsible for many of the book’s eldritch, macabre, and mysterious magic items!
When Kobold-in-Chief Wolfgang Baur approached me in early 2019 to design a suite of magic items, I had no idea what would become of it. I was given a wide berth to explore several dozen treasures for 5th Edition with only one limitation: the majority of the items in question needed to be designed for lower-level gameplay.
