campaign.story:
Designed for serious adventurers. The Oceanus Brass Kraken Blade is sharp, eye-catching, and built to last. We set out to make a timeless cutting instrument that was both rich in history and classic in design. One that you would want to own and take with you on your day’s journey, either on the open ocean or in the great outdoors. The result is a rugged and attractive knife that can be operated with either hand.
Envisioned while at sea, conjuring images of beasts that live down in the depths of the ocean, quality, satisfaction, and power come packaged with every blade. 
Machined from a brick of solid brass, the Kraken Blade will withstand hard use. A rustproof, working knife, ready to go when you need it. No outdoors adventurer should be going about without a trusty cutting tool by his side.
First-in-class, seamless blade deployments. Keep it magnetically locked, or snap it open for unrestricted action. With a reliable and intuitive mechanism, nothing can get in your way when slicing through your daily tasks.
Below, are targeted milestones for us to hit as a community. When we hit a goal, each and every backer benefits — it's our way of saying thank you! 
 $10k — [UNLOCKED] Stainless steel hardware! The nuts and bolts complementing your Kraken Blade, shall be made out of corrosion-resistant stainless steel.  
 $25k — [UNLOCKED] In addition to the $10K goal, we will add custom pivot washers in soft copper, for smoother, more robust, opening action.
 $35k — [UNLOCKED] In addition to the $10K and $25K goals, we will start manufacturing the knives before the campaign ends, which will move the shipping date up by up to four weeks (depending on when we unlock the reward!).
 $50k — [UNLOCKED] In addition to the $10K, $25K, and $35K goals, we will add double the clasping magnets.
 $75k — [UNLOCKED] In addition to the $10K, $25K, $35K, and $50K goals, we will engineer and add a completely custom, split-shaft, Chicago screw style, pivot screw(s) in stainless steel (of course!). 
 $100k — [UNLOCKED] In addition to the $10K, $25K, $35K, $50K, and $75K goals, we will also ship an additional No. 1992 carbon steel utility blade (*possibly domestic only).
 $150k — [UNLOCKED] In addition to the $10K, $25K, $35K, $50K, $75K, and $100K goals, every knife backer gets an extra solid brass Bow-Shackle. 
 $400k — [UNLOCKED] In addition to the $10K, $25K, $35K, $50K, $75K, and $150K goals, every knife backer gets an extra set of stainless steel hardware.
 $500k — In addition to the $10K, $25K, $35K, $50K, $75K, $150K, and $400K goals, every knife backer gets the Stainless Steel reinforcement blade plate.
 Amazing Backers — [UNLOCKED] In addition to the $10K, $25K, $35K, $50K, $75K, $150K, $400K, and $500K goals, we will be engineering some additional improvements :)
We'll send out the item from the corresponding tier with each Kraken Blade automatically depending on where we finish!
No mythical sea monster has ever been quite as terrifying as the Kraken.  This massive, many-armed creature could reach as high as the top of the main mast of a sailing ship, according to stories. A Kraken would strike a vessel by wrapping its arms around the hull and capsizing it.  What's unique about the Kraken legends is that we have the best evidence of this beast being based on something real.
Although in Systema Naturae (Carolus Linnaeus-1735) the word Kraken is first found in print, tales about this creature seem to date back to  Norway in the twelfth century. Such tales refer to a creature so large that it is mistaken for an island or an archipelago. Even as late as  1752, when Bergen's Bishop Erik Ludvigsen Pontoppidan wrote his The Natural History of Norway, he described the Kraken with a width of one and a half miles as "incontestably the world's largest sea monster." 
In 1802 the French scientist Pierre Denys de Montfort stated in his book on the natural history of mollusks that the creature encountered by  Norwegian sailors was the kracken octopus. The legendary Kraken is basically what we now know as the giant squid.  While a colossal octopus may also fit the description, it is thought that the squid will be much more violent and more likely to come to the surface where men could see it.
The No. 1992 steel utility blade present in the Kraken Blade is tough and will stay sharp with daily use due to its great edge retention and corrosion-resistant material. Without worrying about getting chipped, dull bent, or broken, you can use it for camping, fishing, sailing, as a work tool, or most EDC tasks. 
A dull blade can be more dangerous than a sharp one. Dull knives require more cutting pressure, thereby reducing control. When your blade is dull easily replace it with a sharp new one. These blades can be found worldwide at most hardware stores and online.
It is not only great at cutting, nipping, or carving. Its pointy tip is useful for delicate puncturing and may be more useful than a blunt-tipped knife in the situation of survival at sea. 
The Kraken Blade has been manufactured to thrive over decades of use, through all of the conditions you intend to throw it though. What was once a labor of love, is now a timeless utility instrument available for all, but we need your help to make this dream a reality.
Our products are steeply discounted off retail prices because we want to reward our very first customers. The opportunity to purchase a knife of this magnitude at this price is rare. With our finishing assembly, our master craftsmanship, the Kraken Blade, with your help, shall be accessible to all. 
We stand behind the quality of our tools and the uniqueness and complexity of our hardware. Each piece has its own unique character that we hope will bring joy and nostalgia when put into action.
The Oceanus Brass Kraken Blade is currently spec'd to be as followed. As with any project not yet complete, these dimensions may change slightly over time as we optimize our manufacturing systems and the tool's design:
 Weight: ~9oz (254g)
 Width: ~1.6in (40mm)
 Length (Without Bow-Shackle, closed): ~4.4in (113mm)
 Length (Without Bow-Shackle, open): ~6.3in (160mm)
 Thickness (Without Bow-Shackle): ~0.6in (16mm) 
 Length (With Bow-Shackle, closed): ~4.9in (124mm)
 Length (With Bow-Shackle, open): ~6.7in (171mm)  
 Thickness (With Bow-Shackle): ~1.0in (25mm)
The versatility of the Bow-Shackle made it an indispensable tool on the seas, and it continues to impress today. Although the brass Bow-Shackle is the statement piece of the Kraken Blade, we have made it independently available through this Kickstarter campaign as a gift for backers at our $10 tier. Creativity is your only boundary when putting the Bow-Shackle to use. 
The Bow-Shackle makes for a helpful attachment point. There’s really no excuse for losing your Kraken Blade. You can easily attach it to your backpack, sailing jacket, or any outdoor equipment.
With our design roots in Boston, our company draws creative inspiration from the hub of America’s rich nautical history. In developing our products, our original prototypes and inspiration came from the old shipyards of East Boston.
The nautically-inspired Kraken Blade harkens back to a time of adventure on open seas, its durability a testament to the harsh demands of that bygone era. Our hardware is tied to the art and science of sailing and exploration. We’ve invested into refining the Kraken Blade into its final, perfectly balanced form.
Inspired by nautical-grade hardware, the Kraken Blade is Oceanus's signature utility instrument. Its unique rich color and practical beauty are perfect for everyday use, travel, or adventure.
We launched Oceanus Brass because we wanted to share our nautically inspired knife with the world and turn an idea into action. A project that was both challenging and rewarding, the Oceanus Brass Kraken Blade is something we are very proud to share with you. We hope to encourage others to try their hand at something new just as we did, to build something of their own, to go through that exploration process of learning and bringing inspiration to fruition. We owe a great debt of gratitude to the many relationships we’ve built along the way with industrial designers and manufacturers who helped us push the boundaries of what we were told was possible.
Since launching our first product in 2017, The Oceanus Brass - Bow Shackle Pen,  we are proud to have been embraced by the ocean-loving community.  Below are a few of our favorite excerpts of what the experts are saying  about our products;
Cool Material: "If your EDC needs some serious knife variety, the nautically-themed   Bosun’s Edge Knife should fit in perfectly. Both utilitarian and  artful,  the Bosun’s Edge is made from solid brass and uses a  replaceable  utility blade for perpetual sharpness on the cheap."
Life In The Slow Lane: "It's a beautiful pen and we'll enjoy having it on our boat, and it'll make a wonderful heirloom to pass down to our grandson one day. Maybe  he'll even have a special boat to keep it on."
My2Fish: "The solid brass construction is nearly indestructible, so for the cost  of pen ink refill every couple of years, this pen will likely last  forever."
Sailing Britican: "In the past, I’ve been known to tape string to the end of a pen or tie string around a cap but it inevitably fails when someone gives a little tug and off my pen goes. In other words, my efforts to prevent other pen thieves have failed miserably…but not with my bow-shackle pen! I have it attached to my nav station book rail."
Dinghy Dreams: "Even though I’m ink rich right now I keep navigating back to the same one, my shackle pen by Oceanus Brass. Nautically inspired and handcrafted by a small start-up company in Boston, Mass., this pen is nearly impossible to lose as it has a shackle to attach to logbooks, dry bags, or wherever you see fit aboard your vessel. As I’ve been route  planning for my upcoming voyage this pen has been seeing much use and it  writes just as smoothly as the day it came out of the box."
 What is the history of the Kraken Blade? Well, let's shine a specific spotlight on an inspiring Creative Commons 3d model;
The work done by BiscuitsOnTheFloor, through the Creative Commons Licensed, 3D  model, "Retracc" which can be found here, is a significant inspiration for the Kraken Blade. BiscuitsOnTheFloor is an impressive US-based designer. For any sailor with a 3-d printer onboard their vessel, be sure to check out all work, here!
The work done by CorrugatorSupercilii, through the Creative Commons Licensed, 3D model, "cat claw" which can be found here, was "remixed" by BiscuitsOnTheFloor and improved. 
We built our own model from scratch to optimize its design, its function, and its ability to be machined in brass. More information on the work mentioned above can be found here.  To honor our community and those from who we drew inspiration, more information on our version of the four-bar-linkage model can be found there as well. Some of the ideas sent to us (looking at you @ChrisB), have been very clever and we would love for our latest spin on a four-bar-linkage tool to have as many eyes, hands, and sailors on it, as possible!
BUYING: You must certify that you are 18+ years of age, that you are legally able to purchase this item and that you will use it responsibly. 
We intend to include a No. 1992 carbon steel utility blade with each Kraken Blade purchased (or two blades when the stretch goal is unlocked!). For international backers, an option may be made available during the fulfillment process to possibly have the blades removed from the shipment all together — we had this request during the fulfillment of the Bosun's Edge campaign. As with all campaigns, customs/duty fees are the responsibility of the backer. In the past hasn't been an issue, but with strange occurrences such as Brexit, we will do our best to support however possible. 
To keep up the momentum, please share the campaign on social media and or tell your friends, co-workers, and neighbors about us! We are so excited to start making your Oceanus Brass Kraken Blade!

a box of owlbears by Travis Hanson
After nearly three years of Baby Bestiary development and prototypes, we're finally confident and excited to bring you the Owlbear Plush!!
Owlbear Plush turnaround
The Story
"The owlbear, a creature feared by many adventurers, known for its feathery bear-like appearance, it's sharp beak and claws, and its great ferocity...Little did they know how cute their cubs would be once they hatched from their eggs." 
When we first launched the Baby Bestiary back in 2016, not only were we blown away by your amazing support. Immediately we knew at some point in the future we wanted to make a plush. Little did we know that getting to this point would be quite the journey.  
Baby Bestiary: Volume 1 - Owlbear Cubs, illustrated by Conceptopolis
In the back of our heads, we had always known that we wanted to do a plush. About a year or two after we had completed the core Baby Bestiary handbooks, we started making our first attempts at getting an owlbear plush mad.  
Our results were interesting, to say the least, and we struggled for quite some time to find a design that we liked. Normally, we would show an artist concept art and we could trust them to go from there with minimal feedback. However,  when we provided our concept art to plush makers, they all went to for the traditional stuffed bear look.  
Early Owlbear Prototypes
  As you can see, our early prototypes really didn't quite get to the look that we were going for. The first two, didn't feel cute, and the third and fourth were way too stuffed bear, not even looking like the iconic owlbear (at least to us). 
While visiting LA's Little Tokyo Historic District, and browsing the plush shops, I was hit with the realization that our owlbear needed to be more abstracted. So immediately I had one of our artists draw up a concept, which we immediately fell in love with.  
Owlbear Plush Concept, illustrated by Vincent Yau
After receiving this amazing piece, we started on prototype #5, and although the prototype didn't get the head right on the first try, it was easily fixed. And led to our, favorite plush design!
Since then, we've been wrapping up our other projects, like Awakened and the 2021 Calendar. And preparing to bring this adorable little owlbear to life! 
Owlbear in flowers
Pledge Tiers
As we've discovered in our history of running Kickstarters, simpler is better. So we've broken down all our rewards into three components, Digital, Base Owlbear, and Unlocks Owlbear. And due to the recent interest in having more than one owlbear we've expanded the options to accommodate those who would like to get more than one owlbear plush.   
Pledge Tiers
Watcher ($5)
 Digital Goodies: Recieve all digital goodies created for this project.
Adopter ($35)
 Owlbear Plush (x1): Recieve one adorable owlbear plush.

Twins ($65)

In A Box ($60)

 Digital Goodies: Recieve all digital goodies created for this project.

MWG Owlbear Brand Tags (like those that TY has) 
The Owlbear Plush
Stuffed with fluff and what we assume you all came here for. 
I don't think there's really much more to say about it, but for the year that we've had the adorable prototype we've absolutely loved it, and so has everyone else who's been able to hold and hug it. 
 Its important to note that this owlbear is a prototype and that the final that you receive may change slightly. Though we're going to do our best to keep it as close to the original design/cuteness as possible.  
Owlbear in a tree
Digital Goodies
With this project, we want to create a bunch of digital assets in celebration of our owlbear. To start off, we're going to make a little digital artbook composed of our old owlbear art, as well as new art inspired by the owlbear plush!. Currently, this is slated to about 20 pages featuring a large diversity of artists and art-styles.  
Here are a few of our favorite illustrations for you to enjoy!
Owlbears illustrated by @hessaimarian
Owlbears illustrated by @hessaimarian
Owlbear illustrated by @crystalartsy
Owlbear plush by @christinabindon
 As the project unlocks stretch goals, we'll add more digital goodies as well as expand the artbook.
Post-Project + Shipping 
After this project is concluded, we import everyone into Backerkit or another backer management system. Here, we will collect your shipping information, handle add-ons, upgrades, and charge for shipping costs.
Currently, we can reduce the shipping cost by getting owlbears to our three partner-warehouses located in the United States, United Kingdom, Germany, and Australia. If we can get a larger volume, we can reach out to other regional warehouses (like Canada), to reduce shipping costs. But, for right now, we're estimating costs will near the following:  (costs below are converted to USD): 
 United States: ~ $13.50
 Canada and South America: ~ $26.90
 Europe: ~ $18.37 ($14 shipping + 4.5 of VAT)
 Australia: ~ $18.81 (converted to USD, validating costs)
We understand shipping is hard, and we do our best to reduce the price as much as possible so we can keep the owlbear accessible for everyone. 
Stretch Goals 
 We've got a ton of plans for our adorable owlbear plush, and we're excited to watch the possibilities for this owlbear grow with you.

On the digital side, we're looking to provide you with special owlbear-focused content, from expanding the artbook, system companions, classes, adventures, statblocks, and other useful digital designs for you to use.

I just got our first look at the snowy owlbear and I'm super excited to share it with you!!!
Now its important to remember that this is still a prototype, and things can change. Also I did a tiny bit of photoshop work to tweak the eye color and nose (as the eyes were yellow, and the nose was stark black).  So with these tweaks, the nose should be a dark grey, and I like the blue-grey for the eyes, just a matter of what color we can nail down for them (currently they're paper placeholders).

Hey everyone, 
First up, Backerkit won't be available until I have a prototype of the arctic plush to show off, I will also do a post announcing and explaining it.
I hope you all have been doing well, its been a fast month, currently, I've been going back and forth with the manufacturer on specs and scope, as they're costing out all of the various items this project has come to offer.

Hey Caretakers!!
Just wanted to check in with you all, as so far all of the backer payments have processed and we've received the funds (which is still a staggering thing to look at).  I know some of you have reached out for me to look into transactions (and I am looking into them).

Wow...this project has been quite the ride, and I am stunned at the amount of support that we've gotten for our little owlbear plush. campaign.story:
This is Lighthearted
Welcome to the magical 80s dream world of Lighthearted. You are a Prep, Jock, Geek, Rebel, or Outcast, like those kids in The Breakfast Club, except you are just about to start magic community college. Through play, we'll explore how you grow out of your high school cliques all while dealing with magical mishaps, college parties, vampires, and worse—finals!
Lighthearted is a complete tabletop roleplaying game that uses the language of film and television to reimagine the coming of age stories popular in 80s teen movies like Weird Science and Sixteen Candles, but with a modern fantasy spin. It's set in an alternate 1980s with fantasy elements weaved into the most outlandish bits of 80’s pop culture. There are fantasy religions mixed in with mall culture, dark magic cold wars, and magical glamours instead of plastic surgery.
How does it play?
Lighthearted plays out like a movie or TV show, setting scenes by describing the lighting, camera angles, and soundtrack then playing through the action and dialog. 
The game utilizes an original system, but draws inspiration from Savage Worlds and Powered by the Apocalypse games. The system focuses on the balance between the character’s motivation and their emotional struggle at any given moment, helping to create both external and internal conflict within the game.
Coming of Age Stories
To help players tell their coming of age story, and help their characters overcome society's expectations for who they'll become, Lighthearted uses a system called Malfunctions.  
Malfunctions are sets of positive and negative choices. The negative choices represent the flaws society expects them to have and the positive choices offer a chance for the character to grow and change into something new. 
The Dice
The game uses a roll and keep die mechanic. You roll a Trait die and an Emotion die and keep whichever is higher. Traits are determined at character creation and represent the character's physical, mental, and social attributes. Emotions change over the course of a scene to represent how the character's actions affect their emotional state. This brings the character's emotions to the forefront of the player's minds and affects how they approach their goals. 
Familiar with Savage Worlds? Trait dice function similar to skills, and the Emotion dice function like a variable wild die. You'll also find an exploding die mechanic to add a little excitement to every roll.

The Results
Resolving rolls involves establishing what the character wants and what is at stake if they fail. Based on their roll they might get what they want, get what they want but lose what was at stake, or not get what they want and also lose what was at stake.
Familiar with PbtA games? This works like the banded success you are already used to where you can succeed, succeed at a cost, or suffer consequences.

The Music
Music is an important part of setting scenes in Lighthearted. To help with that we've put together a Spotify playlist of some of our favorite 80s songs to accompany your games. Listen to the playlist here!


Try the Quickstart
A screenshot of the Lighthearted Quickstart
The Lighthearted Quickstart is a guided tour that teaches a slimmed-down version of the rules through a Spirit Week adventure. Get access as soon as you back!


Watch It Played
Episode 1 of St. Elco's Fire
If you'd like to get a feel for what campaign play looks like. Check out St. Elco's Fire, a full series of Lighthearted, run by Kurt on the Happy Jacks RPG Podcast.
Fulfillment
Lighthearted will be fulfilled by publishing partner Gallant Knight Games which has over 20 Kickstarter campaigns worth of fulfillment experience. 
Digital Fulfillment
For all backers, Digital Fulfillment will be handled via DriveThruRPG. When we launch our post-campaign pledge manager to gather your emails and addresses (if needed), we’ll ask for your DriveThruRPG email.
Once the PDF is ready, we’ll upload it to DriveThruRPG and send your email a link (in URL form) that contains a coupon for a free digital redemption of Lighthearted! It’s pretty quick and painless, and if you’ve used it before, you know how easy it is.
Physical Fulfillment - US Backers
For US backers, we’ll gather your information in the pledge manager. Once the books are printed, Gallant Knight Games will ship them to you (most likely via media mail in order to make things as affordable as possible, though we’ll have more insight into that when shipping draws closer) and we’ll provide a tracking number to your email.
Physical Fulfillment - International (non-US) Backers
For non-US/International backers, we’ll gather your information in the pledge manager. We’ll charge you shipping there too. Once the print-on-demand version is proofed and ready on DriveThruRPG, we’ll upload your information and order you a copy via DriveThruRPG’s print service. We'll pay the print cost and shipping, and then DTRPG will print and mail it to you.
This has two benefits:
First, DTRPG uses POD services all over the world. This results in more affordable shipping for you, as well as more timely arrival of your package.
Secondly, there is a likelihood of decreased customs fees depending on your locale (though each situation is unique, and it’s on the backer to handle custom fees.) 
Retailers and Game Stores
Gallant Knight Games also has distribution through Studio 2.
Who's involved?
Kurt Potts - Co-Creator and Layout: Kurt is a Creative Director by trade with a healthy love for tabletop games and game design. He's worked as a professional graphic designer for over 17 years and been immersed in tabletop games for a little over 12. Kurt is known for such zine titles as Sigils in the Dark, The Uplift, and Tricksters.

Kate Potts - Co-Creator and Editor: Kate is a marriage and family therapist by day and an RPG enthusiast by night. Kate started playing RPGs with Kurt 12 years ago and has been a co-conspirator on many RPG adventures. This is Kate’s first credited RPG title.

Minerva Fox - Cover and Interior Art: Minerva Fox is a TTRPG illustrator for Demigods PBTA, The Great American Witch, Hearts of Wulin, Barrowkeep: Den of Spies, VigorRPG, and much much more!  Anime and western comics have influenced her since she could hold a pencil. Follow her on Twitter, Instagram, and Twitch at @blue_troller for more illustration shenanigans.  Check out her website and online store at artbyminervafox.com

Dominique Dickey - Editing and Cultural Sensitivity: Dominique Dickey is a writer, editor, cultural consultant, and all-around RPG hooligan. In addition to creating TRIAL, a narrative courtroom tabletop role-playing game about race in the criminal justice system, Dominique has written for Thirsty Sword Lesbians, Sea of Legends, and Monte Cook Games. Their TTRPG Tomorrow on Revelation III, about surviving and building community on a hyper-capitalist space station, is forthcoming in 2021. Updates on their work, pets, and tea preferences can be found at dominiquedickey.com, or on Twitter @DomSDickey.

Gene Astadan - Editing: Gene Astadan is a Los Angeles-based writer, editor, designer, and builder of tabletop roleplaying games and bespoke electric guitars, among other things. He also has an encyclopedic knowledge of 80's music. His most recent project is Gothic Society. Follow Gene's roleplaying endeavors at martianmachinery.itch.io and www.martianmachinery.com.

Christopher Grey - Marketing and Project Management: Christopher Grey is a tabletop roleplaying game designer, publisher, author, and marketer. He is the creator of The Great American Witch, The Great American Novel RPG, and The Happiest Apocalypse on Earth. He has managed and successfully funded five Kickstarter projects and has consulted on four other successful Kickstarters. He is a publisher of over a dozen books in both fiction and non-fiction and works as a marketing and communications professional in Los Angeles.
Gallant Knight Games - Publishing and Distribution: Gallant Knight Games is a tabletop gaming company dedicated to high-quality roleplaying games and card and board games.
Founded in 2016 by Alan and Erin Bahr, and focused on affordable, accessible and exciting tabletop games, Gallant Knight Games produces the award-winning and bestselling TinyD6 line of games, with titles such as Tiny Dungeon 2e, Tiny Supers, Tiny Frontiers: Revised and many more. Gallant Knight Games also produces many other bestselling titles, such as: Cold Shadows, the Venerable Knight Classic line, and many others. .
Gallant Knight Games also serves as a publishing partner for bestselling indie publishers, such as Old Skull Publishing, Barrel Rider Games, as well as several other publishing partners, helping to bring their games to larger audiences!
Rewards
The Geek Digital: This reward tier includes a PDF of the Lighthearted Core Book and all digital stretch goals.

The Rebel Print: This reward tier includes a Lighthearted Hardback Core Book, PDF Lighthearted Core Book, and all digital stretch goals.

The Outcast Signed: This reward tier includes a Signed Lighthearted Hardback Core Book, PDF Lighthearted Core Book, and all digital stretch goals.

The Band 80s Song Submission: This reward tier includes a Lighthearted Hardback Core Book, a PDF of the Lighthearted Core Book, and all digital stretch goals.
In addition, you’ll be 1 of 52 backers to submit your favorite 80s song to be used as the inspiration for a scene prompt card. Kate and Kurt will write a scene starter to accompany your song submission. The first 3 people to chose each song will be named on that card. Submissions must be approved by March 1, 2021. Songs with racist, homophobic, or transphobic messaging will not be accepted.
The Lighthearted scene prompt deck will be a 52 card print and play deck of 80s songs paired with a 2-3 line scene prompt that you can use to help fill out downtime, plan out sessions, or draw for inspiration when you’re not sure what should happen next. The digital version will be included with the digital stretch goals, but...
If we hit 30k we’ll make a physical version and everyone at THE BAND tier and above will get an at-cost print code for a physical Lighthearted Scene Deck.

The Bond Custom Art: This reward tier includes a Signed Lighthearted Hardback Core Book, a PDF of the Lighthearted Core Book, and all digital stretch goals. 
In addition, you'll help design 1 of 7 unique NPCs. Submit a description or your NPC and Minerva will create a custom illustration of your character for the book. You'll be credited in the book along with your NPC. Submissions must be approved by March 1, 2021. We could only squeeze in 7 of these so grab them while they last.

PREP Host a Game: This reward tier includes a Signed Lighthearted Hardback Core Book, a PDF of the Lighthearted Core Book, and all digital stretch goals. 
In addition, Kurt will run a 3-4 hour session of Lighthearted for you and three of your friends. The game will be run over zoom or discord and must be scheduled before Dec 31, 2021.

Stretch goals
We are dedicated to creating a high-quality book with beautiful art as our baseline. To achieve that we set our starting goal at a point where we can deliver a full color illustrated hardback printed in the US.
However, if we blow past that goal it will give us the opportunity to work with some exceptionally talented writers who will bring their own unique perspective to exploring the world of Lighthearted! To keep our delivery dates on track, all stretch goals will be delivered digitally.

 ◉ $10,000: Cinematic Adventures by Adira and Gene!
If we hit 10k, we'll be able to bring you Cinematic Adventures written by Adira Slattery and Gene Astadan.
Theatre Vérité by Adira Slattery: Romance and hijinks await when your theater rehearsal becomes more than just practice. Adira Slattery is a trans Jewish game designer and poet in the Chicagoland area. Her work spans comedy, horror, and intimacy while covering topics like queer joy, futility, and hope. Recent projects include the solo journaling game The Machine. You can find her on Twitter @adiraslattery and get her games at adira.itch.io
Battle of the Bands by Gene Astadan: Gene's encyclopedic knowledge of 80s music will surely make his Battle of the Bands style adventure sing! Find Gene's full bio above.

 ◉ $15,000 - Adventures by Aabria, Lucian, and Spenser!
If we hit 15k, we can bring on Aabria Iyengar, Lucian Kahn, and Spenser Starke to create even more Cinematic Adventures for your table to explore!
Evil Yearbook Committee by Lucian Kahn: Find out who's most likely to end up cursed when the Evil Yearbook Committee tries to put the community back in community college. Lucian Kahn is the game designer of Visigoths vs Mall Goths, Dead Friend: A Game of Necromancy, and If I Were a Lich, Man, and co-editor of Honey & Hot Wax: An Anthology of Erotic Art Games. His awards and honors include IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Awards winner for Most Innovative, IndieCade nominee for Live Action, and ENnies nominee for Best Writing. He is trans, Jewish, and a gay-coded villain. Follow his game design updates at bit.ly/luciangames and his Twitter at @oh_theogony.
Adventure TBD by Spenser Starke: We have no doubt that Spenser's work on games like Kids on Brooms and Alice is missing will translate into a heartfelt and magical Lighthearted Cinematic Adventure. Spenser Starke is an industry creative and ENnie-Nominated game designer out of Los Angeles best known for Alice Is Missing, Icarus, and Kids on Brooms. Follow him on Twitter @SpenserStarke
Adventure TBD by Aabria Iyengar: Aabria is a powerhouse storyteller and we're sure she'll deliver a unique and exciting take on the world of Lighthearted. Aabria is an acclaimed tabletop streamer, podcaster, and game author. She's currently a player and GM on channels like Hyper RPG, Saving Throw Show, and Dimension 20. She is also the Chief Marketing Officer for Dice Envy! Find her @quiddie on all social media platforms.

 ◉ $20,000 - Double the Cliques!
If we hit 20k, Kate and Kurt will write alternate cliques for the Prep, Jock, Geek, Rebel, and Outcast! This will make it easier to play multiple characters from the same clique and also expand the types of stories they can tell right out of the gate.

◉ $23,000 - A Lighthearted Scene Deck!
If we hit 23k we will create a 52 card print and play scene deck. Each card will pair an 80s song with a 2-3 line prompt for a new scene that you can use to help fill out downtime, plan out sessions, or draw inspiration from when you’re not sure what should happen next.
New Tier THE BAND: Along with this stretch goal we’ll add a new tier THE BAND for you to submit your favorite 80s song that Kate and Kurt will write a prompt for. The first 3 people to chose each song will be named on that card.

◉ $26,000 - a Lighthearted Theme Song!
If we hit 26k we’ll work with Elspeth Golden to create a podsafe Lighthearted theme song that anyone will be free to use in their Lighthearted streams and actual plays. We’re super excited to work with Elspeth on this so we can’t wait until you smash through this goal too!

◉ $30,000 - Physical Lighthearted Scene Deck!
If we hit 30k we will include an at-cost print code for each backer at THE BAND, THE BOND, and THE PREP, reward tiers. With this code, you will need to pay the wholesale printing price along with shipping to receive your card deck.

◉ $33,000 - The New Kid!
If we hit 33k, Kate and Kurt will write another Clique exploring a common trope in teen movies, The New Kid! This Clique will focus on the potential to reinvent yourself with Ties that are rumors the other characters have heard about the new kid.

◉ $40,000 - Discord Ice Cream Social!
At 40k we’ll have an Ice Cream Social on the Lighthearted Discord. Kate and Kurt will have a big group video call on the Lighthearted discord where we’ll answer questions, chat with backers, and celebrate with all of you. Grab an ice cream or tasty beverage and spend an afternoon with us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Lighthearted isn't our first game, but it is our first Kickstarter so we've partnered with some great people. We are working with a US-based printer to reduce the chance of pandemic related shipping issues. We're working with Christopher Grey, who has fulfilled several Kickstarters, to help smooth out any bumps in the road. The game is written and playtested, and we have some wonderful editors and artists signed up to help complete the project when we fund.

All that being said the pandemic still proposes some risks. The world is unpredictable and our team is small. The illness of a core team member or someone close to them could cause delays. In that event, we have a sturdy network of creative professionals we can lean on to get the project done.

campaign.story:
SHOTGLASS ROUNDS Round 2: three more quality One-Shots designed to minimize DM prep and playable in a single session! This Kickstarter is only running for 15 days, so get in fast before it’s over!
SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are 12-page, PDF-only One-Shots for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like prep and loves value-for-money! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session or counting change until your next payday!
Each adventure is presented in the proven Shotglass Adventures  format, designed for a 4-5 hour game. Each PDF includes a two-page spread of the adventure with DM’s map and key (so you can lay it out on the table in front of you and have everything at a glance), 2 new monsters & 2 new magic items, a full-size player’s map with grid & a full-size grid-less player’s map! 
PLUS there's STRETCH GOALS (see below)!

I won the 2019 and 2020 One Page Dungeon Competitions. If you’d like to try out one of my previous adventures, click here to download 2020’s winning entry.
 $5 AU (about $3.90 US) - 3 Shotglass Rounds modules (#5 - #7)in PDF
 $10 AU (about $7.70 US) -  7 Shotglass Rounds modules (#1 - #7)in PDF
 $30 AU (about $23.20 US) - All 7 Shotglass Rounds modules in PDF + PDFs of Shotglass Adventures 1, 2 and 3 books – 37 ONE SHOT ADVENTURES! 
 $50 AU (about $38.70 US) - All 7 Shotglass Rounds modules in PDF + PDFs of Shotglass Adventures 1, 2, 3, SA: Gravis Town Blues, SA: Mined Games + Dungeons Your Party Will Die For books – 60 ONE SHOT ADVENTURES! 
I wasn't planning on having stretch goals, but what the heck:
$1000 - FUNDING ACHIEVED! A hand drawn, full color map - DRAGON CAVE - available to download from my website! ** UNLOCKED! ✔
$1500 - A hand drawn, full color map - CULT TEMPLE - available to download from my website! ** UNLOCKED! ✔
$2000 - Another hand drawn, full color map - OVERGROWN CASTLE RUINS - available to download from my website!  ** UNLOCKED! ✔
$2500 - A hand drawn, full color map - FETTERED TOMB - available to download from my website! ** UNLOCKED! ✔
$3000 - Another hand drawn, full color map - MULTI-LEVEL CAVES - available to download from my website! ** UNLOCKED! ✔ 
$3500 - A hand drawn, full color map - FIELD HOSPITAL - available to download from my website! ** UNLOCKED! ✔ 
$4000 - Another hand drawn, full color map - MESA BRIDGES- available to download from my website! ** UNLOCKED! ✔ 
$4500 - A hand drawn, full color map - PUZZLE DUNGEON - available to download from my website!
(Note: All maps can be used for personal projects but are not licensed for commercial use)
Everything in this SHOTGLASS ROUNDS Kickstarter  will be delivered as PDFs via DrivethruRPG, the biggest marketplace for RPG PDFs in the world, so you can always access a copy through your DrivethruRPG account.
It’s completely digital (no printed books), so there are no shipping costs and no waiting on print proof approvals. The PDFs will be with you 2 weeks after the Kickstarter ends!
I’m the author of 7 books of adventures for 5e and OSR RPGs, 2 books of poetry and 29 other RPG products and I won the 2019 and 2020 One Page Dungeon Contests. 
I first started playing and DM’ing D&D in 1981 and DM and play RPGs four times a week. I have lots of RPGs - Fate Core, Symbaroum, Numenera, Pathfinder 2e, Mutant Year Zero, Stars Without Number, Mouse Guard, Coriolis, Forbidden Lands, Dragon Warriors - basically too many to list, but I'm a fan of them all. D&D remains my greatest love and when I write a new product, I pour my years of experience and passion into the project. Your support helps me continue to produce quality fantasy role playing adventures and supplements.
This is my 9th Kickstarter  and I’ve always delivered ahead of schedule.
What's the money used for?
Kickstarter  enables me to write and design role playing game content. Every Kickstarter I do is not only a labor of love, it pays for all the time I've invested creating, designing, laying out, editing and play testing the product - and more importantly, making a living! Read a blog by any product designer and you'll know margins are always tight, so your support for my projects is amazing and always appreciated.
Visit Laidback DM at stevestillstanding.com for DM/GM hints, product reviews, and free maps. And let’s not forget - poetry!

We are NOT using a pledge manager for this campaign. If you're after a deck or book you missed out on, please adjust your Kickstarter pledge by the appropriate amount.
   Please note, add-ons are not available for the New Deck PDF only pledge.
Shipping
All shipping costs are included in this Kickstarter, and no additional shipping is payable. 
To find out your shipping cost, click on your pledge level and select your destination country. Your shipping cost will then be shown.
If you are in Australia, US or UK, you won't have to pay any import taxes or VAT. Outside of that, each backer is responsible for any import costs charged by their country.
Since we are shipping EU copies from the UK, EU backers may need to pay VAT as applicable in your country.
For those in Canada we have been informed that it is likely a small import tax will apply.
Good Society is created by Storybrewers Roleplaying, made up of game designers Vee Hendro and Hayley Gordon. Vee also did the Good Society layout. We are two Australians with a passion for roleplaying and also tea (preferably together). This is our fifth Kickstarter.
The Team 
Raven Warner - Artist. Raven is an illustrator working in Baltimore. She started roleplaying for much the same reasons she started drawing: a love of imagining spaces, exploring characters, and creating stories with friends.
Aviv Or - Artist. Aviv is a UK-based freelance comic artist and illustrator with a passion for character art. She works (and plays) mainly in the tabletop games industry, and co-creates the webcomic Up to Four Players about roleplaying adventures. She doesn't like tea, but makes up for it by drinking coffee very daintily. 
Lauren McManamon - Editor. Lauren (they/she) is a full-time game editor and has edited over 20 tabletop rpg texts to date. She developed a taste for creative writing by the age of 10, that blossomed into a secret engagement to Austen around the age of 14.
Additional Team
Alex Robinson - Additional Writing 
Catherine Ramen - Additional Writing 
Violet Flohr - Playset Editing

This is our fifth Kickstarter, so we are well aware of the risks and challenges that occur during the process.

The biggest risk is delays in the printing process and in global shipping. While these are outside our control (especially in the current environment), we will allow extra time above the estimates we've been given to help things go more smoothly. While October 2021 is our goal, because of the logistics involved in international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner or later than others.

We write monthly updates, and we’ll keep you informed throughout, from stretch goals to fulfilment.

campaign.story:
It has been twenty-five years since the first release of the groundbreaking Everway diceless mythic roleplaying game designed by Jonathan Tweet (DUNGEONS & DRAGONS 3rd Edition, OVER THE EDGE). The time is right for it to return in this stunning new format for its Silver Anniversary. 
The Campaign 
This campaign includes the entire Everway Mythic Roleplaying product line re-launch:
 Book 1: Players – Everything a player needs to play.
 Book 2: Gamemasters – Information a gamemaster needs to run quests.
 Deluxe Fortune Deck – The tarot-like deck that powers Everway.
 Vision Collection 1 – 84 fantasy art cards by world renowned artists.
 Vision Collection 2 – 84 additional fantasy art cards for play.
 Numerous add-ons – Enhance your Everway games.
The Basic Fortune Deck is all that is required to play Everway, and it includes just the 36-card Fortune Deck in poker-sized cards. 
The Deluxe Fortune Deck has 77 tarot-sized cards and includes both the Fortune Deck and Season Deck. It also adds elemental, planetary, and zodiac correspondences directly on the cards as shown above. When used as tarot cards, the Fortune Deck acts as the major arcana and the Season Deck as a the minor arcana.
Each card in the Season Deck can be used as a replacement Usurper card in the Fortune Deck if desired.
We've included several other ways to use the Fortune Deck and Season Deck together or separately. We know you'll love the new look of these cards, as well as how well they work as an oracle deck.
We weren't satisfied with a simple re-release. We wanted to make it bigger, better, more accessible with larger fonts, and more awesome! Here are a few things you'll find in the set.

Book 1: Players
368-page full-color book for players.
168 full-color vision images for hero and quest creation. 
A guide to the 36-card Fortune Deck is included, with a random card draw at the bottom of each page. 
Expanded Roundwander campaign setting, with a full-color map of the realm.
A Quick Start Guide summarizes the most important game rules.
A dozen ready-to-run heroes are included.

 Book 2: Gamemasters 
400-page full-color book for gamemasters. 
Detailed guidance on how to run combat, handle wounds, design quests and realms, reward players with boons, and more. 
New rules options to cater to different play styles. 
More than 100 new mythic creatures.
4 large ready-to-run quests with 27 quest visions (14 brand new). 
17 beautiful full-color maps for the quests.
This book can also be used as a Fortune Deck by flipping to a random page. 

Basic Fortune Deck
36 cards in a poker-sized Fortune Deck.
Digital edition of Key to the Fortune Deck PDF.

Deluxe Fortune Deck
Tarot-sized 36-card Fortune Deck.
Tarot-sized 41-card Season Deck.
7 double-sided source cards.
Digital edition of the Key to the Fortune Deck PDF.
The combined deck can be used independently as an oracle deck.

Vision Collection 1
The first set of 84 vision images (7 sets of 12) included in Book 1: Players.

Vision Collection 2
The second set of 84 vision images (7 more sets of 12) included in Book 1: Players.
This campaign includes two amazing books filled with more than 200 pieces of full-color art, poker and tarot-sized versions of the Fortune Deck, the Key to the Fortune Deck PDF, and two Vision Collections, of 84 cards each. 

Tarot Tier
Digital Tier
Hardback Tier
Deluxe Tier
 The Deluxe Hardback books are renderings of how we intend for these limited-run collector books to look, not actual photos. They are bound in leather-like Skivertex, with silver foil stamping, silver foiled page edges, and a ribbon.
We will announce our pledge manager near the end of the campaign. Additional items will be able to be added after the campaign through the pledge manager. Any pledge over $1 will gain access to add-ons.
 $25 - Book 1: Players PDF. The digital edition of the first book.
 $25 - Book 2: Gamemasters PDF. The digital edition of the second book.
 $60 - Book 1: Players Hardback. The hardback edition of the first book.
 $60 - Book 2: Gamemasters Hardback. The hardback edition of the second book.
 $15 - Basic Fortune Deck. This deck contains 36 poker-sized cards.
 $30 - Deluxe Fortune Deck. This deck contains the tarot-sized 36-card Fortune Deck and the 41-card Season Deck, for a total of 77 cards (plus additional source cards).
 $25 - Vision Collection 1. The first set of 84 vision images included in Book 1: Players. Printed on poker-sized cards with development questions on the back.
 $25 - Vision Collection 2. The second set of 84 vision images included in Book 1: Players. Printed on poker-sized cards with development questions on the back.
 $10 - Quest Pack 1. Get the 27 vision images used for the 4 included quests in Book 2: Gamemasters. Printed on poker-sized cards with quest information on the back. 14 brand-new images with the rest from the Vision Collections.
 $50 - Everway Companion Cards Display Unit (1995 Edition). Published by FPG, Inc. under license. Contains well-known fantasy art curated for Everway. Each display unit contains 36 packs of 10 random cards per pack. 90-card series with possibility of randomly inserted metallic muse chase cards. While supplies last.
 $50 - Spherewalker Source Cards Display Unit (1995 Edition). 90-card series of original Everway art, printed on fantasy art cards with source material on the back. This art also appear in the Vision Collections. Each display unit contains 36 packs of 10 random cards per pack. While supplies last.
 Logistics. We are partnering with a well-known company to operate worldwide logistics. They have successfully delivered many Kickstarter campaigns in the past.
 Delivery expected by August 2021. We have waited until the books were written, edited, and laid out to start the campaign, so will move rapidly to manufacturing in China following the close of the campaign. The Digital tier will get their rewards at the same time as the Hardback tier out of fairness to our Hardback backers.
 You’ll pay later for shipping. You keep more of your money longer, and shipping rates will be as close as possible to actual cost. Trust us, we won’t make any money on shipping.
 Rewards will ship from the warehouse in the United States. This is more reliable and ultimately less expensive than a collection of global partners. In part due to direct control of this facility, shipping operations have remained both open and safe during the global pandemic.
 Cards. Card add-ons may ship separately to reduce total shipping cost. Cards may be produced by a print on demand service, depending on order volume.
 You’ll prepay taxes later. This allows rewards traveling outside the US to be sent “Delivery Duty Paid” (DDP) where available, so international packages shouldn’t be delayed at customs or flagged for extra fees. Backing Everway on Kickstarter is not a useful way to avoid paying your local government’s taxes.
 Shipping and handling by destination country. Shipping and handling will be collected through our pledge manager after the campaign closes. They are our best estimates given the current shipping climate, not guarantees. You can find these at our shipping page after the campaign.
 Restricted countries. This campaign will not ship rewards to Afghanistan, Brazil, Congo, Ivory Coast, Eritrea, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar, North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, or Ukraine.
 Your responsibility. From the day we begin shipping, you’ll have six months to complete your order and pay for shipping and taxes. Pledges unclaimed after six months will be assumed abandoned and your pledge amount will be converted to a project donation. Fulfillment any time thereafter is best effort based on availability.
 Retailers. Backing as a verified retailer (open to both online and brick-and-mortar stores) gets you credit toward our standard 50% of MSRP discount (prepaid) for 6+ items, with freight paid by purchaser. See our retailer page for details.
The Everway Company focuses exclusively on release of Everway products and licenses. But that doesn't mean that we're new to Everway or to RPGs. We have been involved with Everway from the very beginning, and are thrilled to be bringing Everway back for it's twenty-fifth anniversary party.

The Silver Anniversary Edition Team
We've been thinking of how to bring back Everway for more than two decades. We feel the time is finally right to make that happen. We cannot be more excited to share the Everway Silver Anniversary Edition with you!
Contributors
Everway also owes a lot to the many amazing and diverse set of artists and content contributors who have added their efforts to the product line over the years. 
Our artists include: Doug Alexander, Rob Alexander, Rick Berry, Maria Cabardo, Roger Coad, Dakota Curry, Liz Danforth, Geoff Darrow, Al Davison, Joe DeVelasco, Daniel Gelon, Gary Gianni, Tom Gianni, Gerry Grace, Janine Johnston, Doug Keith, Hannibal King, Scott Kirschner, Ed Lee, Anson Maddocks, John Matson, Martin McKenna, Ian Miller, Jeff Miracola, Katie Murphy, Dermot Power, Alan Rabinowitz, Rudy Rauben (Roger Raupp), Andrew Robinson, Chris Rush, Will Simpson, Mark Tedin, Jerry Tiritilli, Tom Wänerstrand, and Amy Weber. 
Our additional content contributors include: Scott Hungerford, Kathy Ice, Bob Kruger, Nicole Lindroos, Evan Sass, Greg Stolze, Aron Tarbuck, Jenny Scott Tynes, John Scott Tynes, and Jenny Zappala. 
Also thanks to Ori Kagan at Kagan Productions for our incredible Kickstarter video.
What people are saying about Everway
For a whole generation of indie tabletop designers EVERWAY was foundational — innovative, revelatory, ambitious and wonderfully strange. It was all the things we aspired to be, and EVERWAY got there first, and better. I’m really excited to see it return to life.
 —Jason Morningstar, creator of FIASCO

Jonathan Tweet is one of the most innovative designers in the business, and EVERWAY is his masterpiece. It’s a tragedy that EVERWAY, one of the industry’s trailblazing indie designs, has been out of print for twenty years. That it’s coming back now should set the entire roleplaying world ablaze.
 —Shannon Appelcline, author of Designers & Dragons

EVERWAY is one of the most inspired and innovative storytelling games I’ve ever seen. It has been a key influence on how I run, play, and design games for twenty-five years. I’m thrilled to see it return for a new generation to discover.
 —John Scott Tynes, designer of PUPPETLAND, UNKNOWN ARMIES, and DELTA GREEN

Wow. Just wow... This is a fantastic revision! Emphasis upon the "vision." I was wondering which game to use to introduce our niece to roleplaying and now I know! I’m thrilled about the new tarot-sized Fortune deck, the expansion of the deck with the insightful Seasons cards, and the revised rulebooks that play off the game’s visual strengths. EVERWAY is a great game and it has been remixed by people who love and understand it.
 —Rob Heinsoo, co-creator of 13TH AGE and 13TH AGE GLORANTHA, lead designer DUNGEONS & DRAGONS, 4th Edition

EVERWAY’s powerful but subtle mechanics and total commitment to trust as game motivator mark off a significant and influential step away from roleplaying’s wargaming origins. Tweet integrates trust and dialogue into every facet of his innovative design, which was revolutionary 25 years ago and remains inspirational (and aspirational) today. 
 —Kenneth Hite, designer of NIGHT’S BLACK AGENTS and lead designer of VAMPIRE: THE MASQUERADE 5th Edition

EVERWAY was an act of love: one of the first fully-committed statements that role-playing can have a different purpose, can be played by different people, and can work in a different way.
—Ron Edwards, Adept Play, designer of SORCERER, co-founder of the Forge independent forum

It is not that EVERWAY was a game that could be fruitfully hacked (though it was), rather that EVERWAY was a key to opening the door to how and, more critically, WHY you could hack anything. The tools and lessons of EVERWAY made for a great game, but it is in the spaces beyond EVERWAY that they became truly transformational. I am absolutely looking forward to the new edition for what is in it. New fortune cards, gorgeous layout, clever product design — these things are going to be amazing. But more than anything, I'm excited to see EVERWAY in a world that is (I hope) ready for what it brings to the table.
 —Rob Donoghue, co-designer of FATE

Remember the guy who took D&D and turned it into the coherent and streamlined system that dominates the RPG market? EVERWAY is the game he made when he was given full creative control. Its original edition was like a time-travel message from the future, and now we’ve finally caught up to it.
 —Greg Stolze, creator of REIGN and TERMINATION SHOCK 

My first day at Wizards of the Coast, Jonathan Tweet said, "Mike, I want to show you an RPG I've been working on." My response was, "Neat." Which is what I say when something blows me off my chair. Get ready for that to happen to you. Ladies and gentlemen: EVERWAY is back.
 —Mike Selinker, developer, BETRAYAL AT HOUSE ON THE HILL, APOCRYPHA, and the PATHFINDER ADVENTURE CARD GAME

In a pivotal era for TRPG development, EVERWAY taught gamers to look beyond tables and dice and to explore a thousand worlds through art and inspiration. It is as much a touchstone of my game design style now as it was when it first hit shelves in 1995.
 —J Gray, R. Talsorian Games as Lead Designer for CASTLE FALKENSTEIN

When I look at Everway I am amazed that it was originally published in 1995; and I was at the company that published it! At the time I thought it was smart - but strange. Now it looks smart - and completely sensible; it was so far ahead of its time that I pretty much completely misunderstood it. I am excited to see this game again - it is deserving and I am looking forward to playing it again.
 —Richard Garfield, creator of MAGIC: THE GATHERING, KEYFORGE, and HALF TRUTH

I’m so pleased to see EVERWAY getting more love than I was able to give it at Wizards of the Coast. 
 —Peter Adkison, Chairperson of the Board of GEN CON, former CEO of Wizards of the Coast, co-creator of the WORLD OF CHALDEA
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
MANUFACTURING: This Kickstarter is massive. We know that. Five different products (plus add-ons) is a TON for one Kickstarter project, especially our first. But we are confident in our ability to deliver, based on backing hundreds of projects and knowing what works and what doesn't. We have waited until ALL of the products are on the verge of being done before even beginning the Kickstarter. We are building the final maps and making final tweaks. We've ordered test prints of nearly everything and have high confidence in our ability to actually make all the products, because we have held almost all of them in our hands from print on demand services already (with the exception of the deluxe hardbacks). We've just got a few finishing touches and final press checks before we go to press. We are printing the books in China out of economic necessity, and products will ship from the factory to the distribution points before fulfillment. We expect to go to press within a month or two of the campaign end. Depending upon volume, cards may be printed via print on demand service.

SHIPPING: As you know, many things are affecting shipping around the world right now. COVID-19. Customs. Brexit. Instability of the U.S. Postal Service. This is honestly our biggest unknown and worry at this point and may cause unexpected delays. That said, we have an outstanding logistics partner lined up who has fulfilled many Kickstarter campaigns and has the expertise to do everything right.

SPREADING THE WORD: Finally, the last risk is whether we can reach the biggest audience possible. We are starting our company from scratch (although the founders have run companies successfully in the past), but we don't have a large mailing list to work from. We are utilizing many advertising opportunities, but we really NEED you to spread the word to all your friends and colleagues to make this project a smashing success. THANK YOU!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
It's like a 'Legend of Zelda' puzzle dungeon, but instead of Link, you play as a group of grubby grave robbers. Also, there's way more eyeball stuff. 👁
 10 room dungeon crawl where each location has its own mysteries to poke and experiment with
 Cohesive puzzles that build on each other
Lets players to discover their own solutions in true OSR fashion
 Magic items and equipment that change how the players interact with their environment and previously explored areas
Use as a 4-6 hour one-shot or the start to a planar hopping campaign for wherever you'd like to go 
zine cover mockup
sample spread
Puzzle Dungeon: The Seers Sanctum can be used with any tabletop adventure game rule set. It includes monster statistics in the format popularized by the Old School Revival, but you can easily swap them out for monsters in your system of choice. B/X OSE, Knave, Maze Rats, 5e... w/e np.
phone mockup
Bryce Lynch of tenfootpole, writes:
 "Interactivity is very high, rivaling the best of adventure in that area." 
"Far too often 'Puzzle Dungeons' and interactivity is [a] simple something like a riddle or some other forced concept that is divorced, mostly, from the theming of the adventure... This dungeon doesn’t do that. It’s less puzzle, in that definition and more 'the dude who built this house was really into eyeballs.' The dude, in [this] case, being the eyeball religious cult that used to live here."
For this Zine Quest, I want to bring my first published adventure to physical print. Its design is something that print on demand printers can't really deliver, so I'm bulk printing with Mixam. It turns out, this professional printer has the right combination of options to bring this vision to life.
 Professionally printed 8.5x5.5 inch, 22 page, staple bound book on beautiful, high quality paper.
 Removable cover with noted map. A harken back to the old days, except more readable and easier to use.
removable cover with noted map
You can also support the project by backing at a lower tier to just get the digital PDFs, which are bookmarked. There's also a DIY print pdf.
tablet mockup
If you really want to kick up your game, you can back at a tier that includes a one of a kind, handcrafted monster miniature! Get one of the floating eyeballs featured in the video above, or go ham and grab the Watcher Beast. While supplies last, that is.
Floating eyeballs won't blink first
Watcher Beast wants to know watcher doing
The Pupil backer tier is for students and those experiencing financial hardship. If you need the discount feel free to support via this backer level.
Backers at the Cornea True Seer tier, and above, increase the number of Pupil community copies available.
I am directsun. I'm an adventure game enthusiast who likes puzzles from games like The Legend of Zelda series. I want to see more of those puzzle box dungeons in tabletop adventure games.
I am a new parent, but I come upon the cheesy dad role naturally. Besides the lack of sleep, it's been an amazing ride so far. I'm lucky to have a situation where I can be close to my family in these still uncertain times. In between the feedings and cuddles, I've been working on this, my first kickstarter.
You can follow my intermittent musings on twitter @directsunGames
Fine, floating eyeballs, fine.
Alec Sorensen created an original piece for the floating eyeball monster. You might have seen Alec's illustrative masterpieces from Stygian Library or Electric Bastionland. He did a fantastic job on the floating eyeballs. They are one of the monsters you might encounter in The Seers Sanctum. They are unbeatable at staring contests.
Find more from Alec on twitter @oddsbod
We are ready to print after some final changes like including the names of backers at certain levels.
Mixam is printing the physical book. 
I'll be picking and shipping the print versions through US media mail to keep shipping costs reasonable. You should expect your physical copy in July.
Digital rewards will be fulfilled by DriveThruRPG. They should come much sooner.
What if you already paid money for the PDF on drivethruRPG?
If you've already purchased the digital version, thank you! You will continue to receive file updates through your drivethruRPG library. After you have backed this kickstarter on a tier for a physical copy, let me know, and I'll make sure you get a dad joke and that your copy is signed.
You will have transcended from a True Seer to a Cornea True Seer.

campaign.story:
TLDR: We're publishing a letterpress and handbound edition of Arthur Conan Doyle's "A Scandal in Bohemia" – the first Sherlock Holmes short story. The story of Irene Adler, the strongest woman lead in the Sherlock canon, remains to this day one of his most beloved and riveting adventures. The book is beautifully illustrated by Rūta Kuzmickas, signed, and numbered in the limited edition. Pledge to support fine press bookmaking in the twenty-first century!

No Reply Press is a publisher of handmade limited editions. We make our books using centuries-old techniques and technologies. They are printed letterpress and then bound entirely by hand – at our workshop, nothing plugs into the wall (except two lightbulbs and a coffee maker). Our process is wildly slower than digital printing, but we believe in the results.
Last year was big for us. Before the Coronavirus pandemic, we set out to make our debut with an edition of Edgar Allan Poe’s “The Masque of the Red Death,” a story about... a pandemic. In Poe's telling, while the “Red Death” rages, a prosperous few cloister themselves away to party with abandon. But an outsider circulates among them. Abruptly removing his mask, he brings about the death of all assembled…
We learned a lot in publishing “Red Death” in the time of Coronavirus. We faced further challenges in the summer when wildfires smothered Portland in smog, and in the autumn, when our office was burglarized with books and electronics stolen, upending months of work. But in all that time, we got to know book collectors across the world, honed our bookmaking skills, and turned what had begun as a hobby among friends into a small business. In other words — not such a bad year after all.
Still, in the face of challenges, we found ourselves returning to stories and fiction which granted a brief escape. There is no better escape than detective fiction, and no better detective fiction than that of Mr. Sherlock Holmes.
So, allow us to present the No Reply Press edition of “A Scandal in Bohemia,” in which the inestimable detective made his short story debut.
"A Scandal in Bohemia" from No Reply Press.
A new edition of a beloved classic
“A Scandal in Bohemia” is the story of Irene Adler – “the woman” – who holds compromising documents over the King of Bohemia. Adler is undoubtedly the greatest female lead in the Holmes canon, and perhaps the person Sherlock himself admires most.
As excited as we are about the re-telling of this story, we are doubly excited about Rūta Kuzmickas' original artwork. She has created a suite of pen-and-ink illustrations — over a dozen in total – which capture the story perfectly. Her arresting portrait of Irene on our cover is just the beginning. 
"A Scandal in Bohemia" features a dozen pen-and-ink illustrations by artist Rūta Kuzmickas. They are printed letterpress on some of the finest papers in the world.

We are excited to add "A Scandal in Bohemia" to the catalogue raisonné of No Reply Press.

Handmade books in the 2020’s
Our books are printed letterpress and handbound in limited editions. 
What’s letterpress? Letterpress is a process by which raised plates and individual pieces of metal type are arranged and inked, then pressed into paper. Unlike digital printing, which leaves just a whisper of text on the surface of the page, letterpress creates an impression which you can feel as you run your finger across the text.
How are the books bound? Our binding process involves a hundred small steps – there are sheets to fold, threads to snip, boards to cut with no margin for error, glues and inks to mix, covers to assemble, endpapers to affix, and on and on. Every step we do by hand.
What makes an edition “limited”? When we go to press on a book, we set a certain number of copies which will be produced, and declare the limitation. No further copies will ever be made. Each book is numbered in the series – Number 127 out of 300, for example – and then signed by the artisans involved, from the illustrator to the printer to the binder. 
Our books are made by hand. These are the tools we use to bind our books. That's it! (We also use a book press from the 1860's named Ulysses Press Grant. Ulysses could not be photographed because he's roughly six thousand times the size of our other tools combined.)
With these tools, we craft limited editions committed to elegance of design and richness of character.
From “Red Death” to “A Scandal in Bohemia”
Our first Kickstarter project was "The Masque of the Red Death," and many collectors considering whether to back "A Scandal in Bohemia" may have subscribed for a copy. We hope that "Scandal" will improve upon our past work. Here are just a few of the changes we’ve made:
“A Scandal in Bohemia” is four times the length of “Red Death,” and produced in a significantly larger format (7.5’’ by 11’’ rather than 5.5’’ by 9’’).
  “A Scandal in Bohemia” features original artwork, and is signed by the artist.
  “A Scandal in Bohemia” is printed on Zerkall-bütten mouldmade paper in its Hardbound De Luxe, De Luxe, and De Scandale states. This paper takes the impression of letterpress beautifully, features a wonderful deckle edge, and is watermarked.
  “A Scandal in Bohemia” uses a quarter-cloth flatback binding, rather than a case binding, which allows the book to lie flat when opened with greater ease.

"The Masque of the Red Death" and "A Scandal in Bohemia" side-by-side. "Scandal" is four times the length, features original artwork, and offers finer mouldmade papers.

The books
All of our books are printed letterpress and handbound, but we offer a variety of “states,” each with a different binding and limitation.

Hardbound / $85 / Limited to one hundred more than subscribed
Printed by hand using a Vandercook Universal I on Mohawk feltmark paper from New York State.
Handbound in quarter-cloth with facing "Sherlock" and "Irene" illustrations printed letterpress on Zerkall Ingres over the boards.
Signed by Rūta Kuzmickas, as well as the printer and binder.
Numbered in the limited edition.

Hardbound


Hardbound De Luxe / $145 / Limited to ~175
Printed by hand using a Vandercook Universal I on Zerkall-bütten mouldmade paper from Germany. 
Handbound in quarter-cloth with facing "Sherlock" and "Irene" illustrations printed letterpress on Zerkall Ingres over the boards.
Housed in a handmade cloth-lined slipcase.
Signed by Rūta Kuzmickas, as well as the printer and binder.
Numbered in the limited edition. Current estimate is only 175 copies, though this may be revised slightly upward or downward. 
The first one hundred backers at this tier will receive a complimentary copy of "The Shortest Sherlock" broadside.




Hardbound De Luxe

De Luxe / Starting at $385 / Limited to 50
Printed by hand using a Vandercook Universal I on Zerkall-bütten mouldmade paper from Germany. 
Bound in quarter-Morocco and Italian marbled paper boards.
Housed in a handmade solander case.
Signed by Rūta Kuzmickas, as well as the printer and binder.
Numbered in the limited edition of 50.
Includes a complimentary copy of "Per Se Phone" by Rūta Kuzmickas, forthcoming from No Reply Press.

De Luxe

De Scandale / $945 / Limited to 10
Printed by hand using a Vandercook Universal I on Zerkall-bütten mouldmade paper from Germany. 
Bound in quarter-Morocco and Italian marbled paper boards, with matching endpapers. 
Featuring an original illustration drawn with pen-and-ink directly onto the page.
Accompanied by a portfolio of numbered prints from the edition.

"Irene" / "Sherlock" / "Watson" / Limited to 1 copy each
 Three unique copies are being bound in full-leather at Pracownia Leśna, one of the most celebrated binderies in the world. They have designed three bindings, featuring Rūta's portraits of Irene, Sherlock, and Watson. These bindings use multiple inset leathers and gold tooling by hand.
Each is numbered 1 of 1 in the limited edition.

"Irene"
What's a "Solander Case"? 
Our De Luxe, De Scandale, and unique full-leather books come housed in handmade solander boxes. These are sometimes also called "clamshell" boxes. They are a beautiful way to securely house and present your book.
A solander case from our edition of "The Masque of the Red Death"!

Become a collector
Steadfast collectors make our work possible! To thank our collectors, we are offering a complimentary copy of Ruta Kuzmickas’ upcoming illustrated poetry collection, “Per Se Phone,” on our Collector and De Luxe tiers.
New to No Reply or to fine press collecting in general? Consider pledging for the “Collector” tier and receive a few of our books to start your collection.
You can now add another of our books to your pledge here on Kickstarter! After selecting your tier, you will have the option of adding to your pledge. Our currently available editions are as follows.
"The Great Man" by Leo Tolstoy
Leo Tolstoy's passages from the epilogues of War and Peace on the "great man" theory of history. He rejects the view that individuals move history. The text is presented in both the original Russian and a new English translation by Valeria Zecchini, alongside her somewhat ironic woodblock portraits of the great man himself.
Hardbound limited to 345 numbered copies, which are printed letterpress on Mohawk feltmark paper and bound in red full-cloth. 
De Luxe limited to 26 lettered copies, which are printed letterpress on Zerkall-bütten mouldmade paper, bound in quarter-Morocco over marbled boards, and housed in a handmade solander case. 
The fourth book from No Reply Press.
Reserve your copy as an add-on after selecting your tier!
"The Great Man" by Leo Tolstoy
"The Failurist" by Markus Zusak
The first edition of Markus Zusak's moving essay on failure. "When I walk up to my writing desk," he says, "I want a little failure in the air."
Hardbound limited to 96 numbered copies, which are printed on Mohawk feltmark paper and bound in handmade paste paper.
De Luxe limited to 26 lettered copies, which are bound in marbled paper, slipcased, and signed by Zusak.
The fifth book from No Reply Press.
Reserve your copy as an add-on after selecting your tier!
"The Failurist" by Markus Zusak
"The Most Efficient Language" by John McWhorter
The first edition of John McWhorter's eye-opening essay on the efficiency of language – how long does it take to say what you mean? He illuminates the differences in efficiency between languages, and what factors give rise to those differences. 
Hardbound limited to 96 numbered copies, which are printed letterpress on Mohawk feltmark paper and bound in blue full-cloth. 
De Luxe limited to 26 lettered copies, which are printed letterpress on Zerkall-bütten mouldmade paper, bound in quarter-Morocco over paste paper boards, and housed in a handmade solander case. 
The seventh book from No Reply Press.
Reserve your copy as an add-on after selecting your tier!
"The Most Efficient Language" by John McWhorter
"The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock" by T. S. Eliot
T. S. Eliot's modernist masterpiece, with an introduction by Christopher Ricks, the world’s foremost Eliot scholar (and perhaps its greatest literary critic) for the past half century.
Hardbound limited to 96 numbered copies, signed by Ricks, which are printed letterpress on Zerkall-bütten paper and bound in quarter-cloth and marbled papers made specially for the edition.
Hardbound limited to 96 numbered copies, signed by Ricks, which are printed letterpress on Zerkall-bütten paper and bound in quarter-Morocco with marbled papers made specially for the edition. Housed in a handmade solander case.
The tenth book from No Reply Press.
Reserve your copy as an add-on after selecting your tier!
"The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock" by T. S. Eliot


"Preludes" by T. S. Eliot
T. S. Eliot's quartet of "Preludes," which beautifully mingle the profound and the mundane, accompanied by a suite of paintings from scenes around Paris by Frêle Sivinaigre.
Limited to only 50 numbered copies, signed by Sivinaigre, which are printed letterpress on Mohawk vellum paper and bound in quarter-cloth and paste papers made specially for the edition.
The eleventh book from No Reply Press.
Reserve your copy as an add-on after selecting your tier!
"Preludes" by T. S. Eliot
"Per Se Phone" by Rūta Kuzmickas
In "Per Se Phone," Rūta Kuzmickas presents a dozen new poems, illustrated with her signature pen-and-ink artworks. She uses ink as if sculpting wire or thread, tangling everything together but seeking clarity amid the knots.
Limited to 300 numbered copies, signed by Kuzmickas, which are printed letterpress on Mohawk feltmark paper and bound in stone-paper wrappers.
The thirteenth book from No Reply Press.

Buy them now
Alone or with friends you must choose a dangerous quest, but beware only those with the skill, intelligence and bravery of a hero will survive.
Quick to learn, portable and most importantly really fun. This game is a unique hybrid of Role-playing, board and adventure gamebook.
As you make your adventure map, the StoryMaster will give you FOUR choices for every card, These all come from the StoryBook provided, and each one will have its own options and results.
This game can be played solo or with a group of family or friends.  You can play cooperatively or against each other, the option is open.
Each player chooses the character Class they would like to play and makes note of the statistics of the Fighting Skill, Magic Craft, Fortune, Health and Gold, on the Quest Log provided. Attributes will change throughout the story, make sure they are updated as you go along.
Choose a Quest (there are ten) from the book that you would like to do, read the opening, note the starting Cards and any special rules. You are then ready to play.  Follow the options given by the choices in the book as you turn over the cards that create the quest.
Anyone can become StoryMaster. If you are playing on your own, it will, of course, be yourself. If there is more than one player, you can either have one person who does not adventure and just reads from the book as the StoryMaster OR you can all play and take turns to read the StoryMasters parts.
When reading the StoryCard information from the book, you must try to bring to life each passage and option. You can improvise more detail into the written text, use voices for the creatures and people the players might meet. Feel free to adapt the game for your players, however, you MUST keep to the options given but you can expand on the results of the decisions.  Unless playing alone, it's more fun if you don’t show the other players the results of their decisions, just read them out.


The game is designed for all ages (6-Adult) and experience to enjoy the game equally. The game is simple to pick up and can be played by novices and role-playing experts alike. It is also possible to have someone who has never role-played before, play and do the StoryMastering within minutes of picking up this game.
"Deeper into the Woods" Expansion, will bring you...
FOUR NEW QUESTS, Four extra Classes to play. Bard, Wise Woman, Lost Children, and the Gentleman.
15 new Story Card locations, 10 new Reward Cards, Extra rules, an extra Quest Log pad, cut out standees AND a Green Bag!
It will also have (Free to those that already own the first 50) 15 new narrated soundscapes as an option.
