campaign.story:
Brewing a cup of loose leaf tea on the go isn’t exactly convenient; it usually involves multiple messy tools, time, and a lengthy cleanup process.
The Tao Tea Tumbler is a multi-functional tea infuser that allows you to brew the perfect cup of loose leaf tea wherever you go. With Tao, you are now able to brew a perfectly tasty cup of tea anywhere, anytime.
Some tumblers can be really complicated and you feel like you need a masters degree in engineering to figure it out. While we think engineers will also love the Tao Tea Tumbler, we wanted an intuitive experience for everyone.

Here’s how it works:
Fill the tea compartment with your desired tea and screw on the lid.
Next, add hot water to the larger compartment, then flip it upside down.
Turn the filter control dial to allow the water to pass through to the tea for the appropriate steeping time.
Once steeped, flip it back and turn the filter control dial to close off the tea compartment.
Press the pressure release button to safely release any built-up pressure and enjoy your tea.
There are a number of carefully designed features which set the Tao Tea Tumbler apart.
Easy to turn Filter Control dial moves the food grade silicon seal and allows water to easily pass through.
Unique stainless steel mesh pattern blocks tea leaves but allows water to pass through with ease and prevent clogging.
Regular tea infusers can be dangerous to open because of the built up pressure from the hot water, which can spray as you open the lid. To solve this, we added a clever pressure release button so you can feel confident every time you open your hot beverage.
We wanted a tumbler that would hold enough large tea leaves but also a generous amount of steeped tea and still fit into cup holders. So we maximized the capacity without sacrificing the benefits of double-walled construction.
Our durable double-walled glass insulates to keep the inside hot but the outside slightly warm to the touch at the perfect 40 degree Celsius (104 degrees Fahrenheit), keeping it condensation free and easy to grip.
With Tao, you are not only limited to brewing tea. Use it for matcha, coffee, or just to keep any drink hot or cold for hours on end. The options are endless and up to your imagination.
After use, disassemble and hand wash or put it in the dishwasher for hassle-free cleanup.
Crafted with the highest quality components and purposely designed to be simple to use, the Tao Tea Tumbler fits right into your day.
We have some stretch goals, and we may add more based on backer feedback. 
*UNLOCKED* $11,000 CAD - Bamboo Scoop Duo optional Add-On - $10 CAD each Duo
*UNLOCKED* $15,000 CAD - Second Color option (see selections below)
$25,000 CAD - Third Color option (see selections below)
Please add $10 CAD for each Bamboo Scoop Duo you would like.
We also have a Disassembly Tool Add-On, which is two custom-machined metal pieces, available for $10 CAD. For each Disassembly Tool set you'd like, please add $10 CAD to your pledge amount.
As an experienced creator in the tea space, we know what it takes to bring our first Kickstarter project to life. You can see our working prototype in the videos and images.

Since we started designing the Tao Tea Tumbler in 2018, we have drafted, prototyped, and finalized the design. Now we are ready to begin production with the manufacturing facility. Help us bring this project to life by sharing it with your friends and family who would be interested in backing it.

Tao is a Chinese word signifying the “right way”, and Tao is also my name. I want to share my tea passion with you, so you can enjoy tea anywhere you go. We look forward to sharing this journey and the Tao Tea Tumbler with our backers.

Worldwide shipping costs will be calculated after successful campaign completion; we need approximate shipping volumes to negotiate the best possible freight costs for our international backers.

campaign.story: This was a rather fortunate accident. We were simply attempting to make a nice family-friendly product for those crammed inside for the duration of the Coronavirus quarantine. Upon attempting to produce the prototype however, our manufacturing liaison, Dave, happened to spill his chai tea on the computer running the algorithm. The computer malfunctioned, causing the complexity of the puzzle to skyrocket 100-fold in every aspect. The result? A fiendishly-difficult puzzle that is sure to be both a party-starter, as well as a party-stopper roughly 10 minutes later.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are several challenges with this puzzle. First, the product utilizes double-sided acrylic to give the glassy look for each piece. Acrylic is rather expensive, and laser cutting also increases the cost of production. Lastly, the frame will require injection molding that needs to be finalized for high-throughput manufacturing. All of these factors increase the overall cost of the puzzle, which some may find off-putting. However, it is our belief that this is a rather reasonable price point compared to many other craft puzzles available online.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Considering this puzzle is produced from double-sided acrylic, this puzzle is extremely sturdy. Pieces will not break, even under a significant amount of force. Compared to traditional cardboard cuts that bend easily, these pieces will be sure to last for a significant period of time.
Reusability and recyclability
PMMA (acrylic) is categorized as a Category 7 plastic. While historically not easily-recycled, recent advancements in material science has allowed for PMMA to be repurposed and combined with PVC to form a thermoplastic that is being investigated for fabricate housings, casings, medical equipment. Therefore, it is possible for PMMA to be recycled and repurposed in other ways. It is worth noting however that this type of acrylic is often going to require disposal at designated centers accepting PMMA.

The injection mold will likely utilize polyethylene, polypropylene, or PLA, which are readily-recyclable. If PLA is chosen, this is one polymer that is biodegradable.
Environmentally friendly factories
As noted above, PLA is one option for our injection mold, which is a biodegradable plastic. Furthermore, the edge formed between two pieces is generated from a single laser cut. Therefore, there is no unused acrylic between each piece within a single puzzle. Third, our laser-cutting process utilizes a tessellation-based pattern between each puzzle order to minimize excess acrylic between each puzzle order. Lastly, all shipping material will utilize cardboard and trace amounts of plastic, and therefore all shipping material can easily be recycled after receiving the shipment.

campaign.story:
Dictionary Story is a tale that celebrates the creative potential of the world's most famous reference book. It is a story in which definitions from the dictionary come to life and meet. The story is told and illustrated by using over 230 of the dictionary's own definitions.
For this new 20th anniversary print, which has been completely rewritten and redrawn, we are hoping to print at Nomad Letterpress (home of Whittington Press) in Cheltenham.
 Nomad Letterpress prints from metal type and plates on a wide variety of presses dating from 1830 to 1960 and includes a collection from the Oxford University Press. (What is Letterpress? You can find out here)
The previous Dictionary Story book and print were widely collected, finding their way into libraries such as the British Library UK, the Library of Congress US, Bibliothèque Nationale de France FR, Deutsche Nationalbibliothek DE, as well as museums like the V&A museum UK and The Getty Research Institute USA, MoMA NY and the Tate UK. The original version was soon out of print.
From left to right - 2001, 2006, 2009 and 2014 editions of A Dictionary Story. Designers such as David Pearson, Richard Bonner Morgan and A Practice for Everyday Life have all helped on previous editions.
“Sam Winston is uniquely alert to the way words take their place in the world; in his agile and mischievous fingers, each word and even each letter radiates vivid, graphic personality. Dictionary Story is a fairy tale as concrete poem, a typographical romance, filled with wit and tenderness.”  Marina Warner - Author & Curator 
The idea of a fluid language has been explored throughout Winston's 20 year practice and the project has taken many forms - including a full folded dictionary where he transformed the twenty volumes of the OED into a 80,000 folded page sculpture.
"Dictionary Story has always been close to my heart. I think we don't examine words well enough and presume we all share the same understanding of what things might mean. A Dictionary Story playfully explores this presumption - deep down into the subterranean world of letters and type." Sam Winston
We would love your support in bringing this new story to life. 2020 has been a year where "Fantasy has been mistaken as Fact, Jokes have been reported as News and Literature itself has sometimes slipped into Trivia” [a sample line from the new story]. Your help in supporting a celebratory home for language would be warmly welcomed.
If the project is successful, this would also open the door to a stretch goal of free additional art prints and a new publication all together.
Rewards
Delivery before Christmas is possible, but please message us first, so we can provide a shipping quote and details. Email studio@samwinston.com
Every pledge plants (at least) one tree with TreeSisters - a global women's empowerment and reforestation project. We will update you on tree total at close. 
A Dictionary Book supporter: A classic Dictionary Story artist book and a small ‘Stolen Dictionary’ print
The 2014 Dictionary Story (this version with a beautiful sleeve by the design studio A Practice for Everyday Life). The book comes as three loose accordion sheets housed in a transparent wallet. Plus a completely new 'Stolen Dictionary’ print [approximate size is 6”x8” or 15 x 21cm]. The only trade edition still in print with 500 left of the edition. More images here
A letterpress supporter: New Yorker art print
You will receive a signed limited edition New Yorker Magazine Letterpress Print [edition of 130 with 40 remaining], the classic 2014 Dictionary Story book plus the small reproduction of a 'Stolen Dictionary’ print. The first four backers of this reward will also receive a copy of The New Yorker magazine in which a corresponding article first appeared. More details here
Main Event: The new Letterpress Dictionary Story
You will receive the new signed limited edition Letterpress Dictionary Story print [22 x 29in / 56 x 75cm]. Completely rewritten and redrawn with new characters and definitions. Typeset in Baskerville and printed on 225gsm Zerkall (mould-made & acid free) printmaking paper. Printed by Nomad Letterpress in an edition of 190. A completely new story with new art. You will also receive the classic 2014 Dictionary Story book plus the small reproduction of a ‘Stolen Dictionary’ print.
2nd Main Event: A ‘Stolen Dictionary’ folio
A folio of 3 artist prints:
Letterpress Dictionary Story print 22 x 29in / 56 x 75cm
Full size 'Stolen Dictionary’ print 23 x 31cm / 58 x 79cm
Unique ‘Process Print’ 22 x 29in / 56 x 75cm
All three prints housed in a handmade folio. Editioned, signed and printed on archival paper. Detailed description below.
                Letterpress Dictionary Story   |   Stolen Dictionary   |   Process Print
To make this collage Winston had hand cut hundreds of words from an Oxford Mini Dictionary and arranged them with a glue and knife on a page, trying to match the narrative of the story he had just written.
We’re not sure how literally one should take the often (misquoted) phrase of “bad artists copy, great artists steal”. But there must of been some ‘great artists’ passing through Camberwell College of Art when Winston put this work on display in 2001 - because it disappeared overnight. Fortunately a few black and white reproductions were made and now this is all that remains of this early project - aptly titled a 'Stolen Dictionary’.
There are 10 archival reproductions of this at [23 x 31cm / 58 x 79cm] printed with pigment ink onto Hahnemühle Fine Art Bamboo Natural White 290gsm [90% Bamboo fibre, 10% Cotton] acid free paper.
It’s all part of the process. Multiple drawings, prints, photographs, and screen shots layered onto one sheet of paper. The prints and photographs were taken at different stages of the production process and layered over one another to offer a glimpse into the making process.
There are 10 unique versions of this. Part drawing, part letterpress and part archival digital print. All on on 225gsm Zerkall (mould-made & acid free) printmaking paper.
Original artwork: Hand cut collage 
Commission and keep a unique artwork. Sam will make you a new typographic collage based on the the 2020 Dictionary Story.
Give Sam the opportunity to reimagine the 'Stolen Dictionary' artwork using the same hand cut techniques used in 2000. Approximate size is 23” x 33” / 60 x 85cm. Delivery by end of Summer 2021. Includes studio visit or virtual studio visit.

campaign.story:
PLAY

 My name is Kris Keeffer, I'm an artist living in North Carolina. Growing up I had a fascination with creepy folklore and the things that go bump in the night. I took this passion and turned it into an art series in the style of pages from a monster hunters journal.
After doing many art shows and comic cons, people kept saying Wow! you need to turn this into a book. Well, With YOUR help I'm trying to make that dream a reality.
 The Artist/Monster Hunter 

All the art is done, The book is already fully written, I just need your help bringing this project to life!
The basic book will be a 124 page, 8.5x11, hardcover edition. 30 full-page Illustrations, as well as many small exclusive sketches throughout the book. This book will detail the adventures of famed monster hunter, Kristoff VonKeeffer.
30 unique creatures, each having 4 pages dedicated to general information, classification, size comparison graphic, as well as a 2-page "Expedition Notes" section, being a short story detailing our monster hunter's run in and experience with the creature.
Classification and Size comparison example
The Basic Hardcover Edition
 8.5"x11" uncoated #80 paper for that authentic look and feel
 30 full page illustrations including many smaller book exclusive sketches
Hard Cover 
124 pages


Deluxe Leather Cover Edition
While you can get the basic Hardcover book for much cheaper, where this project truly shines for me is in the Deluxe edition.
I am hand making authentic full grain leather journal covers, adorned with burned canvas sigils of protection. This transforms the already neat book into a piece of art!
Deluxe Leather Edition
 Includes basic hardcover book and custom leather journal cover 
 Authentic, thick 4/5 Oz Full-grain Crazy Horse leather 
 Completely handmade by me, not from a factory in China 
 The cover is removable from the book if you want to add a different book (but don't do this or I will find you) 

Did I mention the cover was handmade?
When I mean handmade I don't mean someone else crafted this for me, I measure and cut these from full leather hides, hammer in sturdy metal rivets, and add the final cloth sigils of protection!
Authentic Handmade Goodness!
 ALL the following creatures are contained in the book. 
If you choose a print package reward, you may choose from any of the following at a later date when I send out the backer survey before shipping.

FREE goodies to unlock!! The better I do, the better YOU do!



Once printing is done and production is completed, the rewards will ship out. I ship art daily for a living, so this will not be anything out of the ordinary for me. I am aiming at February for the art prints and basic book, and March for the Leather deluxe edition, but depending on demand (the leather editions are a bit of work) and possible COVID delays from my printer and leather tannery (who knows what's going to happen next) there is always a chance of a delay.
COVID Notice: The Pandemic has put an immense strain on worldwide shipping, International orders may take much longer than normal to arrive.

campaign.story:
Ten Dungeon Escape Room Battle Mats features 10 hand drawn maps, in high detail, in a 1 inch to 5 foot scale that comes in both printed and digital formats. These dungeon rooms, drawn by Toby Lancaster AKA Dark Realm Maps, are different from your normal subterranean domain though. They show a series of escape rooms where the players must take on a number of physical challenges and solve puzzles. Each one is independent from the other and can easily be slotted into any dungeon. They can be worked into the main story line or exist as a one off challenge.
A party of adventurers have come to a very different feeling dungeon room. The space is laid out before the players, placed on the table, a colourful map full of detail and peril. Miniatures are placed at the entrance. It is not immediately clear what needs to be done, or whether there is in fact a way out! But whatever it is it involves a series of obstacles and challenges. How are they going to escape the room? They consider going back but a bolt slides into place on the door they just came through and they realise they must move forward…
As it says in the title the box contains 10 Maps. They are all as follows:
1. On A4 (210mm x 297mm) card stock 
2. Full-Colour 
3. Feature an escape room challenge
4. Has visual clues to how to escape the room
5. 1 square = 5 foot scale
6. Each square is 25mm (1 inch) wide
Also in the box is a descriptor sheet that explains each room. These are not designed to be overly complicated though.
Digital copies feature the maps as files which is part of a PDF that includes all maps and additional content.
Each map is hand drawn, inked in black and then coloured with pencil giving a bespoke  look that has been very popular in a range of publications. As a result Toby has been commission to use this style in the two current hit Kickstarter projects: Midnight Towers "A Mystery Adventure Inspired by Edgar Allan Poe for 5e" and Windmill Slam Games "The Book of Cults for D&D 5e".

These maps are designed to be handy! Here are some examples of how and why they might be used:
The DM needs to extend a session as the players are progressing too quickly
You need a location to hide a key treasure
The dungeon needs a focus room or you need new content for your game
If the adventurers want something a bit different, as they're a bit bored with the standard dungeon encounter
A more difficult challange is needed...these have plenty of scope to be made very hard
You want to throw something physical into a gaming session to introduce a different playing style
Toby Lancaster is an ENnie nominated cartographer and  active member of the roleplay community contributing content, advice and working with a number of key figures. He operates under the handle of Dark Realm Maps and has had his work published in a long list of products and has produced a range of PDF products in the past which can be found on DMsguild and DrivethruRPG.

 “For years now I have been drawing maps for a range of projects. These include maps for Peterson Games, Midnight Tower’s D&D supplements, Jeff Stevens Games bestselling modules and supplements and Mark Chaplin’s up and coming board game ‘Where Human’s Don’t Belong’. I love working with these awesome people but as yet I have not created my own map based Kickstarter and I thought it was about time!”
Toby Lancaster
Limited Edition Postcard Bonus
If you like extras with your rewards then you might like this bonus. We are offering up one of Toby's Limited Edition Postcards in one of our tiers. This is the first postcard in the Ancient Structures series called The Wheel House.
Here is an example of one of the Battle Mats. As you can see there are a series of rooms, a central focus mechanism and electricity flashing from one wall to the next which is controlled by the lever to the right of the door.

These stretch goal tokens use the same scale as the dungeon rooms in this project and so can be placed anywhere on the maps. They can be used to enhance the story line or serve to hide elements of the map, are produced in full colour and sent with your tier rewards.
We are shipping internationally and the postage cost is added to the pledge. We have tried to make this as affordable as possible and having shopped around we think we have found a reasonable price and hope you feel the same too. There is always the option of buying the digital edition as well and this will be sent out via an email on this platform which will include a link from where you can download the maps.
Following Dark Realm Maps
We are active on a range of social media:
Twitter @Darkrealmmaps https://twitter.com/darkrealmmaps
Instagram @Darkrealmmaps  https://www.instagram.com/darkrealmmaps
Facebook Page https://www.facebook.com/Dark-Realm-Maps-297212987513285/
Don't forget to put the word out so we can grow the community. 
One last thing!
We will be uploading some of the black and white versions of the maps, to the updates section of this campaign, for the backers. So even before the product is shipped you will have content to sink your teeth into!
Thank you for your support and for spending the time to ready this. 
Toby and Jo
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Of course during these troubled times we all have a few more challenges to deal with. We are trying to reduce these by working with a local printer to avoid customs issues, shipping times and potential lock downs. We have also added more time for printing as this time of year can be very busy.

We are working hard to finish all the maps, but will be of the usual high standard shown in the three featured here and what has come to be expected from Toby at Dark Realm Maps. They will be finished over the Christmas period. Many of them are in their black and white stages and just need colour.

Postage has been a problem globally with quarantining (especially for Australia) and lock downs so we have allowed for a slightly longer completion time of March for the printed versions, so hopefully you'll receive them before then. It goes without saying that the Digital will be available much sooner in January.

We have had one successful project recently which was a D&D module that did feature our maps so we hope those who backed that project can vouch for their quality! And can see we have successfully fulfilled a Kickstarter and have experience with the platform.

We are also available for any questions if you want to contact us directly on here on the message boards.

campaign.story:
“All the News That Fits Symmetrically”
This is a follow-up to my eight previous Kickstarter projects from July to December 2013, from July 2014 to May 2015, from June 2015 to April 2016, from May 2016 to March 2017, from April 2017 to February 2018, from May 2018 to January 2019, from March to December 2019, and from January to December 2020. The puzzles will come once every two or three weeks, over the course of about a year.
Try a Sample Puzzle
Here is a sample puzzle from 2013. To try it, right-click on it and open it in a new tab, and then print it.
Sample puzzle from October 11, 2013
(For the answer grid, click here.)
The Backstory
From January 2009 to March 2013, I wrote a crossword for every issue of The Week magazine. Each puzzle was based on the events from the previous week, and I put as many news-related items into the grid as I could.
My big problem with writing for The Week was that I wrote the puzzle on Fridays, but the solvers didn’t get the magazine delivered to them until seven days later. That made the newsworthiness of the crossword less than ideal. By using email, I can send the puzzle to solvers the second it’s finished. Back this project and you can be part of the forefront for how crosswords are delivered to solvers in the digital age.
About the Puzzles
These puzzles will be delivered to your email inbox in two forms: Across Lite, which can be solved on your computer, and pdf, which can be printed and solved on paper. They will generally come every other week, but there will be occasional exceptions. It will finish around December 2021.
Note that unlike the superhard Fireball Crosswords, Fireball Newsflash Crosswords are aimed at a general audience. The difficulty level will be like that of a typical Tuesday or Wednesday newspaper crossword.
Go here to sign up after the deadline.
The Swag 
Fireball Crosswords baseball cap
Fireball Crosswords lanyard
Fireball Crosswords bottle opener and keychain with light
Previous Year
If 20 puzzles aren’t enough for you, you can get the puzzles from January to December 2020. Just add $9 extra to your pledge.
About Me
I started Fireball Crosswords in 2010 as the first online-only pay-to-play direct-to-the-solver crossword. I have written or edited more than 50 puzzle books, with combined sales of over a million copies. I was the editor of the Post Puzzler, a tough themeless crossword that appeared in every Sunday Washington Post from April 2010 to March 2015. From 2002 to 2008, I was the crossword editor for The New York Sun. I was the editorial director for Puzzlewright Press, an imprint of Sterling Publishing, where I worked for 23 years. I am also the creator of the iPhone app Celebrity: Get a Clue. I was a member of the American Heritage Dictionary Usage Panel from 2012 until its demise in 2018. In 2017, New York Times best-selling author A.J. Jacobs called me “a six-letter word starting with MENS and ending in CH.”

Risks and challenges
As newspapers and magazines struggle to survive in the current economy, more and more are cutting back on extras like crossword puzzles. Professional puzzle writers are losing opportunities left and right. There has to be a better way than going through magazines and newspapers to get puzzles to the solvers. By supporting this campaign, you are providing direct support to the writer, allowing me to continue to write the news puzzles that I so enjoy doing.

As for the deadlines, I wrote more than 200 crosswords for The Week without missing any. This is the ninth year I’m doing this through Kickstarter, and the first eight years went very smoothly. Solvers will get the puzzles before the ink dries on the news.

The Southlands feature high adventure in a self-contained and standalone campaign setting, with all the tools at your fingertips for a dozen adventures and even full campaigns! This updated 5E version includes new player options, an updated Worldbook with all-new chapters, and a fantastical city book to launch a memorable campaign—and a caravan's weight in short- and medium-length adventures. The Southlands setting is fully compatible with the 5th Edition of the world’s first RPG.
Welcome friend! Come and adventure with us here.
The project will create more than a dozen main rewards covering 4 major formats with two partner companies:
A hardcover Southlands Worldbook in both regular and limited editions, described in this Table of Contents preview 
A hand-tooled, rich leather edition of the Worldbook, 
A hardcover City of Cats, a home base containing many adventures,
A softcover Southlands Player's Guide of heroic options, subclasses, and races, described in this preview and developer's diary 
The fully-optimized PDFs for all of the above,
 Digital Roll20 editions of the Southlands Worldbook, City of Cats, and Player's Guide for that virtual tabletop (VTT), published by our partners at Roll20, and
The Fantasy Grounds editions of the Southlands Worldbook, City of Cats, and the Player's Guide for that VTT platform, published by our partners at Smiteworks.
Kobold Press will also produce the Kickstarter-exclusive hardcover edition of Tales Beneath the Sands, a collection of adventures by Jerry LeNeave (preview).
Special Editions
The limited edition will be printed once with a leatherette, foil-stamped cover, ribbon bookmark, special endpapers, and similar touches. The content is identical to the regular edition, but this deluxe, limited edition often becomes extremely sought after.
This project does also offer a handbound leather edition for collectors and bibliophiles. This is done entirely in the traditional style of bookbinding, with excellent leather (possibly deep green or sky blue) stamped with gold foil and embellished with corded spine, ribbon bookmarks, and other flourishes. This is limited to roughly a dozen copies and is not available after the Kickstarter. Because of the extra time needed to create it, this reward ships about a month after the other reward packages do.
Bundles
You can get the Southlands materials separately or in bundles of 3 items, and the bundles offer a discount. In addition, the limited edition is available only though the Kickstarter, not through later elements such as a survey or pledge manager. (Sometimes we have a few extra limited editions for sale in the Kobold Store—that's never guaranteed!).
 Bonus Goals & Level Up Items 
Up to 10 of the PDF rewards for backing the Southlands come as standalone stretch goal items. These include both new and existing adventures set in the Southlands, for levels 1 to 10, as well as expanded takes on Southlands magic and groups such as the Emerald Order. These PDF rewards are included for everyone who backs at the $25 reward level or higher, and you can see them marked in the Stretch Goal graphics with the "Bonus Goal!" icon. Depending on how many are ultimately unlocked, some will be delivered in January and February; others will come later. 
The various rewards and bundles are described and listed to the right, and shown in the chart below. In addition, this project has been selected for the Kickstarter Add-Ons Beta (see below). After you choose your main pledge, you'll be presented with the option to add additional items in whatever combination works best for you.
Note that there will be no pledge management step for this project; it is not possible to pledge $1 now and add on rewards later. A print preorder may be made available through the Kobold Press store for late backers. Surveys requesting your address will come from Kickstarter.
This project has been selected by the Kickstarter team for Kickstarter's Beta Add-Ons feature. This is a new element for Kickstarter that we used to handle in a separate pledge manager, but for the Southlands, add-ons are now included in the Kickstarter campaign directly.
Add-ons make it easy to add items to your pledge during the Kickstarter campaign when you want to mix and match. (For example, if you want the Limited Edition package of all 3 books, but you also want a second copy of the Player's Guide softcover and all the Roll20 licenses, you will have the option to add that second copy and the Roll20 bundle as add-ons to your Limited Edition package after you select your pledge level.)

 Kickstarter Exclusive
In particular, the Tales Beneath the Sands adventure collection is a Kickstarter print exclusive that is available only as an add-on here (PDF and VTT will be available more generally—the print exclusive version is a collector's item). Tales Beneath the Sands collects three adventures into a hardcover trilogy with new art and maps, for a full tomb-centric adventure series in the Southlands. It covers levels 2 to 5 of play, and makes a perfect complement of tomb-crawling to match the urban, treacherous, and roguish adventures in City of Cats.
We'll have more information about Add-Ons in the FAQ and are grateful to be part of Kickstarter's new experiment in Add-Ons.
This project continues the Kobold Press goal of reducing shipping costs to international backers and shipping in a sustainable way by using friendly, bulk shipments to three main regions outside the United States: Canada, Australia/NZ, and the UK. From there, physical shipments go to backers via Canada Post, Australia Post, and Royal Mail.
GLOBAL SHIPMENTS: Because of the difficulties we encountered getting Tome of Beasts 2 to backers in a timely way and the increasing costs of international shipping, we're shrinking our printed reward distribution. The Southlands Worldbook, Player's Guide, and City of Cats PDFs and VTTs are all available worldwide; unfortunately, the printed books are not available as part of the Kickstarter in Europe and countries other than on those on the list above. Printed books will be available via local retailers instead. 
We hope to remedy this situation in future projects. For now, we simply can't provide effective shipping without a high degree of risk in both schedule and cost.
As always with our projects, if the Southlands project exceeds its funding goal we will expand several elements. The more people who support the Southlands, the better the rewards are for everyone!
In particular, we will add up to 10 adventure and player option PDFs to the rewards for all backers at the $25 level and up. These goals are marked with the Bonus Goal icon in the stretch goal list, because each adds another standalone title to the reward items.
That's the last of our stretch goals, as this project has exceeded expectations in every way. A massive thank you to everyone who has supported the 5th Edition Southlands!

At Kobold Press, a fantastic team of accomplished tabletop gaming professionals is working hard to pull this project together.
In addition to the folks listed below, it is very important to us at Kobold Press to involve voices that represent the real-world cultures from which the Southlands draw influence. To make sure we do this project right, we've involved creators who trace their descent to those regions, and as all of the text and art nears completion and the stretch goals are incorporated, we'll continue to employ these diverse creators as well as cultural consultants every step of the way. Please see our FAQ for more information about this important topic.
Richard Green, Worldbook Lead Designer: Richard Green has been in love with tabletop roleplaying games since 1980. An early contributor to Open Design, he's been writing for Kobold Press for over ten years. He was the lead designer on Empire of the Ghouls, and his credits include the Midgard Worldbook, Midgard Heroes Handbook, and Midgard Bestiary. Six years ago, he wrote and published Parsantium: City at the Crossroads, a fantasy city sourcebook based on his long-running campaign. He has also designed for D&D Adventurers League and Raging Swan Press. Richard lives in London with his wife Kate and two cats.
Kim Mohan, Worldbook Lead Editor: Kim Mohan is an editor and writer whose work on D&D dates back over four decades, beginning in 1980 when he joined the staff of Dragon magazine. After seven years as the magazine’s editor, he went on to fill other roles for TSR Inc., and Wizards of the Coast, including managing editor of RPG R&D and a stint as editor of Amazing Stories. He is the author of the Wilderness Survival Guide, one of the original D&D hardcover rule books. Officially retired from Wizards of the Coast since 2013, he continues to work as an editing mercenary for any company that will have him.
Anna B. Meyer, Worldbook Lead Cartographer: Anna B. Meyer is a professional fantasy cartographer specializing in visualizing worlds using the latest digital tools and an artistic eye. Her goal is to create maps and images that inspire and guide Game Masters and players to experience a world in ways beyond what words and traditional fantasy maps alone can accomplish. She started pursing fantasy cartography as a hobby over 20 years ago and specializes in large-area setting maps. For the past 10 years, she has worked full-time on more than a dozen projects with several well-known publishers.
Brandes Stoddard, Player’s Guide Developer: Brandes Stoddard started out in the video game industry designing crafting systems. From there, he resorted to designing and running LARPs, then degenerated into freelance writing and development. Brandes has worked with a wide variety of publishers, including Kobold Press, Tribality Publishing, Pegasus Spiele, Rite Publishing, and Atomic Overmind. He lives in Atlanta, Georgia, with his wife Rabbit, two sons, and two cats. Find him on Twitter at @brandesstoddard.
Richard Pett, City of Cats Lead Designer: Richard Pett lives on top of a very remote hill in England where place names like Roughpiece Lane and Moisty Knoll are considered normal. His adventures have been tormenting role players for two decades now, and he has yet to get over his peculiar obsession with placing pigs in as many adventures as he can, as prominently as he can. His recent adventure Three Little Pigs is the latest blatant example of his sad porcine obsession. He has a peculiar garret home in Per-Bastet, lurking in an alleyway on the borders of the Gnoll Quarter and the Perfume District.
Meagan Maricle, City of Cats Editor: Meagan Maricle is an editor at Kobold Press and was the lead editor on the Margreve Player’s Guide, Empire of the Ghouls, Underworld Player’s Guide, Tome of Beasts 2, and the ENnie award-winning Creature Codex. When not saving kobolds from their own word traps, she schemes the demise of her players' characters while petting her diabolical, furry companion (“I’ll get you next time, PCs!”). She moved to Washington from Louisiana in 2013, and she has been playing (Advanced) Dungeons and Dragons since the early 90s when her parents turned her into an emerald wyrmling.

Three One-Shots designed to minimize DM prep and each is playable in a single session! This Kickstarter is only running for 15 days, so get in fast before it’s over!
SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are 12-page, PDF-only One-Shot adventures for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient and super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours preparing for your game session!
Each is presented in the proven Shotglass Adventures format, designed for a 3-5 hour game. Each PDF includes a two-page spread of the adventure with DM’s map and key (so you can lay it out on the table in front of you and have everything at a glance), 2 new monsters & 2 new magic items, a full-size player’s map with grid & a full-size grid-less player’s map! And each quality adventure is of the high standard you've come to expect from the Laidback DM! 
Shotglass Rounds #1 – The One That Got Away is available NOW on DrivethruRPG  for FREE! You can download by following the link from my web page at stevestillstanding.com.
This adventure is a full re-working of one I submitted to the One Page Dungeon Competition in 2018 that gained an honorable mention. Lost in the Abyss, the party needs to get home – and to do that, they need to solve the dilemma of a demon’s long-lost love…
Everything in this SHOTGLASS ROUNDS Kickstarter  will be delivered as PDFs via DrivethruRPG, the biggest marketplace for RPG PDFs in the world, so you can always access a copy through your DrivethruRPG  account.
It’s completely digital (no printed books), so there’s no waiting on print proof approvals. The PDFs will be with you 2 weeks after the Kickstarter ends!
I’m the author of 7 books of adventures for 5e and OSR RPGs, 2 books of poetry and 24 other RPG products. I first started playing and DM’ing D&D  in 1981. Nowadays, I game roughly 2-3 times a week. I own lots of RPGs - Fate Core, Symbaroum, Numenera, Pathfinder 2e, Mutant Year Zero, Stars Without Number, Mouse Guard, Coriolis, Forbidden Lands - basically too many to list, but I'm a fan of them all. D&D  remains my greatest love and when I write a new product, I pour my years of experience and passion into the project. Your support helps me continue to produce quality fantasy role playing adventures and supplements.
This is my 8th Kickstarter  and I’ve always delivered ahead of schedule!
What's the money used for?
Kickstarter  enables me to write, design and play-test role playing game content. Every Kickstarter  I do is not only a labor of love, it pays for all the time I've invested creating, laying out and play testing the product - and more importantly, making a living! Read any blog by any product designer and you'll know margins are always tight, so your support for my projects is amazing and always appreciated.
Visit Laidback DM at stevestillstanding.com for DM/GM hints, product reviews, and free maps. And let’s not forget - poetry!
Social Media:
TWITTER: Twitter/SteveStillStand
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/steve.stillstanding
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/stevestillstanding/
Wordpress: https://stevestillstanding.com/

campaign.story:
The newest edition of the Deadlands: The Weird West roleplaying game (at the printer and shipping early 2021!) focuses on Wild Western tales of local horror, and what could be better than a good old-fashioned cattle drive from Hell!
This twisted tale takes a posse of hard-riding drovers and their Texas Longhorns from the rolling hills of Texas through swollen streams in Colorado, the mountain passes of New Mexico, the haunted prairies of Wyoming, and more! The weirdness escalates along the way, slowly exposing our heroes to the true horrors of the Weird West. So saddle up, partners, and join us on a Blood Drive!
Includes PDFs and VTT assets for the Blood Drive Campaign, Figure Flats, Archetype Set 3, Infernal Device cards, AND Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass!). See below for more details!
Includes the PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book and TWELVE new PRINTED Archetype Cards! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of the book, Figure Flats, Archetype and Infernal Device Cards, and Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! (Go All In for the PRINTED maps at a special, one-time only rate!)
Includes PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book, THREE sheets of individually DIE-CUT cardboard pawns, TWELVE new Archetype Cards, and SIX Infernal Device Cards! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of everything, including Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! (Go All In for the PRINTED maps at a special, one-time only rate!)
Includes PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book, THREE sheets of individually DIE-CUT cardboard Pawns, TWELVE new Archetype Cards, SIX Infernal Device Cards, and Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of everything.
Here's a closer look at the rewards, amigos!
Blood Drive is a 96-page hardcover book printed in full color.
The Blood Drive Campaign Book
This gorgeous, graphic-novel size hardback contains all you need to run this epic tale of intrigue, adventure, and exploration. The story takes our heroes from greenhorn cowpunchers to hardened trail hands, letting players take on the roles of regular cowboys and cowgirls or any mix of Deadlands' unique character types.
Interior spreads from the book, already laid out and ready for printing! Your support helps us create the additional materials we think will add to the entire Deadlands experience!
Archetype Cards
Our Archetype Cards allow players to jump into Blood Drive or any other Deadlands game quickly. We gave you a passel of pregenerated characters in the original Deadlands Kickstarter, and Set 3 adds even more ready-to-play heroes and heroines to choose from!
Print Version: 127x89mm on sturdy and durable 350gsm cardstock.
12 new Archetype Cards suitable for Blood Drive or your own Deadlands games. Stay tuned for updates and previews as the Kickstarter drives on!
Pawns
This project features three sheets of Deadlands Pawns containing a selection of characters and critters and brand new terrain pieces as well! (We'll have art to show you soon, partners!)
We'll supplement your maps with campfires, a chuck wagon, hangin' trees, and other bits you'll find useful for Blood Drive or your own outdoor adventures, all printed on thick, die-cut punchboard. 
Beautifully illustrated front and back and easy to transport, Deadlands Pawns make your games come to life on the tabletop, especially when used with our gorgeous new map packs (see below)!
Sample pawns from our first pawn set. We'll have new art to show soon for these Blood Drive-specific pawns.
Infernal Device Cards
Mad Scientists in the Weird West harness the Hellish energy of the superfuel known as ghost rock to power their incredible gizmos. These quick reference cards grant convenient access to the most important information about six common infernal gadgets, adding to those already printed in the original boxed set.
Print Version: 2.5" x 3.5" on 300gsm cardstock.
Map Packs
Deadlands Map Packs are large, 30" x 24" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns. They're marked with a  light one inch grid, perfect for Savage Worlds. Map Pack 3: End of the Line features a train station, corner saloon, and other classic western buildings. Map Pack 4: Ambush Pass features wilderness terrain ideal for use in Blood Drive. We'll have detailed images for you soon!
Print Version: 30" x 24", double-sided, laminated cardstock for use with dry and wet-erase pens.
Artist's render of a Deadlands pawn on Map Pack 1 (Grand Saloon).
Our Kickstarter Boosters are smaller support projects for our existing lines. They come with Booster Rewards built-in rather than Stretch Goals. We're definitely going to print them on our own no matter what and want you to know that up front, but are asking for your backing so we can order the right amount and most importantly, create the extras that add to the entire experience for all of us—like maps, pawns, and additional Archetype Cards. We play too, and we want all these goodies as much as we hope you do!
Why Kickstarter?
Pinnacle is very fortunate and grateful to have a loyal and established group of friends and fans who enjoy playing our games, but it's sometimes very hard to get our products to you. We love game stores and sell to them through our fulfillment partners at Studio2 and through traditional distribution, but we also know many of you don't have a store in your neighborhood, or your local store just doesn't carry our games.
For those that do, great! Retailers who want in on our Kickstarters get discounted versions of the rewards including Stretch Goals for them and their customers. If you're a retailer, just sign up to our newsletter for all the details. (And gamers, please feel free to let your local store know!) Retailers also get their rewards when backer orders go out, usually several weeks before they show up in the traditional distribution chain.
In sum...
If you want Blood Drive and the extras we're offering with it, back this Kickstarter Booster.
If you want Blood Drive but prefer to support your local store, GREAT! You can pledge for the Digital reward level here if you like, get the Booster Rewards, then order the print version of the book from your store later next year. (But be sure to tell them or they might not order it on their own!)
Deadlands is the premier Weird Western setting. You can download the free Test Drive, here to see what it's all about.
If you missed the Deadlands: the Weird West Kickstarter, you can still get in on the action through the pledge manager, which is still open. Anything you add through that pledge manager will be delivered as soon as it arrives in our warehouse in early 2021.
You'll be able to add these items to your Blood Drive order in the Pledge Manager.
You can also add on our other Deadlands products once we launch the Blood Drive pledge manager (available sometime after this Kickstarter Booster closes and funds). There you'll be able to add on extras like the Deadlands core boxed set, pawns, the Horror at Headstone Hill campaign, town maps, Action Cards, Bennies, and more!
Spread the word!
It's hard for a small company like ours to get the word out about our game and our worlds. If you care to help boost the signal, you can do so using the following channels. Much obliged, amigo!
Blood Drive is written and in layout. Your support allows us to create the extras and get the word out to other fans (by far the hardest challenge for a small company like ours).
We plan to deliver the PDF of the book and cards a few weeks after the project funds and we get the final backer list from Kickstarter.  This means delivery of the main PDFs about a month after funding and the physical products about 5 months later depending on the printer and shipping, and barring unforeseen mishaps...y'know, like world-wide pandemics and all!
Digital Rewards

Tabletop Tycoon will donate a game to Toys for Tots for each game sold through this campaign. To date, we’ve raised enough as a company to donate over 60,000 games to kids. This campaign will help give even more! 
The Newest Expansion to Nemo's War is Here! Featuring...
 A COMPREHENSIVE OPERATIONS MANUAL & BETWEEN VOYAGES GUIDE: The new Operations Manual shows how to run the ship turn-by-turn and includes many useful appendices at the end, while the new Between Voyages Guide features instruction for setup, ending the game, scoring, epilogues, variants, and more!

 A NEW 2-PLAYER VERSUS VARIANT: Joining the riveting solo and cooperative modes where players command the Nautilus, in this game variant one player will play as the Imperialists, bent on its defeat. Includes special cards and 2 Imperial Squadron Miniatures!  

 A NEW CHARACTER TILE: Entering our story is Nemo’s son, Nadeen Dakkar, who crosses paths with his father after hearing news of mysterious events at sea!

 NEW FINALE CARDS: Spice up your endings with The Trap, Imperialists’ Catspaw, Scientific Espionage, and The Kraken! 

 NEW STERN MOTIVES, ADDITIONAL NAUTILUS UPGRADES, AND EVEN MORE TOKENS & MARKERS! 
Brave the hazards of the seas, combat vessels around the globe, incite uprisings, chronicle amazing wonders, find mysterious treasures -- your quest knows no bounds in this Ultimate Edition. Combining all expansion content, including the Journey’s End Expansion, both new and returning players will be able to experience everything Nemo’s War has to offer. Play solitaire, cooperatively, or competitively; the choice is yours!

Each turn, you must address the seas’ challenges in a grand adventure, confront the growing pressure of the Imperialist powers’ navies, undertake Actions with the Nautilus and her crew – all while maintaining Captain Nemo’s spirit to continue.  The Turn Sequence is as follows:

Begin each turn in the Event Phase by flipping an event, Test, or other card from the Adventure Deck. Favorably resolving Tests, and using resources to manipulate your die rolls in this pursuit, will be critical to securing a victory no matter what your motive is.
Roll high, captains, but be careful: your mission ends in Defeat if you deplete a Ship Resource. Developing an understanding of the probabilities, risks, and rewards for each Test and to what degree will ultimately be the reason for your mission’s success or failure.
Next is the Placement Phase, where you roll the dice for this round’s Oceans for Ship token placement based on the game’s current Act and your Notoriety. Strategic choices about where to place your ships, what we call “painting the board,” will be crucial to your plans! Which Oceans to populate (and, through combat, denude) is the vital strategic chess game you are playing with the Imperialist powers who oppose you.
 You also receive the Differential Roll result of the two (selected) white dice rolled in Action Points for that turn. If the two (selected) white dice are doubles, a Lull Turn takes place..
  Now it’s time to act! During the Action Phase, you spend your Action Points to Move, Attack, Search for Treasure, Incite Uprisings, and more, all to advance Nemo’s goals.
Always remember: you are questing for the greatest number of Victory Points (VPs) that you can acquire, as modified by Captain Nemo’s Motive, while avoiding the many ways to suffer defeat. BVPs are earned in several ways (e.g., sinking enemy ships, passing TEST Events, collecting Treasures, inciting oppressed peoples, making scientific discoveries, etc), so choose your actions wisely each turn, and beware: 
 Your mission ends in Defeat if your adventures gain too much notoriety, as you become an international Pariah to be hunted down mercilessly.

Repeat these Phases until the game ends with your early defeat or you reveal the Finalé card that ultimately instructs you: “The game ends!”

When all is said and done, read the epilogue to your voyage in the Between Voyages Guide. Your level of victory and motive will change the story of your Journey’s End.

Here's a Preview and How to Play video for The Ultimate Edition from the Game Boy Geek:
You can also check out this How to Play from Meeple University with designer & developer Alan Emrich! This video uses an older edition of the game, but it does an excellent job of showing the gameplay.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Royal Grand Opera House, the largest and most prestigious theatre in the city of Pavilion. All of your characters have just joined the company of the Royal Grand in one of several potential roles. You might be an actor, dancer or musician, but you might also work backstage on the crew, in wardrobe, lighting or sound or even as a stage manager.
Your contract had an extra section asking if you would be happy to do 'additional duties' for a very small bump in salary. You thought that might be just putting out chairs before a rehearsal, or having to help tidy the auditorium or suchlike. Unfortunately, it turns out to be much more.
Other theatres send spies and saboteurs in to try and ruin the show, and you have to stop them. But that's not all, ghosts haunt the theatre looking to suck the life out of the audience. Horrors are often drawn up from the impossibly deep basement levels by the sounds of the show. Then there are the cursed props that need to be handled exceptionally carefully. The rats in the building are also intelligent, so watch out for that.
You and the other poor souls who agreed to additional duties have to solve all these problems. No one cares how, as long as the audience never knows. However, you also have a job in the show to do, and if you miss a cue because you were fighting a ghost, chasing a saboteur or trying to intimidate a morlock that's no excuse.
Opera House is a tabletop roleplaying game designed with three things in mind.
First, its everything you'd expect of a tabletop RPG, with the option to tell stories in the strange world of the Royal Grand Opera House.
Second, the game can be played in a single session, 'one night only' mode where events occur in real time during the performance of a show.
Finally, Opera house is a theatre sourcebook. It explains what each department does in a theatre, and how a show is put together from auditions to the final night.
The book also offers a full description of the Royal Grand Opera House itself. It is a vast building with more than enough stories packed inside its walls to run whole campaigns without ever setting foot outside. As the building is self contained it might be transplanted into almost any setting to suit your group's current campaign.
Opera House is a complete stand alone RPG. The book will be available in pdf and as a letter size black and white interior hardback book.
My name is Andrew Peregrine and I’ve been writing and creating games for over ten years. I’ve worked as a freelancer for Cubicle 7 (Doctor Who/Victoriana), Onyx Path (Vampire 20), Margaret Weis Production (Leverage/Firefly), Eden Studios (Buffy/Angel), Modiphius (Vampire 5/Star Trek) EN Publishing (Judge Dredd) and AEG (7th Sea) among many others. I'm also currently the project manager for the Dune: Adventures in the Imperium RPG on the way from Modiphius.
However, as well as being a games writer I've also been working in the professional theatre for around thirty years. I have acted in amateur theatre, but went to drama college to study stage management and technical theatre. Since graduating I've worked all manner of jobs, mainly in theatre lighting, across the industry. I'm currently the Deputy Chief electrician at the Theatre Royal Haymarket in the West End of London.
As Corone Design I’ve released my own independent products including the anarchic Hellcats and Hockeysticks, the dark Dance of the Damned and horrific Pie Shop. I've also successfully funded and completed a kickstarter project before with Cabal.
As well as my playtesting team, I’ve had some great help from many awesome people. Not least of which are Andrew O’Hara who has been my layout lifesaver, Mark Stewart-Birch who crafted the graphic design and the incredible Jon Hodgson who put together the excellent introduction video and my editor Keith Garrett.
Now we come to the tricky bit, getting the product to you after the Kickstarter!
To make this as simple as possible, I'm going to be using Drivethrurpg's fulfilment process. The advantage of doing this is that it puts all the shipping and packaging into the hands of professionals with a worldwide network. This means the game can ship to anywhere in the world, although you will need to add the costs for shipping the product yourself. Additionally, there is a small unit charge for any print copies of the game, but the print pledge levels take this into account.
So, the things you need to know are:
Opera House will be an letter size hardcover book with a colour cover and black and white interior. The current page count is around 200 pages.
Shipping costs will be extra, you can see more about Drivethrurpg's charges in this regard here.
There will be an extra charge (the printing cost) for each print reward. This should be around $10.31 or £7.62 but this may change a little as their prices may vary and my page count isn't quite fixed yet. Its a little higher than I'd like so I'll see if I can reduce that.
But you will still not be paying any more than the retail value. When it hits retail the price will by £28 ($36) in print and £14 ($22) PDF, so backing now, even with the extra unit cost still offers a discount.
By the way, everyone who backs Opera House gets their name in the book. Everyone. Without you there is no game, so credit where its due!
The book will not be available for sale until all the backer rewards have been completed, and will only be available in the final version including the stretch goals.
£1 Theatre Tour
You just popped in to have a look round the building, and that's fine. Hopefully you'll book a ticket if something catches your fancy. This is a great way to bookmark the campaign and keep an eye on things as you can always upgrade later.
£10 Online Audience
With social distancing its tricky to get a seat. But you can still support the performance digitally. You get a PDF of the final version of Opera House. The PDF will be £15 when it goes on general sale so you get a solid discount.
£20 Royal Circle Seats Discounted
You want to see the show and get the souvenir brochure. You get a copy of Opera House in both print and PDF. This option gives you everything with a significant discount as both print and PDF will add up to £42 on general release.
£30 Block Booking Discounted
As a retailer you will be after a few seats for the show, maybe even a coach party. You get five copies of the final version of Opera House in print. The book will also be available on the bits and mortar scheme so you can provide PDFs to your customers. However, like any print version you will need to pay for the books unit cost and shipping. I will need to see some evidence you are a retailer but I'll not be needing a full background check! Drop me a line for more details via the kickstarter message board.
Adding Cabal
In amending some of the pledge levels I'm able to offer a deal on my other kickstarter game 'Cabal'  Take a look at the kickstarter here 
So, if you want to get hold of both games you can select one of the 'season Ticket' pledge levels.
Each copy of Cabal in print will cost an additional $3.51 for the print cost. The pdf costs you nothing extra.
£25 Royal Circle Season Ticket
This gets you a print-at-cost and pdf copy of Opera House, and the same for Cabal. 
£40 Block Booking Season Ticket
As well as 5 print-at-cost copies of Opera house, you get 5 print-at-cost copies of Cabal as well.

Sadly I was forced to make some amendments, so don't back the old Royal Circle or Block Booking pledge levels or you will just pay more money than you should. 
 I'm not planning a lot of stretch goals for this project as I just want to get it out there. Stretch goals can start to complicate the project and create delays. But if we do well I'll be looking at adding some more goodies. However, I should have something on the horizon at least to start the ball rolling, so...
£4000 Map of the Royal Grand
The Royal Grand Opera House is a vast building, so navigating around it is usually done in quite broad terms. But its always nice to have a map and if we get the funds I'll be commissioning the renowned RPG graphic artist Mikael Brodu to craft something cartographical.
£5000 Rewards for Backstage
If we hit this level I'll be able to add a bonus to the amazing people who have done such excellent for criminally low wages.
While it is not alone, the theatre and events industry across the world has suffered a crippling blow with the advent of Covid-19 and social distancing. While the industry recognises the importance of public health and keeping our audiences safe, government assistance has been painfully minimal, leaving the industry on a precipice. In the UK we were among the first industries to close and will be the last to open. Many amazing shows are simply unable to break even without a decent size audience.
With most of the industry freelance, there has been little to no support for actors and backstage staff.  These people are not just wealthy celebrities, but jobbing actors, technicians, stage managers, wardrobe and crew etc. who don't earn a particularly impressive wage at the best of times. With no option to work from home, and companies unable to keep them on, they have been left with nothing.
With no events, we have already seen several production companies and theatres announce bankruptcy and most of the few full time staff remaining are facing redundancy. On a personal note, it has been heartbreaking to see so many talented people looking at the end of their entire careers. Theatre is a tough industry at the best of times, but we are looking at a collapse that may take decades to repair. The industry hasn't asked for a full bailout as it recognises how many others are also in need. But its calls for a minimal package to keep its head above water (such as a furlough extension) feel like they have been ignored.
If you care about the theatre, which I hope is what has led you to this game, please also consider supporting the following charities that are trying to keep the actors and backstage staff afloat through these difficult times. Just buying a T-shirt helps to raise money and awareness. While I'm not allowed to add charitable donations as part of the kickstarter, or use its funds for charity, I'm looking at making donations from the post kickstarter earnings of the project. Thankyou for anything you can do to help.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Opera House is fully written and edited, with art and a cover. So this kickstarter is designed to recoup my losses rather than get the funds to start it. Even if it fails horribly I'll be offering the game for sale via retail.

I've already run a successful and complete kickstarter campaign before with my game Cabal. So I'm familiar with most of the problems and issues that come up.

I hope to amend any mistakes I’ve made with the Kickstarter as we go, but I’m keeping things simple to avoid as many problems as possible. Retailer levels are new to me, so that may take a little adjustment, but I have talked to FLGSs about what they need and expect. 

As such I honestly welcome any advice and suggestions you may have to improve this project for you, the backer. Having said that, any marketing company who mails me to say how they can help my project reach thousands after its already funded will be ignored. Actually, I'm pretty likely to ignore any emails about marketing, the spam you get for running these things gets ridiculous!

updates.update_content:
Apologies this has taken a while, but I should emphasise its all me.
Mikael has been very patient with my lack of email as the sands of Arrakis have piled up around me.
But Dune is out in pdf now and its something else I and my team are very proud of, check it out here:

So, the final proof came back and it all looks fine.
So those of you who ordered a print at cost copy should now have a token to redeem at drivethrurpg for that. I've made the hardcopy option public so they should all work.
The print at cost should be about $11.30/£8.05 plus shipping.

So, I've uploaded the final files for print and the previous proof copy was perfect, so I was ready to send out print tokens.
But drivethrurpg insist (not entirely unfairly) I order another proof copy to check as its a new file.
So, once I have that in about 2 weeks (as long as its fine) I'll finally be issuing print tokens.

Quick update to say we've made all the final corrections to Opera House and there is now a new version 1.1 in the drivethrurpg library. If you have already reclaimed your token just check your library and the updated version will be there. If you've not sent me your survey or used your token, you'll have to do that but you'll be getting the 1.1 there too.
The only thing we've not been able to duplicate is the weird black blobs instead of art some people have had. We've tried the pdf on old and new systems on mac, PC and tablet and can't see the problem. With luck the is new file might fix that. But if it doesn't, do mail me with details of the system you are using and we can see if there is a common factor.

Just a quick message to remind you I need your survey back by the end of the month if you'd like your name in the book. 
If you've had a pdf token you're either already there or on my list for the final round of corrections. But if not, you'll miss your chance.
Obviously if you've sent a survey and not got the pdf yet, check your spam traps for the token otherwise drop me a line.

So, like any show, we stagger on for the first night and find a few bits of the set don't work the way they did in the dress rehearsal!
While most people seem to be getting their pdfs ok, I wanted to share a couple of issues that have been reported and what we can do about them if you've had this problem.
The first one was the initial release that should be fixed. I thought I could issue tokens for a project that was not on open sale, but it turns out I can't. So Opera House as a pdf is now available to the public and thats unlocked your tokens. This means if you were lightning fast to redeem your token and it just refused you, try again now it should be fine.

It looks like Drivethru can't cope with having the title private and processing tokens.
So I've made it live for pdf, which will solve the problem.
The tokens you already have should still all be valid.
I'd ideally wanted you all to have your copies first, but you will still be the first ones to see it.

If you've sent in your survey you should now have a token for a pdf copy of Opera House (and Cabal if you backed that level).
(if you don't  - check your spam filters, down the back of the sofa, etc.)
The code will take you to drivethrurpg where you should be able to redeem it for free.

updates.update_userinfo: Random Disasters - but the good kind
updates.update_content:
Fear not! Despite the title this is not an update about a last minute print disaster. Everything is on track and we're just putting the finishing touches to the pdf. 

But I do have a new bonus item for you, a Random Disaster Table. Its a table in the book, but I've put it up on the website as a useful accessory.

I've got almost all the names now we've hit the Jan 18th initial deadline so I've passed those on to Andy to make the final amendments to the book. Hopefully not long now until I at least put a pdf in your hands.
If you still haven't sent in a survey and want your name in the book there aren't many of you left. So I'm making Feb 1st the deadline for getting in a survey if you want to see your name in the list. Andy will then have a final update early in February and that will be the last one and the book will be locked.

campaign.story:
Find A-Puzzle-A-Day and many other fun and original puzzles at DragonFjord puzzles and games.
An incredibly fun and addictive puzzle with a new challenge every day!
We have a new puzzle that people are going crazy about. It’s called A-Puzzle-A-Day. 
It gives you a new challenge every single day of the year.
Incredibly fun and addictive!
All you need to do is fit these eight pieces into the calendar frame to leave one month and one day showing. Can you find your birthday? Your favorite holidays? Your anniversary? Today’s date? Every day you have a new puzzle!
There are almost 120 thousand ways the pieces fit in the frame, but finding the date you want can sometimes drive you crazy! (Some people decided it would be easier to change their birthdays instead!)

Everyone loves this puzzle!
“I can’t put this down! I think I’m addicted.” – John N.
“Genius! Most puzzles you only solve once and you’re done. This puzzle is a new puzzle every day.” – Terry E.
“My husband usually doesn’t like puzzles, but he plays with this one every day.” – Grete V.
“So much fun! Unbelievable that you can make every single day!” – Solveig D.
“I can’t solve August 26th, so I’m changing my birthday to August 24th.” – Kristin B.
A-Puzzle-A-Day is a great way to start your day! You'll keep your brain sharp, develop visualization skills and have a lot of fun trying to find the solution... every day of the year! This is a puzzle for all ages – young, old and everyone in-between!

Each puzzle comes with a fold-out calendar so you cross off each day as you find it. Can you find all 365+ solutions? Compete with your friends and family!
You're really going to love this puzzle. You can get several puzzles so you can compete with your friends and family. If you have a business, you can place them in your waiting rooms. Invited to dinner? Bring one as a gift!

Patented design - a whole new kind of puzzle
Most puzzles you can solve only once and you're done. A-Puzzle-A-Day is an exciting new challenge day after day! 

A-Puzzle-A-Day is a patented design (EUIPO 007690433) and is hand-assembled and packed in Norway at our headquarters in Vanvikan on the shores of Dragon Beach.

Size: 14 cm x 14 cm (5.5" x 5.5"), 8 pieces in a calendar frame. Our puzzles have distinctive burn marks ... maybe they were cut by dragons ... ?


Delivery
We're producing like crazy now and can send out our Early-bird orders the first week in December so you can have them in time for the holidays. We'll do our best to send out all orders as soon as we can, but delivery for non-Early-birds may take longer depending on demand.
Get in on our Early-bird special to catch a really low price and be one of the first to get your A-Puzzle-A-Day!  
A-Puzzle-A-Day makes a great holiday gift!
About us
We are a small puzzle-making business located on Dragon Beach (Drakestrand) on the shores of Trondheimsfjord in Norway. We design and produce many different puzzles. A-Puzzle-A-Day is our most popular and we're excited to offer this on Kickstarter.
Right now we’re operating with just one laser cutter in a small studio. With your help we can build up our production and expand our business around the world. Your support will help make this happen! Check out our other puzzles, too, at  www.dragonfjord.com! 
Gerd Åsta and Mike in our studio
Our gallery
We design and produce lots of different puzzles
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We believe there is very low risk that we cannot deliver as promised. We have many puzzles ready to go and we're working every day to make more. We are a small company with only one dragon cutting puzzles (well... one laser-cutter), so if we experience equipment failure we could be delayed. Barring a catastrophic event, we have high confidence we can have all Early-bird orders in the mail before December 7th so that our supporters can have their puzzles in time for Christmas. Mail service delays are a possibility beyond our control.

updates.update_userinfo: Our profile name is changing to DragonFjord
updates.update_content:
Hello! We've had a lot happening lately... new machines, workshop, designs, improvements to A-Puzzle-A-Day, new puzzles and new campaigns coming! We're excited to share the news with you shortly.

First, we want to be sure you know that we're changing our profile name to DragonFjord puzzles and games so that it will be easier to keep connected to our upcoming Kickstarter projects. We hope you'll keep an eye out for us!

We have had many people sending us a message that they have solved today's date. That has been incredibly fun! 
We invite you to post your solutions on our Facebook page:
DragonFjord Facebook page
There are so many different solutions and it will be exciting to see how many we can find as a group. Join us!

updates.update_userinfo: ALL ORDERS SENT FROM DRAGONFJORD - MORE IDEAS ARE SPINNING IN OUR HEADS...
updates.update_content:
Mike and I are very satisfied that we now have all the orders sent out... Early Birds and Regular Birds! (except for those we haven't gotten a survey from). We are overwhelmed with the positive energy from your good feedback and it is very motivating to us. Thank you all! 

Dragonfjord puzzles and games will be back with more fun and challenging ideas 2021. We are working on ideas and design for a couple of new products.

updates.update_userinfo: A-Puzzle-A-Day in other languages, and more of your ideas
updates.update_content:
We've enjoyed reading your comments on the surveys! Thank you for your suggestions, some of which we'll be implementing as we move forward.

Many backers were interested in a version in English, or German, or Hungarian or other languages, which we will DEFINITELY be making in the first part of next year. It will take some time after the New Year until we have our machines back in service, but we'll keep you updated. Exciting times ahead! Thank you!

Packages sent to all over the world - 36 different countries - we are so excited to see if they all arrive safe and in order! A few people have not filled in the surveys and we can't send them if we don't have their adress. Hopefully we get them soon!

updates.update_userinfo: Over an hour at the post-office licking stamps today!
updates.update_content: Yes, it took that long... we are struggeling with the post office system to print out 355 customs forms. We are learning a lot, not things that we necessarily are so eager to learn... anyways more packages on their way to their new homes!
We'll be sending out surveys tomorrow (Monday) so we can get your address and other info and begin addressing packages. After an exciting campaign we need to relax for the weekend with grandchildren.

updates.update_userinfo: Peaceful morning - unusual - nothing went wrong...
updates.update_content: Big surprise this morning - nothing bad happened!! Only a few minutes left until the campaign is over. Thank you so much for being a part of our adventure. The feedback you have given us, has been so encouraging. And since we have had such good respons, this will help us to buy extra replacement parts for the days coming... we also want to buy a new, faster and better laser cutter. Maybe there will be less feeling of dragons making them, since there will be less burn marks. We hope that you will follow us and our new projects. We want to start a blog on dragonfjord.com, so that you can learn more about what we are doing (and learn a little about life in Norway).

Thanks to all of you who have supported the project. It is only a few hours left untill the campaign is over.  Not only have we reached more than 900% of our goal and gotten more than 800 orders, but we've also had some orders from our webpage Dragonfjord Puzzles and Games. We have even gotten orders for some of the 3d puzzles that we make. (They are actually not a product that we want to sell because it takes forever to make them, but we have had so much fun making them!).  We are not expecting to get rich from our business, but we hope to be able to make a living from it!
