campaign.story:
Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game was released in 2018. It has been translated by Kosmos Verlang in German, Polish, Frech, Italian, Czech and Hungarian under the title of EXIT das buch series of Kosmos EXIT GAMES. 
This second version will include a new gameplay system, new faster website,  and 5+ new puzzles and riddles.  

Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails, will be officially launched on March 2021 on Amazon.
Scattered around the globe, parts of a legendary naval diary.
Writings of an insane mind, while stories speak of a greater mystery filled with sea monsters, nightmares and messages from other dimensions.
Years since its disappearance, the sea legends speak of a dark journey, on a ship long forgotten. 
All that until now.
The missing pages of this journal have been mysteriously put together.
The naval diary appears every now and then on the doorsteps of people who challenge its existence.  It's now the time to see what lies hidden and reveal the ship's final days."
 The basic idea behind Trip 1907 (second edition), is to provide an enhanced game play by limiting the webpage usage, and focus on the hardcopy. In this version the webpage is only for submitting the chapters answers and receiving puzzle hints.
The main differences between Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game and Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails are on the game experience. The new version does not need logging into the website. The passcodes are there to save your progress as well as the sanity system is now embedded inside the book. The passcodes are transformed into game clues and 5 riddles have also been replaced with new ones, along with two Easter Eggs. In this version the book's story will be in the hard copy.
In this version of Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails you will find:
A new, faster, website has been added with no registration required.
The "sanity" token hint exchange system is now on the hard copy. It is up to the players to keep track of their sanity tokens spent, leaving more space to continue the book even if all sanity points are spent.
 Pass codes have been added in order to save the game progress and give a linearity on the game puzzles.
The game story will be on the hard copy instead of the website.
 5 riddles have been replaced with two easter eggs on the hard copy.  
In order to play Trip 1907 (2nd Edition):Dark Sails you will need:
A copy of Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails.
A pencil.
An internet connected device.
A pair of scissors.
In this version you will need to go through 45 chapters of the book, solve the puzzles, submit your answers online and get the passcodes of each chapter.
Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails  is finished. Given previous experience on Kickstarter the game is finished as well as the play-test getting an excellent response from our game testers.  In this way delivery is a primary issue to us and will be done through Amazon & KDP separately for every backer of this project. Main goal is to complete all the shipping process by the first days of January. 
EU countries together with USA and Canada have at the moment an estimation time for dispatching of 5-7 days.
Is Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails an eBook?
Nope, Trip 1907 is  a hard copy book.

Do I need an app to play it?
Nope, all you need is the copy of the book a pen and an internet connection.

Is there a hint system for the riddles?
A hint system is provided on trip1907.com, where players can exchange their sanity tokens for hints.

Are there any additional charges for playing the book?
Nope, once you have purchased your copy there are no additional perks to buy.

What is the language of the game?
English.

Is there a forum to keep up with the riddles?
A forum will be provided for players exchanging ideas over the riddles.

I have the original copy of Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game, should I back this one?
There are changes in 5 [puzzles and gameplay. So if you have played the first version you will only find 5 different riddles. The story and the rest of the riddles remain the same.

When this version will come out so I can buy it?
This version will be launched on February 2021.

                 Pages: 170+
                 Puzzles: 45+
                 Artwork pages: 20+

campaign.story:
Welcome to The Fantasy Trip, the classic fantasy RPG of labyrinth adventures that is back and growing larger than ever! Thanks to you and many other fans of The Fantasy Trip, we have successfully run and delivered a total of eight different Kickstarter campaigns for The Fantasy Trip. 

Hexagram #6 digital mock-up. The zine will be printed at Mixam, the same printer we have used for the other releases in the series.
Hexagram #6 is the latest in a series that started out as a part of Kickstarter's 2019 Zine Quest event. We had so much fun working on the zine that we just kept making new issues. Fortunately for us, you've had as much fun incorporating the Hexagram content into your games as we have had writing every issue. 
This latest issue includes:
Rapier to Rapier: Fencing inThe Fantasy Trip by Lester W. Smith
Forge Sprites by Stefan Jones
Maximum Range of Thrown Spells by Henry J. Cobb
Random Mission Generator by Jean McGuire
Questions Three: David Pulver by Steve Jackson
The Ultrahex Map by Howard Kistler
A Tool of Flesh by James Eisert
The Household Grimoire by John Paul Bakshoian
Gralls: Moss, Bracken, Briar, and Bramble by Gregory Miller
Medium: A Proposed New Talent by Benjamin Pew
The Stench Snake by Kelly Nall
Creating an Infinite Arena by Philip J. Reed
Naturalist’s Notebook by Anthony Shostak
Laggy’s Last Game by P. D. Haynie

Hexagram #6 digital mock-up. The zine will be printed at Mixam, the same printer we have used for the other releases in the series.
Ultrahex Playmat
As with Hexagram #5, one of the articles in this latest issue was designed to work with a new 36" x 36" playmat. The Ultrahex Playmat is included in the $55 and $125 reward levels (see right). If this campaign succeeds, the playmat will be listed for pre-order on Warehouse 23 in the future.
Digital mockup of the 36" x 36" Ultrahex Playmat for use with one of the Hexagram #6 articles.

The Fantasy Trip Adventures 2
Now at print and set for release in 2021, we are making this new 64-page hardcover collection of adventures available as a part of this campaign so that you may combine shipping costs. 
As with the original Adventures hardcover, this new book features five adventures and includes five different sheets of new megahex tiles and counters. Please see the $40 and $125 pledge levels to include this new book in your rewards.
The Fantasy Trip Adventures 2 digital mock-up. Image is representative of the book and not 100% final. Details may change.
Old School Monsters
Steve and the team have been busy! This new 64-page hardcover book -- now at print and scheduled for release in 2021 -- is packed with monsters that have been adapted from the world's oldest roleplaying game, all thanks to the Open Game License! In addition to the hardcover, this set also includes two new sheets of counters and 55 new creature cards – one for each monster in the book!
To include this book in your rewards, please see the $45 and $125 pledge levels (at right).
The Fantasy Trip Old School Monsters digital mock-up. Image is representative of the book and not 100% final. Details may change.

NOTE: Unlocked stretch goals only apply to the $125 and $165 pledge levels. None of the pledge levels below the $125 reward benefit from unlocked stretch goals.

All stretch goals unlocked!

Please note that some of the add-ons that are listed below may be limited in BackerKit. It is best to always complete your BackerKit survey early so that you can lockdown your preferred extras. Contact help@sjgames.com if you have any questions about using BackerKit. 

 NOTE: Street addresses only.
After the Kickstarter project closes, and after all pledges are collected, we will open the BackerKit pledge manager. There, you will tell us your Warehouse 23 email address, provide your physical address, and pay for shipping (if you are receiving physical rewards). You will also have the chance to add more items to your rewards package. See the FAQ for estimated shipping costs.
Failure to complete your BackerKit survey by the deadline (which will be announced in a Kickstarter update once the pledge manager opens) will result in a refund and removal from the project. We cannot allow projects to remain open forever; we must set firm deadlines so that we can properly close campaigns.
If you wish, you may choose to use a fulfillment service. This allows you to pledge for the project and then provide us with a U.S. address for the delivery of your rewards. Forwarding from the fulfillment service, as well as any local fees, is your responsibility when using a fulfillment company.
INTERNATIONAL DELIVERY NOTE: There are no physical rewards offered to international backers. If the project closes successfully, we will offer the various titles through our online store, Warehouse 23.
We continue to search for reliable, economical solutions to international Kickstarter delivery.

Fortunately, we're still able to hit our target delivery date of April 2021, but the slack we had built into our plans is now completely consumed.

campaign.story:
TL;DR: Thornwillow is publishing the first ever fine press edition of Octavia E. Butler’s visionary masterpiece, Parable of the Sower. Letterpress printed and hand-bound, the Thornwillow edition is available in a range of versions, from classic paper, cloth, and leather bindings, to an array of unique artists’ books incorporating unconventional materials such as limp vellum, burl wood, wool, Baltic amber, lapis lazuli and gold. Featuring historic U.S. Geological Survey maps, which trace the heroes’ journey across the ravaged California landscape, as well as indices of record-breaking wildfires and events from our own times, the Thornwillow edition ties past, present, and future together to create a book which will honor Butler’s extraordinary legacy and preserve this important story for the (dystopian) future.

Check out our new Stretch Goal Reward - a free INVICTUS letterpress broadside for all backers of a physical tier if we break $100,000 and our new add on The Map of DYSTOPIA. See below for details.
The Ultimate Edition of Octavia E. Butler's Masterpiece - Parable of the Sower
A Book for Our Time
In 1949, George Orwell imagined 1984. In 1953, Ray Bradbury imagined 1999. In 1993, Octavia Butler imagined the 2020s. Her future is now.
For the first time in a fine press edition, Thornwillow proudly presents: PARABLE OF THE SOWER,  Octavia E. Butler's iconic view of a future that is all too familiar today, printed letterpress and hand-bound. 
Wildfires. Global Warming. Racial Violence. Drug Addiction. Desperation. The dystopian future Butler imagined is sadly ringing ever truer to life as we know it—and is an ever more visceral warning for what our future will hold if we are not mindful.
Parable of the Sower begins in the year 2023. Climate change and growing inequality have decimated the country, and the American middle class has been all but erased, with the last holdouts residing in fragile gated communities. The story centers on Lauren Oya Olamina, a young woman forced to flee her home on the outskirts of Los Angeles. Traveling north, she dreams of a redemption for humankind: Earthseed—a new religion, a new community, and a destiny to take root among the stars. With a small band of companions, she makes her way along the coast of California, fleeing wildfires and roving gangs of marauders and pyromaniacs in an apocalyptic wasteland.
It is a dark story, and a grim warning of what may come—but one equally steeped in hope, as well as fear.
 The Mother of Afrofuturism 
The Mother of Afrofuturism, Octavia E. Butler
Octavia Butler changed the landscape of science fiction. At a time when there were few Black sci fi writers—and virtually no Black women—she dared to imagine diverse and nuanced worlds and present a tangible vision of a future world that increasingly feels like the one in which we live. She wrote about Black heroes and Black futures integrated in universal hopes and dreams for a better tomorrow and created stories that capture all of our imaginations. 
Not only was Octavia Butler a two-time winner of both the Hugo and Nebula Awards (science fiction’s highest honors), she was also the first science fiction author to be awarded a MacArthur “Genius” Grant. Her dream was to become a New York Times bestselling author.
Octavia Butler dreamed of becoming a New York Times bestselling author. In 2020, that dream became reality.
This year, that dream finally came true. More than 25 years after publication, in September of 2020, PARABLE OF THE SOWER appeared on the New York Times Bestseller List for the first time. It is high time we celebrate this extraordinary author with an edition that will honor and preserve her legacy for generations to come.

Taking Her Place in the Thornwillow Canon
Thornwillow Press has published the works of some of the world’s greatest thinkers and writers, from Jane Austen and Frederick Douglass to John Updike and Barack Obama. Our books reside in the permanent collections of the Metropolitan Museum, the Smithsonian Institution, the White House, the Vatican, and many more—as well as the homes of readers like you all across the globe.
With your support, Octavia Butler will take her place in the Thornwillow canon with the ultimate edition of PARABLE OF THE SOWER—exquisitely letterpress printed and hand bound.
 Tracing our journey through past, present and future...
2020 has seen some of the worst wildfires in history, including the disastrous fires of the Australian “Black Summer” and record-setting blazes across California. As of the time of this writing, over 4 million acres have burned in California, displacing tens of thousands of families. Octavia Butler’s PARABLE OF THE SOWER is prescient in more ways than one, but perhaps her most prophetic observation was of the effects of unchecked climate change.
In Parable, as the heroes journey northward through her native California, they are pursued not only by bandits and thieves, but by flames. On several occasions, they are forced by wildfires and pyromaniacs to change course—all of which Butler describes with incredible specificity. Throughout the Thornwillow edition, historic U.S. Geological Survey maps trace their journey north along real California roadways. An index of real 2020 fires, with pictorial indicators on the maps, tie Butler’s fiction to a terrifying reality.
How Thornwillow Books Are Made
For 35 years, Thornwillow has been committed to making books that enhance the relationship between the reader and the written word.
All of the design, printing, and binding are done at Thornwillow in our workshops in Newburgh, New York. We are perhaps the only fine press publisher in the world to unite these related arts and crafts of the written word under one roof, and we are committed to teaching and perpetuating them for readers today and for years to come.
We start with a beautiful layout.  The text is set using classical ratios of type to page, giving each book luxurious margins and elegant proportions.
Once the book is laid out, the text is printed letterpress on our Heidelberg Cylinder Press. The type is literally pressed into the paper, so that you can feel the letters as you run your fingers across the page. This is an ancient art—the same process by which Johannes Gutenberg printed his books 500 years ago.
The books are then bound by hand by our master craftsmen, who create the highest quality bindings in the world.
 The Edition 
This is the first ever fine press edition of Octavia E. Butler’s visionary masterpiece, Parable of the Sower. Letterpress printed on archival papers and hand-bound, we are presenting our edition in several versions from classic paper, cloth, and leather bindings, to an array of unique artists’ books which explore ancient and unconventional binding techniques that push the boundaries of fine bookmaking. These hyper-limited editions feature rare and unusual materials, including limp vellum, burl wood, wool, and gold, as well as genuine Baltic amber, opals, carnelians, onyx, and lapis lazuli.  Three are presented in wooden boxes, handcrafted in cedar and black walnut by exceptional craftsmen from our own Makers Village.
Paper Wrapper  |  Edition limited to 100 more than backed  |  $95
Letterpress Paper Wrapper Edition
Our paper wrapper bindings are made with incredible care. Like the cloth and leather bindings, they have sewn signatures, enabling them to open easily for a beautiful reading experience. The letterpress printed wrapper is folded over a letterpress cover that secures the signatures. The text is printed letterpress on vellum finish archival stock. Each copy is numbered and signed.

Half-Cloth  |  Edition limited to 100 more than backed  |  $195
Bound in Half Cloth and Letterpress Printed Boards
The Half-Cloth Edition features a cloth spine and corners, letterpress printed boards and endpapers, and a letterpress spine label. The text is printed letterpress on vellum finish archival stock. Each copy is signed and numbered.

All Leather Bound Editions are presented in an elegant Clamshell or Wooden box. 
As established collectors of our leather bound editions know, Thornwillow's signature black clamshell boxes are an elegant way to preserve and protect your books and to unite the collection on a shelf. For this campaign, we have added two new variations, just as elegant and meticulously crafted, but made to complement this unique project.
All of the Half Leather and Full Leather editions include clamshell or wooden boxes for safekeeping. Clamshell boxes will be hand wrapped in either black or buckram binder's cloth (depending on the binding style), lined in suede, and have leather title labels tooled in genuine gold on the spine. Each of the EL DORADO, WORLD ON FIRE, and EARTHSEED volumes will be presented in wooden boxes, handcrafted in either cedar or black walnut by exceptional craftsmen from our own Makers Village.


Half-Leather | Edition limited to 25 more than backed  |  $595
Bound in Half Leather and "Scorched Wood" Paste Paper Boards, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The HALF-LEATHER edition is bound in black Moroccan leather and scorched wood grain patterned paste paper boards, with letterpress printed endpapers. The top edge of the book is gilt and each copy has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is printed letterpress on felt finish archival stock. Each copy is signed and numbered.

Deluxe Half-Leather GOD IS CHANGE Edition  | Limited to 36 Copies | $795
'God is Change' Half Leather Deluxe, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The GOD IS CHANGE DELUXE HALF-LEATHER edition is bound in yellow Moroccan goatskin leather and psychedelic letterpress boards—inspired by the ‘Pyro’-addicted “painted faces” who terrorize the California landscape in Parable of the Sower. The top edge of the book is gilt and each copy has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is printed letterpress on felt finish archival stock. Each copy is signed and numbered.
 Full-Leather DESTINY Edition | Limited to 24 Copies | $895 
'Destiny' Edition bound in Full Purple Moroccan Leather, Presented in a Clamshell Box
“The Destiny of Earthseed is to take root among the stars.” The full-leather DESTINY edition is bound in full purple Moroccan leather and features hand-marbled end papers. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is letterpress printed on felt finish archival stock. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 24 copies.

 Full-Leather Antique Calf SCORCHED EARTH Edition | Limited to 18 Copies | $995 
'Scorched Earth' Edition bound in Full Black Calf, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The SCORCHED EARTH edition is bound in black mottled calfskin with 'burnt wood grain' paste paper endsheets.  The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is letterpress printed on felt finish archival stock. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 18 copies.
 Vellum BOOK OF THE LIVING Edition | Limited to 18 Copies | $1350 
'Book of the Living' Edition bound in Limp Vellum, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The BOOK OF THE LIVING edition is bound in full limp vellum, a historic binding style popular in the 16th Century and revived by many of the great bookmakers of the early 1900's. It is a flexible binding made of genuine vellum and it is tied at the fore edge by grosgrain ribbons that lace through the cover. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. The text is letterpress printed on gypsum felt finish archival papers. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 18 copies.
 THE GROVE Edition in Half Leather and Ash Wood Boards | Limited to 12 Copies | $2000 
'The Grove' Edition bound in Leather and Burl Ash Boards, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The GROVE edition is bound in half leather and ash burl wood boards. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is letterpress printed on gypsum felt finish archival papers. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 12 copies.

Full-Leather HEARTHSTONE Edition | Limited to 7 Copies | $3000
'Hearthstone' Edition bound in Full Calf set with Baltic Amber, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The Full-Leather HEARTHSTONE edition is bound in full mottled calfskin with genuine Baltic amber inlaid on the cover, and features handmade paste paper endsheets. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is letterpress printed on gypsum felt finish archival papers. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 7 copies.
PLAY

Baltic Amber is 35-40  million years old and each piece is unique and distinct. It is said  to help balance the emotions, clear the mind and release negative energy.

 Full-Leather fully gilt EL DORADO Edition | Limited to 3 Copies | $4000 
The 'El Dorado' Edition is bound in Full Moroccan Leather. The whole cover is gilt in genuine gold. Presented in a Suede Lined Black Walnut Box
The EL DORADO edition is bound in full scarlet Moroccan leather with hand marbled endpapers. The entire cover is gilt in genuine gold leaf. The top edge is also gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in an elegant suede lined black walnut presentation box, handcrafted right here in the Thornwillow Makers Village. The text is printed letterpress on all-cotton fiber stock. Each copy is numbered and signed. Limited to 3 copies.
The entire cover of the 'El Dorado' Edition is fully gilt in genuine 23 carat gold

 Full-Leather WORLD ON FIRE Edition | Limited to 3 Copies | $4500 
'World on Fire' Edition bound in Full Orange Moroccan Leather set with genuine Opals, Citrines, Onyx, Carnelians, and Lapis Lazuli. Presented in a Suede Lined Black Walnut Box
The Full-Leather WORLD ON FIRE edition is bound in full orange Moroccan goatskin with hand-marbled endpapers. The cover is hand tooled and set with an array of gemstones, including opals, citrines, onyx, carnelians, and lapis lazuli for a psychedelic look inspired by the novel’s dread designer drug “pyro”. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined black walnut presentation box, handcrafted right here in the Thornwillow Makers Village. The text is letterpress printed on all-cotton fiber stock. Each copy is numbered and signed. Limited to 3 copies.

Wool and Leather EARTHSEED | One of a Kind Artist's Binding | $5000 
Each 'Earthseed' volume is bound in a soft leather and one of a kind crocheted wool cover. Presented in a suede lined Cedar Box
Each EARTHSEED volume features a one-of-a-kind crocheted wool and leather cover by artist Irena Martens. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands and bark patterned end sheets. It is presented in an expertly crafted cedar presentation box, handmade right here in the Thornwillow Makers Village. The text is letterpress printed on all-cotton fiber stock. As each copy is completely unique, each will be numbered 1/1 and signed by the publisher and artist.
Each hand crocheted cover is a one of a kind work of art.
Irena Martens is a celebrated sculptor who has always had a passion for fiber arts. Her work has been exhibited across three continents, by the Smithsonian and the Museum of Contemporary Crafts among many others. Friends of Thornwillow may also know her as Luke's mom. Her eighteenth century New England farmhouse (called "Thornwillow") was the birthplace of our press. Born during WWII in Hamburg, Germany, some of her earliest memories are of a world ravaged by hate and war—and conversely, of what it took to stitch that world back together. 
Luke (several years ago) with his mother, artist Irena Martens.


SPECIAL OFFERS and ADD-ONS
As in past projects, we are offering some very special ADD-ONS and EXCLUSIVE OFFERS for subscribers of the Thornwillow Dispatch. 

STRETCH GOAL | INVICTUS for All

If the campaign breaks the $100,000 barrier before the end, we will send free copy of William Ernest Henley's iconic poem INVICTUS for FREE to all backers of a physical tier.
Stretch Goal - a free copy of William Ernest Henley's iconic poem INVICTUS will be sent to all backers of a physical tier if we break the $100k barrier on this campaign.

CHECK OUT OUR NEW ADD-ON | The Map of DYSTOPIA | $50
DYSTOPIA represents the entire journey undertaken by Lauren Olamina and the Earthseed community as they travel northward through the California wasteland. This letterpress printed, limited edition map is the perfect complement to Thornwillow’s Parable of the Sower—and a powerful reminder of what it will take to plan our journey forward.
DYSTOPIA is a letterpress printed limited edition map that represents the journey of the Earthseed community.

DANGEROUS SPEECH | Exclusive for Patreon and Thornwillow Dispatch Subscribers.
For our Thornwillow Dispatch subscribers, we are pleased to offer a complementary Broadside Portfolio — DANGEROUS SPEECH — with any book tier backed on this campaign.

Freedom of speech is a cornerstone of Western society, yet in these past few tumultuous years, even this fundamental principle has been shaken. This portfolio features 10 letterpress printed broadsides and is complimentary for all backers of the campaign who are also subscribers of the Thornwillow Dispatch. The broadsides included are: 'Banned Books', 'The Apology of Socrates', 'Areopagitica', 'Brandenburg V. Ohio', 'An Ideal For Which I Am Prepared to Die', 'The First Amendment', 'The Sermon on the Mount', 'If We Are Wrong', 'I Know It When I See It', and 'A Sincere And Honest Book'.
Patreon subscribers are always the first to know about new campaigns (and always get some free goodies when they back our projects on Kickstarter), so if you would like to be the first to know about our next upcoming project, be sure to sign up!

Plus, next month, we are bringing a very special related publication to the Thornwillow Dispatch that supporters of this campaign will not want to miss...
 Octavia Butler's award winning short story SPEECH SOUNDS 
We are pleased to announce that Octavia Butler’s Hugo Award-winning short story SPEECH SOUNDS will be coming to the Thornwillow Dispatch in December! Like Parable of the Sower it is letterpress printed and hand bound. 
PLAY

This publication is available in two limited editions: CLASSIC EDITION copies will be bound in letterpress printed paper wrappers. PATRONS EDITION copies feature handmade paste paper bindings with engraved labels, and will be individually numbered and signed by the publisher. The paste paper on the covers of the Patrons Edition is the same "Scorched Wood" pattern used on the Half Leather and Full Leather "Scorched Earth" edition of Parable of the Sower.
"Speech Sounds" is available in the Classic Edition or the Patrons' Edition as an add-on or by subscribing to the Thornwillow Dispatch before November 30th..
SPEECH SOUNDS is available two ways: You may reserve the Classic Edition for $38 or the Patrons Edition for $138 as an add-on to your pledge. Alternatively, both Classic and Patrons Edition copies are available as part of an ongoing subscription to the Thornwillow Dispatch until the deadline of November 30. As a 'thank you' for their steadfast support, subscribers to the Thornwillow Dispatch receive not only the anchor publication and other delightful contents of the monthly Dispatch, but are also given access to the most advantageous pricing, at $30 for the Classic Dispatch, and $100 for the Patrons Edition (which includes an additional, complimentary copy of the Classic Edition). 

To receive SPEECH SOUNDS as part of an ongoing subscription (and to secure the best price), be sure that you are subscribed for the Thornwillow Dispatch on Patreon before the November 30 deadline! Subscribers at the 30pt. Baskerville tier will receive Classic Edition copies in the December Thornwillow Dispatch; Subscribers at the 100pt. Electra tier or higher will receive BOTH Patrons’ Edition and Classic Edition copies, and will support the continuation of the Thornwillow Patrons’ Prize for Emerging Artists. 

What is the Thornwillow Dispatch?
The Thornwillow Dispatch is our monthly subscription of finely printed ideas and inspirations. Each month ongoing subscribers receive a new letterpress printed, hand-bound publication from the Press, as well as a curated collection of engraved and letterpress printed keepsakes. Past Dispatches have included an assortment of limited edition chapbooks, broadsides, and prints that feature editorial and artistic content, as well as finely crafted goods for your study like engraved note cards, journals, and calendar cards.
To reserve your copy of "SPEECH SOUNDS" and claim your FREE "DANGEROUS SPEECH" Broadside Portfolio, subscribe to the Thornwillow Dispatch here: www.patreon.com/thornwillow

"Tomorrow is the Child of Today" | Letterpress Broadside | Add-on $5
"Tomorrow is the Child of Today" Letterpress Broadside featuring quotes of Octavia E. Butler
This broadside is part of the Thornwillow Broadside Library, and features notable quotes from the author, Octavia E. Butler. It is letterpress printed on heavy archival stock and pocket-sized. This handsome keepsake is a fun read and a thoughtful enclosure with a letter to a friend. It is included with all the tiers on this campaign and additional copies can be added on for $5 each.

 The PYRO Notebook | Add-on $20
The PYRO NOTEBOOK features sewn signatures and heavy archival stock to preserve your ideas and inspirations.
Like our fine press editions, the PYRO NOTEBOOK features sewn signatures and heavy archival stock with letterpress printed cover—perfect for keeping your ideas and inspirations. It is included for free with the PARABLE BOOK CLUB and PARABLE FAN tiers. It is also available as an add-on to your pledge for $20.

BUNDLED TIERS
We are pleased to offer the following bundled tiers that give backers of the campaign more ways to engage with Parable of the Sower and the work of Thornwillow Press.

 The Parable of the Sower Book Club | $190 
The Book Club Tier features TWO copies of Parable bound in paper wrappers and TWO Pyro Notebooks and TWO "Tomorrow is the Child of Today"broadsides.
If you’re planning to read PARABLE OF THE SOWER with a group of friends (or would simply like an additional copy to give as a gift), subscribe to the BOOK CLUB tier and receive two copies of PARABLE OF THE SOWER in letterpress paper wrappers, along with two PYRO NOTEBOOKS and two "Tomorrow is the Child of Today" BROADSIDES. Like the edition itself, the pages of the PYRO NOTEBOOK are sewn into signatures, and they have a letterpress printed paper wrappers. The pages themselves are heavy archival stock suitable for notes, diaries, sketches, ideas, and inspirations. Reading with three friends? Four? A dozen? Additional paper wrapper and half-cloth copies, as well as additional journals, are available as add-ons to your pledge.

 Parable Fan | $325 
Receive two copies of PARABLE OF THE SOWER: One book is bound in paper wrappers and the other in half cloth. Each copy is individually numbered and signed, and your name will be included on the subscribers list. Plus, receive the PYRO Notebook and the "TOMORROW IS THE CHILD OF TODAY" Broadside.
The Parable Fan tier includes both the Paper and Cloth editions plus the Pyro Notebook and letterpress Broadside.

Receive three divine Thornwillow books, all bound in letterpress paper-wrappers:
GENESIS, Dante's INFERNO hand-lettered and illustrated by George Cochrane, and PARABLE OF THE SOWER by Octavia E. Butler.
Each copy is individually numbered and signed, and your name will be included on the PARABLE OF THE SOWER subscribers list.

Backers of the Half-Leather Collector: Wastelands tier will receive THREE WAR STORIES by David Mamet, PARABLE OF THE SOWER by Octavia E. Butler, and THE WASTELAND by T.S. Eliot
Get three Thornwillow books, all bound in half leather and paste paper boards:
THREE WAR STORIES by David Mamet, THE WASTELAND by T.S. Eliot, and PARABLE OF THE SOWER by Octavia E. Butler.

Each book is signed, numbered, and presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. Your name will be included on the PARABLE OF THE SOWER subscribers list.

A Note on our Pricing:
We are extremely grateful to pre-publication subscribers like you. Without your support, it would not be possible for us to do what we do. By way of thanks, we offer our work at reduced pricing to those who come in early to support a project and help it get off the ground. Our prices increase as availability decreases. After the prepublication subscription period ends for a particular project, we will post available copies on our website. (NOTE: Often certain versions of the edition are fully subscribed during the Kickstarter launch.) When an edition is down to just a few remaining copies left, the prices tend to be much higher then they were at the beginning. This rewards collectors who came in early.
In subscribing to a Thornwillow publication, you are not just adding a beautiful book to your shelf that is likely to appreciate in value, you are making an investment in people. You are making it possible for us to teach and perpetuate the related arts and crafts of the written word. By joining our community, you join us in celebrating the written word.
About Thornwillow Press:
Thornwillow Press was founded in 1985 by Luke Ives Pontifell when he was 16. During college he ran the press from his Harvard dorm room and the barn at his parents’ 18th century farm in Western Massachusetts. Over the years, Thornwillow has grown to become one of the preeminent fine presses in the world. Thornwillow has published the original works of John Updike, President Barack Obama, James Merrill, and more. Thornwillow publications can be found in the permanent collections of the Metropolitan Museum, the Smithsonian Institution, the Morgan Library, the Vatican, and the Bodleian Library at Oxford, among many others.
To learn more about Thornwillow Press please visit thornwillow.com. To learn more about the work of the Thornwillow Institute and Makers Village — a 501(c)3 public charity committed to supporting craft, culture and community — and how you can help support our mission, please visit thornwillowinstitute.org.

campaign.story:
SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES is the sequel to the successful Shotglass Adventures: GRAVIS TOWN BLUES Kickstarter and the 7th book from Laidback DM!
Published under the OGL and compatible with 5e and OSR fantasy role playing games, SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES is 78 pages of adventures that can be played as One-Shots or as the second module in a four-part campaign, taking your players from 1st– 14th level.

Gravis Town is locked down as the Kal-Zar’s Bane virus runs rampant. A journal found in a lost shipyard provides the location of the long-hidden library of Kal-Zar Ro. The party must travel to the Orinspeak, a mountain trapped in perpetual winter in the heart of the forest.
There are questions to be answered, secrets to be uncovered. The truth about Kal-Zar’s Bane may be revealed. And the quest to find a cure can begin…
So, what’s in SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES?
· 7 adventures – puzzles, investigations, dungeon crawls, quests, social encounters - complete with full color maps! Varied adventures from 5th – 7th level, designed for minimal preparation and flexible delivery. Each adventure can be run as part of the ongoing Kal-Zar’s Bane campaign, or as a One-Shot. Every adventure has both Campaign-specific and One-Shot-specific hooks. The One-Shot hooks ignore all the sub-plots and provide you with exactly what you need to run each adventure as a one-off for your players - you can either slot them into your existing campaign or run them as separate, individual side quests.
· Loads of hand-drawn, full-color maps!
· 20 new monsters & NPCs and 9 new magic items!
· Fully detailed village and region setting– The Elven tree village of Ai’Pa’El is home to the An’st’rm elves and a potential regional base for the PCs in the vast Orinwood Forest. The elves harbor a secret that may start to unravel the truth about Kal-Zar’s Bane…
· Expanded map of Verona Province - including the Jarldoms of Skandara – a new, expanded map and brief gazetteer of the Invician Empire and Verona Province! More new and expanded lore for the Shotglass Adventures campaign setting!
· Full guide for OSR conversions!
Here are some example pages:
Note: adventures are currently being play tested – some content and page lay outs may change slightly as a result.
As an added bonus, Shotglass Adventures Rounds #1 - The One That Got Away is FREE with all pledges of Party Died For and above! A 12-page PDF-only module with gridded and gridless maps included, this is a re-working of an adventure I submitted to the One Page Dungeon Competition in 2018, which gained an 'honorable mention'. Lost in the Abyss, the party needs to get home - and to do that, they need to solve the dilemma of a demon's long-lost love...

Concise, easily accessible and quick to prep for, every adventure comes complete with adventure hooks for Campaign play and for One-Shot play, maps, NPCs and monsters, with enough space for you to incorporate improvisation based on your players' decisions. Loads of variety and something for all your players - run them as One-Shots or easily slot them into your existing campaign!
Check out these teasers for each of the adventures included in SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES:

Several of the pledge levels include the MINED GAMES Digital Maps Package. This package contains two versions of every hand-drawn, full color map in the book – full size color (A3 & A4-size) + optimized full color suitable for virtual tabletops like Roll20or Fantasy Grounds  – giving you options for how you use them. 36 images – all are 600 DPI (300 DPI is print quality) high quality digital JPEGs.
Purchasing the Digital Maps Package also gets you a limited Royalty Free License enabling you to use each map in your own commercial and non-commercial projects (but not to sell them separately or as part of another digital maps package).
Here are some examples of maps in the package:
Note: Only some of the maps are shown. Additional maps will be added as stretch goals are unlocked.
$2000 - 1st Stretch Goal Unlocked!
A bonus full size, hand drawn, unkeyed full color map added to the book PLUS 2 x Digital JPEGs added to the Digital Maps Package – Full size and a smaller version sized for virtual tabletops - you can use for your own adventures.
Forest Tower Ruin!
The tower is a shadow of its former self. The upper levels have collapsed, bowing to the weight of years and other conflicts. Crumbling, rib-like walls extend out from its emaciated torso. Your party can smell the stench of death within. Foul, rotting zombies cluster in the tower courtyard, ambling senselessly about. But why aren't the creatures coming out? And why does the water in this central well smell so wonderfully pure and clear? It's overwhelming your senses. It's so good you just want to taste it...
How would YOU use this map in your own adventure?

 $2500 - 2nd Stretch Goal Unlocked!
A bonus full size, hand drawn, unkeyed full color map added to the book PLUS 2 x Digital JPEGs added to the Digital Maps Package – Full size and a smaller version sized for virtual tabletops - you can use for your own adventures.
Forest Cave!
The treeline thins. A cold and dank cave entrance lies before you, its darkness swallowing the forest canopy's light shafts like a great, toothless maw. Bloody footprints lead away into the black - man or beast? They're too smeared to tell. You can hear sounds echoing from the depths. Is that the tearing of flesh? You draw your sword...   
 $3000 - 3rd Stretch Goal Unlocked!
2 bonus full size, hand drawn, unkeyed full color maps added to the book PLUS 4 x Digital JPEGs added to the Digital Maps Package – Full size and a smaller version sized for virtual tabletops - you can use for your own adventures.
Both of these battlemaps have 1-inch squares ideal for 25mm miniatures!
Ravine Bridge Map
The Troll licks its lips as it gestures for you to cross the rope bridge. "It's just a small toll," you remember it saying. As you place your foot upon the unsteady slats, you glance below. Was that a spider you saw down there in the ravine? Pretty big. And now it seems to be crawling up the wall... 
Druidic Island
Ancient standing stones rise from the island like giant teeth. The hairs on your neck rise as you step out of the boat onto the shore. This is a sacred place - perhaps you shouldn't be here. As you move closer to the circle of menhirs, you notice a red stain upon the ground at its center. Then a great howl breaks the silence as something rises from the murky waters behind you...  
 $3500 - 4th Stretch Goal Unlocked!
1 bonus full size, hand drawn, unkeyed full color maps added to the book PLUS 2 x Digital JPEGs added to the Digital Maps Package – Full size and a smaller version sized for virtual tabletops - you can use for your own adventures.
Cavern Platforms
This cavern is huge, with a ceiling at least a hundred feet high; hanging stalactites outlined in phosphorescence and resembling ghoulish teeth provide a modicum of illumination. Sprinkled around massive natural columns are rock platforms, rising to various heights like tin cans in a pantry. Suddenly, an arrow scrapes your cheek - glancing up you see humanoid creatures on top of each platform. It seems they have the drop on you... 
$4000 - BONUS: Map Upgrade and Addition to DIGITAL MAPS PACKAGE! 
Map upgraded in book PLUS 2 x full size old and new map and 2 x virtual tabletop versions added to Digital Maps Package, bringing total maps to 36!

SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES will be delivered as a PDF via DrivethruRPG, the biggest marketplace for RPG PDFs in the world, so you can always access a copy through your DrivethruRPG account.
Additionally, if you are an Illustrious Backer, Excelsior Backer, Avenger Backer, Scion Backer, or Ultimate Backer, you'll also receive a POD code to purchase a print copy if you want one - you won't have to pay the cost of the PDF again, only the base printing and postage costs (approximately $6-7 printing + approximately $5-6 postage, depending on where in the world you are) via DrivethruRPG. The book will look great on your bookshelf and in play!
I’m the author of 7 books of adventures for 5e and OSR RPGs, 2 books of poetry and 21 other RPG products. 
I first started playing and DM’ing D&D in 1981. Nowadays, I game roughly 2-3 times a week. I have lots of RPGs - Fate Core, Symbaroum, Numenera, Pathfinder 2e, Mutant Year Zero, Stars Without Number, Mouse Guard, Coriolis, Forbidden Lands - basically too many to list, but I'm a fan of them all. D&D remains my greatest love and when I write a new product, I pour my years of experience and passion into the project. Your support helps me continue to produce quality fantasy role playing adventures and supplements.
This is my seventh Kickstarter – the last six were delivered ahead of schedule, and anyone who’s been part of them can tell you I always come through.
What's the money used for?
Kickstarter  enables me to write and design role playing game content. Every Kickstarter I do is not only a labor of love, it pays for all the time I've invested creating, laying out and play testing the product - and more importantly, making a living! Read any blog by any product designer and you'll know margins are always tight, so your support for my projects is amazing and always appreciated.
Visit Laidback DM at stevestillstanding.com for DM/GM hints, product reviews, and free maps. And poetry!
Social Media:
TWITTER: twitter.com/SteveStillStand
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/steve.stillstanding
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/stevestillstanding/
Wordpress: https://stevestillstanding.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Your funds help cover my costs as a full time Product Designer. Much of the work is done, with some play testing, writing and editing to be completed. 

Once the Kickstarter is complete, I add the backer names and draw, digitally color and write any stretch goals and add them to the book, and compile the digital maps package. I complete the work myself, which means there are no staffing/scheduling issues. And I’m locked up in isolation like you guys, so Covid-19 won’t impact on my production of this book.

I worked for 22 years in customer service and project management, so I'm used to managing time-scheduled projects and delivering products within timeframe. My previous projects have all been delivered within a month of Kickstarter completion, all ahead of schedule. 

The only potential delay is any shutdown of DrivethruRPG’s printing house, which is always possible in light of the current pandemic. This hasn’t delayed the production of my print proofs previously, and I’ll keep you all informed if it does happen. If it does, I can release the digital content early and release the print version when their printing house comes online again.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
When things are at their worst, the best among us rises to the fore. When disaster strikes or menace looms, they don’t run from the danger, they run toward it. Whether they claim supernatural abilities or just plain courage, there's a single word that describes such people:
In a world that could use a few heroes now more than ever, you can now join their ranks—using the flexible TTRPG mechanics of the Cypher System.
Imagine, for a moment, that you find yourself imbued with powers well beyond those of mere mortals. With great might, you leap into dark and daunting dangers. You stand before the forces of injustice with confidence. You slip the grasp of gravity and soar. You Claim the Sky itself.
But what about on the other end of the scale, where we’re all a bit more earth-bound? We can still be heroes. Saving lives amid natural disasters, man-made cataclysms, pandemics, or crises of any sort, we can take on the role of First Responders.
These two new Cypher System sourcebooks focus on heroes of all kinds!
Claim the Sky continues the series of genre-focused books that includes The Stars Are Fire (science-fiction), Stay Alive! (horror), We Are All Mad Here (fairy tales), and Godforsaken (fantasy). Each of those titles dives deep, exploring different aspects and variations of its genre and offering new rules, character creation ideas, equipment, creatures, cyphers, and other elements for making the most of the topic.
In this case, of course, the topic is superheroes. Whether your love is comic book superheroes or the blockbuster films of recent years, Claim the Sky will give you step-by-step guidelines for recreating all your favorite characters, building your own heroes from scratch, and sending them out into fun, fast-paced RPG adventures and campaigns.
But there’s more. Like the books that came before it, Claim the Sky presents a fully realized, ready-to-use superhero setting: Boundless. In the world of Boundless, your player characters can join the ranks of well-established heroes and face titanic foes: invading alien creatures, horrors from other dimensions, supervillains using their powers for selfish or destructive ends. This setting is like our own world, but superpowers have existed for generations, and the world has adapted accordingly (in sometimes surprising ways!). If you’re looking for a setting with the feel of movies or comics, Boundless will take you there!
First Responders looks at heroism from a different angle. This is a world where the heroes' powers aren't supernatural: our world, where courage, wits, experience, and grit are the tools by which our heroes overcome crises and disaster. Around the globe, the PCs respond to earthquakes and hurricanes, floods and fires, war zones and industrial disasters, plane crashes and pandemics. They're part of an international organization with a mission to save lives and to not just respond to crises, but to end them.
In First Responders, you create a campaign with a broad roster of heroes. In one session you might need a paramedic, a trained rescue worker, and a firefighting specialist, while the next mission requires the paramedic, a field researcher, and a pilot, and the one after that you need a rescue worker, a field researcher, and a technician. The players maintain multiple characters, but the unique system advances them all, regardless of which are involved in a given adventure, so that any can be called upon as the campaign progresses and the threats become ever more dangerous.
First Responders also provides exciting rules for mega-challenges, making events like a forest fire or an earthquake into a fully-realized narrative filled with challenges as dynamic and exciting as any battle against monsters or crawl through a dungeon. These large-scale challenge rules will be easily useable in any Cypher System game, so you can incorporate them into your Numenera campaign, or adventures based on Claim the Sky, The Stars Are Fire, or any other Cypher System setting.
Our world needs heroes. Cypher System fans love new books. We've already unlocked The Origin, a new hardcover setting book. And we're looking forward to reaching the Cypher System Bestiary later in this campaign! What else might we unlock before that title—or beyond it? We have lots of great ideas, and look forward to lots of cool stretch goals!
The critically acclaimed, award-winning Cypher System is fast-paced, narrative-focused, flexible, and uniquely easy on the GM. Baked-in mechanics like Effort and player intrusions easily support heroic styles of play—PCs can really push themselves to do amazing things. The Cypher System’s Power Shift mechanic and Power Boost cyphers perfectly portray the way superpowers work. They make it easy to show how a super-strong hero can break down a door without thinking twice or how another hero might briefly try something unique with their powers to get a very specific effect. Both of these mechanics—and more—will be even further developed in Claim the Sky.
Creating a great Cypher System character is as easy as coming up with a great concept. You build the character you imagine through a quick, fun process that results in a character with depth, nuance, and flexibility.
Cypher System characters are built with a three-part sentence. You might be a Rugged Warrior who Stands Like a Bastion. A Guarded Adept who Keeps a Magic Ally. Perhaps a Graceful Explorer who Moves Like the Wind. Or a Charming Speaker who Bears a Halo of Fire. Each part of your sentence says something about your character—but also provides some of your abilities, skills, and stats. They even offer guidance on your connections to other characters in your party, creating bonds that can be a foundation for an ongoing campaign, or facilitate great roleplaying in one-shot adventures.
Cyphers give characters single-use abilities frequently gained and spent, adding variety to the character’s capabilities and providing exciting new approaches and options. Depending on what’s appropriate for the campaign, cyphers can be subtle, representing blessings, unusual turns of luck or capricious powers, or manifest, in the form of bits of unusual technology, charms, or minor magic items.
Character arcs encourage and reward players for pursuing their characters’ own motivations, in addition to the overall story of the campaign. Just as the heroes of movies, comics, and TV shows grow through their own subplots, Cypher System players may choose arcs to pursue, tying their characters’ personalities more closely to the overall story and engaging the players even deeper into their characters and the campaign.
No problem! Every backer level includes a copy of the complete Cypher System Rulebook in PDF. This 448-page book is a $22 value in PDF, but it's free with every reward and delivered early, mere weeks after the campaign closes. (Already have the CSR? You can gift your free PDF to a friend!)
Want to Check It Out Now?
Download the free Cypher System Rules Primer, and have a look at the system's amazing mechanics right now!
Claim the Sky is a 224-page hardcover (upgraded to include a poster map!) that delves deeply into all aspects of the superhero genre. With a similar look and form, it's a beautiful companion to the recent Cypher System supplements The Stars Are Fire, Godforsaken, Stay Alive!, and We Are All Mad Here. Beautifully illustrated, it explores the many facets and subgenres of superhero comics, movies, and fiction, with rules and options for all of them. It includes the Boundless campaign setting, along with creatures, cyphers, artifacts, equipment, and more.
First Responders is a 128-page hardcover (strike that: we've upgraded the page count through stretch goals!) that presents rules, options, gear, and more for heroes inspired by the real world to take on massive challenges and dangers.
The Origin is a 128-page hardcover (strike that: we've upgraded the page count through stretch goals!) setting book. This is a world where superheroes are not a fact of life. Player characters must come to grips with the fact that they can do things normal humans cannot, and then decide what to do with these abilities while facing clandestine government branches, terrorist organizations, and even more mysterious groups that want to study, recruit, or destroy them.
Every backer level includes a copy of the complete Cypher System Rulebook in PDF. This 448-page book is a $22 value in PDF, but it's free with every reward and delivered early, mere weeks after the campaign closes. If you already have the CSR, we'll make it easy to gift your free PDF to a friend.
Are You a First Responder? If you're a firefighter, EMT or paramedic, emergency worker, or other front-line hero, the Real-World Heroes backer level gives you First Responders and the Cypher System Rulebook at a deep discount just for you.
Looking to Get into the Cypher System? You'll get the Cypher System Rulebook in PDF at any reward level. Prefer it in glorious hardcover? The Brand New Hero level gives you every title funded by this campaign, plus the CSR in print (a $70 value). Or check out Any Character, Any Campaign, which includes four additional genre books at an astounding discount! If you're looking to spend a little less, you can instead choose the CSR as an add-on.
Want to Playtest—or Just See It Early? Materials for the titles funded by this campaign generally go to playtesters about four months before those titles become products and go out as backer rewards (that's a generalization, though—not a specific commitment). If you'd like to be part of the action, or just have early access to the materials to check them out, or to roll the mechanics into your existing Cypher System campaign, back at any level from The Danger Room up. Backers at these levels may choose to be part of the playtest, or simply to receive the playtest material without providing feedback. It's up to you!
Love an Incredible Deal? To get your hands on a whole stack of awesome Cypher System products, you can't do better than the Any Character, Any Campaign or THOOOM! reward levels. The savings are so spectacular they're a bargain even if you already own some of the titles. All the levels from The Danger Room and up also get you the Cypher System playmat for free, and early access and playtesting!
Are You a Retailer? The Secret Base level is a flexible way for you to decide how many of each title is right for your store, and to avoid tying up lots of cash between now and release. Your pledge gets you three copies each of Claim the Sky and First Responders. You may, at a later time, increase the quantity of these titles, and add additional titles funded by stretch goals. You’ll pay for those additional titles, at a retail-friendly discount, at that time. It is likely (but not guaranteed) that you will get them ahead of street date, and you are welcome to begin selling them immediately. For this retail backer level only, MCG covers domestic US shipping—but you must still complete BackerKit and follow our fulfillment process (see Shipping, below).

REWARD REDEMPTION AND FULFILLMENT Because we will ship rewards at several times over the course of many months, our fulfillment process may be different than other campaigns you’ve backed.
A few weeks after this campaign ends, we will invite you to BackerKit, our pledge management platform. This allows you to confirm your pledge and add on anything you might have missed. Later, when a reward is ready to fulfill, you'll use the MCG Shop to manage the process. This puts you, the backer, in charge of redeeming rewards at your convenience, and ensures we always have your up-to-date address at the time we ship a reward. YOU MUST COMPLETE THIS STEP TO RECEIVE YOUR REWARD.
Here’s a brief look at how it works:
1.  When a reward is ready, we’ll notify you by email.
2.  You log on to the MCG Shop.
3.  You go to your Coupons page and click on the coupon for the reward, and it is automatically added to your cart. If you have multiple rewards, or want to make purchases, you can add them all to your cart before checking out.
4. Check out! You give us your address and pay for shipping (for physical rewards) at that time.
UPDATING YOUR ADDRESS OR GIFTING YOUR REWARD If you move, you won’t need to tell us, since you’ll simply enter your new address the next time you redeem a reward. If this is a gift and you want to ship it directly to the recipient, just enter their shipping address when you check out. If it's not convenient to receive a reward at the time of fulfillment, or to ship multiple rewards together to save on shipping costs, you may delay redemption of a reward for up to one year after the product’s release date. 
SHIPPING All backers pay for shipping when they redeem their rewards. We offer a variety of domestic and international shipping methods from which you can choose. As of this writing, basic domestic shipping is $7 per shipment, but we do not control future postal rates, so that cost is subject to change. International shipping is based on postal and shipping rates at the time of the order, and varies by destination and shipment weight.
INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING International shipping is expensive. We don’t have any control over that, and we can’t accurately predict what shipping rates will be at the time of fulfillment. We must comply with international law and cannot mark your reward as a gift or as a zero-value item. Here are details that apply to your region:
 The Americas: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in the United States. You will be responsible for import duties, taxes, and brokerage fees (if applicable). Canadian backers please note that our books are printed in Canada, and thus are not subject to import duties; however, items not printed in Canada, such as decks of cards, are subject to import duties.
 The EU and UK: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in the UK. UK and EU backers will not pay import duties and taxes.
 Australia, New Zealand, the South Pacific, and Asia: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in Australia. Backers in Australia will not pay import duties and taxes; other backers will be responsible for import duties, taxes, and brokerage fees (if applicable).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Monte Cook Games has run sixteen previous Kickstarter campaigns. All of our previous campaigns have been successful and jam-packed with rewards. Most of those campaigns are completely fulfilled, and we have a strong record for fulfilling rewards on time—we’ve delivered well over a million rewards to date. These include such varied items as corebooks for Numenera, The Strange, and the Cypher System, leather-bound deluxe books, boxed sets, scores of hardcover supplements, signed bookplates, playtest access, special-access seminars, meetings and dinners with the creative team, online and in-person games, and so much more. Thus, while there are always challenges that can arise, we've probably already faced them.

We are extremely proud of our track record. There have been bumps on the road, but what are roads without bumps? We're confident that the project will meet all its promises.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The first step in opening BackerKit is to send surveys to 5% of backers from each pledge level (the 5% of backers to receive surveys is selected at random). BackerKit calls this step the Smoke Test. Once the surveys are sent, BackerKit collates data on the response rate, the proportion of support inquiries received, and the add-on purchase rate to let us know if the survey and pledge questions are working appropriately. Once we're sure all is well, surveys will be sent to all remaining backers. We expect this to happen no later than Tuesday, January 12th.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank You So Much for a Great Campaign! Plus, What Comes Next
updates.update_content:
Greetings, heroes—
Thank you so much for your support of Heroes of the Cypher System. We are thrilled to be making these books, along with the other great products that will make your Cypher System games (and ours!) better, faster, and more fun. We’re looking forward to sending you these rewards over the months to come, and we think you’ll be really happy with the results!

Greetings, hero!
This campaign ends in less than an hour, and we’re closing in on unlocking the XP Deck. It’s a real nail-biter. Will we make it? We have, in the past, unlocked goals literally in the final minutes of a campaign. It will take a stretch to make this one happen (that’s why they call them stretch goals!), but we’ve succeeded in similar stretches in the past!
Some Critical Things to Take Care Of

Greetings, heroes—
We’ve hit another stretch goal, and upgraded The Origin. We’re adding more pages, more art, more crunchy bits, and most importantly, more fantastic ideas and inspiration. Every backer who has The Origin among their rewards just got more of it, for free!

updates.update_userinfo: Some Good News for EU Backers
updates.update_content:
Greetings, heroes—
If you’re in the EU, we have some good news that we’re making official today. (I say “making official, because this has been in the works for months—since well before the Kickstarter launched—but we didn’t want to make an announcement until all the details were completely finalized.)
We ship our products, including Kickstarter rewards, to EU customers from our fulfillment site in the UK. With Brexit on the way, there’s been some uncertainty about how that will be handled. We may at some point open an EU shipping site, but for now we’ve been able to ensure that you will not pay any duties or import fees on your rewards that ship from the UK.

campaign.story:
Welcome ADVENTURER, to Eldritch: the Book of Madness!
Follow the campaign's progress by signing up to our mailing list - CLICK HERE!
 Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/entertheblackvault 
 Twitter: https://twitter.com/BlackVaultUK 
 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/entertheblackvault/ 
Designed by creators with thirty years’ experience in professional publishing, and created by the writers of the bestselling Lords of the Night: Vampires, Eldritch: The Book of Madness is a beautifully written 144 page hardcover tome featuring an all new mini setting for your 5e campaign. It’s filled with new monsters, spells, items, cults, dark magic, locations, and a horde of otherworldly adventure ideas for your players, all designed to be instantly added to any campaign. It features a shadow war between the worlds of light and the monstrous creatures of the Dark Place - the realm beyond the mirror -while still being decidedly D&D. With expanded rules for madness and corruption - it's designed to put the dread into your heroes - literally!
Eldritch: The Book of Madness
ELDRITCH CONTENTS
Here’s a summary of exactly what you are getting with Eldritch, and why it’s such great value for money. Not sure, check out the many previews in every update!
So far, Eldritch: The Book of Madness is a 144+ page hardcover featuring:
50 pages of monsters and their powers (all completely new - these creatures will shock and terrify your heroes - guaranteed - I've schemed for months to bring you the most terrifying abilities designed to give pause to the most seasoned adventurer). Also includes DMs tips on handling your otherworldly creatures and a host of other details on their existence (including the cults that worship them).
6 pages of fearsome Dread mechanics (designed to strike fear into your heroes - literally!)
20 pages of locations in the Grey Wastes – the demi-plane that sits beyond the Dark Mirror.
10 pages of new magic items including the Dread Staff and the fearsome Shadow Blades.
12 pages of new profane spells that use the heroes' fear against them!
6 pages of corrupt spells and cursed magical items, including cursed scrolls and trapped spells.
6 pages featuring four of the Dread Lords – creatures of incredible power that are able to manifest a tiny fraction of their power in the mortal realms.
18 pages featuring the many faces of evil (including some terrible cults hiding in plain sight). 
Just one of many creatures (this page is cut down to show an all round selection of its abilities)
What is Eldritch: The Book of Madness?
The Book of Madness is a high quality hardcover with 144 pages featuring a unique setting where the magic of the mortal realms is coveted by the minions of chaos from the realm beyond the Dark Place. They cannot enter this world - yet - but they can reach out tendrils of magic to ensnare the minds of the weak-willed and the corrupt! 
The first of five books, Eldritch has its fingers in the feel of HP Lovecraft's works, but it most certainly is NOT a clone of his works - oh no - this is 100% D&D. In Eldritch you will encounter a paranoid world where anyone could be in league with evil. The sinewy tendrils of wicked magic seep into the mortal realms from the Dark Place; its inhabitants seek to corrupt the minds of the living, with the goal of one day passing from one reality and into the worlds of light. Should the heroes discover what is going on under their noses, they have a choice: face the evil head on and risk being destroyed by its power, or walk away and do nothing knowing that a terrible shadow is gathering... 
Eldritch is a book about ancient evil powers, unfathomable magic, and entities with goals and desires beyond those even of the gods. Check out the  many updates for more information on what you can expect from this tome of shadows!
You can see from the previews (below) that there's nothing standard about this book!
An Assortment of Amazing Art from Eldritch: The Book of Madness
Key Selling Points
Gorgeous art - evocative of the madness-inducing mythology of an alien universe.
Beautifully written - the Book of Madness is filled with plot hooks and adventure ideas to stir the imagination.
New Dread rules - wrapped up in an ultra high fantasy D&D setting. These monsters will fit right in with any setting, from fantasy to sci-fi.
Monster tactics - gain an insight into how to use these monsters to take your players by surprise. They will never see it coming!  
Unique game mechanics - so secret we can't reveal them here, but they will fit seamlessly in with any game version allowing you to strike fear in to the hearts of your players!
PREVIEW: THE GREY WASTES
The Demi-Plane of Madness and Evil
PREVIEW: DREAD BLADES
Corrupt Magical Weapons (Work in Progress). Use with Supervision!
Preview: The Hounds of Veth  
The Hounds of the Ancient Ones (work in progress)
Some encounters may have serious repercussions! (work in progress)
These enemies aren't playing around!
Want the Book but Too Close to Christmas?
Pledge just £1 and then we'll open up the pledge manager in January through February 2021 to make it really easy for everyone to pick up a copy of the book.
Contents
Here is a work in progress of the book's contents. Check out some of those exciting chapters. There's a whole section dedicated to proper madness. Now it's not just a bunch of random rolls on a single table - I guarantee the possibilities will shatter your sanity!  
A Work in Progress Copy of the Book of Madness Index (may cause sanity loss)
 Preview of Eldritch: The Book of Madness 
On the fence?  You've already seen for yourself how beautifully written this book is. But there's more to come. There will be a preview every night of the week until Halloween itself! That's four more delicious pages filled with murderous monsters to tempt you! 
The Agolytes: Putting the Fear Back into Divination!
Part of a Series!
This is the first book in a quartet which aims to challenge your players in new and surprising (and often terrifying) ways. Nothing in this book is like anything you've seen before (we genuinely mean that - Stewie is a writer unlike any other when it comes to new and exciting ways to present gaming material). The next release, Aether: The Book of the Summoner has already been written and you'll see it in 2021.
Playtest!
One month after the campaign ends, we will release a playtest (text-only) version of the book. This is your chance to give feedback on the contents and to shape the direction of the book. We'll take all your feedback and we'll even reward those testers who submit proper testing reports (but more on that after the campaign).
STRETCH GOALS
I'll reveal the stretch goals as we get closer to them. They will increase the value of the book and make it even better value for money. You've already got the best possible paper with a lovely silk finish and cover, so all that's left is more quality writing and gorgeous art. 
£6000 - The Black Grimoire - six pages of gruesome dark magic
£7,500 - 16 NEW PAGES! Taking the book total to 112 pages (find out exactly what when we reach the Stretch Goal). 
£9,000- The City 6 - additional pages featuring the city of evil.
£11,000- Corruption - 6 additional pages featuring cursed items and deadly trapped spells.
£12,500- Everything expanded to *144* pages of dread and evil. 
Work in Progress. Do Not Look Directly At These Spells
 SOCIAL MEDIA
Like BlackVault on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/entertheblackvault 
Like BlackVault on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/entertheblackvault/ 
PLEDGE MANAGER
This campaign promoted by GameFound and there will be a pledge manager launching in January 2021.
SHIPPING
Physical rewards will be sent from the UK. Please check our restricted shipping locations (below). Shipping fees will be added after the campaign, during the pledge manager phase (January 2021). Below are a few shipping fee estimates - overseas prices may go down based on the number of copies we sell (more copies = lower shipping for everyone). Please note right now these shipping charges include the Covid-19 Temporary Carrier Air Charge, which may be removed in 2021. 
Your estimated shipping costs are:  
Estimated Shipping Charges Per Region
We are using GameFound for our post-Kickstarter management website. Through GameFound, you will be able to let us know of your delivery address, and also to add extra books and options to your pledge, depending on the remaining stock.
PDF: Your PDFs will be available on DriveThruRPG and on your GameFound account.
Restricted Shipping Locations
We will ship worldwide, but if you are shipping to one of the following locations you will be required to pay additional charges for signed and insured delivery. We anticipate these costs are approximately £10 over the standard fees listed in the Shipping information (above).
Who is BlackVault
Based in Yorkshire, UK, BlackVault Limited specialises in the creation of magical worlds. This is the first of many game books: Aether: The Book of the Summoner, The Book of Blood, and Chaos: the Broken Mirror- have already been written and will launch in 2021. 
Stewie Black
Starting out with a full-time career in journalism, Stewie's credits include: The Doctor Who RPG, the Scarred Lands setting, as well as working with Wizards of the Coast on 3rd Edition D&D, White Wolf Publishing, Cubicle 7, two novels, a self-help book. He lives in Scarborough with Zachary, his elderly Cavalier King Charles Spaniel.
Zachary fully approves this campaign!
Risks and Challenges
This may be our first Kickstarter as BlackVault, but it's perhaps our tenth physical book we've printed in the last 20 years and everyone involved in this project has delivered at least one previous Kickstarter. Eldritch: The Book of Madness has been written, it just needs peer-review and final editing.
By participating in this campaign, you will follow the uncertain process of designing, manufacturing and delivering a project. There are always risks that the schedule will change. For five years we have dedicated endless hours to creating these universes. But the risk remains. If you don't want to take this risk, don't participate in this Kickstarter campaign and wait for the public release in 2021.
We want to thank all the people and the community who have supported our project from the start.
Without you, we would be nothing. Thank you!

Hello friends
Today’s update is very brief, and a bit different from our typical posts. Right now we’re in the middle of a major sprint to wrap up the expansions’ comic books, which were added to this campaign via stretch goals. We’ve been having so much that we felt we needed to share a quick behind-the-scenes preview of how they’re made!

After the initial design, playtesting, and iteration process for the gameplay, art for the graphic portion of the scenario comic book is drafted using a combination of reference images and a written breakdown of the action.

Greetings Citizens of Megalopolis!
It’s been a bit since our last update, and we can’t thank everyone enough for all your patience while we’re busy bringing everything together behind the scenes. While we have manufacturing and production updates on the horizon, we couldn’t wait another minute to share some previews of what our artists and developers have been working on over the past few weeks. There is a lot to share, so let's jump right in!

Hey folks!
We hope this update finds you happy and healthy in these first few weeks of spring. Today’s update is brief; we just wanted to touch base and share some of the art coming in as we polish off the expansion content!

Hello friends!
We hope the first few months of 2021 have been treating you well, including plenty of time for games amongst the crazy winter weather! We have two important things to share today, so let’s jump right in.

updates.update_content:
Greetings heroes!
Today is the day! After extensive logistical coordination, the Freedom Five Pledge Manager is finally live!

Invites

Hello friends!
We hope this update finds you all happy, healthy, and riding out the final hours of 2020 with some games! As this year comes to a close, we’re reflecting on how fortunate we are to have a community as passionate and supportive as you folks by our side. 2020 has been a long and winding road for all of us, but as the newest pieces of Freedom Five come together, we’re feeling incredibly optimistic about what the future has in store!

Hey folks!
Hope everyone is staying safe and sane as we charge headfirst into the holiday season. Today's update is on the shorter side, but we wanted to touch base to let you know how immensely thankful we are for you all! 2020 has been a crazy year all around, and we are beyond grateful to be a part of this incredible community of gamers.
