campaign.story:
Before the Stroke of Midnight is a Gothic mystery adventure inspired by
Edgar Allan Poe for the world’s largest roleplaying game 5e.

You’ll get the following products:
➛ The adventure Before the Stroke of Midnight
➛ The Black Raven’s Compendium
➛ Specially designed character sheets with a Gothic theme
➛ Digital maps, tokens, and handouts for virtual tabletop gaming
➛ Bonus: You’ll get a special mention in the book!   
Before the Stroke of Midnight is a level 9 adventure, and includes scalable encounters so that the adventure can be played by all characters of level 1-20.
We’ve also included free VTT tokens, gridless maps, and digital handouts so that the adventure can be played online.

The Black Raven’s Compendium contains new monsters, magical items, spells, and more. It also includes unlocked stretch goals and will be available to all backers.
The book will be approximately 80 pages (if all stretch goals are unlocked) and available in hardcover, softcover, and digital format.

This adventure is created by Midnight Tower, the two nerds who brought you
What happened to Evy Ashwood? and Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy.

Join us on our epic journey!    
The Duchess Rose Blackraven of Shieldsborg Castle is dead.
However, her last will is missing, and it is unclear who will inherit from her.

You must find the will before midnight and identify the true heir to Shieldsborg Castle.
Search the old castle for clues, interview the secretive residents, and investigate the mysterious surrounding areas.

But be careful – more blood will be spilled, and a new murder will occur before midnight.  
➛Download the first part of the adventure Before the Stroke of Midnight.
(Spoiler alert! The PDF preview contains vital information about the adventure plot and is meant to be read by the DM only.)   
Viola Grey, one of the many ghosts that haunt Shieldsborg Castle.
➛ A classic mystery adventure inspired by Edgar Allan Poe!
➛ New monster: Dusk wolf
➛ Unique magical item: The Ring of Serpent’s Tongue
➛ Nine illustrated and detailed NPCs (including a ghost) with personal background descriptions, agendas, and secrets
➛ Legend & Lore: Shieldsborg Castle
➛ More than 40 original high-quality colour illustrations and artworks, including professional commissions from Alaina Milare (Empyrean Investigations and Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy)
➛ Approximately 80 pages of content in total (if all stretch goals are unlocked)
➛ High-quality maps created by cartographers like Dark Realm Maps and Lizard Ink Maps
➛ The Black Raven’s Compendium with all the unlocked stretch goals
➛ Bonus: You’ll get a special mention in the adventure!       
Dusk wolf, one of the new monsters in the book.
➛ You’ll get the adventure before it’s released anywhere else
➛ You save money, as all prices are heavily discounted
➛ You’ll be part of the community and get to be involved by voting for stretch goals, shape the compendium, join exciting contests, and get the first sneak peek of the project as it comes alive    
The adventure will include several hand-drawn and watercoloured maps by Dark Realm Maps and plenty of commissioned artwork.
This is our fourth Kickstarter campaign, and we’re really excited to share it with you! We’ve been working on this project day and night (mainly nights!), and we’ve playtested the adventure together with our group of gaming friends.

We now kindly ask for funding to cover production costs to make the adventure truly epic! Production costs include commissioned maps ($600), beautiful illustrations ($420), covers and artwork ($300), print design ($250), and professional proofreading ($75).

The more funding we get, the better the adventure and the compendium will be, and the more art commissions we’ll be able to afford – which in turn will support other fantasy artists! :)      
Pages from the book. The characters will encounter dusk wolves along a dangerously steep mountain road. (The picture is a digital montage.)
This project is fully funded and we’re now unlocking epic stretch goals!  :)   
We love local game shops and offer greatly discounted prices to brick-and-mortar stores. Midnight Tower’s roleplaying books are available at The Gaming Goat (USA), The Shop on the Borderlands (UK), Science Fiction Bokhandeln (Sweden), Dillbergs (Sweden), and others.

Click on the retailer pledge rewards to order 5 hardcover books of the adventure and the compendium. We can also offer additional discounts if you order more copies or would like to order previous titles released by Midnight Tower. Please contact us and we’ll see what we can do. :)

midnight-tower.com/join-the-tower/

➛ Help us spread the word about the campaign on social media! (Doing this guarantees a significant increase in natural 20 rolls the next time you play. True story!)

I've backed Midnight Tower’s Epic Kickstarter ‘Before the Stroke of Midnight’!
#dnd #dnd5e #kickstarter #gothic #mystery #rpg 
Tove is a highly introverted geek (level 6, lawful neutral). She writes the main part of the adventures and does a lot of art for Midnight Tower.

Erik is a bookish nerd (level 5, chaotic good). He does much of the graphic design and edits the adventures for Midnight Tower.

Tove and Erik live in Oxford together with their rebellious daughters and a small menagerie of pets, including two sarcastic cats, a tiny pseudodragon (leopard-gecko), and a springer spaniel with a lazy eye.

For this project, Midnight Tower is collaborating with the talented illustrator Alaina Milare, the amazing cartographer Toby Lancaster from Dark Realm Maps, and eagle-eyed proofreader Pauline Nolet.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Midnight Tower’s fourth Kickstarter campaign, and all of our previous campaigns have been successful thanks to our amazing backers! (Thank you!!!)
We’re collaborating with DriveThruRPG for the printed versions of the book. We’ve partnered with them before and are really happy with the results – the books are great!

We ran our previous Kickstarter campaign in March during the coronavirus pandemic, which resulted in a few delayed deliveries. However, we always add extra time in our schedule for unforeseen mishaps and managed to complete the project on time, even though one member of our team fractured her wrist in a very untimely way.

If we don’t reach the goal for this Kickstarter, all backers will get their money back. 
We’ll probably struggle to pay artists and editors with our own money, but that’s all right. (This is not a sob story! We’ll be fine and can still feed our rebellious kids and pets. :)

However, if the wonderful and kind people out there would like to support our Kickstarter campaign and we reach our goal, we promise to make the adventure even better! 
Backers can look forward to more content and commissioned fantasy artwork! 

Thank you for considering backing Midnight Tower’s Epic Kickstarter Campaign! 
:)

campaign.story:
Pincha en la imagen para la pagina web en castellano
Aboard a cruise ship, the lifeless body of a passenger has been found in their luxury suite…
The prime suspects are the occupants of the VIP cabins on the upper deck. They are the only ones who could have had access. You and your fellow private detectives are participating in a conference aboard the ship, and you all decide to make a bet to solve the murder. Who among you will prove to be the finest sleuth?
The story-based competitive crime investigation game Midnight Murder Mysteries takes you on an unpredictable voyage, in which you must try to reconstruct the circumstances of the alleged crime…
Who is the murderer? What was their motive? How did the victim die? These are the questions you will need to answer once the ship has docked… Or after another detective discloses what they have found! 
Common assumptions for all cases: the suspicious death occurred the day before, between 11:45 pm and midnight; the murderer acted alone and is always one of the occupants of the VIP cabins unless it was an accident or suicide.
In each case, you will be able to talk to 12 suspects who could be interrogated about three topics and 24 locations that are spread over several floors that could be explored. The cases are completely independent of one another. Even though they have identical first names in all of the cases, the suspects are never the same people. 
OUR FUNDING GOAL!
Please see cases details in the CASES section below.
NEXT STRETCH GOAL
Unlocking this stretch goal will add 1 case in the Green/Red booklets & 1 case in the Purple one.
CORE BOX
The board, with floor plans of the decks of the ship and the Ship Progression track
 ALL-IN BOX = Core box, plus:
Cases are the heart of Midnight Murder Mysteries! Each booklet contains several cases, which you don’t have to play in any particular order. Amateur cases contain fewer wrong paths than Expert cases and offer more ways to find important clues.
At the beginning of a booklet, you find the Case Presentation (which may include special rules), with a correlation table: each of the 60 possible paths you can follow has a number, which points to a specific Paragraph. 
In the middle of the booklet, the Paragraphs for all the cases, referenced by a number, are mixed, which means that the surrounding Paragraphs won’t be relevant to the case you are playing.
Plenty of cases!
You will get tons of cases from the start! But the 100% goal is only a first step: the more backers we get, the more cases will be added to the boxes! 
The Green & Red booklets: the 12 starting cases
Please note all cases are written and tested but most cases are not translated yet. 
The Purple booklet: the 8 starting cases
Please note all cases are written and tested but most cases are not translated yet.
The White booklet contains 5 cases and is an exclusive KS bonus for ALL backers! 
Fancy yourself a detective? Try out the game by playing 3 cases: K01 - The Billionaire Cruise; K02 - Pirates!; K03 - The Epidemic. 
Download the print and play version (zipped file)
These 3 cases need less material than the Standard ones: only 6 Suspects; no Purser; no Event deck for K01 & K02. Nevertheless, the plot is just as exciting as in other cases! You'll also need the rules. You'll find 4 files:
MMM-2DED_EN_PnP_Booklet-White-K1to3 (landscape format with 2 pages per sheet)
MMM-2DED_EN_PnP_NotebookSheets (you'll need one double-sided page per player)
MMM-2DED_EN_PnP_Board&Tokens
MMM-2DED_EN_PnP_BlueSetEventDeck (only required for playing K03)
DOWNLOAD THE RULES (pre-published PDF version)
Choose a case (Amateur level or Expert level) from one of the case booklets. Read its presentation out loud, and embark on a new mystery adventure…
At the beginning of each round, reveal a new Event card (some will cause the ship to advance on its track, others will add a bit of spice to the game) and place the purser in the zone designated by the number on the card.
Then, players will take turns investigating in clockwise order. On your turn, you have 3 action points to spend (Buoy tokens also give additional action points). You can use them to take the actions described below.
Investigation actions
Whether public or private, all investigations are automatically successful. To search/inspect a location and to interrogate a suspect, the detective must be in the same zone as the target. To interrogate a suspect, you must also choose one of the three possible conversational subjects and announce it to the other players:
 ALIBI (Where were you at the time of the murder?),
 WITNESS (Do you know something about the death, the victim, or the other suspects?),
 MOTIVE (What was your relationship with the victim?).
Then refer to the case booklet to read the paragraph (each of the possible paths you can follow has a number, which points to a specific Paragraph).
After spending your action points, you may move one suspect of your choice one or two zones for free. Put the Last Moved Suspect disc underneath the moved suspect, which indicates the next suspect to be moved this way has to be a different one.
End of the case and player conclusions
A case ends when the ship arrives at the port OR when a detective makes disclosures. In both cases, all players will share what they have deduced. After that, read the entire solution of the case out loud and then calculate the scores. The player with the highest total score wins the game! 
The most exciting parts of this game lie in discovering the story piece by piece and in trying to understand what happened. Ultimately, you’re aiming to avoid the wrong paths and be the best at gathering and interpreting the puzzle pieces presented by the story…

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
You are a crucial part of making Midnight Murder Mysteries a reality. It is your support that will ensure we can translate the remaining cases and launch production! It is quite a challenge, as neither the game nor the author and publisher are yet well-known in the English-speaking game community.

Except for France and Spain, we do not have yet a distribution network established. So the only guaranteed option to get your hands on Midnight Murder Mysteries is by backing this campaign.

In terms of development, rules and cases are 100% written and tested on a large panel of gamers. Rules have been improved since the First Edition (in French and Italian only). Illustrations and graphic design are completed. Except for the case booklets, whose translations in English and Spanish remain to be financed, the files are ready for manufacturing. Once the project is 100% funded, we will be able to complete the translations.

Since the very beginning (prototype in 2010!), Midnight Murder Mysteries was also intended to be published in English. It just required some time to sail in this direction. We're happy to work with GDM Games for the Spanish version as they have shown interest in this game since 2016.

Thank you very much for your interest and your help!

campaign.story:
The Hidden Listener
THE TRUTH:
This cosykiller series is based during World War 2 in England at a top secret war time POW interrogation centre known as Latimer House.  
At Churchill's orders, the estate underwent 2 million pounds worth of renovation at the start of the war to fit out the manor house out with secret listening devices which would enable the MI5 and 6 operatives to listen in on conversations between high ranking POWs .    
Many secrets discovered by the teams of secret listeners at Latimer house were integral to the war effort - and although many files have now been declassified, lurking in the basement of the property (which incidentally is now a stylish hotel) is a tunnel which is still sealed under the official secrets act and will not be opened for many more years.
THE FICTION:
This cosykiller series explores the fictional secrets contained within this tunnel at the very real wartime interrogation centre.  Discoveries are made as the National Archives slowly release information to the Inheritance hunting firm "Fairhall and Brett" who contact you as the last living descendant of a woman your family always thought had been killed during a V2 rocket attack in 1944...

Never played before?
This is our  fourth "season" of cosykiller - but the stories grow in complexity  annually as we learn what we can and can't do with paper and extras - we're moving offices this year because the cosykiller series have become so popular we need more space.  We're using this increase in space to buy a few more large machine gadgets that will enable us to really increase the hands-on nature of cosykiller this year...

For those who've played before you know each story contains a heady mix of puzzles and plot allowing players  to get really immersed in the story as each unfolds.  It's a unique mix  of choose your own adventure and cryptography and it's not for the  faint-heated.
Each series has included mementos and memorabilia from the time thanks to our various contacts in reproduction services and our  excellent design team.
If you've never played before, then you won't be disappointed with this year :-)

The Rewards?
We've tried to create tier points that enable you to back us even if you don't want to commit to a full story!  If you have never played cosykiller before and want to dip your toe into the water to see what a box might be like - then why not just pledge for our Christmas Murder Mystery Weekend Gift Box.  This will be a stand alone story with evidence and live action drama via zoom on a weekend in January.  Our last murder mystery virtual weekend contained puzzles similar to our cosykiller series... so if you can achieve those - then you'll know you can tackle the full year...

Our Early Bird Pledges have some unique offers, only available in limited quantities.  So grab those while you can!

Why are we seeking funding through Kickstarter?
Since we started Cosykiller in 2016 it's literally taken over our  office!  We are currently working within a cocoon of cardboard boxes,  sitting behind stacks of printing for the boxes, and with finished  subscriptions stacked up to the ceiling around us!

At the moment we can't actually FIT another story into our office, which means we are moving offices!  

As we hand pack each box it means we need space to lay out all the  pieces that fit inside each one.  Players this year have noticed the odd  mistake as we miss items, or add in duplicates, and this is purely  caused by space problems within the office as we're working without  space to swing a cat (probably just as well as I think the two dogs in  the office would eat any we did bring in to test swing-ability).

A fully funded Kickstarter will help towards the office expansion  plans, as we need more shelving, fit for purpose storage and just  generally MORE ROOM to grow!

This office move will also mean we'll have space for a laser cutter of our own, which we will be using to increase the complexity of our puzzles!  An overfunded kickstarter will make this vision a reality much sooner too!


Reviews for previous series:
Amazing and friendly company with a very immersive story line. Half  way  through the first season and have to say I’m addicted! I’m solving  this  with my mum and it’s a great way for us to spend quality time  together.  Can’t wait to see what the other seasons have in store! Thank  you cosykiller xx
-----
This is the ultimate mystery. There is so much information that you   receive over a year’s time. It’s fun to get completely immersed in the   story. There are lots of clues, but many of them are difficult to  figure  out and are a great challenge for your brain. The different  ciphers  used take just enough work that you get a real sense of  satisfaction  when you complete them. Overall, this has been a great  experience!
-----
I feel like I've been transported to 1930s India, and I'm only  working  through the journal in the first box! I cannot wait to see  what's next!  In addition to the game itself, the women who are Cosy  Killer have been  very welcoming and accommodating with all of my  questions! Way to go,  ladies! You all are fantastic!
----
I just got my first box and it is really cool. The journal came  burned,  it is so interesting. I wonder why, that is something I need to  figure  out. This is the best box ever!!!! If you like mystery, i  highly  recommend.
----
Cosy Killer is by far the best murder mystery subscription box. If  you  are looking for an engaging experience filled with authentic  characters,  a story with multiple interwoven plot lines, puzzles that  are  organically entwined within the narrative which serve to enhance  the  whole experience then this is it. The excellent skills of the  CosyKiller  team encourage an inevitable emotional investment in the  characters.  While you know that you are investigating the death and  whereabouts of  Marie, there is a point in Box 9 where you decode a  tricky artifact,  with every letter decoded my heart ached a little as I  could predict  what the next letter would be.
If you want an experience like  no other I have encountered, one that  will keep you puzzling and that  keeps you coming back for more - then  Cosy Killer is the only  subscription box out there.
Treat yourself - you won't regret it
----
Let's get the downside out of the way first -  CosyKiller is a  year-long subscription.  Telling one story over twelve  monthly boxes,  it's some commitment of money and time.
BUT!
What  it gives you back for that subscription is unsurpassed in terms  of  mystery subscription boxes.  There are no phone numbers to call  that  might end up disconnected after a few months, there are no  websites to  visit that might be taken offline at no notice, everything  you need is  there in the boxes.
And what boxes they  are - one month you might get a 128 page  diary/journal containing two  obvious ciphers and one very well hidden  one.  You might get twelve to  sixteen letters from one character to  another, including drawings and  birthday or christmas cards.  You might  get clay artifacts, or death  certificates, or shipping manifests, or  telegrams, or....
You  can read something in box 8 that reminds you of something in box  1 to  find an inconsistency in testimony that feeds into the final  solution -  you can find ciphers in early boxes that are made more  explicit later  on, but still solvable at that early stage.
The commitment is huge, but the project is major league, satisfying, intelligent, interesting and thoroughly recommended.
----
I am only three episodes in but the storyline is awesome and very   gripping. I didn’t want to stop reading! You get very authentic items   and they pay close attention to detail. Very impressed!

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter has now ended but if you missed out - or want more episodes - visit our website:  https://thedetectivesociety.com/
 Receive a package to your door! Our packages are delivered direct to you, filled with incredible puzzles and a deep, immersive world.
 Team up or play alone! You can play by yourself, with your partner, or with a group of friends or colleagues. Each of the packages should last around 90 minutes.
 Interact with the world! Contact the characters by email or message, stalk their social media accounts and scour the internet to help solve the puzzles.
 Become immersed in the story! Put yourself into the shoes of the detective to solve The Sudden Silence of Timothy Lee.
 Continue your journey! Each package follows on from the previous one, presenting you with new challenges and exciting plot twists.

Physical Items
At the heart of each episode is the package that will be delivered through your door. Inside you will find a range of different items, which you will need to solve the case.
Interactive Technology
To create a truly modern detective experience, all members of the Society will need to examine digital sources as well as the physical ones in the package.
Our bespoke communication systems allow players to converse with characters via email and SMS/Whatsapp.
Our detailed and immersive websites create complex online worlds for detectives to explore as they search for answers.
Exhaustive Clue System
Even the best detectives can require a little help. That's why we created an innovative and exhaustive clue system for Season One, to enable detectives to get a little assistance should they require it.
Our master detective Lucid Montgomery takes a look over every case that comes through our door and is kind enough to write down a few prompts for each part of each episode in case a detective is in need of assistance.

Welcoming Community
We have already collected together an incredible bunch of detectives from Season One on our dedicated Facebook and Reddit groups.
These amazing detectives discuss and share their findings, assisting each other when they get stuck and pointing out hidden tidbits that some might have missed (while flagging spoilers, of course).
We know some detectives like to work alone, but for those that don't, you will find the community a welcoming place for you to discuss the cases.
Christmas is coming and you might want to give a loved one the gift of detecting this holiday season.
To make this easier, we will be giving backers the option to be emailed a gift voucher code, that they can pass on to the recipient at Christmas (or for their birthday or for any other event worthy of a present). The recipient can then redeem this code via our website to receive the packages at the same time as everyone else.
This option will be provided when we send out our backer survey once the campaign ends, meaning you will receive these vouchers in time for Christmas.
Add-ons are a new feature being trialled by Kickstarter and mean that we don’t need to utilize a pledge management system.
Backers can also select to receive Season One (either the first episode or all six episodes) as an add-on when they pledge to receive any of our rewards. The Season One add-ons are available at discounted rates as a thank you to all our Season Two backers.
Season One add-ons will be shipped in January 2021, alongside Episode One of Season Two.
You can also use the add-on feature to purchase additional copies of Season Two (Episode One or all six episodes).
As a Company, we're committed to producing Season Two - no matter what! And we'd like to thank everyone who has supported us so far for allowing that to happen. 
So what made us decide to launch Season Two on Kickstarter?
By pre-selling on Kickstarter, we then know how ambitious we can be with our plans for Season Two. The huge support we received for Season One, meant we could do so much more than we originally planned.
Every copy of Season Two that's purchased on Kickstarter contributes to extra design features, video work, voiceovers, interactive elements, digital content and physical box contents. Simply put, the more you support us the more we'll be able to do.
We're a super small company, but we have big ideas and your support makes them a reality.
We are pleased to say that we ship worldwide! You can view the shipping costs in the table below:
All shipping to the United Kingdom is included in the price, as that's where we manufacture and ship our packages from - we have also reduced the normal international shipping costs to take into account that shipping is included for UK customers.
We take all precautions to ensure that customers outside of the UK pay no customs or import fees - including attaching CN22 forms - although we cannot guarantee your parcel will not be held at customs or have additional fees applied. However, to date, we are unaware of any of packages we have shipped internationally having additional fees applied to them.
If you have had board games sent to you in the past from the UK without issues, then there is a good chance the same will happen with The Detective Society's games.
The season is made up of six episodes and if you buy the whole season you will receive one a month. We'll ship each of the episodes to all players simultaneously. This will help avoid any spoilers, whilst also giving all players the chance, if they wish, to experience each episode at the same time as every other player, making it an exciting 'live' event.
How will this work with your Kickstarter pledge?
If you pledge for “First Package” then you will receive your first box at the same time as everybody else, when Season Two goes live (January 2021). You can then choose to buy the rest of the season, either via a subscription or by buying the packages individually when they are released.
If you pledge for “All Six Packages” then you are purchasing the whole of the season - you will receive one episode every month. The story will run alongside your life for the entire six months!
Who can play the game?
The game can be played solo, with a partner, or with a group of friends or colleagues and is recommended for players aged over 14 years, due to the peril the characters find themselves faced with.
When will we deliver?
Episode One will be produced and shipped in late January 2021, with the subsequent five episodes being shipped monthly from then on.
It's always been important to us that we deliver what we promise on schedule, and we have achieved that with Season One. 
All our processes and supply chains have been established from the production of Season One and that will continue seamlessly as we move into the production of Season Two. 
Season Two is being designed by the same people that brought you Season One - Joe Mills and Tristan Rogers - while Dan Wiseman is in charge of the business operations.
Before creating The Detective Society, Joe was instrumental in the success of some of the best escape games that London has to offer. His journey began with Time Run, ('fifth best escape room company in the world' in 2018); before moving onto Sherlock: The Game Is Now - the official BBC TV series tie-in. He also created and launched one of Design My Night's top picks for a night out in London: the immersive puzzle-based cocktail experience, The Case of the Poisoned Chalice. Joe takes the lead when it comes to creating all the puzzles. 
Tristan is a game designer, actor and award-winning writer. He's worked in some of London's top theatres and has written on numerous programmes for BBC Radio. He’s worked with Joe designing puzzles at various escape games, most recently penning the plot for The Case of The Poisoned Chalice. Tristan is in charge of overseeing the narrative of the cases.
Dan is our managing director and brings his vast business and marketing experience to the team. For over 10 years he has been building and operating successful businesses, including a digital marketing agency. He is connected to the Detective Society through a mutual love of all things gaming-related, evidenced by his constant stream of RPG game ideas. Dan made his first RPG when he was just 13 years old. Dan ensures that we deliver on our promises.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project, there are of course various risks and challenges involved - problems with design, procurement and shipping can all occur. However, our extensive work creating Season One means we have lots of experience to draw on. We have already built relationships with our key suppliers, and we are now very well versed in the processes required to release one episode a month. Our budgets are thorough, and we have built in significant contingency to deal with those issues we cannot foresee.

Of course there are two factors that are outside of our control. Firstly, Covid-19 continues to spread across the world, and its existence has underpinned the lifespan of our young company. As we have existed with it for so long, we are confident we can deal with what the current situation throws at us. We are in regular contact with our suppliers, all of whom continue to operate as normal. Initially it impacted on the delivery timescales of our suppliers, but - at present - those have returned to their normal estimated delivery times. However, should this crisis deepen further, and cause major disruption to these supply and distribution networks (both here in the UK and worldwide), then this may impact our ability to deliver according to our planned schedule. Secondly, it remains unclear what trading agreement, if any, will be reached between Britain and the EU. While we believe that regardless of the outcome we should be able to continue to ship our packages to the EU and beyond without any customs issues, the nature of these negotiations means that things could change suddenly and unexpectedly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Something else
We manufacture in the UK, which is also where the vast majority of our suppliers are based, reducing our carbon footprint.

campaign.story:
Face the threat of the supernatural as a traitor with a chance of redemption in the service of Queen Elizabeth I, in an alternately historical tabletop RPG from the creator of The Cthulhu Hack.
When Elizabeth Tudor succeeded to the throne in 1558, she found herself under assault from all sides, paying for her father's arrogant machinations, and the weakened barrier between worlds his split with Rome had caused.
As magic and creatures of the supernatural proliferate throughout the land, the Queen passed an Act Against Conjurations, Enchantments and Witchcrafts, making the punishment for acts of magic more severe than others, but in many cases drawing the line before a death sentence. In 1564, John Dee and Francis Walsingham convinced the Queen to pass an amendment to the Act — The Dee Sanction — permitting the practice of magic in defence of the realm.
You are an Agent of Dee; not out of choice, but out of some twisted sense of self-preservation. Somewhere between conscription and penance, you work for Walsingham and Dee to make amends, with a faint hope that you can use your talents to earn your pardon and absolution.
You can see the light at the end of the tunnel. If only you can outrun the shadows of your past and the horrors of the present…
This is The Dee Sanction.
The Dee Sanction is a tabletop roleplaying game about serving Queen and country in the late Tudor period, in a time where kingdoms vie for power, the Church splinters under the pressure of reform, and creatures of folklore emerge from enforced hiding seeking revenge against those who imprisoned them.
You're a bad person — sentenced to hang for dabbling in magic — given a chance to redeem yourself and earn freedom in service to Queen Elizabeth's newest line of defence. 
Like The Cthulhu Hack, the system focuses on simple mechanics. A player rolls against one of three Resources — measured by a dice value for Physical, Intellectual and Supernatural — and hope to avoid a result of 1 or 2. The agent always succeeds in broad terms, but with a result of 1 or 2, they fail forward.
That means even a bad roll won't stop progress; it just means things might get a bit harder. That's the core of it, the philosophy that even in failure, the story should always be moving forward, even if it might tilt toward potential disaster in the process!
The campaign will fund a 60-page black-and-white illustrated compact book (A5, 148 x 210mm/5.8 x 8.3 inches), 95% written at the time the Kickstarter starts and tested over several years. You can find out more about the background and development of the game at The Dee Sanction blog — which will continue to expand and support the game.
The Character Sheet and the Core Book
Two-page spread from the current edit of the Core Book
Recorded as part of Virtually Expo in August 2020, three fearless agents head into the unknown — south of Krakow, April 1585 — on the trail of a missing relic at the strange mercy of a blessed eyelash...
Both an interview and an actual play (starting at 32m 46s) as part of podcast Orlanth Rex's Gaming Vexes. We chat around the genesis and development of the game, before setting out to Deptford, 1593, in pursuit of a volume from Dee's lost library, The Book of Dead Names.
Orlanth Rex's Gaming Vexes — Episode 8 
And finally, an interview with Paul Mclean, of Yog-sothoth.com, was kind enough to interview me in January 2020 about the development, back story and future release of The Dee Sanction. Paul has kindly allowed me to host the interview, previously only available to Patrons via Patreon.
The core of the Kickstarter is the book, available in PDF (the Page), softcover (the Gentlefolk) and a cloth-bound hardcover version with a foil-blocked sigil of the Black Seal on the front (the Courtier).
All pledge levels with a physical book will also include a PDF, fulfilled through our web store at All Rolled Up.
In addition to the basic levels of book, both the Agent of Dee and the Favoured of the Queen pledge levels offer Kickstarter Exclusive rewards in the form of an All Rolled Up game roll. 
The All Rolled Up game roll is a versatile, compact hobby wrap, that's way more than a dice bag; it can hold more than 100 polyhedral dice, plus up to 10 pens and pencils, as well as index cards or a small notepad.
These hand-crafted Kickstarter Exclusives feature special design features:
the Agent with closure strap complete with a metal buckle;
the Favoured with a crimson cord tie tipped with charms, representing elements of Elizabeth's elaborate outfit. The accessories and material of the game roll accentuate and mimic the Queen's dress design (see Update #22 for more pictures).
Softcover and Hardback covers (to be finalised)
Work-in-progress printed fabric badge motif for All Rolled Up
Charms adorning the ends of the cord tie on the I, Elizabeth ARU
After the Kickstarter concludes, and the book is finalised, all physical rewards will ship. PDF copies will be available as soon as the book is completed. The PDF and softcover will be available on an ongoing basis through All Rolled Up. 
The hardcover book is a Kickstarter exclusive, printed in limited numbers on a short run. Any not sold through the Kickstarter will be available through the All Rolled Up web store.
The campaign's core goal aims to bring The Dee Sanction to print with the artwork it deserves. Mindful that the book is almost complete, we're keeping any stretch goals simple — focusing mostly on enhancements and digital extras.
The book stands at 60-pages, illustrated with black-and-white full and half plate illustrations by Evlyn Moreau. The £3,000 base Goal will fulfil the print run and pay for existing artwork.
If we achieve stretch goals, we'll add more art, more content and enhance the range of initial digital material available to support the game.
Additional PDF adventures and accessories will not delay the release of the physical content.
Beyond the base Goal of £3,000, stretch goals will add:
 More Art (£4,000 — UNLOCKED) - We will add two additional full-page commission pieces by the talented Evlyn Moreau to the Core Book. This brings us to 62-pages.
 PDF Adventures #1 through 4 (ALL — UNLOCKED) - Over the course of playtesting the game, many adventures have been run, taking the Dee Sanction from the heart of the Ossulstone Hundred in the shadow of the Tower to the foothills of the Carpathian Mountains in the wilds of eastern Europe.
 Longer Bestiary (£6,000 — UNLOCKED) - The Core Book contains a two-page bestiary. At this stage, we will expand that count to four-pages in total. This brings us to 64-pages.
 Tudor Mini Guild (£8,000 — UNLOCKED) - We will commission Evlyn to create twenty mini character portraits in the style of her Fabulous Mini Guild. All backers of virtual or physical product will receive a copy of the PDF version to print out or use online as tokens.
 Ossulstone Map (£10,000 — UNLOCKED) - First glimpsed at Dragonmeet in 2019, the part of London at the heart of many Dee Sanction investigations is that which lies in the shadow of the Tower of London. A work-in-progress, at this level, all backers of virtual or physical product will receive a copy of the PDF version to print out or use online.
 Sanction Journal (£11,000 — UNLOCKED) - The Dee Sanction encourages a play style that weaves tales across different dates, places and characters. Rather than restrict character information to just a sheet, a Sanction Journal - also known as a Book of Days - provides copies of the character sheet interspersed with a mix of gridded, lined, and dotted paper. All backers of virtual or physical product will receive a copy of the PDF version to print and use.
 More Art (£14,000 — UNLOCKED) - As we've extended the bestiary, it's appropriate to add some creature images to the section. We will add two additional full pages to the book to include additional commissioned pieces by the talented Evlyn Moreau. This brings us to 66-pages.
 More Tables (£16,000 — UNLOCKED) - The character generation system includes tables for generating occupation, association, focus and favours. We will add two tables, providing additional occupations and humours, which defines a possible quirk for your character (like the pre-generated characters used in the Actual Plays). This brings us to 68-pages.
 Wipe Character Cards (£18,000 — UNLOCKED) - When we worked on The Cthulhu Hack we found that the option to have a dry wipe character card made sense for one-shots; an easy way to create and erase characters. We propose to create A5 dry wipe character cards (148 × 210 mm or 5.8 × 8.3 inches) for The Dee Sanction and include two cards with each physical reward level. Also, we will add the option to buy a pack of 10 as an Add On.
 PDF Adventure #5 (£20,000 — UNLOCKED) - What's a wooden rammar and how did John Dee hurt his left shin on the sharp small end of it at four o'clock in the afternoon today (or possibly tomorrow – he isn't certain) in 1592? If we hit £20,000, I'll write an adventure that explains (or at least considers) Dee's shin injury.
 Mystery Final Stretch Goal (£30,000) - Dee's interminable quest, persevering in contempt of all reason, always pushed him onward. Who knows what esoteric wonders might await should such lofty heights be attained?
Southwark and The Dee Sanction

campaign.story:
In 2014, Magpie Games launched a Kickstarter for Urban Shadows, an ENnie award-winning tabletop roleplaying game of political urban fantasy that quickly became one of our flagship titles. For years, fans have praised both the game’s effortless explanation of the Powered by the Apocalypse engine and the groundbreaking content on race and urban communities, leading Urban Shadows to be a favorite of urban fantasy gamers, podcasters, and streamers alike.
Now—more than six years later—we are returning to the dark streets of the city for Urban Shadows: Second Edition, updating the game’s rules, look, and tools to better support moving stories of political urban fantasy. Featuring new playbooks, new faction mechanics, and completely revised materials from first edition, Urban Shadows 2E will thrust you into the danger and drama of the city like never before!
Urban Shadows is a political urban fantasy tabletop roleplaying game in which mortals and supernaturals alike vie for power in a modern-day city. Vampires, faeries, hunters, wizards, and more clash in the shadows...or make backroom deals for their piece of the streets and skyscrapers. No one is ever safe, and everything is always at stake.
In Urban Shadows, you play unique and powerful archetypes, protagonists who are attuned to the supernatural world. While the mortal world remains ignorant of the struggles of the city’s supernatural denizens, you are caught in the middle of the physical conflicts and political drama of the city’s past, present, and future.
You might be a spectre bound to an artifact, unable to move on until you’ve resolved your trauma. Or you might be a clever vampire who controls the best blood supply in the city, caught up in a war between your kind and those who hunt you. Or you might be a veteran of your city’s ancient conflicts, someone who got out of the game but keeps getting drawn back in by friends and allies.
No matter who you are, you contain within you the power to shape the city’s destiny. What future will you choose? And what will your victories cost you?
Urban Shadows is based on the Powered by the Apocalypse system used by tabletop RPGs like Apocalypse World, Dungeon World, and many of Magpie Games’s own titles such as Masks: A New Generation, Root: The RPG, and Zombie World. The game uses the core framework of that system to provide a strong, simple way to create your own stories of political urban fantasy. You’ll create a character using one of several archetypes, and then you’ll take action, rolling two six-sided dice to resolve the outcomes of dangerous and difficult situations.
Urban Shadows creates stories like those you’d find in Constantine, Diableros, The Dresden Files, The John Wick franchise, The Last Witchhunter, Lost Girl, and The Wire. 
In Urban Shadows, the city is a living, breathing character all its own. It hides dark desires, wicked deeds, and devious schemes, its shadowy tendrils a danger to mortals and supernaturals alike. Some residents have sacred sanctums or secure workshops—places to weather the storms of the city—but a sprawling metropolis lies just outside those little nooks, caring little if you prosper…or bleed out in the gutters.
But nobody faces the city alone. Even the humblest of imps has a small community, a circle of those who can offer solace in the face of problems and danger. But community is a double-edged sword—demanding as much as it gives—and the needs and desires of those same circles constantly shape and reshape the vibrant urban landscape of the city. Nothing lasts forever, but the city turns over nearly every night, different forces laying different claims to you and yours.
The city hungers. Will you sate its gnawing desires? Or will your enemies make you the feast?
The schemes and plots of supernatural beings have been a part of the city for as long as anyone can remember. The faces at the top may shift and change with the tides of fortune, but rarely does something occur in the mortal world without some push from those who lurk in the shadows. A new subway system? A contested election? A bank robbery? Nothing is what it seems.
But what is mere money or prestige to wizards, ghosts, and faeries? Who cares about cash or elections when trafficking in human souls or exploring other dimensions? The supernatural forces of the city—and the mortals who deal with them—know only one real currency: debt.
Debt is the power to influence those who owe you, the chits you call in to get things done, the ties that bind you to the rest of the city, and the proof that your word is strong and your bonds unbreakable. There are few true friends in the city, but your debtors always want to see you survive—you can’t pay up if you’re dead.
But there are other ways to triumph in the city beyond the economy of favors and patronage. Cruel rituals. Dark secrets. The temptations of the monster within you. Those who seek power at any cost will find no end to the magics and mysteries available for the merest price of a soul.
The streets bleed shadows—your debtors always around the corner—as the city threatens to swallow you whole. Will you die a hero… or live long enough to become the villain? Will you fight the darkness…or beg for power? The choice is yours.
Over the past five years, Magpie Games has developed and created multiple games that broke boundaries and redefined what PbtA can do. Now, we think it’s time to apply the lessons we’ve learned to Urban Shadows, making a game that’s tighter and easier to run, but also filled with new ideas and improvements, including new tools for players and GMs. We’re also excited to create a beautiful new book with visionary art and fantastic graphic design. In short… we’re making Urban Shadows 2E because we’re thrilled to revisit and refine our work!
Here’s a quick list of the major changes, many of which are already available in the quickstart:
revised basic moves, including new versions of turn to violence and let it out 
revised playbooks, including rebuilt versions of The Hunter and The Oracle 
two brand new playbooks: The Sworn (Power) and The Imp (Wild) 
changing Factions to Circles—see below—and adding Circle Status to represent standing
a new downtime phase of the game focused on player-facing city moves and rumors
replacing Storms with a new MC-facing faction turn, including new faction moves
expanded MC tools for generating your city and Circles at the start of play
We’re also adding a new mechanic to bring PCs into contact more often with each other: City Hubs. Cities are enormous spaces, and we found (in US1E) player characters could sometimes retreat to their different corners of the cityscape, interacting only with their own worlds and not with each other. With City Hubs, we want to create smaller, expandable environments to focus play and create drama. These Hubs—described below—position characters in neighborhoods, institutions, and community spaces in which they interact more frequently and avoid sessions in which PCs rarely come into contact and conflict.
Download the quickstart for a chance to test out some of these new features! We’ll be previewing more of them during the campaign, and we’re excited to get your feedback and refine Urban Shadows even more. Thank you to everyone who has given us feedback on 1st Edition since 2015!
 In Urban Shadows, your characters juggle relationships and obligations, seeking allies and opportunities, cashing in debts along the way to get things done. When you seize the day, you reshape the city in your image and unleash your powers on those who stand against you; when your enemies move and hunt, you do your best to stay ahead of the oncoming storm.
Urban Shadows uses the Powered by the Apocalypse framework to resolve interesting moments of uncertainty through moves, bits of mechanics that say: “When you do [x], [y] happens.” Each move trigger—the “When you do [x]” part—is designed to help point at moments of uncertainty, when neither the players nor the GM know exactly what happens next. Some examples of such moments include:
When you throw a punch at a loudmouthed werewolf in a demonic club
When you plead with the wizard’s council to return a tome of magic stolen from you
When you try to escape the evil ritual you stumbled onto in the city’s sewers
When you ask one of your companions to forgive the debt your fae lover owes them
When you trigger a move—when you perform the action described in the move’s trigger—then the rest of the move kicks into effect, often requiring a die roll. You roll 2d6 (two six-sided dice) and add in one of your stats to find out what happens.
Every playbook has four stats: 
 Blood is the measure of your fight or flight instincts. It tells us how tough, dangerous, coiled, and quick to act your character is in a perilous situation.
 Heart is the sum of your passion, charm, and charisma. It tells us how proficient your character is at getting what they want through negotiation and persuasion.
 Mind is a reflection of your critical thinking and analysis. It tells us how perceptive your character can be and how good they are at manipulating others through deceit.
 Spirit is a gauge of your connection to the “other” and your force of will. It tells us how focused your character is under pressure and what kind of power they can unleash.
Each stat is ranked from -3 to +3. You add your stat to some rolls when you trigger certain moves. For example, when you turn to violence, you roll 2d6 + Blood.
On most moves, if you get a 10 or higher (10+), things go your way! If you get a 7-9, you get what you were after, but usually with some cost or complication. If you get a 6 or lower, that’s called a miss, and the GM gets to tell you what happens next as things spiral out of control. 
Urban Shadows has basic moves for all the usual conflicts in urban fantasy—fighting, lying, escaping, magic, and more—along with special moves for managing debts and your relationships with communities at large.  
The city is a fierce cesspool of politics and corruption, but there are clear connections and boundaries between like-minded residents, spheres of influence that make up the scope of politics within the city. Most call these divisions Circles, loose political groupings that illustrate the differing affiliations and loyalties in the world, each one a community with its own internal politics and dramas. The Circles are:
In addition to the main stats, each character also has ratings (from -3 to +3) for their Circles, measures of how well the character understands each specific community. A character with a high rating in a Circle has contacts and connections within it, and can easily interpret its political information; a character with a low rating in a Circle doesn’t understand how that Circle works or who the power players are within that community.
Circles aren’t organizations or formal alliances; they are more like broad communities or subcultures. The disagreement between two members of the same Circle may be as—or more—intense than any conflict between two differing spheres. A werewolf and a vampire both hail from Night, but that doesn’t mean they get along. It only means they understand each other...and the violence inherent in the language of their streets.
Yet there are factions within each Circle capable of acting in unison, alliances who can shape the city’s future—werewolf packs, witch covens, faerie courts, and more. In Urban Shadows: Second Edition, we’re giving GMs new tools to support those factions in a “faction turn” between sessions. We’re also giving players new tools to get stuff done in downtime, acting on the rumors they heard about what the factions have done in the past week or two of offscreen activity, all fueling the drama of the city and the power players have to shape the setting.
Urban Shadows uses archetypes (The Wolf, The Wizard, The Oracle, etc.) to help players create characters quickly and easily. These archetypes are only ever a starting point; you can always bring in different myths, legends, and ideas to make your character entirely your own.
Characters often acquire abilities and powers from other archetypes and may even change archetypes over the course of play. As your character advances, you may also find reasons to retire to safety, securing that character’s place in the city as you create a new character to continue your group's story.  
Absolute power...corrupts absolutely. Urban Shadows features a dynamic corruption mechanic, tracking your character's descent into darkness. When you take a life, give in to your monstrous nature, or cross a line you shouldn't cross, you mark corruption. As you gain corruption, you unlock new and potent powers, allowing your character to get what they want—at the cost of further corruption. The dark side of your nature bears productive fruit.
Power is never free, though. Cross the line too often and you lose your character to the darkness, handing them over to the GM for them to play as a threat. Corruption is a downward spiral threatening to push you over the edge, and not everyone is cut out to make it back from the brink. As your character gains new abilities fueled by the growing darkness within, you face a difficult choice: will you give up what you've gained to save yourself? 
Corruption also encourages you to play to your archetype. Each archetype contains unique boundaries and taboos that define when you mark corruption. Life is always sacred, but werewolves, mages, and faeries all face unique temptations while stalking the city's streets.
Cities are giant, complex networks of interconnected communities caught in an almost constant state of change. In order to focus your characters’ conflicts and provide reasons for the players to consistently play together across those spaces, Urban Shadows 2E uses City Hubs—dynamic sections of urban life that frame the story you’re telling together without cutting you off from the rest of the city’s potential.
A City Hub isn’t just a physical district or area of your city. Instead, each Hub is a collection of institutions, relationships, and anchors—important NPCs—that create a background for the action in your story. Even better, Hubs can be added over the length of a campaign, expanding the city with new locations, conflicts, and NPCs as your story progresses. 
Urban Shadows 2E features four City Hubs, each dominated by one of the four Circles:
City Hall (Mortalis)
Downtown (Night)
The University (Power)
The Arts District (Wild)
Perhaps your Tainted is a student at the local university, the same campus that lies within the Wolf’s territory...and the same institution at which the Wizard recently started working as a professor. Or maybe your Oracle has an occult bookstore downtown in the same office building in which the Sworn is regularly summoned to meet with the wizard’s council, just down the street from the family restaurant in which the Aware still waits tables.
Hubs are also a flexible tool for structuring your campaign as a whole. You can use two different Hubs set in the same city for different campaigns, you can grab elements from any Hub to use as inspiration for your campaign, or you can expand your campaign to include new Hubs as your city grows. We’ll release new Hubs through this campaign as stretch goals and as digital supplements after the Kickstarter.
People have been playing Urban Shadows since 2013, and we love the stories they’ve told during that time. Check out what some of these fans and designers have to say about one of their favorite games:
FIRST EDITION

And many more…

campaign.story:
Welcome to Themeborne’s fourth Kickstarter campaign: Expand the Universe!
Whether you're a returning backer or just discovering the Escape the Dark™  series for the first time, this campaign is for you.
If you already own a copy of Escape the Dark Sector you can skip ahead to the What's New? section below, and don't forget to check the Add-ons section too.
Newcomers, a warm welcome to the community of Escape the Dark players. Allow us to run you through the story so far...
The Game of Deep Space Adventure
The second game in the Escape the Dark series, Escape the Dark Sector is a simple, sci-fi adventure game for 1 to 4 players with a focus on atmosphere, storytelling and player cooperation. It takes just a few minutes to set up, lasts around 45 minutes, and each mission is randomly generated so no two games are ever the same.
Playing as the beleaguered crew of an impounded starship, players find themselves confined to the detention block of a vast space station. Using a variety of advanced gear and weaponry, they will embark on a desperate mission to find their ship and blast their way home.
Along the way, the crew will have to overcome a variety of dangers, traps, and terrors. From cyborg guards and faulty replicators to killer alien organisms, with each challenge represented by a large, lavishly illustrated chapter card.
As these immersive chapter cards are revealed one by one, the game takes on the form of a shared storybook experience, with the players making decisions about what to do each chapter before using a combination of tactical dice combat and timely use of item cards to complete them.
The goal of the game is to recover your starship by completing every chapter in the mission deck and defeating the final boss. To win, you must keep each member of the crew alive - if any player is killed the game ends immediately.

After the initial campaign in 2019, we made the Escape the Dark Sector core game along with playmats, books, and an original soundtrack. 
Now we're back with four new expansions to expand and deepen your adventures in deep space:

 MISSION PACK 1: TWISTED TECH 
Discover the bizarre and disturbing technology of the far future, where sinister intentions and limitless possibilities collide...
Design, title and contents still in testing and subject to small changes
Contains: 
 1 New Boss: Face-off against an evil uber-genius obsessed with neural implants
 12 New Chapters: Four per act, exploring the stations tech-skewed terrors
 10 New Items: Including deadly new weaponry and powerful new cybernetics
 7 New Dice: Special new Ammo Dice to accompany the enhanced firepower on offer, plus a 'Tech die' - used to determine the effects of certain chapters and items, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle
 New Mechanics: Tactical Drone Selection! During setup, choose which drone your crew will take on the mission. The 'Activate Drone' action now includes a choice of drone ability to trigger, and is no longer limited to merely healing...
Mission Pack 2: Mutant Syndrome
Exposed to cosmic radiation and mysterious alien substances, the bodies of many station denizens have begun to gruesomely distort - as have your own...
Design, title and contents still in testing and subject to small changes
Contains: 
 1 New Boss: Encounter an advanced and powerful alpha-mutant
 12 New Chapters : Four per act, plagued by horrific mutant adversaries
 3 New Crewmembers: Loyal alien specialists eager to join the mission
 8 New Item Cards: Gruesome crew-mutations, and powerful new cybernetics
 4 New Dice: Three new crew dice, plus a 'Mutation die' used to determine the effects of certain chapters and items, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle
 New Mechanic: Mutations! Crewmembers can now fall prey to mutations during the mission, warping their bodies and bringing about both negative and positive effects...
Mission Pack 3: Quantum Rift
The very fabric of what you consider real is shattered as you hurtle through time and space - coming face to face with legendary dangers of the distant past...
Design, title and contents still in testing and subject to small changes
Contains: 
 1 New Boss: Battle a creature who wields time itself as a weapon
 12 New Chapters: Four per act, including dangerous historical settings
 3 New Crewmembers: Versatile alien friendlies, keen to do take up the fight
 8 New Item Cards: Quest Items, a new type of item card found only in specific time-travel chapters
 4 New Dice: Three crew dice, plus a 'Time die' - used to determine the effects of certain chapters and item cards, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle
 New Mechanic: Time Travel! With every turn of a chapter card, hold your breath as you risk plummeting through a rift in time, coming face to face with deadly threats from the distant past...
The Collector's Box
Design, title and contents still in testing and subject to small changes
Contains:
4 New Bosses: An array of powerful new foes, each unique and devious
3 New Start Cards: Each offering a choice about how to begin your mission
1 Mech Suit: A powerful, full-body contraption comprising 4 slot's worth of interlocking item cards. This awesome rig grants the wearer immense armour and firepower for a limited time, and at the expense of mobility and tactical flexibility 
2 New Starting Weapons: Alien sidearms with variable-ammo functionality 
4 Ammo Dice: To ensure you have enough on hand for the full arsenal the game offers 
4 Health Trackers with Cubes: A reusable alternative to the medical record pads
1 Dice Bag: Store all the game’s beautiful dice and tokens in one satisfying pouch
1 “Acting Captain” Card: Used to help keep track of who is leading the crew into each chapter
Important note: The contents of this product will be improved by stretch goals. See the Stretch Goals section below
Mock up of the entire Escape the Dark Sector collection in place. Final design may differ.
With it’s sturdy, matt black box and minimal spot UV detailing, the imposing exterior of the Collector’s Box hides an elegant organiser within. Now you can store every item in your Escape the Dark Sector collection in one box with ease.
The custom insert features slots to perfectly divide your cards by type, sleeved or unsleeved. Not only is this immensely satisfying, it also cuts down on card handling time during setup - just slide out the desired group of cards when called for (Act 1, Act 2, Act 3, Crew Members, Bosses etc) and your game can be set up and packed away in moments.
The larger cavities are moulded to securely hold all your playmats, rulebooks, scorepads, pencils, dice etc - and as you can see the full set of 4 crew playmats combine to create a pleasing image of the station. 
And best of all, just like the Collector's Box for Escape the Dark Castle before it, this beauty is designed to fit perfectly into Kallax shelving:
The Collector's Box for Escape the Dark Castle shown in Kallax shelving.

campaign.story:
Blinks is the world's first smart tabletop game system. 2,577 backers have supported its development on Kickstarter in 2018 & 2020. We've now shipped over 40,000 Blinks games, sold out at every major convention, and now we're back with more games! 
What is Blinks?
This is a Blink. An intelligent game piece that responds to touch, is magnetic, and communicates with neighbors. Each Blink knows a single game.  
Getting started is easy. Just grab your Blink, choose your game, and connect them together to get started in seconds. 
Blinks teach each other and learn how to play games together
Jump right in with the fast fun timing games like Darkball, or Puzzle101, along with 9 other games included with the Blinks Game System. Games for every style of gamer.
What is the Blinks Game System?
The Blinks System is 9 of the most popular Blinks games and everything you need to start playing. All of these games play great with 9 Blinks out of the box and expand in difficulty and fun when combined with more Blinks, such as the Epic Bundle.
GAMES Included: 
Astro  An asteroid field rich with rare space ore awaits you. Can you collect enough to fill your cargo hold before your competition does?
Darkball is Pong for the Blinks Game System. Players put their timing to the test against a speedy disappearing ball and each other. 
Group Therapy It's your job to get these Blinks what they need most: extraverts want neighbors, introverts need their space. It's a focused frenzy for one or many!
Heist  It's Crokinole for crooks! Fling your Blinks at the vault in an attempt to take the gold!
Paintbrush is a deeply strategic game with pieces act as both brush and canvas.
Puzzle 101 Challenge yourself or work with friends to solve an endless supply of self-generating puzzles!
WHAM is Whack-A-Mole at any scale, in any arrangement, for any number of players.
Widgets - UPGRADE YOUR GAME NIGHT The Blink becomes your favorite new game accessory! Light up your game night, whether for Blinks games or not. Need to roll dice, but don't have the space? Use the dice widget. Settle the score with a coin flip. Spin your own wheel of fortune. You could even use these widgets to invent your own game! We've created 4 unique games that use widgets: Takeway Dice, Spinomino, Flip Bet, & Topple Stones.
ZenFlow - RELAX Sometimes you need to relax and bliss out at your desk. Be mesmerized by swirling colors and patterns as Blinks share their happiness. Witness emergent behaviors and find your zen.  
9 wickedly fun games to get started
Blinks Game System Includes: 9 Blinks, 9 Games, 2 Sushi Roll Cases, 1 Instruction Booklet and a simply ridiculous attention to detail, you won't want to put them down.

What previous Kickstarter backers are saying
Roll up your Blinks in the included Sushi Roll and take them on the go
 Blinks takes you on an Epic Adventure! 
An adventure awaits you, don't miss this wild ride!
6 SERIOUSLY EPIC NEW GAMES from 6 delightfully fresh game designers. We've teamed up with amazing creators, such as Big Potato Games, to imagine brand-new adventures taking your gaming to new heights. For all of our fans, these games are not to be missed.
Epic Adventure Games 
Tip Toe Volcano is a game about betting, bluffing...and not stepping in any lava. Each round, you’ll secretly hide your traps before putting the map together. After that, it’s an all-out bidding war to see who can tip-toe the furthest around the volcano — without getting burned.

Afraid of the dark? No worries, this is Blinks' first truly cooperative game. Work together to hunt Ghosts with your saber-like flashlight and rid the mansion of evil spirits. When ghouls appear, you must work together to make them disappear.

Bubble, bubble, boil and... It’s your first day attending Alabaster’s School of Alchemy and Potions. Can you match the potions to create the most magical brew? This is a chain-reaction frenzy unlike any Match3 game you've played.

Stay in the arena to stay in the game. Two teams enter a strategic battlefield, only one will leave victorious. Muster an army by creating a unique formation of Blinks and take on your opponent in a turn-based brawl. Protect the crown, your life depends on it. 

You are a gem-hungry archaeologist who has finally uncovered a long rumored ancient treasure chamber. Glorious riches await you, but not without their challenges. In this, first-of-its-kind stacking game, Ancient mechanisms redirect falling treasure, how much can you collect in your treasure chest without it all coming tumbling down?

Tha•lasso•phobia: (n.) A deathly fear of the ocean’s depths, and for good reason. You are a diver exploring an underwater grotto when your oxygen tank springs a leak. With only six minutes of air left in your tank, can you navigate this oceanic labyrinth and return to the surface in time?

Blinks Epic Adventure Expansion Set Includes: 6 Blinks, 6 Games, 1 Sushi Roll Case,1 Instruction Booklet, 1 Blinks Sticker, Big Fun in a Little Box.


We ❤️ Reviews and Reviewers ❤️ Blinks
Blinks has lit up reviewers eyes and spread joy where ever we've brought them. 
Don't just take our word for it, hear from game reviewers yourself. 
 "The coolest hexes in gaming" - Game Boy Geek 
 "It is real-time done well. Which is rare in the board gaming world" - The Board Game Kaptain"
"It's a medium all its own" -Ricky Royal 
"Unlike anything you've played before" —Roll for Crit

"A unique tabletop experience" -Learn to Play Games


You can join us on our own YouTube livestream every week on Thursdays as we play each of the games and share news with the community. It's the best way to learn how to play.


Pledge Tiers
Stretch Goals 



What's in the Box? 

Shipping Fees
To simplify the fulfillment process, all shipping fees will be collected in BackerKit. We know you'll want to add lots of goodies after the Kickstarter campaign and this way we can simply calculate one shipping fee. Note that customs will apply for some destinations. Checkout more on Shipping for VAT and Taxes in our FAQ. 
Prices are in USD.

For our EU backers, we are thrilled to share that we are "EU Friendly" meaning that we have a warehouse based in the EU and are able to deliver your rewards with duties paid (collected in BackerKit) to insure that your Blinks won't be held at the post office, get stuck in customs, or surprise you with unexpected fees. 

Own a Game Store?
We love brick and mortar game stores and want to help you make Blinks a part of your magic circle. Send an email to sales@move38.com and we'll get you a linesheet ASAP. We love shop owners that like to teach games and we'll make an extra effort to make sure you can show off your skills to every customer 🙌
 Want to Make Your Own Games? 
All backers will have the option to purchase a developer kit made available in our pledge manager after the Kickstarter campaign has fully funded. Blinks is open-source software and hardware and we are dedicated to growing a developer community. In fact, that's how all 6 of the Epic Adventure Set games were made.
Want to learn to code or have a kid that does? This is a great way to get started and one of the most supportive communities of developers ever. Blinks are based on the ubiquitous Arduino platform, and has you saying Hello World in 15 minutes. Developer and consumer Blinks are exactly the same hardware.


Blinks are brought to you by Move38. This is us!
Jonathan Bobrow, Ishmael Asante, Daniel King, Marty Wood, Josh Levine,  Mary Georgescu, Elizabeth Yuan, Robert Canciello, Nicole Polidore, Connor Wolf, Jacob Surovsky, and Hunter Peress. 
The only thing cooler than Blinks themselves is the team and community behind them. Blinks is a product of curiosity, exploration and excitement from the design, tech, and gaming communities. From workshops at Maker Faires to game jams with Playcrafting, IndieCade, and the NYU Game Center, lots of people have been brought together by Blinks.
Kickstarter Video by Tom Caswell, Photos by Adela Wagner, and special thanks to Andrew Chepaitis for a beautiful and safe location to shoot.
And More...
Standing on the shoulders of the generous help of those around us. Thanks to Nick Bentley, Luis Rodriguez, Diana Peterson, Lingyi Rose, Justin Lamb, Kealani Finegan, Nick Soni, Winston Struye, Shiyun Liu, Justin Ha, Kris Atanasoski, Junege Hong, Armin Minassian, David Khananov, Pedro Benitez, Andrew Saldivar, Xiao Yang Feng, Bill Cowles, Sophie Lefebvre, Celia Pearce, Em Lazer-Walker, and the entire team at CrunchGrowth.

Origin Story
While at the MIT Media Lab in the Playful Systems group, I was researching emergent behavior, complex systems, and cooperation. I was simulating natural systems such as swarm behavior like a flock of birds, ant colonies, or fireflies and forest fires. I designed little hexagonal tiles that could think for themselves, respond to touch, and communicate with each other.
My fellow lab mates asked if they could design games for the platform. I agreed to a short game jam session and in under 3 hours, we had designed the first game for Blinks, Fracture. It went on to be a finalist at IndieCade. This is how it all began.
We couldn't be more excited to have you join the Blinks Community!
-Jonathan + the Move38 team

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Blinks are designed to work for generations to come. In fact, we manufacture with the same factory as LEGO. By using a user-replaceable battery, we insure that your Blinks will live an extended lifetime.
Sustainable Distribution
In addition to beautiful packaging, we avoid wasteful plastic trays and instead custom designed paper-pulp trays. To reduce our carbon footprint, and yours, this year, we shrunk our packaging by more than 60% in volume and more than 35% in weight.

updates.update_content:
Hi Blinksters,
We can't believe that Spring is here, and we have a big news to share. This journey has been humbling to say the least and whether you’ve joined the blinks community recently or been here from the very beginnings, I think everyone will appreciate this update.
The past 12 months included some amazing wins for Blinks and Move38.  The community grew 400% and beyond the amazing stories we hear of friends and family playing in quarantine, the games from the developer community continue to inspire us. We’re dedicated to bringing you the most incredible experience for your Blinks.

Hi Backers,

I want to start by offering a sincere apology for the continued delays. My intent has always been to spread joy and build community. While we have been very successful in building a strong, caring Blinks community, our logistics haven't always been up to snuff. We recognize how frustrating this wait can be, and we are working diligently to smooth these processes.

Hi Backers!

Usually the mention of Chinese New Year(CNY) for any product means delays. Last week we were awaiting news on whether our latest production run of Blinks would make our deadline and get our the door before CNY.  It is wonderful coincidence that today on Groundhog's Day – the day in which some of us (me included) are silly enough to determine the length of Winter based on Punxsutawney Phil's prognostication (seeing his shadow)– I am delighted to let you know that the rest of your Blinks are coming! And sooner rather than later!!
