campaign.story:
Lost Ones is a stunningly illustrated, fully cooperative game where 1-4 players take on the role of a young person who finds themselves in a nightmare, inexplicably taken to the Fae world, and are trying to find a way home. 
Click on the image to learn more about Lost Ones!
Playing a character, you must use your mental and emotional resolve (in the form of action cards) to solve riddles, defeat foes, acquire boons, and explore the map. As you travel, place new map tiles that unravel the mystery of this land, by reading the matching page in the Story Book. This narrative will give you choices of how you may interact with the magical creatures you encounter. Every choice may be a piece of the puzzle to find a way out, or it may be a trap to keep you in the Otherworld forever. You must consider your choices carefully, and spend your resolve wisely, or forever be a Lost One.
This hauntingly beautiful game, designed by Gordon Alford, also has character miniatures, and a Kickstarter Exclusive Metal Compass Rose token available.
The Core game, which will retail for $39.95, comes with 128 map tiles, 40 Ability cards, 20 Bane cards, 32 Boon cards, 12 Foe cards, 4 Hero cards and standees, 1 Moon Card, Moon token, Lock/Unlock tokens, Story tokens, Story Ending tokens, The Adventure Guide, the Story Book, and more!
New Character Kaya will come as a standee and with her character card in the base game, and a miniature in the minis box.
Character Minis do not come painted.


 Dominika
Fenrir
 Maeve
 Will

The Lost Ones Expansion will come with at least 9 tiles, one new Boon card, additional story content, and more!
This gorgeously illustrated book, showing the world of Lost Ones and Of Dreams and Shadows, will have over 80 pages of illustrations, and is a WIP
We couldn't leave it this close... the final stretch goal is unlocked!
We have so many exciting previews, reviews, and interviews scheduled for you! Here's a look at who will be looking at Lost Ones throughout this campaign!
"I really enjoyed my time with this one, and off camera I'm going to continue to try to figure out what is going on in this Otherworld." 
- Adam Smith, Rolling Solo
"I found it really cool there were a multitude of paths out."
- Robert Geistlinger, FOMO, Dice Tower

"I am going to say that you are going to want to discover what this game has to offer."
-Jeremy Howard, MvM
PLAY

"If you enjoy a really good adventure game with stunning artwork then Lost Ones is the game for you and you should definitely check it out!" 
- Sarah Shah, Board Games In A Minute

"The sense of wonder around every corner and questioning your trust in everyone you encounter is the best part. You’ll find yourselves exploring your own creativity as much as you explore the lands of Lost Ones."
- Kitty, Long Distance Gamers
"Lost Ones will light your imagination on fire. Find your way out. Trust no one… or everyone. Take chances... or play it safe. Embrace the magic. Get Lost!"
- Brooks, Long Distance Gamers
"Lost Ones provides a beautifully written tale to weave together with your friends. Embody your characters and make thoughtful decisions, working together to create a fully engrossing experience."

Click on the image to subscribe to our Tabletop Simulator version of Lost Ones.

If you are a retailer or distributor and are interested in securing copies of The Lost Ones, please read the information here about how to place an order.   


  If you'd like to add more content to your pledge level, you may add funds by clicking "manage my pledge" (available after you've selected a level). A post campaign pledge manager will be open for a brief window after the Kickstarter ends, where you will be able your add-ons pledges. You will also have an opportunity to add more funds during the pledge manager, if you decide you want to upgrade last minute. You are free to mix and match any combination of add-ons you'd like, adding the sum total to your pledge. These changes will alter shipping estimates.
NOTE: The Kickstarter exclusive content will be available only at higher price point levels in the pledge manager as add-ons. After the Kickstarter, the remaining content will be sold through our webstore, and at conventions only. Retail items will differ from these Kickstarter Bonus items. Some of our license partners will eventually publish our games in their own language. We will try to keep you informed through Kickstarter updates and on our website when this occurs.
If you are a publisher interested in licensing any games in this campaign or in the Greenbrier Games catalog for a non-English language, please contact julie@greenbriergames.com.

With 17 successful Kickstarters under our belt, we have learned a lot about what it takes to get our games into your hands. One of the biggest things is how variable the cost of shipping can be. As such, we will be charging shipping after this Kickstarter concludes, according to the actual costs incurred to ship to your area. We will do this through the pledge manager system once this Kickstarter has concluded.
There are two reasons we do this. First, it allows us to provide a lower rate on the actual pledge levels and structure a much tighter budget for the campaign and stretch goals since we do not have to estimate shipping costs. Second, the funds raised for the project are 100% for the actual project itself rather than being partially inflated by shipping costs that may not be accurate. Though the pricing will vary due to any add-ons you pledge for by the end of the campaign, these are our closest estimates for shipping, based on region  region this year.
If you live in the regions where we offer “friendly shipping”, you will not have to worry about paying additional taxes or duties. These numbers are based on regional averages, and are subject to change. Unfortunately, import laws and customs have made it impossible for us to ship to Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
Timeline for Fulfillment - What to expect
Once mass production is complete, shipping from the manufacturer to the fulfillment centers in the US and Europe takes about 8 weeks, followed by 3 weeks of set up time before shipping to all backers in the US and Europe begins. From manufacturer to our Chinese based fulfillment center, it takes about 4 week followed by 4 weeks of setup time before shipping to all backers begins. Note, these times are only estimates based on information from the fulfillment centers.
We are pleased to work with these companies to bring this project to life.

updates.update_userinfo: Update - Mostly about the card and standee tray and mini bases
updates.update_content:
Hi Friends!
We're just giving you all the updates!
Insert design
We sent our design in and the engineers sent back some tweaks, likely concerned with the structural integrity knowing the plastic they will be using. We’ve looked it over, and are asking for a sample because we have a few questions we need answered before giving a green light. First we’re looking to see if the cards will fit sleeved. This is not something everyone will want to do, but it is better to plan in case you do. Then, we thought the dimensions for the area holding tokens was too big, and we don’t want the tokens to slide around. Finally, the depth for holding the story book was less, and we need to ensure the story book will fit. This brought up an additional question because the binding was not spiral bound as we had asked for. We are looking to see which binding will be better since this book will get used frequently (we hope).

updates.update_userinfo: Where we are in the process
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone!
Finalizing Manufacturing
The past few weeks have been a lot of going back and forth on miniature scaling. We want the bases to be 25 mm so that the four characters are able to fit on the map tiles (2.5 in. squared), while keeping  the scale of the characters smaller than the Nightmare. This was an ongoing conversation that is sometimes a challenge. We are relaying the details to our contact person at Long Pack, who relays the information to the miniatures factory. Sometimes this game of “telephone” along with translation challenges can mean incorrect information. We want to be sure everything is correct, and to that end, both teams have worked carefully to make sure the end result is correct. The prototypes are being shipped next week so that we can verify all the adjustments.

Arkham Archives: the Limestone Abyss is an immersive story, the first of a series, taking place in the world of the Lovecraftian horror. Its interactive storyline is based on an innovative playing system, in which you, the player, will take all the decisions, but the Fate will help or hinder you in an unpredictable way. 
Each Arkham Archives chapter is unique, since it comes with finely designed, Made in Italy collector's items. "The Limestone Abyss", for example, features a custom poker card deck, illustrated with amazing Lovecraftian artworks by the Italian artist Francesco Crisci. The traces left by Cthulhu, Dagon, Azathoth and the other cosmic horrors wait for you in the clues you will find in the Archives.  
It was 1932 when the first file marked with a "top secret" label was deposited in the Arkham Archives. During the years, the police had to face so many unspeakable events that even the harshest of the officers had to pay a visit to the Arkham Sanitarium. Now, the Archives are abandoned, just like the city itself, and the memory of these events is now sleeping under a blanket of dust and mold stench.
It seems, however, that one single person is able to link all these nightmares with a subtle red thread. While her or his name is still unknown, we soon find out she or he can possess the people who were touched by the cosmic horror. 
In the first chapter, "The Limestone Abyss", you will be thrown into the mind of Jack, an experienced archaeologist, who finds himself involved in a horror as old as the Earth itself. As soon as you start to understand that you have a full control on Jack's thoughts and actions, you also realize that you will have to face the monsters lurking in the depths of the Abyss... alone.  
The stars of the first chapter of "Arkham Archives" are our gamebook and the poker cards deck.
The gamebook "The Limestone Abyss" is nearly 200 pages long and it offers a wide, immersive storyline in an environment you will be able to explore completely. Your actions will determine the course of the adventure; if you are smart and wise enough, you'll make it until the final showdown; otherwise, the horrors along the way will kill you... or worse.
The storyline is written by Samuele Zanotti and the artwork in it has been realized by Davide Molino, two of the project founders.  
The gamebook and the cards are meant to be together. The game system featured in "Arkham Archives", in fact, uses a poker cards deck to determine elements like events, fatigue, outcomes and, of course, your madness level. The cards feature original artworks representing the entities that obliterated Arkham and its people at the end of XIX century: you will find Azathoth, Nyarlathotep, Dagon and, of course, Cthulhu. 
The two objects are accompanied by side elements in some bids: for example, the Ouija cardboard is used to place the cards, and the hard paper tokens can remind you the items you have got with you. 
We though of some prizes that we really want to share with you, in addition to what we already put inside the different bid tiers. Fingers crossed and let's hope to match them all:  
And we also added a bunch of fantastic rewards if you help us grow our community on the most popular social networks. The two social goals are alternatives: we will consider the goal unlocked if we get at least one of the two numbers described.


 Each of the 4 chapters in the Arkham Archives storyline will be narrated in a gamebook, both a paper tome and a digital ebook. Most importantly, each chapter features a different Made in Italy, exclusive object.
All of them will be launched here on Kickstarter, so be sure not to miss them! 
"The Limestone Abyss" is the first adventure of a long series, so expect hours and hours of fun and thrill while you explore the world of H. P. Lovecraft from a completely new perspective. The story is structured as a one-shot though, so you'll experience a complete and satisfying adventure even if you won't there to order the next chapters.
There is much more to be seen in the next releases, and brand new Made in Italy, finely designed objects wait for you with the following chapters.
We also have a special gift for you. You will soon be able to play a gamebook demo that will let you explore the world of the Arkham Archives whenever you want!
In the meantime, you can play an interactive prequel at the link below: it will drag you into the terrifying atmosphere of the '50 Arkham, right when the Cosmic Entities started appearing again in the life of human beings.
You will find the interactive story here.
If you speak Italian, there is a translated demo already here.
Stay tuned, follow us on our social networks and be among the first backers! And remember: a fantastic early bid awaits you if you'll be here on day 1!

campaign.story:
Missed the Kickstarter?
Explore the magic at fairytalefiles.com
The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring  you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!
The Fairy Tale Files are immersive escape room style experiences in which you interact with physical game components and also chat with characters, suspects, and witnesses in real-time to solve the case!
As an investigator at the Magical Mishap Agency, you are called upon to shine light on crimes and other strange events troubling this faraway land.
The Experience:  you receive a case packet in the mail - review the crime files, dispatch your team to the crime scene to uncover evidence, break locks, solve puzzles, and send the culprits to rot in the Fairy Land dungeons!
As the case takes shape, you'll get immersed in the rich and surprising stories that unfold!
In each game, you receive a file that covers the known facts of the case.  Included are:
- At least ten physical paper documents to inspect along the course of the case. 
- Puzzles to unlock and mysteries to solve
- A web-based messaging portal to talk to your Magical Mishaps Agency team in real-time
- Re-packing instructions so you can give the game to a friend or re-sell it
- Magic Mirror hint system
An sample from The Cinderella Murders game.
The Messaging Portal: An integral part of the game is interacting with your Magical Mishap team on the ground in Fairy Land.   These interactions with the characters are powered by the industry-leading AI messaging system developed for the Society of Curiosities games.
PLAY

It's easy: there are no rules! Just open up the game and play!
In each game, you will have a file from the Magical Mishaps Agency with the evidence that has been gathered so far. 
Review the evidence to find the culprit or eliminate suspects. 
Use the agency messaging portal to send your team to the crime scene, converse with your team and suspects, and learn more about the case.
You will need an internet-connected mobile phone or computer to direct your crime scene team and interrogate the suspects and witness.
Consult our Magic Mirror for hints as often as you want. We leave you little breadcrumbs of hints.  There are a lot!  This way, if you've lost your path, you can get back on track to solving the mystery.  
We expect to sell the game for $25 each after the Kickstarter launch, so you get up to a 25% discount by backing the project with Kickstarter!
Stretch Goals
We are happy to announce 3 stretch goals for the Fairy Tale Files:
REACHED! - $15,000 - Printable certificate for gift-giving
We know some of you want to give this as a gift and the first game will be released after the holidays, so we want to give you something great to present.
REACHED! $20,000 - Audio introduction to each case
Each game will be enhanced with a 1-minute storybook opening narrative (for the players out there who don't like to read, we hear you loud and clear! For everyone else, this is a great way to set the tone!)
REACHED! $25,000 - Magical Mishaps Agency stickers and pins
All backers will receive a Magical Mishaps Agency sticker and backers of the 4-game pack will receive a Magical Mishaps Agency pin.
SO CLOSE THAT WE THREW IT IN!!! - $35,000 - Fairy Tale Files Soundtrack
We will create a soundtrack for the Fairy Tales files that will fill you with whimsical delight and set the stage for a magical evening of exploration.

The award-winning team
We're Michelle and Yacine and we are the creative minds behind Society Of Curiosities and Kauai Escape Room. We've been creating escape games and mystery games since 2015.
Kauai Escape Room was ranked a Top 100 escape room in the world in 2019!
Society Of Curiosities launched in 2020 and has already published 5 adventures to great acclaim in the mystery game industry!
How we got started
We got into the game and puzzle industry the old-fashioned way: by accident!
We played an escape room in 2015 in Montreal and loved it. So we played a few more. Soon, we were designing puzzles and building full-scale escape rooms for our friends in our home and 30-foot airstream trailer.
Eventually, Michelle made the suggestion to go commercial and open a physical escape room business. Yacine didn't think it was such a great idea but agreed to set up a fake website with fake escape games "to prove her wrong".
Of course, she was right.
Within a few days, people were finding the fake website and trying to book our fake escape games! Fast-forward a few months and Kauai Escape Room opened its doors.
Over the last 5 years we have designed and built 10 escape games and also created and launched 5 play-at-home mystery games.
Yacine Merzouk
Yacine has been a tabletop and strategy game enthusiast and designer since high school.
This hobby culminated into a few years running an award-winning D&D blog, the publication of 2 RPG books, and a stint freelancing for Wizards of the Coast.
From there, it was a natural jump to take these storytelling skills to the escape room and mystery game worlds.
He enjoys long walks on the beach with his dog and generally has a tendency to adopt too many pets from the Humane Society.
Michelle Rundbaken
Michelle is a master storyteller and the driver of the artistic vision for our games — always polishing minute details of the stories and adventures she designs for her audience.
She channels her background in psychology, education, and film to craft delightful experiences and puzzles that are challenging but never overstay their welcome.
Five years of escape room design taught her there's always room for a sprinkling of magic and delight.
Her ideal day consists of reading in bed with a steaming cup of tea. Cuddling a cat is a bonus. 
Top 100 escape rooms in the world
The game design team of The Fairy Tale Files received a Top 100 Escape Room In The World award for their creations at Kauai Escape Room.
Reviews of our other games
Read the Society of Curiosities reviews from Esc Room Addict, Escape Mattster, ESCAPETHEROOMers, Escape Adventurer, Escape The Review, Review The Room UK, Armchair Escapist, and Escape Mattster (again).
Read the Kauai Escape Room reviews 5★ on Google, 5★ on Yelp, 5★ on TripAdvisor, and 5★ on Facebook.
Podcast interviews - listen to Yacine and Michelle discuss game design:

campaign.story:
A New Chapter in Cthulhu Mythos Horror
GOD CANCER starts with At the Mountains of Madness, meshes it with The Narrative of Arthur Gordon Pym (the origin of the dread phrase "Tekeli li!"), and brings it into the twenty-first century with a heavy dose of harrowing medical drama.
The twin narratives of GOD CANCER concern two doctors, Miles Trewick and Gail Pym. Miles is a renowned oncologist, hired to heal a sick billionaire in secret. (Why in secret? Because they don't want to panic the investors.) Gail is an archaeologist, leading an expedition to the deadliest depths of Antarctica in search of evidence that everything commonly accepted about prehistory is a lie.
Gail and Miles never meet, but both push science far beyond its limits, into deadly realms of cosmic horror. Both uncover truths new to science, but ancient when humanity was in its infancy.
A New Novel from Greg Stolze
If you've read Mask of the Other, or You: A Fiction, or Switchflipped or The Forgotten Monk, you should have some idea what kind of stories I'm capable of telling. You can expect this to have relatable but desperate characters making understandable but bad decisions. You can expect people to suffer, and to overcome it. You can expect the strange, the ugly, the bizarre, and perhaps the small moments of grace that can arise when misery is transcended.
Or you can just go read from my free online fiction library, that should let you know if it's to your taste or not. The stories most similar to GOD CANCER are probably  How to Make A Book Safe, Specimens, and The Grey People.
The tangible version of GOD CANCER is a softback print-on-demand book, produced via DriveThruFiction. It's about 260 pages, not counting the afterword. 
The Tangible Rewards
As you can see from the examples in the photo, the linocut prints are done, there are three different designs, and I've done a lot of experimentation with color, paper and other aspects of production. They're all 6x9 inches or a little smaller, handmade, and I've done 107 of them. If you pledge at the linocut level, you get one picked pretty much at random. (The ones that, for whatever reason, I deem "not so great" will get sent out last.) I believe there are slightly more of the skulls. 
There aren't many patches left, so if you want one, don't delay. They're four inches in diameter.
UPDATE: A Preview Reader Weighs In!
Spoilers: He says nice stuff about the book.
-G.

updates.update_userinfo: Some Good News? In THIS Economy?
updates.update_content:
I don't know about you, but 2021 has not been the best of all years for me. I like it more than 2020, but... that's a bar so low it's actually digging into the ground, right? In the spirit of "be the good news you want to see in the world," though, I'm trying to make something positive happen. You can read all about it here, on the website where I keep all the free fiction people have funded. 
It's nothing revolutionary, but it is an opportunity for me to get fiction out there, which means it's an opportunity for you all to read it. I hope to see you involved. Thanks!

updates.update_userinfo: Hey! Here's something cheaper, simpler, and less deliberately unpleasant!
updates.update_content: As backers of GOD CANCER you've all shown your tolerance for my bleak and nihilistic cosmic horror, but just in case some of you really dug the linocut print aspect of the project, I have a KS going now that's all that.

updates.update_userinfo: And Now, For Something The Same, But Different
updates.update_content:
GOD CANCER was a novel, about how humankind might fit into a bleak and uncaring universe, with a lot of thought given to what "the truly alien" might feel like.
DIFFERENT TROUBLE is a game supplement, about how humankind might fit into a weird and confusing universe, with a lot of thought given to what "the truly alien" might act like.

updates.update_userinfo: Hey Greg, Did That Printer Issue Ever Get Fixed?
updates.update_content: PLAY

Print Copy Issue
The last update was about print copies being delayed and rejected. The good news is, it looks like all the hard copies I requested before the formatting issue arose did get processed and are being sent, so the only a small number of backers are affected by the delay. The problem has been isolated at the printer and is being corrected over the next few days. After that, we'll need another proof copy, which inevitably has some turnaround time, but you have to do it -- or else risk sending out a differently damaged book, which just means more delays multiplying. It's still well on track to March delivery.

updates.update_userinfo: We made it? WE MADE IT!
updates.update_content:
The day before Election Day 2020 seems like a weird time to be happy and excited about a horror novel succeeding against the odds, but here I am. Hopefully, you're all as stoked and pleased as I am. It's humbling to see the support and excitement y'all have thrown at my project, and I can only hope to live up to your expectations as much as I aspire to exceed them.
So! The next step is surveys. The sooner you get your survey in, the sooner I can start fulfillment. I have to put that off until the money clears, but once that's secured, I'll be sending out the ebooks as quickly as I can.

My hope is that this spooky season whets an appetite for the weird, the fearsome, and the uncanny. Unfortunately, as with every fourth Halloween, a season of beloved terror is overshadowed by the election, and the pleasurable chills of ghosts and monsters is displaced by the very real fear of "What if my candidate fails?"
I can't help you with that.

Digital mockup, details not exact.




You own lots of dice . . . it's time to start playing with them!
Random Fun Generator, written by Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann and illustrated by Len Peralta, includes over 20 new dice games, all of which can be played with standard six-sided dice.
Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.


Random Fun Generator is a 76-page 7" x 10" B&W book that we're offering in both print and PDF. (Please note that print rewards are limited to U.S. backers only; we cannot ship any physical items to supporters outside the United States.) If you're on the hunt for more dice to add to your collection, we are making many of our custom dice sets available as add-ons (including some sets that have not yet been released) – see below.
Digital mockup, details not exact. More sample pages from Random Fun Generator! In addition to the rules, every game includes an example of play to make it easier to learn the games that are described in the book. Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.

Some of the games included in Random Fun Generator include:
 Great Rolled Ones – You and the other players are all cultists, attempting to summon Cthulhu and bring about the end of the world. 
 Leftovers – You and the other player are competing for points each round, but the player with the lowest total for the round gets to keep the leftovers as a bonus. Outwit your opponent and finish with the highest score!
 Participation Award – You and the other players must work together to defeat monsters, but you’re all a bit lazy and really don’t feel like working too hard.
 Liquid Courage - You and the other players are Dwarves. After centuries of peace, Dragons now threaten your way of life. Tunnel into long-forgotten mines to find the tools to help you survive the onslaught. With Dwarven beer to bolster your courage, only the bravest Dwarves will be celebrated as legendary heroes!
 Unreliable Flying Object - You and the other players are members of a spaceship crew, trying to return home. Your ship is pretty battered from the last mission, and things are constantly breaking, risking the lives of everyone aboard. Can you work together to keep the ship flying, or will you die in space?
 Six-Sided Slayers - In this cooperative game, you and the other players take on classic adventurer roles and charge deep into the monster’s lair. Kill enough monsters, and become legendary heroes! Fail too often, however, and you become a cautionary tale . . .
These plus another 20 games fill the pages of Random Fun Generator. Whether you play one as a filler between larger games or plan an entire evening of dice madness, Random Fun Generator has something for players of all ages!
Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.

NOTE: Stretch goals only apply to the $35 and higher reward levels. The $6 PDF reward and the $15 and $31 print rewards do not benefit from unlocked stretch goals.  

Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.
Some add-on items may be limited in the BackerKit survey. As always, the best way to secure the exact add-ons you want is by completing your survey early. Please email help@sjgames.com if you need assistance with your survey. 
NOTE: Add-on items are not available with the $6 PDF reward or the selection of No Reward. All add-ons are restricted to the print reward levels ($15, $35, and $75). To learn more about these dice, dice bags, and dice games, please see our online store, Warehouse 23.
Dice
The following are dice sets only – not complete games. You may use any of these six-sided dice to play the games included in the Random Fun Generator book.

Dice Bags
Our large drawstring dice bags are satin-lined and each is ready to carry more than 100 dice of varying shapes and sizes. 

Dice Games
These are ready-to-play dice games, some of which include standard six-sided dice that may be used to play any of the games in the Random Fun Generator. Games that use custom dice – like Zombie Dice and Cthulhu Dice – cannot be used with the Random Fun Generator. 

Other Games
These games are perfect for your next game night! 

 NOTE: United States street addresses only.
After the Kickstarter project closes, and after all pledges are collected, we will open the BackerKit pledge manager. There, you will tell us your Warehouse 23 email address, provide your physical address, and pay for shipping (if you are receiving physical rewards). See the FAQ for estimated shipping costs.
Failure to complete your BackerKit survey by the deadline (which will be announced in a Kickstarter update once the pledge manager opens) will result in a refund and removal from the project. We cannot allow projects to remain open forever; we must set firm deadlines so that we can properly close campaigns.
If you wish, you may choose to use a fulfillment service. This allows you to pledge for the project and then provide us with a U.S. address for delivery of your rewards. Forwarding from the fulfillment service, as well as any local fees, is your responsibility when using a fulfillment company.
INTERNATIONAL DELIVERY NOTE: No physical rewards are offered to international backers. If the project closes successfully, we will offer the Random Fun Generator book through Amazon's print-on-demand service*, which will make it cheaper for you to purchase the print books (shipping will cost a lot less).
We continue to search for reliable, economical solutions to international Kickstarter delivery.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Steve Jackson Games is an established game publisher with a successful track record and we have enough Kickstarter experience to deal with issues should they arise. We have the book almost ready for print – we're working on the last round of proofing – and we will work with a printer who has done well for us in the past. To reduce the chance of delays, we are limiting physical rewards to U.S. only.

Now it's time for you to tell us whether or not to complete the project. As we've done in the past, we will stay in touch with our backers during and after the Kickstarter, all the way through fulfillment of the rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Random Fun Generator 2 Update and Final Hours for the Illuminated Manuscript
updates.update_content: As of yesterday, Sam and Randy have twenty different dice games for Random Fun Generator 2, the sequel to this project! We do not yet have a date for when Random Fun Generator 2 will launch on Kickstarter, but everything is moving in the right direction. In addition to the games, we also took a look at early concepts for the new artwork for the book; Sam roughs out ideas which we will send to Len Peralta when we're ready to move to the art and layout stage of the project.

updates.update_userinfo: You Like Dice? We Have Dice!
updates.update_content:
A couple of news items for today:
Work on Random Fun Generator 2 has officially started! Earlier this week, I sat in on a video meeting with Sam and Randy to discuss some of the new possible games and to play one of them. No solid schedule at the moment, but we're seeing some progress on the design and testing side.
We have launched a new pre-order store at BackerKit for dice, dice bags, and game accessories. This is also the place to order another print copy of the first book if you need extras to give out as gifts. There are several items listed: Check out the pre-order store today!

Thanks to the Warehouse 23 team (as well as our friends at PSI), we can report that the last of the print and dice rewards have shipped. Please watch for your print rewards to arrive just as soon as possible. If you spot an issue in your package, please contact help@sjgames.com for support.
For those of you who have asked where to find more dice, please see this page at Warehouse 23 for a list of our available dice, dice games, and accessories. The page changes as items sell-through and new releases are added, so the page may not look the same a month from now as it does today.

Two important bits of news today:
Physical rewards are still shipping! The Warehouse 23 team is packing and shipping rewards as fast as they can manage. We're a small team, and that combined with the social distancing rules we follow in the warehouse means that we can only ship so many packages each day. We will post an update when the last of the physical rewards have been shipped. (To accelerate the process, some of the rewards will be shipped from our primary fulfillment warehouse in Georgia.)

Earlier today, we started charging credit cards and locking BackerKit surveys. The books are in the final stages of printing and everything is on track for the Warehouse 23 team to start shipping the physical rewards later this month. 
As for the PDF reward, that is still on schedule to go out in December. 
A Sequel?

The time has come!
Random Fun Generator is off to print, and now we need to collect the necessary information to ship rewards for the future fulfillment process. Please check your email for a direct link to your Random Fun Generator survey (retrieval link)
BackerKit will guide you through the survey process. You may provide your Warehouse23 email address to save your PDF copy of  Than take a peek into the add-on store, and finally, provide any necessary shipping information for your order.

Please keep in mind that some of the add-on options are limited, so please complete your survey as soon as it lands in your email.

campaign.story:
It is the dawn of the American Revolutionary War of 1776. A tangled web of conspiracy spans North America. In the war for survival, it does not matter what your creed, color, culture or gender is – all stand together. But as the Revolution has begun, something far more mysterious stirs. Agents of the occult entreat both the Rebel Continental Army and Loyalist Red Coats. Freemasons conspire in the City of Brotherly Love. Maryland is in the throes of a witch hunt by the Knights Templar. Amid the chaos, other grim fairy tales have emerged.
The cover art depicts a young, powerful Black woman leading the charge with sabre and flag, as an older Indigenous soldier prepares their musket and a Colonial militiaman fires a Pennsylvania long rifle. British Loyalists stand at the left-hand side of the conflict.
Reports of witches have been seen in the Great Dismal Swamp. Indigenous sachem say that devils called Manitou walk among the living. Flesh-gobbling ghouls have been tunneling beneath Boston. The Pine Barrens of New Jersey are haunted by what the locals call the "Leeds Devil".
In this game, most people have either chosen to deny the supernatural or rationalize it away. A rare few accept it for what it is and act. You are among those heroes, and are destined for greatness… or death. 
Welcome to Flames of Freedom, where your grim & perilous tale hangs in the balance!
Flames of Freedom & Every Stretch Goal Unlocked ($200k) Mock-up

 Flames of Freedom is an American gothic horror RPG, powered by the Zweihander RPG d100 game engine. Intensely researched by Richard Iorio and developed by a diverse group of game designers, this game explores a range of cultures beyond the history of Europeans in North America. Developed with Black cultural consultants in key decision-making roles, interwoven with Indigenous writers of the nations represented in the work and guided by RPG safety and trauma experts, this game will show that colonial horror can be represented in a mature way.
Click to enlarge
This game represents a melange of heritages and conflicting beliefs, one where cultures and genders outside traditional standards were equally as instrumental in fomenting and conducting the rebellion. And, although traditional games set during the Revolution place men at the fore of the conflict, Flames of Freedom calls upon the true history: one where heritage and genders outside the norm were just as important – and, oftentimes working behind the scenes – during this pivotal time in America’s founding.
It is the dawn of the rebellion in 1776 and life is on the verge of drastic change. To some degree, the Europeans shun folklore and witchcraft as the so-called ‘Age of Reason’ is upon them. Tucked between missionaries, mutineers and midwives there are those who know they know the real truth. Sorcery – along with monsters, demons and mythological creatures – is real. 
Click to enlarge
Experience Flames of Freedom right now by downloading the free 61 page Quickstart! It comes equipped with 32 pages of game rules, an 11 page adventure, 7 pre-generated characters, cut-out paper miniatures and a print-out map. It can be played one-on-one, but also supports up to 7 players and one Historian. The rules and adventure are designed for new gamers, providing a 2-3 hour play experience.
Download the free Quickstart from DriveThruRPG
MODERN, SKILL-BASED DESIGN: This game is designed to accommodate a style of play where role-playing drives the story. The exception to this is when there are potential consequences for failure - then, and only then, is a Skill Test required to determine the outcome.
TRAD MEETS NARRATIVE GAMEPLAY: Melded with narrative gameplay elements, this game has four modes: Chase Scenes, Combat Encounters, Overland Travel and Social Interactions. All are handled in the same way: you’ll roll percentile dice using a Skill Test. Rolling equal to or under your chance of success means you succeed. Rolling over means you failed. If the dice match, something special happens - either a critical success, or critical failure.
Click to enlarge
LIGHT TO MEDIUM COMPLEXITY: This game embraces modern, familiar mechanics with smooth character creation and plenty of tactical depth to last a lifetime. If you have experience with games like Dungeons & Dragons, Pathfinder and Zweihander RPG, the game will feel familiar, encouraging role-playing and alternative forms of interactions before combat. 
BOUNDLESS OPTIONS: With over 84 character types, numerous cultures, tools, weapons, magic and threats to face, your adventures will take you far across North America into the very heart of supernatural darkness.
Click to enlarge
Let us be clear: Flames of Freedom is not a tabletop RPG where you will discriminate against women, practice slavery, slaughter innocent people or ‘tame the wilderness’ of Indigenous nations. It is a game where people come together to fend off a secret war that took root long before the American Revolutionary War. 
Click to enlarge
Flames of Freedom is a tabletop role-playing game where you’ll blaze your own path, free from outdated thinking. History certainly informs the story, but it is not meant to be completely historically accurate. This game does not endorse discrimination of any kind based on differences of the period its set in. 
Click to enlarge
Regardless of characters' identities, there isn’t any mechanical, intellectual, physical, emotional or spiritual distinctions between women, men, intersex, agender, non-binary and transgender characters, or any between cultures. This game will come equipped with ttrpg safety tools to help you navigate and embrace its positive elements while allowing you to explore its more visceral moments. We'll further deliver upon this promise across the entire Zweihander RPG game line with the release of our upcoming Touch The Darkness ttrpg safety tool.
 We have several exciting First Looks and Actual Plays for FLAMES OF FREEDOM scheduled over the next 30 days (and a couple of special extended campaign announcements after the Kickstarter ends):


Mock-up (not final)
Flames of Freedom is unlike other tabletop RPG when it comes to quality. We lean into sustainable quality book materials, over-index on durability & aim to provide a great reader experience without skimping on premium features. Every hardback book is crafted as a collector's item and can be proudly put on display and used around the table without compromising its condition. Here's what you'll find inside:
Premium offset hardback book
Soft touch matte coating cover for easy grip
Reinforced plank & rounded spine, guaranteed to last
Smythe binding, so pages never tear out
Thick, tasteful ribbon to mark your place
Chunky, matte coated interior paper (no reflections/ink bleed-thru on pages)
"Old school" sepia, black & white illustrations that evoke colonial pamphlets
Optimized information flow for an easy reading experience
Entire UX designed using legible font types, optimized for accessibility
Informed padding and spacing choices for those with color deficiency & dyslexic readership
Perforated pull-out horizontal & vertical character sheets
The cover for Flames of Freedom is digitally painted by Ken Duquet. Ken returns as our cover artist, coming fresh off of production of our last Kickstarter Main Gauche: Grim & Perilous Supplement. Watch his progress on the cover art from concept to finish at the video below:
Returning a 4th time to our projects is our artist-in-residence Dejan Mandic! Living as a full-time illustrator in Serbia, his exquisite drawings can be seen throughout the entire Zweihander game line. Dejan's artwork aims to be inclusive of age, body type, culture, gender, hair styles and situations for Flames of Freedom. Every single piece of interior art has been hand-drawn by Dejan, with little if any digital touch-up.
Joining him is Amber Seger, an industry certified UX designer. Her key focus is on information design and user experience in the book. Following her breakout Twitch hit series for character sheet redesign DESIGNHÄNDER, she joins our team to reexamine our layout standards from previous editions, and to reflow the entirety of Flames of Freedom. 
Our PDF will be fully screen reader accessible.
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
In Flames of Freedom, your character will be changed by the choice they make in the world. Will they become a force for the Rebel patriots or the Loyalists? Will they fall prey to the wishes of the Freemasons or the Inquisition? Will they bend their morals to parlay with the Knights Templar? There is no right or wrong answer; there are only shades of grey.
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Cartographer Gabriel Brouillard has mapped out the cities, settlements and long-forgotten places of North America. His map work spans New France and Canada, south along the Thirteen Colonies, into Florida and the Caribbean. Gabriel's maps permeates the cultural sections of the book, breathing life into Flames of Freedom.
Click to enlarge
Click to enlarge
Following our all-in-on approach from Zweihander RPG, Flames of Freedom will come with a player's handbook, Historian's guide, over 100 spells, a fully-illustrated bestiary of 80+ legends & threats, the setting of 1776, a 35 page adventure set during the Siege of Boston & an urban-based sandbox in and around Boston. We anticipate the book to be 600 to 668 pages when lain out. Much like Zweihander RPG, there will be upwards of 300+ pieces of art. Here's the chapter breakdown:
Click to enlarge
We've set up 6 simple pledge levels, which communicates in detail what you'll get at each pledge level:
Once unlocked, Stretch Goals are FREE to different pledge levels. To keep it simple:
 Pledge $75+: get all Physical + Digital Stretch Goals for FREE.
 Pledge $15+: get all Digital Stretch Goals for FREE.
At $20k we will include a full-color perforated World Map in the back of the book! Illustrated by Gabriel Brouillard, this thick, matte-coated gatefold map will be perforated for easy removal from the book (approximately 22"x17"). The map will be made of sustainable paper, matte coated and will exceed what the current ttrpg market offers.
At $35k we will include Campaign Coins! We'll partner with Mark Morrison & team at Campaign Coins to produce high quality engraved Metal Coins to track fortune & misfortune mechanics. They will be 6 poker chip-sized coins (39mm)– larger and heavier than a US half dollar. They will come engraved with a skull on one side (when the Historian needs to play the coin), or the rising star when in the player's hands.
At $50k we will include Custom Dice! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. The dice set will contain six total dice: 3D6 (face 1-6) at 14mm, 1D10% (face 00-90 percentile die) at 15mm and two 1D10 (face 1-10) at 15mm. The face 6 will come engraved with the Rising Star, marking the face '6' whenever dice explore for massive damage. The face 10 will be engraved with Skull, marked for critical hits.
FREE UNLOCK! We went back to our vendors, and are now able to unlock the 24"x36" Canvas Map for FLAMES OF FREEDOM ! As always, our physical Stretch Goals are 100% free to pledges at $75+



At $65k we will include a GM Historian's Screen! This will be a four panel horizontal gatefold screen, lain out by Amber Seger. It will be made of the same heavy duty stock we use for book covers, and matte coated. We'll poll our backers to gauge what sort of scene you want Dejan Mandic to illustrate on it. 
At $80k we will include a Magnetic Dice Tray! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. Using strong magnetic clasps, the dice tray locks in place easily. With a plush velvet interior and leather exterior, they won't scratch your table or make a loud CLATTER sound as you roll dice.

At $100k we will UPGRADE the Custom Dice to Metal Dice! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. These will be copper-style dice, with engraved black enamel numbers: 6 dice: 3D6 at 14mm, 1D10% at 15mm, and two 1D10 at 15mm. 
Mock-Up (not final)
At $110k we will include a Velvet Dice Bag! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. These luxurious pouches make for the perfect fit with both your Metal Dice and Campaign Coins.
Mock-Up (not final)
At $125k we will Upgrade the Magnetic Dice Tray to a Wood Dice Vault! These will be produced by our partner Geekify. Made of a luxurious solid dark wood and soft interior liner, it will store and protect all the dice included in this Kickstarter.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Flames of Freedom is an extensive project with a large team of contributors working on what we intend to be a high-quality, thoughtfully curated and produced collector’s item. The Kickstarter is designed to help us offset the substantial production cost and include attractive features.

We are excited to have you with us on this journey to produce an incredible RPG. We also want to reward our biggest fans with exclusive, Kickstarter-only Stretch Goals that could not be produced otherwise without your support. 

While this is our first Kickstarter, it is the third that our executive creative director will have ran. Along with a dedicated customer support specialist to answer logistical questions with content-related questions sent to Daniel, our communications will be regular, clear and set realistic expectations.

Andrews McMeel Publishing has over 50 years of independent publishing and global distribution experience. While we do not anticipate any challenges for print and shipping, COVID and tariffs may have an impact on our timeline. We will communicate quickly and clearly any perceived challenges, along with adjusted timelines.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We design all of our tabletop RPGs with sturdy, collectors grade materials. It will be printed as a premium offset hardback book, with soft touch matte coating cover. The rounded spine is reinforced with planks, using smythe binding (so your pages don't fall out). It will have a tasteful, chunky ribbon sewn into the spine. The interior pages are 128gsm (80 lbs.) FSC paper, with zero bleed-thru issues with ink. Our perforated character sheets are printed on wood-free paper, with easy pull-out.
Reusability and recyclability
We are committed to Project Gigaton, an initiative that aims to avoid one billion metric tons of greenhouse gases by 2030. https://www.andrewsmcmeel.com/andrews-mcmeel-takes-sustainability-to-a-new-level/
Sustainable materials
We are committed to using FSC paper on all new book releases starting in spring 2021, which includes Flames of Freedom. This does not diminish the quality of paper or fidelity of the ink upon it. https://us.fsc.org/en-us/market/paper-printing
Sustainable Distribution
Our partner SkuTouch guarantees your order will arrive safely. The team as been dedicated to supporting domestic & international shippers for more than 20 years. By offering multiple international source collection through delivery to end locations benefits brand holders and consumers by reducing handling partners and costs while enhancing transportation visibility as materials pass through the required export/import steps. Further, domestic material handling sites for order fulfillment, distribution and value-add services, such as consumer returns, completes a total supply chain offering for shipping and customer inquiry transparencies.

campaign.story:
!!! NEUROCRACY IS FUNDED !!!
You've all been so generous with your words of support, your pledges, your shout-outs, and we cannot thank you enough! All we can do is make Neurocracy the best it can possibly be, and you've made that dream a reality!
With our funding target met and one day left on the clock, let's talk stretch goals!

!!! STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED !!!
Right now, we’re planning to use part of the Kickstarter funding for edited stock photography in order to create the images that will adorn each Omnipedia article, such as character and location shots. If we hit £12,000 in pledges, we can instead work with an illustrator for the creation of digital art with a consistent style across all of Omnipedia!
Where appropriate, we have planned and scripted audio dramas that can be organically included in select Omnipedia articles, such as snippets from in-universe speeches or interviews, journalism podcasts, and various live broadcasts and recordings. If we sail on to £15,000, we’ll be able to hire actors to portray and voice Neurocracy’s main characters in these audio dramas!
We’re currently writing Neurocracy in English, but we would like to include more languages to make it accessible and culturally suitable to a wider audience. This is a costly endeavour given Omnipedia’s text-heavy nature, so if the campaign makes it to £20,000, we can translate each article into Spanish and Mandarin Chinese!
What if you could dive into a Wikipedia rabbit hole in the year 2049 and use that information to investigate a high-profile assassination?
This is NEUROCRACY, an interactive narrative experience that offers an anthology of compelling sci-fi stories presented as hyperlinked articles on Omnipedia, a futuristic counterpart to Wikipedia!
If you want to pay a visit to 2049 right now, you can click the button at the top of the page to access a demo of Neurocracy, featuring a total of seven Omnipedia articles! Which one will come up first when you choose Random article?
Also, hello! We are Playthroughline, a design team consisting of Joannes Truyens (a writer of some variety) and Matei Stanca (a web developer of some renown). We're equal parts excited and excited to kick off our Kickstarter campaign for Neurocracy!
We wrote Neurocracy's story world with the following core premise: "a pandemic turns temporary health measures into permanent fixtures of the surveillance state, including the monitoring of neural implants."
With current events being what they are, we decided we couldn’t ignore the very real pandemic that continues to affect all our lives. As a result, Neurocracy does mention COVID-19 in minimal, purely factual ways, but its story world is specific only to the fictional pandemic we have written. That pandemic is caused by...
Cariappa-Muren disease
The Omnipedia article on Cariappa-Muren disease illustrates how this prion infection manages to spread through contaminated tuna for five years before it's discovered in 2039. You'll learn about the two scientists who first describe it, the aquaculture company that causes it, and how it results in the creation of a global biosecurity system known as...
G6
Considering its biosecurity mandate, G6 works almost too well. It mines all data uniformly, epidemiological or otherwise, so it can be shared across borders in the event of a pandemic. It deploys neural implants equipped to diagnose the early stages of Cariappa-Muren disease, but the implants can be leveraged for other purposes too.
Neurocracy uses Omnipedia as an omniscient narrator to filter the implications of a system like G6 down to the micro level, with different articles showing the interconnected political, social, cultural, technological, and economic implications of a world where governments have cheap and streamlined access to all their citizens' data (including their neural states).
Who's Xu Shaoyong? Why was he a target? What's a Massachusetts?
The hook for diving into Omnipedia is a murder mystery, the assassination of an important public figure that throws the world of 2049 into disarray, leaving it to you to solve the many mysteries that follow. Reading the Omnipedia article of the victim offers plenty of reasons why someone might want them dead, and each one is an avenue of investigation into what has happened, and what is happening, in Neurocracy. 
Neurocracy features a rich and diverse cast of characters, each presented to you through their respective Omnipedia article. Some will have potential ties to the assassination, others play different parts in the world of 2049. Read on to meet four of them and see how they're connected!
Connie Muren
After she gave her name to the discovery of Cariappa-Muren disease and identified the neurodegenerative disorder as a novel strain of mad cow disease in 2039, Connie Muren was turned into the public face of the global effort to stop the pandemic and establish G6 in its wake. She went missing in 2040, her case eventually ruled as either an accident or a voluntary disappearance.
Xu Shaoyong
Often referred to as China's paramount leader, Xu Shaoyong is the founder and executive chair of the multinational tech giant Zhupao. His name and company have become synonymous with the bleeding edge of AI and neural implants, resulting in the creation of G6. When he is assassinated a day before the Chinese centennial celebrations in 2049, the social order imposed by G6 is upended.
Efua Amankwah-Crouse
Efua Amankwah-Crouse is equated with the birth of artificial general intelligence, though she would merely claim the design of a neural network adept at abstract reasoning. She joined Zhupao in 2034 after Xu Shaoyong recognised her design as a sustainable and environment-friendly model for training AI. When he is assassinated, Efua's opposition to G6 revives a conspiracy theory that she is Adira.
Deena Kim
Every day, Deena Kim has to assure people that she's really human. She works at a Zhupao service agency, where she fields calls from people who want to appeal decisions made by G6 but refuse to talk to AI-enabled chatbots. In 2049, Deena is publicly unmasked as Adira when her work terminal is linked to the assassination of Xu Shaoyong. To clear her name in the eyes of G6, she has to find the real Adira before the authorities do.
We like to think of Neurocracy as a hypertext game, a genre that is directly compared to browsing an encyclopedia on its Wikipedia page. Neurocracy is also something of an epistolary novel, since it presents a story in the form of a diegetic, in-universe document.
The document in question being Wikipedia allows us to play around with more interactive approaches, like carrying over Wikipedia's revision history to Omnipedia so we can portray an editing war! You'll be able to check multiple versions of each article, showing you what has been added, changed, and deleted as Neurocracy's story progresses.
These particular edits reflect the recent death of a character.
That story will unfold across ten episodes in a weekly release schedule, with each episode representing one day in 2049 and adding more articles to Omnipedia (while editing existing ones). A single article can tell a self-contained story (making Neurocracy a bit of an anthology), but also contribute to the overarching throughline of the assassination.
You will be able to experience Neurocracy on your own, but if you are so inclined, you can join forces with others to truly bring it to life! Our Discord community has been exploring the Neurocracy demo, comparing notes based on clues embedded in the Omnipedia articles, and coming away with different theories and story interpretations. In that respect, Neurocracy borrows elements from alternate reality games (or ARGs) as well, with the truth hidden between the lines.
HeckinRobin, one of our esteemed community members, explored the Neurocracy demo on his Twitch channel and came back with a perfect encapsulation of everything we're hoping to accomplish! 
PLAY

To enhance the world of Neurocracy with different perspectives and stories, we've approached several amazing sci-fi writers who are set to contribute their own articles to Omnipedia. It is an anthology after all!
We're incredibly excited to be working with such talented people as...
Malka Older is a writer, aid worker, and sociologist whose science-fiction political thriller Infomocracy was named one of the best books of 2016 by Kirkus, Book Riot, and the Washington Post. She is the creator of the serial Ninth Step Station, currently running on Serial Box, and her short story collection And Other Disasters came out in November 2019. 
She is a Faculty Associate at Arizona State University’s School for the Future of Innovation in Society and her opinions can be found in The New York Times, The Nation, Foreign Policy, and NBC THINK, among others.
Leigh Alexander is an award-winning writer, narrative designer, and story consultant (Reigns: Her Majesty, Reigns: Game of Thrones, Love Island 2, Neo Cab, unannounced projects). She won the 2019 award for Best Writing in a Video Game from the Writers Guild of Great Britain, and her work has been nominated for Game Developers Choice Awards, BAFTA Game Awards, Independent Game Festival, Golden Joystick, and Develop Awards, among others. 
As a former journalist and critic, she also creates fiction and audio documentaries about internet culture in the post-reality age. She previously hosted The Guardian's tech podcast, was a columnist in Edge, and spent ten years in major game industry editorial roles. Her YouTube series Lo-Fi Let's Play lovingly deconstructs ancient computer adventures.
Yudhanjaya Wijeratne is an SFF author and data scientist from Colombo, Sri Lanka. He who wrote Numbercaste, The Inhuman Race, and several other stories. His work spans data science, linguistics, artificial intelligence, public policy, futurism, and machine-generated art.
He also co-founded and helps run the factchecker Watchdog Sri Lanka, and researches with the Data, Algorithms and Policy team at LIRNEasia, a nonprofit think tank working across the Global South.
Our plan is to self-publish Neurocracy without relying on distribution platforms of any kind (with the exception of itch.io). Since it plays out entirely on a website with no download required, we feel Neurocracy is a project ideally suited for cutting out the middle and being delivered to you directly. Kickstarter affords us that same freedom.
We've gotten Neurocracy to where it is today in our own time and on our own dime, but now we need your help! We're looking for £10,000 in funding, which will enable us to pay Neurocracy's guest writers and enlist designers to craft the audiovisual elements of Omnipedia (character shots, graphs, maps, animations, logos, etc.). Here's how the Kickstarter funding breaks down into our budget:
Expect a lot of these on Omnipedia too.
We're tentatively aiming for a March 2021 release date. Once Neurocracy is ready to go, we'll offer access in the form of a unique Omnipedia login at a price point of £15 (about €16/$18).
The Create Account reward tier is our preorder model: every pledge of £10 (about €11/$12) automatically comes with access to Neurocracy at a 33% discount! FOREVER!
The additional reward tiers, ranging from Citation Needed to Featured Article, will allow you to inject more of yourself into the world of Neurocracy, from a mention in one of Omnipedia's citations to an entire article written just for you! 
The Personal Life reward tier will see your name added to Omnipedia in the form of an expanded tooltip!
We're keeping our rewards close to the spirit of Neurocracy, which is an entirely digital project. That's why we're forgoing any physical rewards, which means nothing has to be delivered to your doorstep in the middle of a pandemic.
Thank you for making it this far! If you somehow want to learn more still, you can also visit Neurocracy's official website, follow us on Twitter, and check out our development blog!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Neurocracy's digital nature makes it a low-risk project, since there are no physical deliverables to consider. The website to support Omnipedia is under construction with a clear timeline and a significant portion of the articles have been written.

We believe four months (November 2020 to March 2021) is enough time to write and edit the remainder of the planned articles, and work with the writers and designers we have approached to deliver their contributions.

In the event that this campaign does not meet its funding goal, we won't be able to realise the full potential of Neurocracy, but we will still do our best to finish it and bring it to you in limited form!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The time has come to unveil the stretch goals of Neurocracy's Kickstarter campaign, should it manage to shoot past the £10,000 funding target! We're over 80% there with one week left to go, so that might actually happen who can say. Read on to find out what we possibly maybe have in store for you...

After the campaign, we will do some record keeping and then send each backer a survey, using the CrowdOx pledge manager system. Yours will be sent to the email address associated with your Kickstarter account. This will give you the chance to give us your shipping address, pay for shipping, and allow you to add any add-ons you want. If you end up changing addresses before we ship your rewards, you can click the graphic above to link to update your survey.
 
Estimating additional shipping for multiple copies:
tl;dr: It will be cheaper to order two or more copies of the base game or Enemies Among Us as one order than as multiple orders but we cannot predetermine how much cheaper.
Our pledge manager will allow you to add multiple copies of a Reward (and Add-Ons) to your order and shipping for the whole package will be calculated at checkout. You will see a reduction in shipping per unit but it's impossible to give a single answer on what that will be - it's based on where the order is being shipped, what the total weight & size of the order is, etc. We won't try to figure out a break point where the shipping "resets" for a 2nd outer carton (or cartons); we'll just subsidize any marginal cost changes if the order is too big for one outer carton.
Estimating additional shipping for Add-ons:
Generally speaking we are able to put Add-on components into the same master carton as the base Reward in your Pledge which makes them less expensive to ship than they would be if shipped individually. When you build your order in the Pledge Manager the system will generate a shipping & handling cost based on the weight, size, and taxes due for your order. 
Restricted Delivery:
Due to the increasing frequency of Kickstarter Rewards failing to clear customs or being lost or stolen during delivery AEG now ships only to the following countries:

                            United States, Canada, United Kingdom, European Union+ (UK, Lichtenstein, Norway and Switzerland), Australia, New Zealand, China (including Hong Kong), Japan, Singapore, South Korea & Taiwan.
All other backers must arrange to have their reward received in one of those countries and freight-forwarded, at backer expense, to their final delivery address. We will cancel and refund orders from countries we do not ship prior to fulfillment if other arrangements have not been made.
If you have any questions please email kickstarter@alderac.com
