campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
AEG uses a 3rd party Pledge Manager. This is a system that you will use to update your delivery address, add and remove items from your order, calculate your shipping & handling and pay any balance due on your order. You will be sent a link to your order in the Pledge Manager approximately 3 weeks after the end of the campaign. You will select the French, German or English language version of your Rewards and Add-Ons in the Pledge Manager. You will not be able to select multiple languages in one order; all products on each order will be in the same language. You may create multiple orders if you wish to order in multiple languages but shipping & handling fees cannot be combined.

We do not make group orders or bulk orders. We cannot combine orders. Brick & Mortar retailers interested in carrying Thunderstone Quest should email kickstarter@alderac.com for more information. 

All images used in this Kickstarter are subject to change and may represent unfinished or non-final art or design. All card counts are approximate and are subject to change. All card and component names are subject to change. All packaging is subject to change and is not finalized. Rules are subject to change.

Alderac Entertainment Group has been in the publishing business for more than 20 years. We are experienced at producing games in China and distributing them worldwide. Nonetheless there are always risks associated with manufacturing and logistics.

These problems can delay or otherwise impact our ability to meet our commitments to our backers.

These issues include (but are not limited to):

* Production delays
* Shipping delays
* Customs delays

The estimated delivery date is September 2021, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize these risks as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

Before the Rewards are shipped we offer no questions asked refunds. Once we have shipped your Reward our refund policy will depend on the circumstances and will be at our discretion.

At your request we can give you a full refund within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that we will subtract Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from Kickstarter after 14 days). Those fees usually equal 8% of the total pledge.

Refunds will be processed through Kickstarter and will be applied to whatever payment method you provided to Kickstarter. In the event that is impossible we will work with you to arrange a refund through other channels.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed. Not responsible for changes in the rate of foreign exchange.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you agree to conduct all public interactions via Kickstarter's communications channels with this project and our team and other backers in a positive manner. Harassment, name-calling, or attempts to inject inappropriate content into the public communications channels for the project will result in the cancellation of your pledge (with a full refund) and your ejection from the campaign. We want the communications channels for this campaign to be a friendly, positive place for our community to gather and discuss the campaign, ask questions, and provide input.

AEG reserves the right to cancel any pledge (with a full refund) at any time, for any reason. If your pledge is cancelled while the campaign is ongoing you agree not to re-pledge either under your original account or under any other account you control. Violations of this policy will be reported to Kickstarter.

Minor cosmetic damage to the box or other packaging can occur during shipping. AEG makes reasonable efforts to ensure that the shipping containers it uses are suitable for the safe delivery of the Rewards. If you believe that your Reward has suffered more than minor cosmetic damage please contact us immediately. Keep all packaging including outer cartons for our inspection. AEG will at its sole discretion determine if the damage constitutes other than minor cosmetic damage and/or was the result of insufficient packaging.

If we ship to the address that you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is returned to us as undeliverable you will pay the full cost to ship the Reward again to a revised address.

If we ship the Reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is delivered to that address but you are unable to receive it, or you have moved and are no longer the occupant of that address and cannot otherwise retrieve the package, or if the package is lost or stolen after delivery, and you wish to have the order fulfilled again you will pay the full cost to ship the order to a revised address plus the amount of the original Reward plus Add-Ons and other upgrades on your order.

In all cases you acknowledge that quantities are limited and AEG may not be able to ship all or part of your order more than once.

If any part of your order cannot be fulfilled for any reason AEG will provide you with a pro-rated refund for that portion of your order.

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in to our Pledge Manager and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your Reward if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our Pledge Manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

If you have questions or concerns about these terms & conditions please email kickstarter@alderac.com for further information.


GERMAN

AEG benutzt einen externen Pledge Manager. Damit kannst du deine Lieferadresse ändern, deine Bestellung verändern, die Liefer- und Frachtkosten berechnen und diese bezahlen. Du erhältst ungefähr 3 Wochen nachdem die Kampagne beendet wurde einen Link zum Pledge Manager. Dort kannst du wählen, ob du die deutsche, englische oder französische Version des Spiels und aller deiner Add-Ons erhalten willst. Du kannst nicht mehrere Sprachen in einer Bestellung auswählen, alle Produkte müssen in der gleichen Sprache bestellt werden. Du kannst mehrere Bestellungen anlegen, um weitere Sprachen zu erhalten, leider können wir dabei die Versandkosten nicht kombinieren.

Wir nehmen keine Gruppenbestellungen an und können keine Bestellungen von verschiedenen Unterstützern kombinieren. Händler, die an Thunderstone Quest interessiert sind, können eine Mail an kickstarter@alderac.com für weitere Informationen senden.

Alle in diesem Kickstarter verwendeten Bilder unterliegen Änderungen und können unvollendete oder nicht endgültige Designs darstellen. Alle Kartenzahlen sind Schätzungen und können sich ändern. Alle Karten- und Komponentennamen können sich ändern. Alle Verpackungen können sich ändern und sind nicht finalisiert. Die Regeln können sich ändern.

Die Alderac Entertainment Group ist seit mehr als 20 Jahren im Verlagswesen tätig. Wir haben Erfahrung darin, Spiele in China zu produzieren und weltweit zu vertreiben. Dennoch sind mit der Herstellung und Logistik immer Risiken verbunden.

Diese Probleme können unsere Fähigkeit, unseren Verpflichtungen gegenüber unseren Unterstützern nachzukommen, verzögern oder auf andere Weise beeinträchtigen.

Diese Probleme umfassen (sind aber nicht beschränkt auf):
 
* Produktionsverzögerungen

* Versandverzögerungen

* Zollverzögerungen

Der voraussichtliche Liefertermin ist September 2021. Beachte jedoch, dass dies nur eine Schätzung ist. Aufgrund der Logistik des internationalen Frachtverkehrs erhalten Unterstützer in verschiedenen Regionen der Welt möglicherweise ihre Belohnungen früher als andere.
Wir haben unser Bestes getan, um diese Risiken so gering wie möglich zu halten, und erstatten deinen Beitrag, wenn das Spiel aus einem völlig unvorhergesehenen Grund überhaupt nicht ausgeliefert werden kann.

RÜCKGABERECHT
 
Vor dem Versand der Belohnungen bieten wir Rückerstattungen ohne Angabe von Gründen an. Sobald wir deine Belohnung versendet haben, hängt unsere Rückerstattungsrichtlinie von den Umständen ab und liegt in unserem Ermessen.
 
Auf deinen Wunsch können wir dir innerhalb von 14 Tagen nach Ende der Kampagne eine vollständige Rückerstattung gewähren, einschließlich der Gebühren. Danach werden Kickstartergebühren und Bearbeitungsgebühren des Zahlungsdienstleisters abgezogen (die wir nach 14 Tagen nicht mehr von Kickstarter zurückerhalten können). Diese Gebühren betragen in der Regel 8% des Gesamtbetrags.

Rückerstattungen werden über Kickstarter verarbeitet und auf die von dir für Kickstarter angegebene Zahlungsmethode angewendet. Für den Fall, dass dies nicht möglich ist, werden wir mit dir zusammenarbeiten, um eine Rückerstattung über andere Kanäle zu arrangieren.
 
Dieses Projekt wird in USD finanziert und alle Rückerstattungen erfolgen in USD für den Betrag, der in USD eingegangen ist, abzüglich aller anfallenden Gebühren, die vom Zeitpunkt der Rückerstattung abhängen. Wir sind nicht verantwortlich für Wechselkursänderungen.

AEG behält sich das Recht vor, einen Beitrag (mit vollständiger Rückerstattung) jederzeit und ohne Angabe von Gründen zu stornieren. Wenn dein Beitrag während der Kampagne storniert wird, stimmst du zu, weder unter deinem ursprünglichen Konto noch unter einem anderen von dir kontrollierten Konto erneut einen Beitrag zu leisten. Verstöße gegen diese Richtlinie werden an Kickstarter gemeldet.

Während des Versands können geringfügige kosmetische Schäden an der Schachtel oder anderen Verpackungen auftreten. AEG unternimmt angemessene Anstrengungen, um sicherzustellen, dass die von uns verwendeten Versandbehälter für die sichere Zustellung der Belohnungen geeignet sind. Wenn du glaubst, dass deine Belohnung mehr als nur geringfügige kosmetische Schäden erlitten hat, setze dich bitte umgehend mit uns in Verbindung. Bewahre alle Verpackungen einschließlich Umkartons für unsere Inspektion auf. AEG entscheidet nach eigenem Ermessen, ob der Schaden einen anderen als geringfügigen kosmetischen Schaden darstellt und / oder auf eine unzureichende Verpackung zurückzuführen ist.
Wenn wir die Belohnung an deine Adresse, die du in unserem Pledge Manager angegeben hast, versenden, und das Paket als unzustellbar an uns zurückgesandt wird, zahlst du die vollen Kosten für den erneuten Versand der Belohnung an eine neue Adresse.

Wenn wir die Belohnung an die Adresse senden, die du in unserem Pledge Manager angegeben hast und das Paket an diese Adresse geliefert wird, du es jedoch nicht entgegennehmen konntest, oder wenn du umgezogen bist und bei dieser Adresse nicht mehr auffindbar bist und das Paket nicht anderweitig abrufen kannst, oder wenn das Paket nach der Lieferung verloren geht oder gestohlen wird und du möchtest, dass die Bestellung erneut gesendet wird, zahlst du die vollen Kosten für den Versand der Bestellung an eine neue Adresse zuzüglich des Betrags der ursprünglichen Belohnung sowie der Beträge für etwaige Add-Ons und andere Erweiterungen.

In jedem Fall akzeptierst du, dass die Mengen begrenzt sind und AEG möglicherweise nicht in der Lage ist, deine Bestellung ganz oder teilweise mehr als einmal zu versenden.
Wenn ein Teil deiner Bestellung aus irgendeinem Grund nicht erfüllt werden kann, erhältst du von AEG eine anteilige Rückerstattung für diesen Teil deiner Bestellung.
 
Indem du dieses Projekt unterstützt, erkennst du an, dass das endgültige Aussehen, die Materialien und der Inhalt der Belohnungen (und des Projekts) Änderungen unterliegen und sich erheblich von dem unterscheiden kann, was präsentiert wurde, während das Kickstarter-Projekt aktiv war.
Wenn du dich nicht bei unserem Pledge Manager anmeldest und deine Belohnung nicht innerhalb von 8 Wochen nach der Benachrichtigung per E-Mail bestätigst, stimmst du zu, dass wir unsere Verpflichtungen dir gegenüber in Bezug auf eingegangene Zahlungen oder Spenden vollständig erfüllt haben. Es liegt jedoch in unserem Ermessen, deine Belohnuung zu erstatten oder zu versenden, wenn du uns nach Ablauf der 8-wöchigen Frist kontaktierst und deinen Pledge bestätigst.
Wenn du deinen Pledge innerhalb von 8 Wochen nach der Benachrichtigung per E-Mail bestätigst, stimmst du zu, dass wir dafür verantwortlich sind, deine Bestellung so zu versenden, wie sie in unserem Pledge Manager-System eingegeben wurde. Das Risiko geht auf dich über, sobald sie an einen Spediteur geliefert wurde und du bist für Einfuhrzölle oder sonstige an die zuständigen Steuerbehörden zu entrichtenden Zöllen verantwortlich. Gib korrekte Adressinformationen an und stelle sicher, dass die Sendung an diese Adresse auf normale Weise zugestellt werden kann.

Wir bedauern, dass wir nicht an Postfächer versenden können.
 
Wenn du diese Bedingungen nicht akzeptierst, unterstütze dieses Projekt nicht, sondern warte auf die allgemeine Veröffentlichung.
 
Wenn du Fragen oder Bedenken zu diesen Allgemeinen Geschäftsbedingungen hast, sende bitte eine E-Mail an kickstarter@alderac.com, um weitere Informationen zu erhalten.

FRENCH

AEG utilise un Pledge Manager tiers. C'est un système que vous utiliserez pour mettre à jour votre adresse de livraison, ajouter et supprimer des articles de votre commande, calculer vos frais d'expédition et de manutention et payer tout solde dû sur votre commande. Vous recevrez un lien vers votre commande dans le Pledge Manager environ 3 semaines après la fin de la campagne. Vous choisirez la version française, allemande ou anglaise de vos récompenses et compléments dans le Pledge Manager. Vous ne pourrez pas sélectionner plusieurs langues dans une même commande ; tous les produits de chaque commande seront dans la même langue. Vous pouvez créer plusieurs commandes si vous souhaitez commander en plusieurs langues, mais les frais d'expédition et de manutention ne peuvent pas être combinés.

Nous ne faisons pas de commandes groupées ni de commandes en vrac. Nous ne pouvons pas combiner les commandes. Les détaillants qui sont intéressés pour proposer le produit Thunderstone Quest doivent envoyer un email à kickstarter@alderac.com pour plus d'informations. 

Toutes les images utilisées dans ce Kickstarter sont sujettes à changement et peuvent représenter des illustrations ou des designs inachevés ou non finaux. Tous les nombres de cartes sont approximatifs et sont sujets à changement. Tous les noms de cartes et de composants sont sujets à des changements. Tous les emballages sont sujets à des changements et ne sont pas finalisés. Les règles sont sujettes à changement.
Alderac Entertainment Group est dans le domaine de l'édition depuis plus de 20 ans. Nous avons l'expérience de la production de jeux en Chine et de leur distribution dans le monde entier. Néanmoins, il y a toujours des risques liés à la fabrication et à la logistique.

Ces problèmes peuvent retarder ou affecter notre capacité à respecter nos engagements envers nos backers.
Ces problèmes comprennent (mais ne sont pas limités à) : 
* Les retards de production 
* Délais d'expédition
* Délais de douane
La date de livraison prévue est septembre 2021, mais gardez en tête que ce n'est qu'une estimation. De plus, en raison de la logistique de l'expédition internationale, les backers de différentes régions du monde peuvent recevoir leurs Récompenses plus tôt que les autres. 


Nous avons fait de notre mieux pour minimiser ces risques autant que possible, et nous sommes toujours heureux de rembourser les promesses de dons si, pour une raison totalement imprévue, le jeu ne pouvait pas être livré du tout. 

POLITIQUE DE REMBOURSEMENT 


Avant que les Récompenses ne soient expédiées, nous rembourserons sans poser de questions. Une fois que nous avons expédié votre Récompensed, notre politique de remboursement dépendra des circonstances et sera à notre discrétion.

À votre demande, nous pouvons vous donner un remboursement complet dans les 14 jours suivant la fin de la campagne, frais inclus. Après cela, nous soustrairons les frais de Kickstarter et de traitement du paiement (que nous ne pouvons pas récupérer auprès de Kickstarter après 14 jours). Ces frais correspondent généralement à 8% du montant total du pledge.

Les remboursements seront traités par Kickstarter et seront appliqués à n'importe quelle méthode de paiement que vous avez fournie à Kickstarter. Dans le cas où cela serait impossible, nous travaillerons avec vous pour organiser un remboursement par d'autres canaux. 
 
Ce projet est financé en USD et tous les remboursements traités seront en USD pour le montant exact reçu en USD, à l'exclusion de tous les frais applicables en fonction du moment où le remboursement est traité. Nous ne sommes pas responsables des changements dans le taux de change.

Des dommages esthétiques mineurs sur la boîte ou tout autre emballage peuvent se produire pendant l'expédition. AEG fait des efforts raisonnables pour s'assurer que les conteneurs d'expédition utilisés sont adaptés à la livraison des récompenses en toute sécurité. Si vous pensez que votre Récompense a subi plus que des dommages cosmétiques mineurs, veuillez nous contacter immédiatement. Conservez tous les emballages, y compris les cartons extérieurs, pour notre inspection. AEG déterminera, à sa seule discrétion, si le dommage constitue autre chose qu'un dommage cosmétique mineur et/ou s'il est le résultat d'un emballage insuffisant.

Si nous expédions à l'adresse que vous avez fournie dans notre Pledge Manager et que le colis nous est retourné comme non livrable, vous devrez payer le coût total pour expédier à nouveau le colis à une adresse modifiée. 

Si nous expédions la Récompense à l'adresse que vous avez fournie dans notre Pledge Manager et que le paquet est livré à cette adresse mais que vous ne pouvez pas le recevoir, ou que vous avez déménagé et que vous n'êtes plus l'occupant de cette adresse et que vous ne pouvez pas récupérer le paquet autrement, ou si le paquet est perdu ou volé après la livraison, et que vous souhaitez que la commande soit à nouveau exécutée, vous paierez le coût total pour expédier la commande à une adresse modifiée plus le montant de la Récompense originale plus les Add-Ons et autres améliorations sur votre commande.


Dans tous les cas, vous reconnaissez que les quantités sont limitées et qu'AEG pourrait ne pas être en mesure d'expédier la totalité ou une partie de votre commande plus d'une fois.

Si une partie de votre commande ne peut être satisfaite pour une raison quelconque, AEG vous fournira un remboursement au prorata pour cette partie de votre commande.

En vous engageant dans ce projet, vous reconnaissez que l'aspect final, les matériaux et le contenu des rewards (et du projet) sont sujets à des changements et peuvent différer substantiellement de ce qui est présenté pendant que le projet Kickstarter était actif. 

Si vous ne vous connectez pas à notre Pledge Manager pour valider votre pledge dans les 8 semaines suivant notre notification par e-mail pour confirmer votre pledge, vous reconnaissez que nous avons rempli nos obligations envers vous en totalité pour le paiement ou les dons reçus. Cependant, nous pouvons, à notre discrétion, rembourser ou expédier votre Récompense si vous nous contactez et confirmez votre promesse de don après que la fenêtre de 8 semaines se soit écoulée. 

Si vous confirmez votre pledge dans les 8 semaines suivant notre notification par e-mail, vous acceptez que notre responsabilité envers vous est d'expédier votre commande telle qu'elle a été saisie dans notre système de Pledge Manager, que le droit et le risque vous sont transférés lors de la livraison par un transporteur pour cette expédition, et que vous êtes responsable des frais d'importation ou de tout autre frais qui pourrait être payable aux autorités fiscales compétentes, en fournissant des informations d'adresse correctes et en vous assurant que cette adresse est livrable par des moyens normaux. 

Nous le regrettons, mais nous ne sommes pas en mesure de livrer à des boîtes postales.
Si vous n'acceptez pas ces conditions, veuillez ne pas vous engager sur ce projet mais plutôt attendre la sortie en magasin du jeu.

Si vous avez des questions ou des préoccupations concernant ces termes et conditions, veuillez envoyer un email à kickstarter@alderac.com pour plus d'informations.

updates.update_content: I know I just updated on the 3rd, but I was doing updates for our other Kickstarters today and there was some info I wanted to make sure you weren't left out on. But first off, English Language Enemies Among Us is currently being printed! French and German will run a little later as the out-of-house translation partners are still working on their end. We could have waited to put it all on press at the same time, but press time is getting tight, so when a spot opened up, we grabbed it. If the partners take too long, it might delay French and German a little bit, but we'll stay on top of that.

Super happy to see this email today from our production master Dave:
"Today I approved the printed color proofs for TSQ KS4. This means the game is now in mass production."
From the outside, game production can be pretty hard to understand, so I asked Goody to send me photos so you can all see the tremendous amount of work that a phrase like "approve printed color proofs" represent. Remember, we not only are printing Enemies Among Us, but we also have to go back on press with past releases so new players can catch-up.

Wanted to do a quick production update to let you know where we are with TSQ.
Production continues with a few small blips slowing things down from time to time as the world tries to adjust to a new normal. The last big milestone step was E-proof approvals (multiple rounds), and now we are waiting for printed proofs. Our printer is slammed right now, but we do expect the printed proofs soon. Because this Kickstarter involves reprinting a few of the older releases, there is a LOT to review, but so far things have been moving pretty well.

I hope you're having an excellent day. Here's what's going on with Enemies Among Us...
The English files are now in the 2nd round of digital proofing. These need to get approved by 3 people before we can move forward. One of those people is on a well earned vacation until next week, but when he gets back, I expect them to move along as quicky as any review of this many files can...

Production for TSQ is continuing at a pretty good clip. This is a complex product due to just how many options people have to order (so many SKUs!!). On the good side, unlike a game like Dead Reckoning with it's double-sided clear cards, the actual components here are things that aren't all that complicated once things get rolling.
We are currently in the process of locking down our print run number, so we are going to be closing the pledge manager for Late Pledges at the end of this month (the 31st). We may have to close the ability to order a few of the add-ons earlier than that as there are a few products that we aren't reprinting as we have copies still in stock, but are running low on. I wanted to give you the heads up in case there were extra copies or other Quests you wanted to add.

About time to let you know what’s going on here with TSQ. We are now officially in the “boring middle” of production as far as updates go. If the production team knew I called it that, they would shoot me because THEY are all hard at work…

The major milestones in the past several weeks were that all of the individual game components have been approved by all the internal teams. This led to the approval of the all important ‘Soft Proofs.’ Chinese New Year just started, so the places we use for production have basically gone dark and will be for a few weeks. During that time there is little we can do from our side, but the next big milestone is the approval of the Color Proofs.

2021 is HERE! and after a solid week of "OMG, SO MUCH WORK NEEDS TO BE DONE!!!" I'm here with an update on TSQ!
Progress continues well. Files are flying around at record speed. Looks like blue skyies right now, but as always, anything could happen... Reprinting previous releases is making production more complex, but only from a "make sure we don't forget/miss anything" perspective. All the art is in, including the box art, so our focus is now pretty much just internal, printer, and then eventually fulfilment.

Saw this cross my email today and thought "I think the backers might want to see it, cause it's awesome!" Here is what the cover is going to look like for the big box for Enemies Among Us. The left thrird or so wraps around one side. So cool...

Sorry it took so long to get an update out. I'm honestly never sure how often I should do these when all I really have to say is "things are moving along" (I personally back a LOT of Kickstarters and my inbox is chocked full of unread weekly updates). If you ever want me to check in, let me know and I'll be happy to give you all the details as to what's going on. And of course, when something really fun/exciting/newsworthy happens, I'll be sure to let you know.

campaign.story:
You have just received “The Shelley Volumes,” a collection of hollowed-out books left by Mary Shelley (author of Frankenstein) to her son, Florence. In the first volume, you find a message from Mary:
Beneath Mary’s letter you’ll discover a treasure trove of gorgeous hand-written documents, 2D and 3D jigsaw puzzles, mysterious objects and artifacts, and devious challenges. Prove your worth by studying the documents, constructing the jigsaws, and solving the puzzles... and you’ll be treated to a heartbreaking story that culminates in a shocking reimagining of the truth behind Mary Shelley’s famous novel.
Combining the best of escape rooms, board games, and immersive theater, Mother of Frankenstein is a 10-15 hour cooperative gaming experience for between 1 and 6 players, ages 13 and up. Mother of Frankenstein was designed to be as welcoming and fun for newbies as it is rewarding for experts, combining the narrative complexity of a good novel with the physicality and challenge of a puzzle-filled escape room. Throw in a couple of clue-strewn jigsaw puzzles, and our game truly has something for everyone!
Our final stretch(es)!
Stretchy!
Mother of Frankenstein is divided into three volumes. Volume 1 concerns Mary’s teenage years and her education by her iconoclastic father. Players must complete three assignments—poetry, music, and astronomy—each of which is presented in the form of a puzzle. Simultaneously, Mary embarks on a love affair with the dashing (but married) poet Percy Shelley. The course of their courtship is laid out over 15 love letters, though players must read closely to determine the order of events!
In Volume 2, the venue changes to Germany, and Castle Frankenstein, where a fancy ball is being thrown on a balmy night in 1814. Players begin by constructing a 300-piece jigsaw puzzle of the castle’s floorplan, then use it—along with gossip rags, billiard hall schedules, and original drawings by comic book artist Liana Kangas—to track the events of the evening.
Finally, in Volume 3, you’ll construct an epic 3D puzzle of Castle Frankenstein and descend into the secret laboratory hidden therein, where you’ll discover what Mary learned under the tutelage of the famous alchemist who called the place home, and how it inspired her to write what many call the first science fiction novel, Frankenstein.

campaign.story:
Voir la page du projet en français.
The 7th Citadel is an all-new cooperative exploration and adventure game from the creators of The 7th Continent.
In this post-apocalyptic medieval fantasy world, you play as a “slave-gardener” who escapes from the Citadel of Necrodruid Ninidazir’, only to find yourself confronted by an even greater Threat!
Explore the Collapsing Lands freely by gradually unveiling the board using numbered terrain and event cards. Interact with your environment and converse with its inhabitants.
As the scenarios unfold, your choices, for better or worse, will lead you inexorably to the epic finale against the Threat!
The 7th Citadel carries over the best aspects of The 7th Continent: huge territory to explore, hidden numbers to spot, botany, etc.
However, many changes make it a brand new game:
an original post-apocalyptic medieval fantasy universe to discover,
survival (crafting, hunting, "die & retry") is no longer the heart of the game,
customize your personal Action Deck, choosing the skills you want to make your character unique,
interact with the many inhabitants of these lands thanks to a dynamic dialogue system,
expand your influence on the Collapsing Lands by updating the world map,
return to your Citadel between scenarios...
…where you are building a city that will signal the renewal of this desolate world!
We’ll be sharing more about these new features throughout the campaign in our updates. Support us now and join our quest to restore The Collapsing Lands to their former glory!
"The 7th Citadel is an absolute sublime adventure. It takes the exploration that I enjoy so much about The 7th Continent while refining its gameplay by streamlining the mechanics in a way that’s both fresh and entertaining. Adventure gaming at its best!” Jeremy Salinas – Man VS Meeple
"If 7th Continent was the journey, then 7th Citadel is the destination. This is a great evolution of the game mechanics. Returning and new solo players are really going to enjoy the extra layers of depth!” Adam Smith – Rolling Solo
"Overall the game is very, very sharp… really compelling whenever you run into somebody to talk to. This is some of the best conversation with board game characters [NPCs] I’ve ever had!" Richard Ham – Rahdo Runs Through
For the last seventy years, the Kel Protectorate has been at war with a fearsome enemy: the Burrowers. Controlled by a mysterious individual, these elongated worms tirelessly dig underground tunnels, causing swathes of territory to sink into the bowels of the earth. 
After years of helplessness, the Protectorate finally found a defense against this scourge in the Necrodruids – men and women who rejected the sacred principles of the Druidic Order to draw upon blood and forbidden incantations. The Necrodruids used their blood rituals to create monstrous plant-creatures capable of combating the Burrowers.
In the Citadels, the Necrodruids’ power centers, YOU grow and tend to the abominations developed within, whose seeds are then spread all over the world to protect the territory against the Burrowers. Working as a slave-gardener, you wish that a fatal accident or death by exhaustion would relieve you of your endless toil.
The world has clearly changed since the days of your forefathers. The Collapsing Lands are choked in gloom and dust belched up by the Burrowers. The horrific plant-creatures that were created to protect you have spread, sometimes out of control, and are now just as much of a threat to humanity as the Burrowers.
On a cold morning bathed in pale light, you awaken for another long day of hard labor in the sacred grove, unaware that this will be your last day at the Citadel and that the course of history is about to change...

Solo or cooperative game for up to 4 players.
30 seconds to set up the game, 30 seconds to save it!
1000+ minutes of thrilling adventure per Threat.
Relive the sensation of the adventure books where you are the hero!
No die rolls: the more energy you spend, the more you increase your chances of success, but the faster you burn out!
Live a different adventure every time; there are countless surprises and the game remembers your choices!
Earn new skills, unlock bonuses, construct buildings: your decisions determine your path. Choose your destiny!
In The 7th Citadel, you face a Threat which will inevitably come down on you (unless you perish before you get there!).
Each Threat comes in the form of a booklet with several scenarios that follow one another, until the final scenario where you either win the game or succumb to the Threat.
Unlike most board games, you will experience an adventure over time, but rest assured, a simple save system allows you to pause your game at any time to resume it later.
You are a slave-gardener, captive of The 7th Citadel for several years now.
You start the game by choosing one of the available characters. Each character has an optional quest and a personal Action Deck.
Casek, female (front) and male (back) version of a playable character
Casek's personal quest
As your adventure progresses, you will choose new skills to create the character YOU want to play. Far from the usual archetypes of warrior, mage, and healer, you will have the freedom to develop your character as you choose.
Are you more into Cunning or Arcana?
Whether you want to play a teenage arcane master with a slingshot, an eloquent adventurer who can sneak through the shadows, or an elderly swordsman who summons creatures to assist him in battle, the choice is yours!
You progress in the adventure by exploring the Collapsing Lands (the game board, made up of numbered cards).
Here you undertake actions that usually result in taking numbered cards from the Adventure Deck to progress through the adventure. These are usually terrain cards or permanent events that will progressively form the game board, but also include obstacles and challenges to overcome, equipment, companions, and side quests.
The game is full of random events, always consistent with where you are, and many alternative cards to experience a different adventure every time you play.
Pay attention to the details and observe your environment carefully: it contains a lot of hidden information and numbers that will be very useful to you!
Each turn, you collectively decide which character will take the next action (search, fight, move, speak, and more) from those available to them (on the terrain card where their miniature is, their character card, an event, one of their skills, etc.).
There are more than 30 actions that you can perform!
All actions have a cost (the minimum number of cards to draw from your Action Deck), a difficulty (the number of successes you must obtain) and consequences that vary depending on whether the action succeeds or fails. 
An action is resolved in four steps: Preparation (choice of objects, companions, etc.), Draw, Result and Consequence.
Over the course of the adventure, taking actions will gradually deplete your Action Deck. When you run out of cards in the Action Deck, you must perform a Recovery to replenish it by reshuffling the cards from your Discard, but you will then lose 5 life points.
When you are almost out of life points, or when you've reached your scenario goal, it's time to return to the Citadel!
The Threat Booklet will detail the consequences of your actions, which will vary according to your choices and performance, and take you to a new scenario.
The Collapsing Lands is populated with dozens of non-player characters (NPCs). 
You will be able to converse with these NPCs using the “Book of Dialogues”, which is divided into nonlinear numbered paragraphs. You will not only choose what your character says, but also the tone they use. Then you will find out what happens by reading the indicated paragraph number.
A chapter from the Book of Dialogues
The Collapsing Lands is also a hostile world where you'll have to battle strange creatures in tactical encounters that take place over several rounds. 
These compound actions are identified by the presence of a die, whose value indicates the difficulty of the round and decreases as you gain successes. The encounter ends when the die is removed from the card, usually after you have successfully completed the last round of battle.
If you want to get out unscathed, you'll need to equip yourself with weapons, armor, and spells, and you’ll need to seek out companions. That won’t be enough to truly face down the Threat, however! You must also develop your skills and your Citadel, and that's where your Destiny comes in.
During your adventures you will gain Hope through your feats of arms and the completion of side quests.
You can spend it to acquire new skills, build buildings, send emissaries to map the Collapsing Lands, and much more. There are so many possibilities that you'll have to choose the direction YOU want to go in!
Buildings will grant you powerful effects once built such as allowing you to start each scenario with more life points, items, or companions. They will also increase the characteristics (defense, knowledge, production…) of your fellowship, in order to defeat the Threat.
You start the game with a map of the Kel Protectorate. This world map provides valuable information about places of interest – city-states, garrisons, waterways, etc. – in the world as it was before the war started. Unfortunately, things have changed a lot since then. 
You will be able to send emissaries to map the Collapsing Lands to update your world map by inserting numbered cards into the plastic sleeves provided for this purpose. You'll be able to obtain interesting effects,  and might even gain the ability to start future scenarios from a more advantageous position, closer to your target destination!
The Collapsing Lands are aptly named. Every step you take could see the ground open up like a gaping maw, eager to swallow you whole. But what if there were a hidden world below, filled with secrets and treasures just waiting to be discovered?
“On the Edge of Peril” is an exclusive expansion offered in the Collector's Edition pledge. It includes 2 dividers, 30 cards, 1 rule sheet.
It expands your adventures with new Exploration cards that will hinder your progress until you fight off the danger.
During your adventure, you may be instructed (no spoilers 😉) to slip the “Peril” divider behind the 110 card. Whenever you take a Terrain card stored after that divider (card nr. 111 and up), you must replace 1 Exploration card attached to that terrain with one showing the “Peril” (skull) icon.
Luckily, you possess a Groundquaker, a powerful artifact stolen from the Necrodruids, which will help you push the divider further back and with it the edge of peril!
We’ve been working on The 7th Citadel for over a year now.
The game’s mechanics have been heavily tested over the last few months. Dozens of players have had the opportunity to try them out, notably at the Essen 2019 and FIJ (Cannes) 2020 trade fairs. Their feedback has enabled us to come up with this almost final version of the rules.
Nevertheless, this "beta" version of the rules is likely to change slightly between now and delivery.

Founded in 2010, Serious Poulp was all about seeing the games we designed come to life.
We’re two friends that love playing and making games. Also, one of us is pretty handy with a pencil.
We’ve been working together for almost 20 years, in the digital communication agency we created in 2002, then as Serious Poulp, which we founded in 2010, when the temptation to publish games became too strong to resist.
Role-playing games and gamebooks played a significant part in both our childhoods. Bruno was 5 when “The Warlock of Firetop Mountain” was published. Ludovic was 11 and already had a few prototypes on the go (one of which would eventually become The 7th Continent!).
We've been inspired by many great works during our lives, whether from board games, role-playing games or video games. When we started out in the board gaming industry, we naturally brought all of these elements with us.
We are not only the designers of the games Serious Poulp publishes: Ludovic also creates all of the illustrations and visual elements for our games and Bruno, apart from writing cards and rulebooks, supervises production.
In 2019, we were honored by the Spiel Des Jahres (kritikerpreis) award for the cooperative party game “Just One” we designed, published by Repos Production.
Bree has worked on Kickstarter campaigns in a variety of roles, from marketing and communications support to community management, a role which she is delighted to be handling for The 7th Citadel campaign. She lives in Las Vegas, NV with her two cats, Samus and Remy. Many of her favorite games are deck-builders or abstract strategy games, but she will play just about anything.

Risks and challenges
TRACK RECORD

The 7th Citadel is our third Kickstarter campaign. To date, we have delivered rewards to over 60,000 backers around the world.

We have accumulated experience and selected our partners (manufacturer, logistics, distribution centers) among the best in the world, so we are confident in our ability to deliver this project and ensure its follow-up (communication with the community, after-sales service) with the same professionalism that we have shown so far.

The main risk factor, which can never be excluded given the complexity of such a project and the potential number of backers, lies in a possible delay in delivery.

COMMITMENTS

Because you place your trust in us and allow us, through your support, to bring our project to life, we are keen to clarify our commitments to you.

To this end, we commit ourselves, as we have always done, to:

1. not launch a new Kickstarter campaign until we have delivered the previous one.
2. do everything possible to guarantee the sustainability of our company through sound management: control of its workforce, its operating costs and investments.
3. ensure continuity as far as possible in the event of force majeure
4. keep you informed with regular updates about the project until its delivery.

We would like to thank all our backers for the trust and support they have shown us since 2015!

REFUND POLICY

All pledges can be refunded up to the completion of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked.
If the refund is requested more than 15 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, 15% will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe, since we will not be refunded at that point), and the refund will have to be done via PayPal instead of the Credit Card you used on Kickstarter.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

All payments (pledged on Kickstarter and/or in the pledge manager) will be made in €uros. Any costs shown in $ will be based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign (1$ = €0.85), the levy of your pledges and the pledge manager will be entirely in €uros.

By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that you are responsible for providing correct address information, and ensuring that this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret that we are unable to ship to PO Boxes in most countries. If you do not reside in a shipping friendly zone , you agree that you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities.

If you cannot accept these conditions, we advise that you do not back this project.

campaign.story:
Machina Arcana is a tactical cooperative horror adventure for 1-4 players.
Players take on the role of explorers thrown into dreadful halls, scratching for survival and progressing through the chapters from one of many horror stories. Even if they manage to stay alive till the end of the story, they will face a special mini game at the finale of each scenario. The unique environment, interactive inventory, combat mechanics and tactical diversity are all enveloped in an integral storytelling experience that provides both total immersion in the world and full replay value.
But beware! A horde of unique and terrifying monsters are bent on destroying your party. If that isn’t enough, horrific events emerge from the darkness, conspiring to disrupt and hinder any remaining hope in these comfortless chambers.
Enjoy the stunning art and dark visuals of the game world. Let yourself become entranced by the gripping story and peculiar events as you fight for survival amidst the mysterious arcane depths.
There is no need for a game master, no special conditions based on the player count, and a modifiable duration and difficulty setting. 
Playable as either one-shot scenarios or in a progressive campaign mode, you can tailor the experience to match your most morbid desires.
The brand-new ‘To Eternity’ expansion adds more value by bringing the core Machina Arcana experience to a new level! Enjoy a whole new way of play with the addition of the new ‘Eternity Chapter Tiles’- a series of custom play areas that augment the existing map tiles. You can even play outside map tiles- expanding the physical space and multiplying the possibilities!
Each scenario offers an experience that takes around 90-120 minutes. Streamlined mechanics provide a heightened sense of urgency whilst retaining the general Machina Arcana playstyle, guaranteeing the game will be different every run!
This expansion is also 100% compatible with all of the previously published Machina Arcana content (Core and 'From Beyond' items, monsters, events, and explorers).


Stretch Goals


After the sold-out success of the 2nd edition we were left with no remaining copies of the game. As word spread, we received high demand for a reprint, and we used that opportunity to listen to your feedback and improve the gaming experience even further.
With the addition of a new introductory tutorial Guidebook, 4 robust Player-aids, and an updated Manual, we are confident that the game is more accessible than ever to new players.
Furthermore, the height of the box has been increased, making it much easier to store your game components. There is errata for a number of cards, but it’s mostly cosmetic in nature. This edition and all expansions are fully compatible with the 2nd edition - there are no rule or balance changes that you need to worry about!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The first edition of Machina Arcana was successfully delivered to 1,700+ backers around the world on time. The second edition was even more successful with nearly 7,000 players pledging for and receiving their game on schedule. We are learning all the time and our current preparation makes us confident that we will maintain this standard of timeliness and quality.

Our team of designers, illustrators and writers are tirelessly working on finishing the final touches of this latest iteration and expansion to Machina Arcana. The only possible delay from our side is with producing the content from stretch goals that have been unlocked.

Delays in production and/or shipping are of course a risk for any game publisher, and can be anything from component shortage, manufacturer error, weather conditions, customs and distribution delays. However, we assure you that we will do everything in our power to ensure that games are delivered promptly and on time. Nevertheless, please understand that there is always the chance of unexpected delays that are out of our hands.

We have put considerable time, effort and research into manufacturing and logistical issues, and can pledge our word that we will do our utmost to fulfill your expectations, retain your trust and use your funds with complete integrity.
We have a strong belief in sticking to deadlines, and an even greater belief in transparency. We will therefore ensure that you are informed with our progress and challenges every step of the way.


REFUND POLICY

All pledges can be refunded in full up to 14 days after the end of the campaign with fees included.

If you apply for a refund more than 14 days after the end of the campaign, then your pledge will be refunded but minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees.

However, once we have started to process and pack your order, refunds will no longer be available.

If your order cannot be fulfilled by us, then we will reimburse you the full cost of your pledge regardless of the date.


TERMS OF SERVICE

We will be using a pledge manager after the campaign to charge actual shipping costs.

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the project are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented on this Kickstarter page.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 6 weeks of our notification via email to do so, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. If you contact us to confirm your pledge after the 6 week window has elapsed, we may choose to either refund or ship your pledge at our discretion.

When you confirm your pledge within the aforementioned 6 week window, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge management system and you agree that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment. Furthermore, you agree that when shipping to countries other than those specifically listed as being “friendly” you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information, and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret that we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If these terms are not acceptable to you, we suggest that you contact us before pledging and/or reconsider your participation in this crowdfunding campaign. Thank you for your understanding.

campaign.story:
The Grandiloquent Word of the Day 2021 Wall Calendar 
Greetings and salutations, my grandiloquent friends…welcome to Grandiloquent Word of the Day’s Kickstarter Campaign, in support of our 2021 Wall Calendars. ‘Tis a very special milestone...our quinary year of producing these beloved chronologies - huzzah!
But first, we’d like to acknowledge what an incredibly hard year 2020 has been for so many people. Please know that our hearts go out to all. We sincerely hope that 2021 brings brighter days for us all, dear friends, and that these calendars may bring a bit of daily joy into your lives.
Please read on as we share details for your illumination and indulgence…as well as a most tantalizing array of rewards for your delight.
 Are you seeking to further your unyielding quest for omnilegence? This elucidating calendar will supplement your sesquipedalian loquaciousness as it enlightens and entertains you daily. It is a calendar of such distinction, such grandiloquence, that I daresay you will need to reference one for words adequate enough to describe it. 
Grandiloquent Words + Lavish Illustrations
This year’s theme pays homage to a classic and much-loved story from years gone by - Robin Hood, as illustrated by one of my favorite artists, Louis Rhead (1857 - 1926). An English-born artist, illustrator, and author who immigrated to America when he was twenty-four, Rhead’s reputation as an illustrator is well deserved. In addition to his famous renderings of fish, he lavishly illustrated popular children's literature, such as Treasure Island, Robinson Caruso, Jonathan Swift, Grimm’s Fairy Tales, and of course Robin Hood. It is from his own book, “Bold Robin Hood and His Outlaw Band; Their Famous Exploits In Sherwood Forest” that I have painstakingly curated these gorgeous pieces of art into an enjoyable collection for any fan of the illustrative arts.
Each month will feature words of such grandiloquence, such magnificence, that you shall astound and confound your family, friends, and colleagues with your inventiveness as you strew them into your daily conversations. 
Daily Holidays
Each day of the year features two or more festivities! Holidays both beloved and bizarre are displayed for your daily amusement, enlightenment, and occasional befuddlement. The novelty of having these delightful quotidian holidays to celebrate shall surely elicit frabjous, dare I say, corybantic jubilance! 
Lunar Cycles Chart
Behold this intricately detailed chart of the quotennial lunar cycles, certain to be most felicitous when planning your nocturnal intrigues. Perfect for those with a lupine leaning! 
Heliocentric Simulacrum
There is also a Heliocentric Simulacrum, which complements the lunar cycles chart. It’s a rather marvelous visual orrery of the reciprocal interposition of the ecliptic interplay between the Sun, Earth, and Moon, as well as relevant equinoctial periods. Oh, the celestial wonders that abound within this most edifying calendar! 
Superbly Crafted
Now, on to the details of craftsmanship. Each calendar will be beautifully printed on premium stock. It is recyclable, but if you find yourself unable to part with it, feel free to cherish it forever as a keepsake! In fact, we hear from many of our fans that they enjoy coloring the interior pages – what a delightful way to personalize this grand menology.
The paper has a stunning matte finish that will enable you to easily commit your written schedule to its bountiful boxes. It is a generously sized 12” x 9” (12” x 18” when opened), and comes with a handily placed hole perfect for hanging upon the walls of your choosing.
Enticing Rewards
But wait…there is indeed more! In addition to the main event of the 2021 Wall Calendars, allow us to beguile you with the enchantments of our additional rewards! 
First is our stunning Grandiloquent Word of the Day Blank Journal. The blank pages of these lined journals beckon your pen to fill them with all sorts of masterpieces…notes, musings, poetry, diaries, novels, grocery lists, and anything else your literary genius can devise. There will be several designs for you to choose from!
 Next is our Grandiloquent Word of the Day Bookplates. These beautiful bookplates are printed on high quality, acid-free, self-adhesive paper...no sticky glue to contend with. Pen your name on the scroll with the proud flourish of a bibliognost to personalize your prized tomes. 
 And yet another splendid reward...our Grandiloquent Bookmarks! These stylish double-sided bookmarks are printed on high-quality, sturdy stock, and adorned with silky cord tassels. A tribute to your literary lifestyle, they shall be a boon companion to mark your favorite passages and save your library from a dog-eared fate.
Stretch Goal Unlocked!
Thanks to your generosity, total pledges have reached $20,000...so all backers who have pledged for any of the reward tiers with printed calendars will also receive one of our new Bibliophile Bookmarks!
SECOND STRETCH GOAL ADDED - Sophophilic Bookplates
Thanks to your generosity unlocking the first stretch goal, we are now rolling out a second...this beautiful Sophophilic Bookplate! If pledges reach $27,500 or more, all backers who have pledged for any of the reward tiers with printed calendars will also receive two of these new bookplates! And if you're in a tier of $100 or more, you'll receive the same number of these bookplates as the originals in the tier (so 10 of each, 20 of each, etc.)
They feature the word Sophophilic - describing a person who loves to gather knowledge, with an emphasis on wisdom. Printed on high quality, acid-free, self-adhesive paper, this splendid design shall mark your beloved books as yours and yours alone!
Our Grandiloquent Gratitude for Your Support!
Your gracious patronage of Grandiloquent Word of the Day has enabled the humble hobby of loquacious grinnagog to blossom into a colossal, convivial community of word lovers. I am eternally grateful for your ongoing support, and deeply appreciative for your consideration of this Kickstarter campaign…a multitude of thanks, glorious readers!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are delighted to be producing our *fifth* Grandiloquent Word of the Day Wall Calendar. We've learned more with each passing year...and while we're never complacent, we feel confident in our process and look forward to a beautiful 2021 edition. A new variable this year is COVID-19, and how it could affect shipping times. We aren't able to guarantee holiday arrival due to potential shipping/delivery variables outside of our control. We've been conservative with our shipping estimate of December to help cover for this, but our goal is to ship earlier to mitigate any shipping delays. We'll keep everyone updated!

updates.update_content:
Dearest Grandiloquent Companions,
Frabjous tidings - the printed calendars have arrived! It's always so exciting to see them in print, and they are splendid indeed.
The flat surfaces of our abode are covered in boxes, envelopes, labels, and Grandiloquent goodies all ready for packing. My dear wife and I are well fortified with caffeine, and all set for a marathon weekend of joyous shippery!

Greetings and salutations,
Splendid news, grandiloquent friends...your munificent support has unlocked the first stretch goal! Huzzah! All backers who have pledged for tiers with printed calendars shall now receive the new Bibliophile Bookmark in addition to their other rewards!
And thanks to your generous support, we have now added a second stretch goal...splendid new Sophophilic Bookplates!

My dear friends...I can hardly believe how fast the time is going! When we started this campaign, the autumn colors were barely appearing on the trees...now the blanket of leaves on the ground is growing thicker by the day. And there is only one week remaining in this year's 2021 Wall Calendar Campaign!
We are so appreciative of your generous support, and excited to be getting closer and closer to reaching the Stretch Goal. Thank you for continuing to help us bring the to life by sharing with friends, family, and colleagues!
Announcing a most exciting development - we have added our first stretch goal of the campaign!
